meaning: bruit marquant la satisfaction d'une personne après qu'elle a bu.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: I think my calves are going to remember this all week, that climb was brutal!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: No kidding! But you know, just thinking about the nice cold juice they're serving us, I almost forget about that last hill.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Look at those ice cubes... It's like they're calling my name.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: *[ahh]*, exactly what I needed after all that effort!

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Looks like you're coming back to life! Next time, I'll let you finish in front, can you believe it?

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: If I'm promised a drink like this at the finish, I'll run for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this sunshine, we definitely made the right choice picking a terrace today!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: I know, right? But I think I could drink the whole pitcher, I'm so thirsty.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The lemonade looks perfect with all that ice, want to go first?

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: You go ahead, you survived the packed subway to get here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: (she brings her glass to her lips, then sets it down gently) [ahh]… We should patent this kind of refreshment!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Just watching you, I can already feel the coolness coming—my turn!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Nadine
dialogue.text: Look at that brute behind the gate, it’s like he’s guarding the whole neighborhood by himself.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: That’s Rex, the Lefèvres’ dog. Even delivery people sometimes hesitate to come close.

dialogue.speaker: Nadine
dialogue.text: Yesterday, I saw a guy walk by and lean in, going '[psst], [psst]!' Rex didn’t miss the chance to show him who’s boss.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wow, some people are really asking for trouble, it’s like they’re testing their limits.

dialogue.speaker: Nadine
dialogue.text: I swear, the guy wasn’t so cocky when he saw those fangs through the bars.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With Rex, you’d better keep your distance—he’s always on guard!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look Léon, that dog behind the gate hasn't taken his eyes off my sneakers this whole time.

dialogue.speaker: Léon
dialogue.text: You're right, he looks like he's seriously guarding his territory. Do you think he'd react if we moved closer?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Try calling him, let's see how he behaves.

dialogue.speaker: Léon
dialogue.text: *[psst], [psst], [psst]* Hey, did you see his ears? He just tensed up all of a sudden!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whew, he's really taking his job seriously, looks like he might jump the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Léon
dialogue.text: A real guard dog, better not test his patience any longer!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that brute, he doesn't take his eyes off the door.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It looks like he's just waiting for a chance to show what he can do.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He takes his job very seriously, you can tell by his posture.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm not sure I'd dare cross the lawn with him here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, just don't make any sudden moves and everything will be fine.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Unless I do this... [psst psst]... Oh, did you see his ears perk up?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look César, your dog didn’t even move when the ball rolled right in front of him.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, Pollux is as calm as can be, he watches his fellow dogs as if he’s meditating.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet with a little enthusiasm, he’d show he can be active too!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If you manage that, I’ll buy you a coffee at the food truck across the street.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Alright, here we go… [pssh pssh], [pssh pssh]! Come on Pollux, show us what you’ve got!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, he’s getting up! You must have a hidden talent for motivating pups, Claire.

meaning: marque une sensation de froid.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh wow, [brrr]! I should have brought my ski jacket!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Well, you're breaking all the shivering records today.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I can't wait until we set foot in that little café over there.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: If there's still some hot chocolate left, I'll buy you one right away!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: The anti-ice mission is on—no way we're leaving empty-handed!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Alright, captain, let's go before my ears surrender!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Don’t you think the air stings a bit more than usual today?

dialogue.speaker: Matthieu
dialogue.text: I feel like my ears are going to fall off, you know what I mean.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Even my coffee can’t warm me up, that’s saying something.

dialogue.speaker: Matthieu
dialogue.text: Can you imagine, they’re saying it’ll be even worse tomorrow...

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You’d almost think we’d been sucked into a giant freezer.

dialogue.speaker: Matthieu
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it, [brrr], it makes my teeth chatter!

meaning: Marque un sentiment vif (plaisir, douleur, admiration, impatience, etc.).
Interjection d'insistance, de renforcement.
Sert à transcrire le rire.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see the line in front of the new crepe place at the end of the street? I wonder if it's really worth the detour.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: My brother told me there's a salted butter caramel crepe that's to die for, but I haven't been yet, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: But with your sweet tooth, it's strange you haven't given in yet!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [mm], just thinking about it makes my mouth water, I don't think I'll be able to resist much longer.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I get it, I've already checked out the menu online, it makes you want to try everything.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you're up for it, we could try it together tonight after work!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Guess what, something completely unexpected happened to me on the subway this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: Oh, now you've got me curious—tell me exactly what happened!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: There was a musician, and he played so well that the whole train stopped to listen to him.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: Incredible! Did you talk to him or just enjoy the moment?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I dared to tell him how much I loved his music, and he even improvised a little tune just for me.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: [ahh], moments like that really make the day better!

meaning: accompagne un élan lorsqu'on porte un coup.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Do you think you can dodge this hook like you did yesterday, Hugo?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Did you see my reflexes? I definitely plan to surprise you today.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Then get ready, I'm going to pick up the pace!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Go ahead, I'm waiting for your combo—show me what you've got!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Watch your guard... I'm throwing the straight punch.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: *Throws his punch energetically* [huff]!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That combo on the punching bag almost made me lose my balance, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, but you’re holding up! And your leg was getting higher and higher with each try.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, after a while it felt like my foot weighed three tons by the end of the set.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, if you bend your knee a bit like this and pivot, it gives, [ugh], more fluidity!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it looks like everything starts from the hips the way you show it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, that’s the secret to throwing strikes without getting tired too fast, you’ll get it!

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement aigue d'un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: It looks like everyone is sleeping in, even the birds are lazy today.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: It never lasts long, there's always something to break the silence, like that dog at the neighbors'.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, you mean the one who stands guard behind the fence?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Exactly, he watches me out of the corner of his eye every time I walk by, he doesn't miss a thing.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Listen, he's starting again with his [yip yip], [yip yip], like he's trying to warn the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: That guard dog has no shortage of energy, there's no way we could ignore him!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Impossible to read in peace last night, there was such a racket outside, did you hear it too?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and it made me jump right in the middle of my show! Did something unusual actually happen?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Exactly, I was trying to figure it out, it kept getting higher pitched, it was honestly piercing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Through the window, I recognized that sound: [ow ow], [ow ow], like a chorus you can't forget!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: No wonder even the cat ran under the couch, what an atmosphere in the street last night!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At least it livens things up a bit, the night is never too quiet around here.

meaning: pour marquer la douleur.
pour marquer un désagrément, un ennui, une surprise désagréable, une inquiétude.
pour marquer la rapidité ou la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: [ow]! My finger just slipped between the toaster plates.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: The toaster got you again? Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Yes, it was just a bit surprising. I'll be more careful now.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: If you ever want me to handle the toast for you, just let me know.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Thanks, but I won't let a toaster get the better of me!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Fighting spirit, I love it! We're going to finish this breakfast like pros.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Wow, this shelf has really decided to resist me today... Do you think I should try pushing it a bit more?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Before you send everything flying across the room, at least let me move the vase out of the way!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Too late, I'm going for it—watch out behind you, it might move!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [ow], easy! I thought you saw my hand!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Shoot, sorry Camille, I thought you were on the other side... Did I catch you off guard?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Nothing's broken, it'll teach me a lesson for next time—I'll keep my distance!

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement d'un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The trees are barely moving today, it's almost too peaceful for a walk.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet even the squirrels have fallen asleep, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, I thought I saw something move near the bench over there.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Well... it's coming right toward us going [woof], [woof], do you think it found a trail?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's crazy how fast he's running off, at this rate he'll end up leaving his owner behind.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe we should think about signing up for his next race, with a coach like that!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you remember the little park near the bakery?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Of course, that's where the kids play on the slide. Why?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was there with Mona yesterday and suddenly, behind a bush, it went [ow], [ow], all of a sudden!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I can just imagine the look on both your faces!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We jumped, then we laughed when we saw Oscar who had hidden there on purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: He really has a knack for stirring things up, that one!

meaning: pour se récrier ou, plus souvent, paraître se récrier.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [whoa], did you really win that baking contest in front of all those people?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It was unexpected! My chocolate éclair was more of a hit than I ever imagined.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wish I could have seen the judges' faces at the first bite, that must have been something.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I think they couldn't hide their surprise, especially with the hint of chili in the cream.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Chili in an éclair? You really like to play with fire, don't you.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Sometimes you just have to dare to change the recipe, and this time, it paid off!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: [whoa], you’ll never believe what just happened to me this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: What? Did you find another 50-euro bill on the ground?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No, even better! I got a call from a publishing house interested in my manuscript.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Seriously? That’s crazy, tell me how it happened!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: They read my excerpt online and offered me a meeting next week.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: That’s amazing, I knew your talent would be recognized eventually!

meaning: premiers sons du language émis par un bébé en signe de bien-être.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at how he's watching you, it seems like he's already trying to understand what we're saying.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He even moves his little fingers, it's fascinating to watch every day.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Earlier he started making a little '[goo-goo]', I melted on the spot!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, you're making me want to hear it, it must be quite a show.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Nothing beats these moments, I could spend hours just listening to him.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's when you realize how much every moment with him matters.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, he's starting again with his little '[ga-ga]'! It looks like he's found a new game.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: He seems really absorbed, I think nothing around him could bother him right now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: His eyes light up every time he does that, it's amazing how he already expresses himself with so much energy.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: He even makes that little face right before, it's a unique show every time in front of us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet before the end of the day, he'll surprise us again with more sound inventions.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Well, with an artist like that at home, there's no way we'll get bored for even a second.

meaning: premiers son du langage émis par un bébé en signe de bien-être.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, Léa, how Théo wiggles in his bouncer with that little smile and his [coo-coo], I have to admit I just melted!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: It's true, it makes you want to just stay here and watch him all afternoon!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: He really has his own way of filling the room with good vibes, even without saying a word.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: In any case, he’s found his audience: with every little move or expression, everyone melts!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With moments like these, you almost forget there’s laundry to fold behind us.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: The laundry can wait, this is today’s main event!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to that little [goo-goo]! It just melts my heart, he's waving around like a tiny orchestra conductor.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It looks like he's conducting his whole stuffed animal audience. His expressions are like a real miniature theater.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He even has that little serious frown, don't you think? As if he already has a thousand stories to tell.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely, he's already inventing his own stage. We should almost sell tickets to watch this show!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Still, these moments make you want to stop time. He's growing so fast, it's fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We'll remember this, for sure. I already can't wait for the next act of this little adventure.

meaning: premiers son du langage émis par un bébé en signe de bien-être.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This morning, Paul woke me up with his famous [goo-goo], I never get tired of it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That’s a sign he’s feeling good, right? It must brighten your day!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it’s amazing how those little sounds can put you in a good mood from the moment you wake up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can picture it—you must just melt on the spot with so much sweetness.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, you forget everything else, even the tiredness fades into the background!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s magical to see a baby waking up to the world like that.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Impossible to forget the smile Léonie gave me from her bouncer, my heart was melting all day because of it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, is Léonie already having her charming moments? Tell me, I want to know everything!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You should have seen her little hands waving as soon as I took out her lovey, it was like she wanted to dance with it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: She's got promise, that little one! Did she surprise you with a new funny sound?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, when I got closer, she looked at me and suddenly went '[goo-goo]', honestly I burst out laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Ah, those moments are irresistible! It seems like she already has her own little language.

meaning: bruit de spasme précédant le vomissement; bruit d'une personne qui s'engoue.
bruit d'un cri manifestant une très vive émotion

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Julien, you just spilled that tub of leftovers right next to my shoes… this is a nightmare in here!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [ugh], the smell hits me all at once, it’s turning my stomach…

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: If you don’t do something, I think I’m going to have to run outside…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I’m grabbing some trash bags, but I really have to be a hero right now.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Try not to collapse, we need you in one piece!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I’m focusing, I promise… but what an olfactory torture!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: See that neon green smoothie over there? I bet I could finish it in one gulp.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Whoa, are you sure? It looks thick, and the smell is already challenging me!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: *She takes a gulp* [ugh]... No but... wait...

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: You should see your face! What's actually in it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I don't know, but it's intense... I think I've been set up.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm choosing—at least something edible!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Looks like the photocopier air isn't helping you much today!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: I think my allergies have decided to keep me company…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Maybe you should try this mint tea, Pierre says it's miraculous.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: I admit I wouldn't say no… And there it is, my nose is starting to tickle again.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Perfect timing, you just proved to me that I should play the lottery.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, the next ticket will give me a vacation… or at least a box of tissues!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, Éric, did you spill all that pepper on the table?

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Oops… [achoo]! Sorry, it caught me by surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's not every day you witness that kind of explosion!

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I'll handle the grinder more carefully.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good thing you keep your sense of humor, even when the spices go wild.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: You have to look on the bright side—it spices up the day!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Oh man, that caught me by surprise while I was looking through these old files.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s not the first time today—you should apply for the record for most unexpected reactions!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With all this paperwork, no wonder I’m turning into a surprise machine…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you want me to bring you some water, or would you rather brave the storm alone?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I’ll try the solo adventure—let’s see if I make it to the end of the morning!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you survive, remember to rest between your unexpected feats, office hero!

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Wow, this park has turned into a dust festival since the construction started, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally… And I forgot to bring my antihistamines, it’s a nightmare.

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Oh no, you look like you’re really suffering, I can even see it in the way you wrinkle your nose!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Cursed particles, they never leave me alone. I try to fight it but it’s tough.

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Careful, with that face you might scare off the pigeons!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: *[achoo]*… There, it had to come out, sorry!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It looks like the park has been taken over by a mischievous wind today! My hair can't take it anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: That's a relief, I was starting to wonder if it was just me fighting off an army of leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And that scent of pollen in the air... My throat has been tickling for five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: [achoo]! There, I had to let it out... This really isn't my favorite season.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Here, catch this tissue before your nose decides to rebel even more.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Thanks, my friend. Between the wind and the allergies, I'm going to get swept away!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This park is beautiful, but there are so many flowers today.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That's true, look at all these colorful flowerbeds… It's making my nose tickle a bit, doesn't it for you?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A little, especially near the lilacs. The air really smells like spring.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, I've had a funny feeling ever since we walked under that tree.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Ah, there it is, I was wondering when that would happen.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You're incorrigible, Sophie, even nature can't resist you!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, there’s a strange smell in the air, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s weird, I feel like it’s tickling all over.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Be careful, it looks like the air is full of tiny particles.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Oops… that caught me by surprise, I think I’m sensitive today.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That’s going to wake up the whole neighborhood, so much for being discreet!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Guilty as charged… but I can’t help it, I admit.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It feels like this old library has decided to tickle my nose today!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Me too, I feel like the dust is dancing in the air with every move.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With all these books piled up, no wonder we end up sniffling all morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh… [achoo]! Sorry, I couldn't help it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was just about to offer you a tissue, you’re practically reading my mind!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Thanks, I have a feeling I’ll have quite a collection by the end of the day.

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Oh look, the trees are starting to bud again, it's amazing how quickly the park changes in just a few days.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Yeah, but you know, the morning air still has that little bite to it, it always catches you off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Exactly, I hesitated to bring a scarf, and now I feel a shiver running up my back.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Hey, did you feel that? [achoo]! Well, now we're making music together, I guess it's just in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Oh wow, you almost made me jump, that came out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: It must be all this pollen playing tricks on us. Nature's waking up, and so are we!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, you look a bit strange, like the weather played a nasty trick on you.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's possible, ever since I opened the window this morning, I've felt a chill.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, that famous draft! Are you all set to survive the day?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I've got my jacket and a pack of tissues in reserve, so I should be fine... at least, I hope so.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You'd better be, because if not, I'll make you an infusion with a thousand remedies!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [achoo]! There, I had to let it out... Looks like the festival is starting.

meaning: bruit produit par un éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [achoo]! There we go, my nose has decided to steal the spotlight again this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You really are breaking records for dramatic entrances today!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I guess I'm destined for unexpected surprises from the very first hour.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With you, it's never boring—even before coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I promise, I'll try to keep the special effects to a minimum for the rest of the day.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Save a little for the meeting—you might wake up the whole department!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, I finally managed to gather all the tables for the report—[achoo]! Oops, that caught me by surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, what timing! Do you want to take a break to catch your breath?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No, it's fine, thanks, it's just this office playing tricks on me today.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's true that as soon as the printer heats up, the air gets weird in here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I wonder if my nostrils will ever get used to it, one of these days.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, if one of us survives this atmosphere, it'll be a victory over paperwork!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at all these flowers, Luc! It’s like the garden suddenly exploded with color.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Well, it seems the explosion isn’t leaving me unscathed.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oops, looks like we’ve found the riskiest patch for your nose!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It’s always like this in spring—every year my nose throws a party without being invited.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you want, we can try our luck by the rose bushes—they’re usually kinder to sensitive noses.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Sounds good to me! Sometimes your floral strategy is better than all the tissues in the world.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Paul, you look funny, like you're fighting something invisible.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It's this dust in the library, it's been tickling my nose for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you explode, at least try to aim away from the old manuscripts!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, too late… [achoo]! Oops, I made a whole cloud of papers move…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You're going to end up waking the ghosts with all that noise, be careful!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With my luck, they'll bring me a box of tissues!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There's still pollen all over the patio, it's impossible to set down a cup without it getting covered in yellow!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Tell me about it... [achoo]! There you go, it starts as soon as I mention it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh no, looks like you haven't been spared this year either.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It really seems like it's become inevitable for me, especially in May.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We really need to invent a special filter for our coffee when we're outside!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Or maybe a full-face helmet... but that would kind of ruin the vibe of breakfast outdoors, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: Look at all those poplar catkins floating along the path—it looks like it's snowing in May!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Oh, this is exactly what I was afraid of when I went out today...

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: The trees really don't want to make things easy for you this year, it seems.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My nose stages a revolution every spring—there's no stopping it.

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: If we walk along the pond, there's usually less dust. Want to try that?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let's go before I turn into a walking fountain—you've convinced me!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Last night, I almost knocked over the whole stack of books next to the couch!

dialogue.speaker: Jeremy
dialogue.text: You’re not the only one—I tripped over the chair right after you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: While trying to catch my balance, I sent my bag flying into the door.

dialogue.speaker: Jeremy
dialogue.text: And then, [crash], everything fell down at once!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: No way to stay quiet with that kind of stunt at home...

dialogue.speaker: Jeremy
dialogue.text: We totally woke up the cat—he kept pacing around after that!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you see that stack of boxes near the stairs? I bet it’s going to end up slipping.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: With all this mess, it’s almost inevitable… But hey, as long as the cat doesn’t get involved.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, you know Pistache, he can never resist climbing.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Oh, look! He’s jumping on them—and now, [crash]! Everything collapses at once.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There you go, I predicted it… He has a knack for causing total chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: At least there’s no need to tidy up the boxes anymore, Pistache took care of it in his own way.

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m telling you, Paul, this storm has no mercy for our old shutters. I have a feeling they’re going to play a trick on us.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With the wind picking up like this, I wouldn’t be surprised to hear strange things in the night.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You won’t believe me, but as soon as I open the window to check… [bang bang]! Both shutters slammed so hard I almost dropped the lamp!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I can just imagine your face! Good thing it wasn’t the glass.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you ask me, this house loves to surprise us every time there’s a storm.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With this show, we don’t even need the TV tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Jérôme, you slammed the attic door harder than usual, didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: It was still creaking, I thought a good push would be enough to wedge it.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: We don't want to find all of grandma's odds and ends scattered in the hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Come on, I'll just put the suitcase up there and come back down.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: And then, [kaboom] behind you! I think we just woke up the attic's memories in style.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: As long as we don't find Aunt Huguette's old tea set smashed to pieces, it's all good.

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: The weather is really stubborn, look at that gray sky, it feels like something is about to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With this wind picking up, everything feels suspended, even the birds have hidden away.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I just saw the neighbor's old shutter swinging dangerously, it smells like disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think it's finally going to give way? It looks like it's hanging by a thread...

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: There, look, it's not straight at all anymore, it's shaking all over!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, there it goes, it's falling... [crash]! Incredible how it echoed through the whole street!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You see, I was just quietly settled in the living room with my book, and all of a sudden, [crash], the painting above the fireplace came loose and landed on the dresser!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that must have made you jump! Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I swear, I almost dropped my book! No, don’t worry, just a bit of dust everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Between the painting and your nerves, it was quite the workout in that living room!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Seriously, there’s never a dull moment at my place—even the walls join in on the excitement!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Next reading night at your place, I’ll bring a helmet… just in case!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If you had seen the cat’s face when he jumped onto the dresser, I should have filmed it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: But seriously, did he knock something over again?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: He wasn’t even paying attention, he slipped on a scarf and everything happened at once.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh wow, I can already imagine the chaos in the living room, it must have been epic!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You have no idea, in three seconds: [wham]! The vase, the keys, all on the floor, and the cat running off like nothing happened.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That’s why all your knick-knacks make a run for it at your place, it’s like a feline action movie!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’ve never seen the café so topsy-turvy as it was at lunchtime today.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wait, are you serious? Tell me, what happened for so many people to suddenly jump up like that?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: There was this tray loaded with cups, and everyone was looking elsewhere… [crash]! The cups went flying everywhere, it was total chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wow, that must have startled half the room, right?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: The servers couldn’t believe it, it looked like a movie in fast-forward.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With a scene like that, even my coffee splashes onto my notebook!

meaning: Onomatopée exprimant le bruit d'une chute suivie de roulement.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [crash]! Well, that was inevitable with all that mess on the shelf…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Did that come from your side or should I call the fire department?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Just some old magazines on the run, nothing living was hit, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good thing your houseplant survived the landslide.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It dodged with style—this plant is a real cat.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Looks like it had quicker reflexes than me on a Monday morning!

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: You should see the mess here, I moved the big suitcase from one corner to another again this morning...

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: Always on a commando mission in your attic, huh! Did something unexpected happen this time?

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Would you believe that while trying to make some space, I almost sent everything flying, especially your old scooter.

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: The scooter from my childhood? I bet it had a close call!

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Exactly, I'm getting close to it again, but this time I'm being careful... wait...

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: Oh, there it goes, and [crash]! Even the floor jumped, Maya!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Hey, I just heard something from the kitchen—wasn't that from your place upstairs?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yeah, it made a real [crash-boom] against the floor, everything shook all the way to my armchair!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Wow, that's not something you see every day... Do you think one of your plants decided to take a dive?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Could be, or maybe my old alarm clock tried to make a run for it off the shelf again.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: We should go take a look before the next disaster strikes.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Alright, let's go—armed with our courage and a flashlight!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, Jules, there was a racket in the entryway, like the ceiling was collapsing!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Oh man, did you get a chance to see what it was? Or is it Paul leaving his skateboard lying around again?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No idea, but from here, it sounded like everything fell all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Shoot, now that you mention it, I stacked the boxes of books right next to the door.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You must be psychic, it made a huge [crash-boom] as soon as the wind slammed the door!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Well... I hope it didn't swallow up my favorite comics, let's go see the disaster!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Take a look at this old vase I found at my grandmother's place, it can barely stand upright.

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: Oh, it's gorgeous! It looks like it's lived a thousand lives, be careful where you put it.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: I swear, just touching it makes me feel like it's going to fall apart.

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: If you ask me, just avoid the wobbly table, you never know with that one.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Good point, hang on, I'll put it on the shelf, the one in the back there.

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: Oh no, Clément, watch out—[crash]!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If I’d known putting up this shelf would be such a workout, I would have grabbed my helmet!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Did you at least wedge it against the wall? With you, you always have to expect anything.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Would you believe that just as I tried to put on the last board, [crash-boom], everything went flying in the living room!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: This really happens to you every time, it’s unbelievable… Any survivors among the knick-knacks?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The little lamp won’t forget it, but the rest were luckier than me in this adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With you, even DIY turns epic, that deserves a medal!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, Leo, this cat is going to end up thinking he's the king of the house with the way he climbs everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: He does whatever he wants, you know that! But honestly, I saw him jump onto the shelf—it was almost graceful.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, it's nice of you to defend him, but last time he almost knocked over my whole mug collection!

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: Wait, look at him... I think he's aiming for that stack of books, he's getting ready to jump!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh no, listen to that [thud]! Now for sure, he sent everything flying.

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: Let's go see how bad the damage is... All that just for a nap up high, well done, feline!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Jean, can you grab the stool for me? The vase on the shelf looks really unstable.

dialogue.speaker: Jean
dialogue.text: Wait, listen... [crash]! I think it fell faster than expected!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, that was the vase grandma gave me...

dialogue.speaker: Jean
dialogue.text: It looks like there wasn't much we could do to stop it from falling.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good thing we saved the other one last week...

dialogue.speaker: Jean
dialogue.text: I have a feeling the dust isn't done flying in this house!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You’ll never believe what happened in the kitchen this afternoon—I almost knocked everything over!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh really? What were you making this time, one of your famous experiments?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was trying to get the pot out of the top cupboard, and then, all of a sudden, [crash]!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I can picture it... Did you manage to save everything or were there casualties?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: A mixing bowl sacrificed itself and it took me ten minutes to find all the lids.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Now that’s classic Claire-style drama—I would’ve paid to see that!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So, do you think your cake will finally rise properly this time?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm just adding the flour and—[ba-dum-tss]! What just happened in the oven?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It looks like it popped by itself, I hope everything isn't on the floor.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's check, but it doesn't smell burnt, so that's at least one good thing.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If the pan slipped again, this recipe is really cursed!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With my skills, apparently every trip to the kitchen deserves a bit of suspense!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I really don't trust this old shelf, look, it's leaning more and more.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: You're exaggerating, it's held up like this for years, you'll see it'll hold up again.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I bet the slightest breeze will make it wobble, especially with all those books on top.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, I think one of the legs just slipped…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yann, step back, I have a bad feeling about this!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: And then, all of a sudden: [crash]! The shelf bursts under the weight, you were right…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hugo, your stack of dishes is still standing by some miracle, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Stay calm, I've mastered the all-in-one technique, just watch!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The last time you said that, we spent the whole evening picking up shards.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: No worries, it slides... [clatter]!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And here we go again with another round of dish acrobatics...

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Let's just say it was to spice up the cleaning a bit, right?

meaning: bruit de cahot, de rebondissement.
bruit de fredonnement d'un air ou bruit d'instruments de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: You know what? I took the little path behind the skatepark on my scooter, and it was a real workout!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, the one with all the rocks and bumps? Weren't you afraid of ruining your bearings?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: At one point, I felt my knees almost touch the handlebars, it was shaking so much.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can totally picture it: you're cruising along and suddenly, [thud], your scooter sends you flying for half a second!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: That's exactly what happened, but I managed to stay on my feet—pretty cool, right?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Totally cool! At this rate, you could almost open a stunt school.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With all these errands to run today, I feel like the day is going to fly by.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Wait until you see the stretch just after the bend—it's always an adventure with the car.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We should almost ask for hazard pay with all these detours.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Look, this is where it gets intense!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah! [thud]! Good thing my coffee was tightly closed, otherwise it would have been a disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It's official: these roads have more bounce than my sister's old trampoline.

meaning: bruit de galop du cheval

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: Wow, we really didn’t expect to see the horses come rushing by so fast near the river!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It took my breath away—they passed right in front of us without warning.

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: At that exact moment, I had ‘[clip-clop] [clip-clop]’ running through my head, it was almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Impossible to stay unmoved—I think even the ground was shaking under my feet.

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: We have to go back—you don’t get afternoons like that every day.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you ask me, next time we should bring stuff for a picnic so we can enjoy the show to the fullest!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: The tracks in the mud near the river reminded me of our little horseback expedition last year.

dialogue.speaker: Jerome
dialogue.text: Me too, I can still picture the morning mist between the trees and the restless horses.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Do you remember that narrow path, right before the clearing?

dialogue.speaker: Jerome
dialogue.text: Totally! At that moment, suddenly, just behind me, I heard that famous [clip-clop] [clip-clop], it almost made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I could feel the tension rising, even the birds suddenly went silent.

dialogue.speaker: Jerome
dialogue.text: It makes the adventure even more vivid to tell, don’t you think?

meaning: Exclamation exprimant l'insouciance, l'indifférence.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: I completely forgot to finish the file for tomorrow, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Are you going to start working on it now, or are you leaving it for tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: [meh], I'll see tomorrow morning if I have time, it's not that urgent.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: True, it can definitely wait until the office opens.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Exactly, no point in rushing for once…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sleep on it, as they say!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Are you coming to the movies with us tonight or would you rather stay home?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I’m not sure, I’m still hesitating, it depends on my mood.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Honestly, [meh], it’s up to you, it won’t change anything for me.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Really, you don’t really care whether I come or not?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: No, it’s just that I don’t want to force you. It’s your call!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Okay, I’ll let you know later then, depending on my mood.

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen, just behind the hedge, [chirp] [chirp]... It’s almost like a little country song.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It really adds a lively touch to our walk, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: There’s always quite a sound show around here, especially when the fresh morning air is flowing.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: The other day, I spotted a herd just after the rain—they were all over the meadow.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: That’s when you realize all the life that fills these little paths.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With moments like this, there’s no need to go far to feel transported.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Another walk through the meadows and I almost stepped on a shoe abandoned in the middle of the grass!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I'm not even surprised, there are always surprises around here, but that's what makes it fun.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look, over there behind the old barn, they've all gathered near the apple tree.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, listen to that sudden chorus, a real festival of [baa], impossible to ignore them!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: You'd almost think they're trying to compete with the birds in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: For the next walk, I'm bringing my recorder—who knows what sonic masterpiece they'll improvise next!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, une détonation, une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think I’m going to end up knowing all the workers’ tools by heart from hearing their noises all the time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we could almost host a renovation show with how much banging goes on here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Last time, they dropped a board right above my head, I jumped with that sudden [thud]!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: No way, really? Did you at least manage to keep your coffee in the cup?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Barely, I almost gave the boss’s shirt a cappuccino makeover…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With you, even a break at the office turns into an action movie!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Tonight's storms are making me a bit nervous, aren't they making you feel the same?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I admit the atmosphere is a bit strange, I even checked to make sure the shutters were closed.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh wait, [thud]! Did you hear that? It came from the hallway!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That was really impressive, my heart skipped a beat!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet it's the old shelf, it's been threatening to collapse for a week.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No doubt, one of your piles of books just decided to rebel.

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Didn't that racket outside last night wake you up? I thought the window was going to shake.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It did, it startled me! I even thought it was a weather alert because of all the noise.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Actually, I think it came from the garden across the street, right next to the old gate.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You mean the moment when we heard that famous: [woof woof]?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Exactly, that's what I was thinking of, it made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe we should think about closing the window tonight, just in case the show starts up again.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: No way to grab the newspaper without hearing [woof woof] behind the hedge...

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: At my place, it's the mailbox that sets off a whole sound show.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: All it takes is a squeal of tires for him to be on alert—it's impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yesterday, a mailman even jumped—he's never run so fast!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: We should invent slippers for them, at least for Sunday mornings.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Or sunglasses, so they can act like stars instead of sentinels!

meaning: bruit sourd, soudain et fort, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, une explosion, une détonation.
bruit à caractère musical.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, Lucas, listen to how peaceful everything is tonight. Even the neighbors seem to be asleep.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true, for once there's no blaring TV or random DIY noises. You could almost believe we're alone in the building.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And then, [boom]! See, all it took was mentioning it for something to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But where could that racket be coming from? It sounded like the ceiling shook!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope it's not Hélène's washing machine starting to dance again.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Or maybe her cat doing nighttime acrobatics again... In our place, anything can happen!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you feel the apartment shaking when the wind hits the windows? It feels like we're in a ship's cabin out at sea.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between the sound of the shutters and the rain pounding down, we can barely hear each other—it's impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It makes me feel like a chimney could collapse onto the roof at any moment.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think the big branch from the old oak is already brushing against the gutter; things might get intense by tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe we should move the car before a roof tile damages it... Will you come outside with me?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that [thud]? I'm pretty sure it came from the garden…

meaning: bruit à caractère musical.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Without warning, the drums let out a huge [boom] and everyone jumped up at once—I thought the walls were going to start dancing!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that's the kind of moment that turns a simple concert into a real experience! Did you at least manage to film it?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I tried, but honestly, my phone was shaking as much as I was—the atmosphere was that electric.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That must have been wild, I can't even imagine the energy! Anyway, you're making me want to go next time.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You'd really enjoy it, especially if you like big musical surprises that turn the whole place upside down.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Noted, next time I'm coming, and I don't care if I end up standing on my chair!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, Lucas, it looks like you brought a whole orchestra in your backpack!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You'll see, this little speaker creates an amazing vibe when we set it on the bench.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I remember, last week, everyone stopped when you started your playlist.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But do you remember that track? As soon as it goes [boom] in the chorus, everyone starts tapping their feet without even noticing!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Even the pigeons looked surprised that day, I almost filmed the scene.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Today, we're going to give them a new impromptu performance—how much do you bet we'll draw a crowd?

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, souvent en cascade, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, un coup, une explosion, une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It looks like Mathieu is going on an expedition in the kitchen... do you think he's still looking for that old food processor?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Possible! You know that every time he touches an appliance, it turns into a construction site.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I heard drawers slamming, then that sound of cutlery collapsing... it's a whole concert in there.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I bet the colander always ends up on the floor, never in the sink.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wait, there was like a silence... something's brewing, for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: And there it is, [crash bang]! See? He pulled it off again, the food processor finally met the floor!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, Arthur, that chandelier really isn’t hanging straight… Do you think we should do something before it decides to come down on its own?

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: If I were you, I wouldn’t walk right underneath it… That’s the kind of thing that ends badly, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And there, [crash bang], now that’s what I call perfect timing!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Looks like gravity won this round… Did you get anything on your head?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No, just my heart skipping a beat, and the chandelier… which didn’t survive its big fall.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: We’re going to need a good ladder and a broom, and maybe a bit of luck for the next repair…

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see how they climb everywhere between the hay bales? It makes me laugh every time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: They're real acrobats, and always looking for something to nibble on.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, one of them just made a big '[baa]'! Sounds like he's asking for attention.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With protests like that, it's hard to resist them. They sure know how to make themselves heard!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That's their little star quality on the farm—it's impossible to ignore them.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We should give them a medal for entertainment—they've definitely earned it today!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look, Sophie, it seems like the sheep are welcoming us with their big collective '[baa]' this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: They look so happy to see us arrive, it’s funny.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Don’t you think they bring a special atmosphere to the farm?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, without them, it would be too quiet. Even the kids love coming here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That’s true, and it reminds me of when I was little, at my grandparents’ place.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We’re lucky to be able to enjoy all this every day.

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that [baa] coming from the field, Julien? It sounds like they're all in on it together!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, they're lively today. They're all around the sheepfold!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It must be mealtime, look how restless they are.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I love this sight, it reminds me of when we used to come here as kids.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's true, nothing has really changed after all this time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Even the old farmer's dog seems to be watching over them just like before.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There's nothing like walking on this trail, you can really breathe here.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That's true, look, there's a group of sheep near the old barn!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: They're all huddled together, it's so funny to see.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Listen, it's like a whole concert of "[baa], [baa]" every time we walk by!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It almost seems like they want to start a conversation with us.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With an orchestra like that, there's no way we'll get bored on this path!

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Oh look, Paul, the flock has moved closer to the old apple tree—now’s the time to bring out the leftover salad!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Do you think they’ll come all the way to the fence? They’re really curious, especially that little black one in the back over there.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wait, I’ll try a sneaky approach... With a bit of luck, they’ll come forward on their own.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Worth a try! Last time, they surprised me by leaping out without warning.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: If I go '[baaahx]', do you think it’ll intrigue them or scare them off?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Go ahead and try! We’ll soon find out if you have the secret to attracting a whole flock.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I still have straw in my shoes—I think my visit to the sheepfold is going to leave memories for a long time!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me you ended up in the pen… or did you go looking for trouble yourself!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As soon as I walked in, a curious little one came up to me and let out a big "[baaa]" right in front of my backpack—I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, he must have sniffed out a secret picnic—those ones are real gourmet spies.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You have no idea—they followed me like I was the shepherd for the day.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like you attract all the rustic adventures. Next step: sheep rodeo?

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, it seems like there are even more than last time, just behind the old barn.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, listen to that chorus over there, it’s a real festival of [chirp], don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It almost makes you want to take out your camera just for the cheerful racket.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Their energy is contagious, it’s impossible to stay unmoved with all this commotion.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It’s amazing how this atmosphere transports you out of time, I love it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s like the hill comes alive just with their noisy antics, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look over there, the whole flock has gathered near the old apple tree.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It looks like they're waiting for something, maybe the farmer is coming by with their grain.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The lambs are even more curious, they keep moving their heads.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen to that little chorus of [baa] mixing with the wind, it's almost a country melody.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If we approach quietly, maybe we can watch them without being noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Now that's a mission worthy of two explorers—let's move carefully through this kingdom of wool!

meaning: bruit produit par une chute; bruit produit par un choc ou par un coup violent.
bruit produit par une grosse cloche.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With this old couch, I should have brought gloves... Can you grab the right side?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm on it, but it's sliding a lot on the rug. Should we sync our steps on three?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait, it's catching on the corner of the radiator, I can feel it's stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Can we try lifting it a bit more? It should go through if we tilt it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm pushing hard... Ready? One, two...

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: There we go, it's slipping – [thud]!

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: If we don't get moving now, the sideboard might end up staying in the hallway all night!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wow, your furniture is heavy... Which way do you want us to turn it?

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Try lifting a bit to the left, I think it'll fit by the door.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, my foot is stuck behind the carpet!

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: I'm letting go a bit, tell me as soon as you're ready...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ouch, it slipped out of my hands... [thud]! Let's hope it's not damaged.

meaning: Interjection exprimant le dégoût.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Can you imagine, I opened the fridge this morning and found a yogurt that was three weeks old?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Oh yikes, do you think it still had a chance of survival or was it already floating?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Honestly, there was a weird layer on top… it looked more like a chemistry experiment than a dessert!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: That reminds me of when I found an old box of cheese hidden behind the veggies… impossible to open without pinching my nose.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: But this time, you know, I wanted to smell it just to be sure… I barely cracked the lid and the whole room was filled with that smell.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: [eww], just thinking about it gives me chills up my spine!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Tell me, what made you accept a bet like that in front of everyone?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: You know I never back down from a challenge… Even if it meant tasting that strange specialty at the market.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Wait, are you talking about that slimy thing with pieces of fish floating in it?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Exactly that one! I expected a surprising taste, but the smell almost made me change my mind.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: [yuck], just hearing you talk about it is making my stomach turn, seriously!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Never again, not even under threat, I promise you!

meaning: marquer le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: You know what? My little brother tried to make his own yogurt yesterday... he put cucumber, strawberries AND ketchup in it.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Wait... was he serious? Your story sounds like a real Halloween potion!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: The worst part is, he absolutely wanted me to taste it, there were still pieces of pickle floating in it, I swear!

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: [yuck], just listening to you, I feel like my stomach is protesting!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Now you see why I’d rather give him the last clementine than be his guinea pig.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Good call, that’s a survival mission right there—no way I’d risk my life for a mad chef experiment!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You can't imagine what I saw in the office fridge this morning, Adrien.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: Another scary discovery? Tell me, I have a feeling this is going to be epic.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There was a container of leftovers... with fuzzy mushrooms that had totally changed color!

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: No way, who forgets their food for that long? Do you still dare to put your mug in there?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I opened the container to check, but the smell... [eww], I closed it right away and held my breath.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: No wonder nobody goes near the fridge; it's basically a smell trap now!

meaning: bruit de beuglement d'un bovidé.
bruit de beublement d'un instrument de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ever since we passed by the meadow, I can still smell the hay.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You know, last time, I almost stepped on a cow's tail because I was so distracted.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: They weren't even shy! They kept coming up to the picnic.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, it was like they wanted to join the conversation.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If we run into one later, I'll try a [moo] to see if she answers me!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Go ahead and try, but it's at your own risk if she adopts you into the herd!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at all that green, it feels like the meadows go on forever.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you see, over there in the back on the left? I almost jumped at that loud [moo] that echoed!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It really livens up the atmosphere, it’s a change from the sounds of traffic.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Anyway, here, there’s no way you’ll forget where you left your boots!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to paint this whole landscape.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you sketch the scene, don’t forget to add a bit of that soundscape!

meaning: marque le dégou^t, la nausée.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Do you remember the buffet at the cafeteria yesterday at lunch? I tried the herring salad, just for a change.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, you dared! So, what’s the verdict?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I barely put the fork on my tongue, [blech], the surprise... I thought something was off!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I’m not surprised, just imagining it kills my appetite.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Even the server made a funny face when he picked up my plate still full.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Well, next time, I’ll just stick to the pasta—at least that’s safe!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Do you remember the restaurant we went to last night? Well, I found something in my soup when I opened it for lunch today…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, don't tell me it was something slimy… [eww], just thinking about it gives me chills!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: It was worse—a kind of clump of hair mixed with pieces of vegetables, an absolute nightmare.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My stomach is turning just picturing you in front of that kind of mixture, honestly…

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Believe me, from now on, I'll lift the lid before ordering takeout, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Never again without checking, I've learned my lesson too—it totally kills any desire I had to try their desserts!

meaning: marquer le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: So listen, last night, my brother wanted me to try his new recipe... melted camembert with dried fish!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Camembert with dried fish? You’re kidding, he really dares anything in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No, I swear, he even added soy sauce, and the smell in the kitchen was incredible.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: [yuck], just thinking about it gives me chills all over!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was impossible for me to swallow more than one bite, I had to rinse my mouth with apple juice!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Honestly, creative mixes are not for me, I stick to good old grilled cheese sandwiches!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I tasted at the market this morning—it was some kind of slimy thing with red beans and a strange sauce.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Oh wow, now you've got me curious! The Asian vendors next to the main square?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly! They offered me a free sample, and I didn't want to say no.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: So, what's the verdict? Did you like the texture?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [yuck], just thinking about it, I still feel like it's stuck to the roof of my mouth!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: That must have been a real adventure for your taste buds—it's going to take you a while to get over it!

meaning: Interjection exprimant le dégoût.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, you didn’t look very convinced in front of your plate earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah… I tried the spinach mousse, bad idea.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh wow, you’re brave, just the smell makes me want to skip it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But wait, the worst part was the texture, it looked like green glue…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Even with bread, didn’t it go down a little better?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I tried, but honestly… [yuck], nothing worked!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You won't believe it, but yesterday at the cafeteria, they served this neon green broccoli mousse—I’ve never seen anything like it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Neon green? Wait, no way, was that thing even edible?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, I hesitated three times before sticking my spoon in it, and there was even this smell, like wet feet…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [yuck], just hearing you talk about it gives me chills!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good thing I had some bread to cover up the taste, otherwise I think I would’ve ditched my tray right away.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m going straight for dessert and skipping the weird mash altogether…

meaning: bruit du rot; bruit de spasme du vomissement

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet you can't finish that last piece of tartiflette!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You'll see! Tartiflette doesn't scare me.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, after all that cheese, I feel like I've got a whole wheel in my stomach.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I can feel things heating up over here too... do you have a magic potion for overeating?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [burp]... No, but I think I should've stopped way before the last bite!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hang in there, next time we'll stick to green salad, I promise...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If I had known, I would have saved room for this giant dessert.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Me too... Well, I have a feeling I won't be able to finish this slice.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Same here, my stomach is so tight that—[burp]—oh oops.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, the classic case of the protesting stomach!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think that's proof we ate way too well.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
