dialogue.text: Next time, mission: share the dessert, and survive the experience!

meaning: bruit de l'expiration.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I feel like there's a hurricane in my head just thinking about what I have to finish today.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, you look completely caught up in the storm. Have you tried taking a break, even a tiny one?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A break sounds simple, but I feel like if I stop, I won't be able to start again!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Sometimes, it's actually when you slow down a bit that you get going better afterwards. Trust me, it makes all the difference.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright... *[whoosh]*... Well, it's actually not such a bad feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: There you go, that's the Sophie I know: you stay standing even in the wind!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know, even today, I got stuck in a massive traffic jam right before that famous interview…

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: That's crazy, it's like the whole universe has been conspiring against you lately! So, how did the interview go anyway?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Not great… I arrived late, stumbled over a couple of answers, then mixed up the boss's first name. The whole package.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: [ugh]... If that's not a day for the history books… But honestly, anyone would have done the same in your shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You're good at putting things in perspective, I admit it really helps me see things differently all of a sudden.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: Wait, tomorrow we'll bet everything on the lucky croissant, but this time, I'm bringing it!

meaning: son d'une cloche.
bruit de coups, de chutes, de chocs.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, listen for a second... [bam], it echoes all the way down the alleys!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: This atmosphere, it's really what I love here. It feels like time slows down.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No wonder artists come to get inspired in this neighborhood, everything here encourages it.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Do you think Monet also stopped to admire details like this?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm sure of it! Little things like this make every walk different.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Anyway, next time, I'm bringing my sketchbook to capture these moments in my own way.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Look, Pierre, the church really stands out against the sky today.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: That's true, the light brings out every detail of the steeple, it's pretty rare.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I love coming this way at this hour, it feels like everything stops just before a big secret.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: Sometimes, I imagine the whole town is holding its breath, waiting for a signal.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: There's a kind of anticipation, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: There it is, the moment is coming... [dong]... the magic happens every time.

meaning: Onomatopée évoquant un bruit de choc, de heurt.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Clément, do you see that box way up there? I bet we're going to struggle to get it down without dropping anything.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: With the way you aim, this is going to be a workout, but go ahead, I'll hold the stepladder for you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Okay, I'll give it a try... Wait, it's heavier than I thought!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Go slowly, tilt it a bit toward me, otherwise it's going to slip.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm tipping it very slowly... watch out below!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Ouch… [thud]! Well, at least it's down... and in one piece, I think.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: With this skateboard, I feel like I'm going to beat my record today!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Try not to end up in the bushes like last time.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Watch closely... and [ding], there goes the wheel hitting the trash can!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oops, the trash can didn't do anything, poor Chloe.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It's official, I must have a hidden magnet for everything lying around on the sidewalk.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Good thing the trash can didn't roll into the street, or we would've had a real show!

meaning: Signal sonore émis par certains appareils (répondeur téléphonique, ordinateur…).
Dispositif (d'alarme, d'alerte) émettant ce signal.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The timer is almost at zero, this wait for results always stresses me out a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'm watching the screen, normally the page should refresh by itself in a few seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope we didn't forget anything in the settings; last time, we had to start all over again.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: This time, I double-checked everything—at least I think I did. Now we just have to cross our fingers.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm holding my breath... let me know as soon as you see any sign that it's done.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: There it is, the little [beep] just went off, we can relax, it's confirmed!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I managed to finish the file, but I can’t find the attachment in my email anymore…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Maybe it slipped into your drafts, you should take a look there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, I’m trying again… [beep]! This time, it’s sent.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Your computer is starting to have more voices than the phone switchboard.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At this rate, it almost reminds me when it’s snack time.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: We can always thank technology for its improvised sound reminders.

meaning: marquer le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, when I found that thing in the fridge this morning, just seeing it made me think right away: [eww]!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, no kidding… Just the thought of opening that fridge gives me chills.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It was green and hairy, though it was supposed to be cheese originally…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I can top that: last week, I found a yogurt that had changed color three times.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It’s like our fridge is trying to launch its own line of mutant foods!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If it ever starts moving on its own, I’m moving back in with my parents, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Yesterday on my way home, I came across a market stall with fish heads lined up, eyes still there—it was pretty surprising…

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Oh, that reminds me of when my uncle used to make fish soup—he’d put everything in the pot, even the bones.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: You know what's the worst? Some people even leave the tongue and the skin, and it floats on the surface.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Seriously? And then they serve it like it's nothing… Have you ever had to eat that?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Yeah, once at a family meal, I had to swallow a bite… [yuck], I almost put my spoon down right away.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: That's exactly why I always escape to the dessert table whenever I can!

meaning: bruit du métier à tisser traditionnel.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Sit down next to me, listen to that little [clackety-clack] coming regularly from behind the door—can you feel how the workshop comes alive?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: It's incredible, it's like it's telling stories every time it goes by.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Exactly, my grandfather used to say he could follow the whole day just by listening closely.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: He must have known every secret of this old place, then.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You can still feel his presence in the walls—it comforts me sometimes when I stay here late.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: With this atmosphere, it's no wonder inspiration comes out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to this, Louis: [clackety-clack], [clackety-clack]... it's almost like music!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: It sounds like you're having fun with that word, Sophie. Do you feel it in your fingers too?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I could stay here just for this rhythm, it creates such a strange vibe, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Yeah, and honestly, it's so different from anything we know. I feel like I'm in another century.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Can you imagine what it must be like with the morning sun shining through the windows?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: It would be a living painting! We'd almost become part of the scenery, just letting ourselves be lulled...

meaning: bruit d'un choc ou d'un coup violent; bruit d'un coup de feu, d'une explosion.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, this construction site really never stops, even on Saturday morning!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Seriously, it feels like they're digging right under our feet. I hope we don't end up in a trench!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Last time, it sounded like they were moving the whole building. We should almost ask them for a guided tour.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Whoa, [bam]! Did you hear that one? My mug almost jumped off the table…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And I thought the ceiling was about to drop down a floor all at once, it's epic here!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We should suggest they record a percussion album—it's live performance art.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I still have trouble believing what happened to you in the parking lot last night…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, but wait! I was about to open the car door when, [bang], something fell really close to me from the floor above!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That must have given you quite an adrenaline rush, right?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You bet! I found myself almost crouching behind my car without even realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good thing you have quick reflexes, otherwise it could have ended badly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, in that moment, I wondered if I’d accidentally landed in an action movie!

meaning: bruit d'un chot violent, qui résonne.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this, I’m trying to open the old wardrobe and… [clang]! That’s what happens as soon as you use a little force.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You almost knocked the paintings off the wall, it was impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, this wardrobe has quite the personality, it resists me every time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like it’s really giving you a hard time, that one.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If it ever opens without a fuss, it’ll be a memorable achievement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I promise, on that day, I’ll bring out the champagne.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you let go now, it's going to shoot straight at my feet!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm not letting go, don't worry! Look at me, I'm holding on like a pro.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's now or never, so watch your fingers!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Go on, aim well, I feel like it's going to work this time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: (hits) [clang]! Uh... that's done, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: My heart skipped a beat, I swear! That wall better watch out.

meaning: bruit de vaisselle ou de verre brisé.
bruit de guitare.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ouch… [clink]! That's what happens when I stack too many cups on the edge of the sink.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That tightrope walker technique of yours is starting to show its limits, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, next time I'll give up my juggling career.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: As long as you don't drop the coffee maker, I'm good!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I promise to stick to basic dishes, breakfast boss.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With you, mornings are guaranteed to be lively, honestly!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you find the large patterned plate, I’d like to use it to serve the salad.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I’ll look right away, it might be behind the glass bowls.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Watch out for the corner of the shelf… [clink]!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oops, that almost hit my feet!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Promise, I’ll take care of the broom this time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal, but next time something breaks, it’s on me!

meaning: bruit sonore, ponctuel et discret.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The lid of the jar just made a little [pop] while I was closing it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, you know, with all these jars, we could almost compose a little kitchen symphony.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Cooking and music—that’s my whole life in one room, after all!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And with your homemade jam, the orchestra gets some flavor.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I’ll play the part with the pots and pans too.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At this rate, the neighbors will be asking for tickets to the next concert!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's the third time I think I hear a strange little sound, don't you?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I thought it was the faucet dripping, but it's tightly closed.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll move the pot closer... maybe it's coming from there.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Weird, the stove isn't even on, everything on it is cold.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And now, did you hear that? [plop], right when I touched the ladle!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Mystery solved, the ladle decided to join in the cooking too!

meaning: bruit produit par une sourde explosion ou par le souffle d'une déflagration.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you remember the old freezer in my parents' basement? That thing acted up again last night.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, that thing just refuses to die... What did it do to you this time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was going down to get some ice, and suddenly it started vibrating weirdly, I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I can picture it: [thud]! That must have really scared you, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, I thought everything was going to collapse, and even the cat bolted like a rocket.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If the cat starts running, you know it was serious. Maybe you should invest in a new fridge before the apocalypse!

dialogue.speaker: Marine
dialogue.text: Honestly, Étienne, do you really want us to try this old experiment in your grandma's saucepan?

dialogue.speaker: Étienne
dialogue.text: You saw the video, right? It's supposed to foam up, nothing dangerous, don't worry!

dialogue.speaker: Marine
dialogue.text: Alright, fine, I'm adding the last ingredient... and... [sploosh]! It just burst out all over the counter!

dialogue.speaker: Étienne
dialogue.text: Oh man, I didn't expect this much mess, it's dripping all the way to the floor!

dialogue.speaker: Marine
dialogue.text: Remind me never to follow your genius ideas again, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Étienne
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll grab an umbrella before suggesting an experiment, I promise!

meaning: bruit soudain, produit par une chute, par un choc, par un coup ou par une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, do you remember the plant I put on the windowsill?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But... [thud]! Did you see that? Something just went flying across the living room.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, I hope it’s not my favorite pot...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With a noise like that, it can’t be a cushion!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’ll go take a look before the cat gets its paws all over everything.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, I’ll get the broom ready... we’re probably going to need it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm warning you, this box isn't going to go quietly—it weighs a ton!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's just say the gym can wait until later, then... Ready to lift it?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let's take it slow on the stairs, especially because of the wet shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you see me wobble, catch me on the fly!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Lucas, wait, it's slipperier than I thought!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And now... [thud]! ...There goes the box getting involved, should've seen that coming.

meaning: bruit d'un liquide qui bout.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: The lid is wobbling a bit, do you think we're getting close to the right moment?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I think so, it's heating up nicely, look at the steam coming out.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: If it keeps going like this, we'll have a perfect infusion for our broth.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: There it is, I hear the little [plop], [plop] under the lid, that's a good sign!

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: Exactly what we needed, now we can add the carrots.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Get them ready, I'll grab the ladle—soup mission almost accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at this pot, it's speaking for itself today!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Do you hear how it goes [blop], [blop]? It's almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It reminds me of grandma's kitchen, it had the same rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If we close our eyes, we could believe we're still there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come on, I bet with a pinch of thyme, the journey will be complete.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Good idea, I'll go grab some from the cupboard right away!

meaning: bruit de bulles dans l'eau.
bruit d'un liquide qui bout.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: The surface is so calm today, it almost looks like a mirror.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, it’s rare to see the pond without a single ripple. Even the birds seem to be tiptoeing.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Look over there, something just moved the water right next to the lily pad.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you think an insect landed, or is there a little monster hiding?

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: If we’re lucky, it’s just a shy frog taking a bath.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [plop]... There it is again, that funny sound breaking the silence, right next to us!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This spot is really perfect for listening to the silence, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: It seems like even the insects have quieted down—look how smooth the water is.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Last time, there was a dragonfly that stayed right here, remember?

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, right on that leaf... Hey, did you see that? There's something moving really slowly underneath.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [plop]... I thought I heard that come from right next to me!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Who knows, maybe a little water monster is waving at us!

meaning: bruit de bulles dans l'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: What if we tried to touch the bottom together, but without using our hands?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, but careful, I always cheat a little with my feet!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: On three... One, two, three, let's dive!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [glub] [glub]... Ah, you almost made me burst out laughing underwater!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I saw your bubbles racing to the surface, not sneaky at all.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Next time, let's count flips instead of seconds, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look, the fish seem really active in the aquarium today, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Listen to that, you can almost hear a little '[glub]' every time they come up near the surface.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, that's true, it's like they're putting on a show just for us.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I love watching them, it looks like they're playing together underwater.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Sometimes, you almost want to dip your hand in to feel that miniature world.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It makes me want to add a few more plants and a little cave for them—can you imagine the scenery?

meaning: bruit du rot; bruit de spasme du vomissement.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: If I survive this cafeteria chili, I’ll have earned a medal!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Honestly, even my stomach is sending me warning signals. Did you really have to get the double portion?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: My sweet tooth will be the end of me, but right now, I really feel like something’s not right…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You look totally wiped out. It’ll never go unnoticed if you faint right in the cafeteria.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: [gurgle]... OK, that weird noise was not supposed to happen. Maybe I should step outside for a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Come on, I’ll open the door wide. We’re not going to let a chili defeat you!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It looked like you were ready to eat a mountain at the table, but now you have a funny look on your face.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: I guess my eyes were bigger than my stomach… I feel like I have a brick in my belly.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you turn into a fountain, at least aim for the sink!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: I'm trying but… [urp]… ouch, that was unexpected, sorry for the noise!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Well, your digestive system has decided to make itself known tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: With everything it had to digest, it's making its own symphony…

meaning: bruit produit par un ressort sous tension brusquement libéré.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you remember how we used to jump so high on that old swing when we were kids?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and you always ended up clinging to the pole in the craziest way!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look, if I get a good run-up and jump on it... [boing]! You feel that spring, almost like before!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You're going to end up flying across the yard if you keep that up!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's the whole point, isn't it? Going for the wildest jump record!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Just be careful not to land flat on your stomach, champ!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I swear the handle just refused to cooperate with me, it keeps getting stuck halfway.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Wait, let me try before you break it for good. I’ve dealt with things more stubborn than this.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: But… be gentle, I have a feeling this is going to end badly if— [boing]!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Huh? Where did that thing come from?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I told you, it decided to act up today.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Well, I guess we’ll just have to improvise with a wooden spoon now…

meaning: bruit d'une grosse cloche, d'un bourdon au son grave.
bruit du canon.
bruit de coups.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It feels like time has stopped here, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true, every alley has something timeless about it... You could almost hear your own thoughts.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look over there, the old bell tower barely sticks out above the rooftops—have you ever visited it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yes, once in winter. You could feel the cold right in the stones, and inside it was shrouded in a strange dimness.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I can imagine the atmosphere, especially when everything around is so quiet...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And then all of a sudden, [dong]... [dong]... [dong]... The sound echoes everywhere—it surprises you every time!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look how the mist dances around the bell tower, it’s almost unreal, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: It’s seriously giving me chills, especially with that light barely moving.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Shh... listen, [dong]... [dong]... can you feel how it echoes all the way through the stones?

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Oh wow, you scared me! My heart skipped a beat, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Admit it, even the frogs in the marsh must be wondering what’s going on.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: And here I thought only the wind could shake up an evening like this!

meaning: bruit produit par un choc violent, par un coup brutal, par une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Bet I can send the disc all the way down the bowling lane!

dialogue.speaker: Émile
dialogue.text: If you manage to knock down all the pins in one shot, I'll buy you an ice cream!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Deal! Watch closely, here I go…

dialogue.speaker: Émile
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, don't fall before you throw, or I'll be the winner!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Here we go, get ready to cheer!

dialogue.speaker: Émile
dialogue.text: [thud]! Wow, even the floor must have felt that one!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Just as I was stacking the boxes, that thing happened—I jumped with that big [clang] that echoed all the way into the living room!

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: I was looking for my shoes and thought a wall was collapsing.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Good thing nothing fell on your foot, with all this mess...

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: It's true, it felt like the whole house shook!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Well, we’ll have to figure out where it’s coming from before everything disappears under the boxes.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: I bet it’s the old radiator—it really doesn’t like unexpected moves!

meaning: Longue tunique ample, vêtement traditionnel africain.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Did you see, the sun has never been as generous as on the day when the whole courtyard is going to dance!

dialogue.speaker: Mamadou
dialogue.text: It's true, the atmosphere will vibrate all the way to the stars, I can feel it.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Between the drums and the laughter, we have to live up to it—are you already getting your outfit ready?

dialogue.speaker: Mamadou
dialogue.text: I'm rummaging through my wardrobe, there's color breathing everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Betting on elegance or originality, the choice is a real headache!

dialogue.speaker: Mamadou
dialogue.text: When I slip on my [swish swish], it's like the party itself settles on my shoulders.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Paul, do you already know what you're going to wear for the ceremony on Saturday?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I'm still hesitating, I really need to make an impression this time.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's the perfect chance to wear something elegant with a story behind it.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Actually, I was thinking of wearing my old [swish swish], the one I brought back from Senegal.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Great idea! You're going to look fantastic, it'll bring back wonderful memories for the guests.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Thanks, I hope everyone will appreciate this nod to tradition.

meaning: marque le dégoût, la nausée.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You’ll never guess what I found at the bottom of my bag this morning… an old piece of cheese, all slimy!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh no, had it at least changed color?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, and it had completely liquefied… [squelch], can you imagine the smell on top of that?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Just listening to you, I feel like I can smell it through your story!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Since this morning, I don’t dare open my bag without taking a deep breath first.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: It’s a real art, managing the wildlife in our bags… I’m going to inspect mine later, just in case!

dialogue.speaker: Jerome
dialogue.text: Honestly, the cafeteria today was something else! Just seeing the tray, I knew I was in for some surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh, are you talking about that weird gratin? When I stuck my fork in it, it made a strange noise, [squelch], I put it down right away!

dialogue.speaker: Jerome
dialogue.text: That's exactly it! Even the bread looked suspicious next to that main dish.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That cured me of trying out any more improvised culinary experiments... That lunch was a real adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Jerome
dialogue.text: We should have gone for the kids' menu—it suddenly seemed a lot safer.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm bringing my own lunch—no nasty surprises in my bag!

meaning: marque le dégoût, la nausée.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I found under my bed when I was trying to grab my slipper.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, did you get another nasty surprise? What was it this time?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: An old piece of cheese, completely moldy, like it had fused with the carpet…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: How did it even end up there? Just thinking about it gives me chills…

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [eww], and to think I brushed that thing with my fingers! I think I'm going to replace the whole carpet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I get it, it's definitely time for an extreme cleaning operation—good luck!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Guess what, my brother tried making a tripe recipe last night…

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Tripe? Wow, he actually dared! So, how was it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, as soon as the pot started simmering, [ugh], the whole atmosphere in the kitchen changed instantly!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I can just imagine everyone’s faces at that moment, it must have been quite a scene.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: My little sister took refuge in her room—she gave up right away.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: With such a strong smell, I think even the cat would have gone to hide under the bed!

meaning: bruit de beuglement d'un bovidé.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey Zoé, look at all those cows lying in the sun, it’s amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Zoé
dialogue.text: It looks like they’re enjoying their afternoon, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I’m going to try something… [moo-moo], [moo-moo]!

dialogue.speaker: Zoé
dialogue.text: Wow, did you just call the herd or what? They’re all turning their heads!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I think we just interrupted their sacred nap…

dialogue.speaker: Zoé
dialogue.text: Quick, we should make up a song for them before they start chasing us!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Look, Lea, over there, they're all lined up as if they're posing for a photo!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It's true, they're watching us with curiosity, like a quiet audience.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It looks like they're waiting for a show... do you think they'd react if we put on a little performance?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Go ahead, I'll let you take the stage, show us your hidden talents!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Alright, get ready, here it comes... [moo-hoo], [moo-hoo]!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: What a performance! The cows are left speechless, or maybe they already think you're one of them.

meaning: bruit de coup donné à une personne.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Swear you've never seen a scene like that at the gym!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious, tell me!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: So here's what happened: I was just doing push-ups, minding my own business, when suddenly Bastien comes running up behind me…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And then, out of nowhere, [whump], you found yourself sprawled out on the mat?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Exactly, I barely had time to figure out what was happening!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, but you, crazy things always seem to happen to you!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Do you remember when Mathieu slipped while trying to catch the ball, right next to the stairs?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, and then he tried to catch himself but ended up crashing into the railing… [thud], everyone jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: The others thought the game was completely over because it made such a loud noise.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He got up laughing like nothing happened, it amazed me.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Mathieu, always ready to put on a show, he'll never change!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Anyway, I think the ball will be wary of him next time.

meaning: Exclamation qui exprime le chagrin, les pleurs, la lassitude.
Exclamation employée pour surprendre, faire peur à qqn.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You’ve got that look of a big day gone wrong—tell me what happened to you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [sigh], nothing wanted to cooperate today, it’s really just bad luck.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Between us, are we talking epic struggle or full-on legendary disaster?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Definitely legendary: even my coffee decided to make a run for it all over my files.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Time for a hot chocolate mission—are you coming or would you rather face another mug?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Mission accepted, I think that’s exactly what I needed!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Tell me, you skipped the coffee break earlier, that's not like you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [sigh]... I lingered in front of my computer without making any progress, just going around in circles.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I noticed you seemed distracted, do you want me to bring you a little chocolate to take your mind off things?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, that would be nice, honestly... even a smile would make a difference this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, gray days always end up letting a ray of sunshine through.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's hope it peeks out before tonight's meeting!

meaning: bruit sourd, soudain et fort, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, une détonation, une explosion.
pour exprimer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: With everything we've just stacked up, the tower of boxes is practically a work of art, don't you think, Malik?

dialogue.speaker: Malik
dialogue.text: If there were a moving exhibition, I think we'd have a shot, but that box on top is making me nervous.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Oh wait, wait... [thud]! That's what happens when you try to defy gravity with worn-out tape.

dialogue.speaker: Malik
dialogue.text: I was just about to mention it, but the box decided to make a break for it live.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: At least now we know we shouldn't have counted on that. Want to bet it's the mugs that took the hit again?

dialogue.speaker: Malik
dialogue.text: Knowing our luck, I'm already getting the dustpan ready. Let's go see the damage from our short-lived masterpiece!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Doesn't all this commotion in the courtyard seem strange to you?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I jumped, you know! All of a sudden, [bang], and everyone turned toward the trash bins.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: My heart was pounding so hard, I thought some kid had thrown something heavy.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No, seriously, even the neighbor's cat bolted like an arrow.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We should go take a look, otherwise it'll be on my mind all evening.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll follow you, but if we run into the concierge, you're the one doing the explaining!

meaning: bruit d'une batterie d'orchestre.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I swear, I still get chills just thinking about the atmosphere last night!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Totally! It was hard to stay still with everyone jumping around.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: But did you see the guitarist’s face during the final song? He was totally in the zone!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Yeah, and at that moment, everyone was clapping like it was automatic, it was crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: For sure! And right then, you hear in your head: [boom clap], [boom clap], everyone in sync.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Exactly, just with that, it’s impossible to stay seated, you have to go with the flow.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Last night, while walking past the square, I heard something that blew me away, it was crazy!

dialogue.speaker: Leïla
dialogue.text: Seriously? I can already picture people dancing everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: You bet! There was a whole group, the musicians were playing like they were on a big stage.

dialogue.speaker: Leïla
dialogue.text: At one point, I recognized that beat coming from the speakers, like "[boom tss]" and everyone threw their hands up!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: It's those kinds of moments that give you energy again, I think I still have the melody stuck in my head.

dialogue.speaker: Leïla
dialogue.text: If only every evening could have that kind of vibe, it would change the city!

meaning: bruit sourd, soudain et fort, produit par une chute brutale, un choc violent, une détonation, une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I bet you my cake will be ready before your timer hits ten minutes!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ha ha, you wish! I handle the oven like a pro—get ready to lose.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: [thud]! Did you hear that? That came from the kitchen, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That was super clear, anyway. I hope it wasn't the dish that slipped.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Let's go see right away if someone spilled the battle.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With our baking skills, nothing surprises me in this kitchen anymore...

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Whew, did you feel that [thud]? I almost dropped my mug!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It came from the hallway, right? Wasn't it supposed to be quiet today…

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: That's suspicious, especially since I closed all the doors—nothing should have moved.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Unless it was the old bike against the wall, it always gives me a fright.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Let's solve this mystery—grab your flashlight, just in case!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With all this suspense, my heart is racing with my footsteps!

meaning: bruit produit par un choc violent, par un coup brutal, par une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With all this commotion in the street, I bet we’ll find bikes knocked over in front of the door again.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? [thud]! Sounds like the mailbox just took a hit.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s not the first time it’s been used as a target for the neighbor’s ball…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Honestly, at this rate, it’s going to end up dented for good.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you ask me, we should put up a sign: Caution, fragile mailbox!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I’ll bring the marker, you take care of the sign?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you hear that big [thud] earlier? I thought the ceiling was going to collapse!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You bet! I jumped in my chair, it was like someone threw a wardrobe against the wall.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We'll either get used to it eventually... or get jumpy at every suspicious noise.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Last time, it was the window banging nonstop. There's always something going on here.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'd love to have a quiet day for once, just to see if that's still possible.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Good luck, especially with our upstairs neighbors. Silence has become a luxury!

meaning: bruit d'un roulement de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I have a funny feeling in my stomach, I think I'm going to burst if I don't say something.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh wow, now you've really piqued my curiosity!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait a second, I need to prepare myself mentally…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Careful, maximum suspense, you're turning up the heat!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here it is, [drumroll] [drumroll] [drumroll] [drumroll]… I got the job I was hoping for so much!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Incredible! We're going to celebrate properly, you totally deserve it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There’s so much tension around this chest, everyone’s eyes are glued to it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I hope you’re ready, there are going to be some surprises when I open this.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Then do it with style, set the mood for us, I love it when you add some showmanship.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hold on, let me set the scene... It’s not every day you discover a treasure!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [thump] [thump] [thump] [thump]... Watch out, it’s opening, suspense at its peak!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Your entrance is unbeatable, Claire, even the chest seems impressed!

meaning: bruit produit par une chute.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I think I broke a record at the skatepark today, you won't believe it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, did you try the new concrete ramp?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly... I got an insane amount of speed, you should've seen me!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Uh oh, sounds like a homemade stunt, tell me what happened next.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: When I tried to land, my wheels slipped like never before.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can already imagine the [crash] that followed, everyone must have turned around!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, my umbrella was more of a prop than actual protection today…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wow, sounds like a rough time! Did something unexpected happen to you?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, I tried to avoid a big puddle on Lafayette Street, you know how it is…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh no, that’s when things got complicated, I bet?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly! And then, my foot just gave out, the sidewalk sloped and… [splat], everything went sideways!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Rainy days always seem to have surprises in store for you…

meaning: bruit fort, produit par une chute, un choc violent, une détonation, une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With all this construction, it feels like we’re in the middle of a war zone, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Even my windows are shaking, it’s crazy. I just hope the walls can handle it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And to think I tried to take a nap… That’s out of the question now.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: These vibrations feel weird. It’s like the ground is playing a prank on us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait… what was that sudden hiccup from the machines?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, you heard it too? And then, [boom]! It echoed all the way into my kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Last night, I heard a huge [boom] right above my room, I jumped like never before!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh man, you heard it too? I thought the whole shelf was going to fall on me.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This is the third time this month there’s been such a racket in the building.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wonder what they’re tinkering with up there, it shakes the whole apartment!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I checked my plants this morning, luckily nothing was broken.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We’re going to have to get used to it or invest in some earplugs!

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille verte.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You should have seen the pond last night, it was quite a show! Between the dragonflies darting around and that [ribbit ribbit] echoing louder than ever, I felt like I was in a movie.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Ah, that almost makes me want to dig out my old fishing rod just to soak up the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, I tried to spot them with the flashlight, but they were experts at hiding under the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It's crazy how they vanish at the slightest movement! It's like they're playing hide-and-seek.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: And even with all that disappearing, the pond always seems alive, it's fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Next time, we should go together and count how many pairs of eyes we can spot in the dark.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen closely, Marc: [ribbit ribbit]... It's crazy, it almost sounds like they're competing in a contest tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: It's true, the pond becomes their favorite stage as soon as the light fades.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I could stay here for hours, just listening and watching the reflections dance on the water.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Definitely, it's a real change from our noisy streets during the week... a real breath of fresh air.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to take out my old sketchbooks and draw them.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: If you do, I promise you a masterpiece worthy of summer nights by the pond.

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille verte.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look how the light reflects on the water—it almost looks like an impressionist painting.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and the trees form a sort of cathedral above us, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Shh, wait... there's something moving in the grass, did it make you jump too or is it just me?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I heard it too, it's not the first time. Maybe it's that little shy resident I'm thinking of again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Earlier, I thought I caught a '[ribbit]' coming straight out of the reeds. It always surprises me a bit!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: What an atmosphere... it's like the pond is telling us a story just for us, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to this atmosphere, you could almost believe we're the only people in the world by this pond.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you listen closely, you can hear: [ribbit ribbit]... That's the kind of little concert that makes me want to stay until nightfall.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet you could even compete with the local performers, it's so natural for you!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You end up catching the rhythm when you hang around here often, it just comes naturally.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You should almost think about adding this to your relaxation playlist.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, there's nothing better for chasing away stress than a bit of rhythm by the water.

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille verte.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [ribbit ribbit], it sounds like the pond comes alive every dusk.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it's like a little hidden party in the reeds, I love this atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It makes you want to stay here longer, doesn't it? We could almost play a game guessing exactly where it's coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet it's coming from the old log, right next to the water lilies. Are you ready to investigate?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Absolutely, just so you know, I'm a champion at sneaky spotting.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Then let's go before it's too late to watch the masters of the pond put on their show!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Last night, the path behind the old barn was filled with an incredible atmosphere; I was almost tiptoeing so as not to disturb that little world.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That's the best time to catch all the life waking up near the pond, especially when the mist starts to creep along the water's surface.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, listening to you, I can see the streetlights reflecting on the water and those fleeting shapes hopping across the lily pads.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, I would have loved to be there! I bet the atmosphere was accompanied by some mysterious splashing sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At one point, in the silence, there was a: [ribbit]... then even louder, like a little improvised band under the moon.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Amazing, it almost sounds like you're telling a fairy tale—I can almost feel the evening dampness just listening to you!

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille verte.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The surface of the pond is really calm tonight... But did you hear that little sudden noise?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's like a strange sound bouncing between the grass, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Earlier, it really went [ribbit], [ribbit], right next to us!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: What an atmosphere! Can you imagine a whole choir in unison with that rhythm?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we approached quietly, we could almost record their little private concert.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet if we sit here, it would feel like we're in the front row of an impromptu show!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look how the mist floats low over the water tonight, it’s almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It’s like the pond holds onto every sound, it’s such a strange feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Earlier, I thought I heard something near the reeds, like a faint echo.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Listen closely… [ribbit], [ribbit]! It’s almost like an answer coming from the water, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It gives me chills, especially with this silence around us that makes every sound stand out.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If you close your eyes, you could almost believe we’re alone in the world, surrounded by these strange whispers.

meaning: bruit de raclement de gorge.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: You know, I was thinking again about that meeting where you spoke in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it really wasn't easy, especially with all those unexpected questions.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I admire you—I would have probably started stammering in the first minute!

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: [gulp]... To be honest, I wasn't very comfortable, but I tried to stay on track.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Looks like you hid it like a pro—you definitely earned your coffee break that day.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: If only there were medals for that, I'd already have a whole collection!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: With everything lying around on my desk, I almost lost this file… Good thing I found it before the break.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You should see mine, it looks like a tornado hit it! What’s worrying you about that file?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: You know, for Thursday’s presentation… I’d like to ask you for a favor, but I don’t want to bother you.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, you know you can count on me. Tell me what you need.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It’s just, um… I’m hesitating because I know you already have a lot of work.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [hmm]… Since I told you that you can ask me, go ahead, really!

meaning: bruit produit par une chute.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look in front of you, Maxime, that bag is about to fall out of your hands!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Ah, too late... [splat]! There goes the water pack splashing all over the sidewalk…

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Another achievement for your collection, it seems. At least nothing's broken?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: The ground mostly got a nice cold shower, I think it's fine.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Grab my tote bag, I'll take what's survived the waterfall.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Honestly, at this rate, I should have caution tape wrapped around me!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that "[thud]" behind the living room door?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Something acting up again, I bet it's the pile of magazines...

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Honestly, with all the stuff lying around, it could have been anything.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I can already picture the mess. Looks like tidying up will be fun!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll take a look... Yep, it's a mess worthy of a construction site.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At least we'll have a real chance to sort things out tonight!

meaning: bruit produit par une chute.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: See that moss-covered log over there? We could try to cross it, balancing.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Aren't you afraid you'll end up covered in pine needles? I'll watch you take the lead!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright, here I go... Oops, [whoosh]!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Well, well, the balance champion—are you putting on a special stunt show for us?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The ground invited me to check out its leaf collection—I couldn't say no.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: In this forest, even the trees knock people off their pedestal!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look Paul, he's going for it again, that guy is really afraid of nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Totally, it looks like he's flying every time he jumps that ramp!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Now he's trying the craziest jump—are you betting on a landing or a big wipeout?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With the speed he's got, I bet he'll either impress us... or make us jump.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ooh, he slipped, look at his board!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Ouch, and there... [crash]! I got chills just watching.

meaning: bruit forte, produit par une chute, un choc violent, une détonation, une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, last night near the old mill, I had a bad feeling as I was crossing the little bridge.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: The wooden bridge over there? The one that moves as soon as you step on it? You didn’t hesitate to cross?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hesitate, yes, but the moon was beautiful, so I kept going… And then I heard a creak behind me.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And suddenly, without warning: [ka-boom]! I actually jumped, even from the other side of the river!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My heart almost stopped, I thought the whole village would come down to see what happened.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: We’ll have to go back together, but this time, I’m bringing a flashlight… and running shoes, just in case!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm not dreaming, there have been objects falling from the balcony across the way for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's not the first time, but this time, it seems more serious... The railing is moving weirdly.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh wait, listen! [crash]! Did you just hear that? Even the window shook.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I almost dropped my bowl, you startled me. It felt like the whole building reacted.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we just stand here doing nothing, we're going to end up getting something dropped on our heads!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Go grab your flashlight, let's take a closer look, but no playing hero!

meaning: Onomatopée imitant le ronflement et la trépidation d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: I thought I saw you speeding by the park—was that your old Vespa?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That was her, wide awake this morning! Right from the start, [vroom] [vroom] all down the street, the whole neighborhood knew Lucas was coming.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Quite a show, you always turn heads with that machine.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey, you have to liven up the daily routine a bit!

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: You should almost sign up as the city’s alarm clock.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At least no one can say I go unnoticed, and it gives me a real boost of energy for the day!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It would be great to see your little car running like before.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yeah, ever since the accident, I was hoping to see her lively again.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Come on, turn the key and impress me!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Hold on, I hope she won't let me down this time.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I've always loved the suspense right before this moment. Ready?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: (He starts the car, leaning over the steering wheel.) [vroom], [vroom]! Hear that? Now that's motivation.

meaning: bruit produit par les routes d'un véhicule.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Do you feel how the car vibrates as soon as we hit this stretch?

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Yeah, listen to that—every time we drive through here, it goes "[vroom]" out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I always feel like we're about to take off, it echoes so much underneath.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: We almost need a helmet, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Or maybe a magic carpet to avoid all this!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Imagine the same drive, but in silence... It would almost be sad, in the end.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Yesterday, I took the old path by the canal, the one that runs alongside the fields.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, the one where the road is never really straight and it gets a bit bumpy in the turns?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly! And at one point, while the whole landscape was rushing by, I just heard "[vroom], [vroom], [vroom]" without even turning on the radio.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That reminds me of when we used to go pick cherries at my aunt’s place, that special music that would just appear on its own.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: There was almost a rhythm the whole way, it’s crazy how that sticks in your memory.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A bit like a song you recognize from the very first note, except it only plays over there.

meaning: pour exprimer un frisson de froid.
pour exprimer un frisson de peur, d'inquiétude, d'angoisse.
pour exprimer une réticence, un certain dégoût, une certaine répugnance.
pour exprimer un frisson d'excitation.
Le plus souvent répété.
bruit des roues d'un véhicule.
bruit produit par la bouche pour appeler personnne, pour exciter.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: How about we try a walk to the kiosk, even if it’s a bit gloomy out?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You never run out of ideas! But I hope you’re serious about the puffer jacket.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I’ve already layered two sweaters, just need grandma’s frosty scarf now.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And my wool socks—essential for surviving this expedition!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [brrr], the street feels like it’s turned into an igloo today!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Off to the kiosk—I bet our fingers will love a good mulled wine there!

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: [brrr], what a freezing wind tonight, I get chills just thinking about it!

dialogue.speaker: Emilie
dialogue.text: You're right, I thought it would be milder when we left the house.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: I should have taken that wool scarf you gave me.

dialogue.speaker: Emilie
dialogue.text: Next time, we'll check the weather before going out, I promise!

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Shall we hurry to my place? I've got hot chocolate waiting for us.

dialogue.speaker: Emilie
dialogue.text: Good idea, that'll really warm us up after this chilly walk.

meaning: bruit de raclement de gorge.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see how the meeting dragged on yesterday? I couldn’t take it anymore by the end.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, everyone seemed at their limit. I think I yawned at least ten times.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [hmm]... when we brought up the Alpha project file, I felt the tension in the room rise a notch.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Definitely, that topic has been putting everyone’s nerves to the test for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We’re going to have to find a way to lighten the mood, otherwise it’s going to blow up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I suggest we talk about it over a coffee, maybe that’ll help us unwind a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You might notice something weird when you open the fridge, but don’t worry right away.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Something weird? Now you’re playing with my curiosity!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Uh… [hmm]… let’s just say the cake you were saving has, how should I put it, changed shape a little.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: So that was the surprise? You sure keep things from me.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I admit, I snuck two slices during the night.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Well, if you’re owning up to it, you’ll be doing the dishes too!

meaning: bruit cinglant produit par le sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at this booth, Claire, it’s like the targets are challenging us!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: They’d better watch out, I’ve got a score to settle since last year.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Your turn! Watch out, here goes the dart... [whoosh]!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, that throw was so fast I didn’t even have time to cross my fingers!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Looks like you just woke up the whole booth with that throw.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I just hope I hit something, otherwise I’m signing up for the loudest throw contest!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You really picked the worst time to take a break, you know? Look at those pigeons flying everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Oh, stop it, it's not like we're in the middle of a western... Want to bet we’ll cross without any trouble?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With your luck, one of the hunters around here will probably mistake your backpack for a pheasant!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Ha ha! For that, I’ll buy you a coffee if we make it out unscathed!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, did you see that guy over there? He just raised his rifle...

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Wow! Did you just hear that, the [whizz] really grazed me!

meaning: bruit de conversation à voix basse ou de marmonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet half the room is already thinking about their lunch.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: For sure, and look at Marc, he's tapping his pen like he could make time go faster.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If only someone dared to bring up the hidden agenda item: getting out of here!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The real drama is that the boss always throws out a new idea just when we think we're done.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Looks like Sophie is trying to get your attention…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: *lowers his head toward Claire and mimes* [psst psst] psst…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look in the back, near the crime novel shelves... Do you notice anything strange?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Hmm, are you talking about the boy pretending to look for a book but keeps glancing around?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly. He slipped a note to the girl in the red jacket, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: I almost missed it... But it's suspicious, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The quiet in the library doesn't help you go unnoticed... It feels like everyone is trying to be more discreet.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Exactly, listen for a second—we can only hear [psst psst] through the shelves, like everyone is sharing a secret.

meaning: pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès, notamment une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Don't you think there's something missing on this shelf?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it... there was the blue vase, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly! I put it there yesterday afternoon, it was still there when I left.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: No one could have gone near it, I was around here all evening.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'm starting to think it decided to move on its own...

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I barely took my eyes off it and [whoosh], the vase was gone!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hey Paul, did you just see that pigeon pecking right there?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it was near my shoes and, [whoosh], just like that, gone in a flash!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: They're amazing with the way they take off at the slightest sound.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: He must think we're going to steal his crumbs.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The competition is tough between sparrows and pigeons, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It's almost like a show, I feel like I'm watching a miniature drama every snack time!

meaning: marque le dégoût, la nausée.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, Éric, I bet you still haven’t recovered from that infamous casserole from the cafeteria yesterday at lunch.

dialogue.speaker: Éric
dialogue.text: You mean that half-melted orange thing? Just thinking about it gives me chills…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I still have the image in my head: that stringy cheese and that weird liquid all around it.

dialogue.speaker: Éric
dialogue.text: Oh no, I’d almost managed to forget, now you’re rubbing salt in the wound!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The worst was when I saw those little bubbles rising to the surface, like it was alive…

dialogue.speaker: Éric
dialogue.text: [ugh], now my stomach is starting a revolution!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I found in my fridge this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let me guess... another old piece of cheese that's turned some impossible color?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Worse: a yogurt forgotten behind the vegetables, and when I opened it... [ugh], that's an experience I won't be repeating anytime soon.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, champion of the ancient fridge, that took guts!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll just stick to coffee—much less risky.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't forget to check the date on the package, you never know with you!

meaning: marque le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know what? I tried to do a bit of cleaning in the fridge this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds like you made a not-so-pleasant discovery... Did you unearth some forgotten treasure?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If only! I found a bowl with an old salad... I think it’s changed color since the last time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, those mutant salads... Don’t tell me you actually dared to open the lid!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I tried, and then, [eww], the smell hit me—total apocalypse in a box!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, your fridge almost deserves a purification ceremony after that...

dialogue.speaker: Leah
dialogue.text: You won't believe this, Marc: I saw a guy dipping his fries in a vanilla milkshake!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Wow, [blech], just the thought of it turns my stomach!

dialogue.speaker: Leah
dialogue.text: Wait, the worst part is that after that he added mustard on top…

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Was he going to stop there or was he planning to dip his pizza in it too?

dialogue.speaker: Leah
dialogue.text: Honestly, when I saw that, I looked away immediately.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: At this point, they should hand out safety goggles in the cafeteria…

meaning: bruit du rot; bruit de spasme du vomissement.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: If my pants split tonight, we'll know why...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, do you think the button on my skirt is already scared?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I'll stop you before the third plate.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But whose idea was it to make a dessert like that... I feel weird.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: You look a little green, is everything okay below the belt?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whoa, not really... [burp]... sorry, I think it's coming out on its own!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I swear, raclette is really my weakness... [burp]! I think I've hit my limit.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: What a performance, honestly! We should give you the medal for the biggest foodie in the neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: But how can you resist that much melted cheese? It was impossible to stop.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, we'll weigh the cheese beforehand, just to keep things under control.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Even with a scale, I bet temptation would win!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: In any case, I've learned my lesson: plan for more drinks to survive your culinary feats!

meaning: Rumeur propageant un message (notamment sur Internet).

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: You know, the story about the cafeteria at lunch—everyone was whispering in the hallways!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, I saw several groups stop to talk about it, but no one was really sure what actually happened.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Even Léa seemed to know about it, even though she wasn’t there. It’s crazy how fast it spread.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally! No way to miss the [buzz], my phone kept vibrating from all the notifications.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: It’s like news takes the elevator here—it’s flying everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh well, a day without mystery at school is never quite normal anyway!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Another story blowing up on social media—I actually raised an eyebrow about it this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Omar
dialogue.text: I swear, this kind of thing always makes a huge [buzz], it's like everyone is only talking about that.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I even got three messages about it, even though I didn't believe it at first.

dialogue.speaker: Omar
dialogue.text: It's crazy how it seeps into every conversation, even during the coffee break!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You know, after a while, I almost start looking forward to the next twist, just to see how far it'll go.

dialogue.speaker: Omar
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we'll have to keep our detective glasses handy, believe me!

meaning: bruit produit par une sourde explosion ou par le souffle d'une déflagration.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look, they're still turning everything upside down on this construction site, it's impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Ah, did you hear that [thud] earlier? Even the barrier vibrated under my hands!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Yes, it cut me off mid-sentence, I really wasn't expecting it.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: With all their machinery, it's not surprising, but that one really stood out.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I wonder if they warn the neighbors every time they do something like that.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: If you ask me, some regulars probably even get a kick out of it, especially the more curious among us!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Did you see that weird cloud right above the field? It was barely moving but it looked heavy.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and just as I was looking, there was this [whoomph], it made me step back without even thinking!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I wonder if it’s not their experiment with the old barrels behind the barn again.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Judging by the farmer’s face when we walked by, I wouldn’t be surprised.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Come on, let’s go around through the orchard, I don’t want to end up covered in soot like last year.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: But if we run into another surprise, this time you’re in front!

meaning: bruit de motmeur, particulièrement lors d'une accélération.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You should see the faces of the passersby when I go past the square, [vroom], everyone jumps!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Can you imagine, me in the middle of the sidewalk, I probably would have dropped my coffee cup!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It was epic, it looked like a movie scene with how everyone turned around at once.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good thing you know how to handle the wheel, otherwise you'd become the terror of the neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, you’re coming with me, so you can judge for yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Deal, but if I scream, promise you'll slow down a bit!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, the red Clio just overtook everyone again like it’s a racetrack!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: It’s always the same one, looks like she’s just waiting for a straight stretch to speed off.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know, the other day she passed me, I heard: [vroom], [vroom], and in a flash she was already gone.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: No wonder, everyone turns to look as soon as that car goes by!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You can feel the passion under the hood, or maybe just the urge to steal the spotlight.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: It almost feels like a movie scene, right outside the school.

meaning: bruit de dourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Amandine, look at what’s on my arm, I feel it tickling!

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Oh wow, wait, don’t move, there’s something flying around you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Ouch, it’s circling, it’s even making loops... [buzz], [buzz]... It looks like it doesn’t want to leave.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: I should have brought my fan, it’s always useful at times like this!

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
