dialogue.text: Looks like my perfume is attracting the whole crowd today!

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: It’s official, the terrace is their kingdom as soon as we sit down.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I told you having a picnic under this big tree would be perfect, look how nice it is in the shade.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And on top of that, we found the perfect spot for the blanket, nothing is slanted!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, stop, do you feel that breeze? And that little [buzz] right next to your ear…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, come on, it looks like it picked my sandwich!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Move your plate to the other side, maybe it'll prefer my apricot juice.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Let's hope it has a thing for fruit—I'll let you offer it a tasting!

meaning: bruit de dourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There’s something buzzing around me, it’s so annoying…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You felt it too? I thought something brushed past my ear.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, right there, [bzz]... [bzz]... it keeps swooping by so close!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I hope that one doesn’t end up in my glass.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That would be just my luck—every time I have a picnic, it happens.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: We should just send them an official invitation, at least then it would be clear!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This checkered blanket was really a great idea for the lawn!

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Good thing, but I feel like something is tickling the back of my neck…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, it's going [bzz] right next to your ear, it stresses me out every time!

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Good thing you're keeping an eye out, otherwise I wouldn't even notice.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll bring a bell or a drum to scare them off, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Or we could swap the sandwiches for garlic, that should create a safety zone!

meaning: bruit de dourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you smell that lavender scent? It feels like we're right in the middle of Provence.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, but listen to that little [buzz] near my ear... A bee must want to share our snack!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, they're attracted to anything that smells nice and sweet.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If only they liked cheese instead of fruit tart!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Forget the bee, enjoy the sunshine with me.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, but keep an eye on my ear, just in case our friend wants to land there!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The spot under this tree is really perfect for spreading out the blanket, look how the light dances on the grass.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And we're sheltered from the wind, do you feel that little breeze? It's just right.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice? There's something fluttering not far from the pie.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, I thought I saw a shadow pass by, right above your cup.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With all these flowers around, it was bound to happen that our guests would show up.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And there it goes again... [buzz] [buzz], it tickles my ear every time!

meaning: son produit par des cymbales.
bruit cinglant produit par le sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Look at this scene, it looks like the band is going to give it their all tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, as soon as the musician raises his hand, it's suspenseful... and then, [zap], everyone jumps all at once!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: I love this adrenaline rush, honestly, it really grabs you!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's crazy how everyone around is buzzing too, you can feel the tension rise and then drop all of a sudden.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: We should come to their concerts more often, this atmosphere is unmatched!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm getting an official t-shirt, just to keep a souvenir of this energy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, the stage really impressed me last night, especially when the light started to dance over the musicians.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I noticed that too, especially that moment when Antoine was drumming like crazy, every move seemed so precise!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There was this tension in the air just before he started that unexpected sequence.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And suddenly, [bam], the whole room jumped! I saw you jump too, it was unforgettable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I thought my heart was going to leap out of my chest, the whole audience was holding their breath.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's in those moments that you feel the real power of a concert, don't you think?

meaning: bruit cinglant produit par le sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It feels like we’re in the middle of a western here, honestly I feel like an arrow could come flying at any moment.

dialogue.speaker: Clement
dialogue.text: As long as we stay behind the line, everything’s fine! The archers are super accurate, look.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I see, but with my luck, it’s still risky… I hope you can run fast!

dialogue.speaker: Clement
dialogue.text: Well, it’s almost more stressful to prepare a presentation than to be here, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait! Did you just hear that thing whiz right above us?

dialogue.speaker: Clement
dialogue.text: [whoosh]… That was close, it sounds like the air is still whistling around us!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, I found an old blowpipe in the attic! Bet I can hit that can over there?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If you hit it on the first try, I'll make the snack! But avoid the window this time, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I got a running start on purpose… Watch your ears!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Alright, I’m hiding behind the chair. Fire at will!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [zing]! Did you see that shot? I think this is my specialty now.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Such precision, you look like Robin Hood in slippers!

meaning: bruit produit par un ressort sous tension brusquement libéré.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Camille, come take a look, the drawer in the old sideboard won't open. It looks like it's stuck again.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh, hand me the screwdriver. I'll try to pry it open, maybe it'll move.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, but go easy... ah! [boing]! Did you see that?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Whoa, that thing almost jumped right at my face!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We've come across the mechanical beast that's been hidden for 40 years!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Well, next time I'm coming with armor, just in case the sideboard has more surprises in store!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Look at this old armchair—every time I try to sit down, it threatens to collapse.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Wait, let me see. If we lift the seat gently, maybe we can figure out where it's stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Alright, but be ready—you never know with these antiques…

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Oh—[boing]! Did you hear that? I think we just woke something up.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Wow, that was unexpected! I didn't think it would react so quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: That's what happens when you play explorer in a living room… What an adventure, honestly!

meaning: bruit de dourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: With a place like this, we've found the perfect spot for a bite to eat, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: I agree, the grass is soft and I love the view of the pond. The cheese is just waiting for us!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Wait, don't move... something just zipped past your head.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Oh, I think it's another unexpected guest who wants to share our picnic.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: And there it goes again... [buzz], [buzz], right above the grapes!

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: If only it preferred the camembert, we'd have the peace of a king!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: [buzz]... There you go, it's always when I start taking out the cheese that one of them pops up out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: You should see your face, it looks like you're preparing a defense strategy against an invasion.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: No kidding, last time my sandwich turned into a landing strip!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: With you, even a picnic on the grass turns into a big show.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Seriously, there must be an invisible sign: 'All-you-can-eat buffet' above our blanket.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm bringing caving gear, just in case it turns into an expedition!

meaning: bruit du cri du canard.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at all those little feathered creatures near the water lilies, it's almost like a show over there!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: You'd think they're holding a secret meeting—it's rare to see so many gathered like that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I love how they glide as if they're barely touching the water... it's mesmerizing.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Do you think they'll come over if we watch them a little longer?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at the one speeding ahead, it looks like it's answering the [quack] from the one in the middle!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: It's really getting lively—it's almost like a debate worthy of a duck assembly.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, Fabien, the sun is shining right on the lake—you could almost see your reflection in it like the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Fabien
dialogue.text: And do you see that little crowd on the shore? The ducks have found another treasure trove of peelings.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I feel like every time I spot one, it tries to dive for something improbable.

dialogue.speaker: Fabien
dialogue.text: Right there, listen... [quack], [quack], they're putting on their own concert, those clever ones!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's impossible to stay serious with that kind of background noise—it really sounds like a comedy troupe.

dialogue.speaker: Fabien
dialogue.text: Sometimes I think they should have a spot at the comedy festival, feathered and web-footed edition.

meaning: bruit produit par une forte expiration.
bruit d'un fluide ou d'une mèche qui fuse.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If I’d known the trail was this steep, I would’ve brought a rope, can you imagine!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, we almost deserve a mountaineering medal just for that stretch!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Sitting on this bench, I feel like I’m floating—my legs are like jelly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look how tiny the city looks from here, it really puts everything in perspective.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I think the climb took all the wind out of me. My muscles are already begging for mercy.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [ahh]... *he leans back against the bench, closing his eyes* This is the kind of tiredness that actually feels good, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [phew]... I'm finally catching my breath, this day has wiped me out!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can tell, you look completely exhausted.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was running everywhere, it was like a real tornado in my open space.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Same here, I skipped lunch and my legs are reminding me of it!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We need a real break, otherwise we won't make it through the evening.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Come on, I'll treat you to a hot chocolate, that'll fix everything.

meaning: pour mettre en fuite un animal.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh look, Jules, there's a flock of sparrows on the windowsill!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Oh wow, they're getting closer to the salad bowl... Those rascals aren't afraid at all.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If we don't do anything, they'll peck at everything, just like last time.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Let me try a technique, maybe I've got the right move.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Go ahead, show me how you handle it with your improvisation skills.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: [shoo shoo], come on, move along, you performers! [shoo shoo], this isn't an all-you-can-eat buffet!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see? There's another pigeon on the railing.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that one's persistent. He comes back every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If we don't do something, soon the whole neighborhood will come to eat here!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll make him leave... [shoo shoo], [shoo shoo]! There, he's flying away.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well done, I think he got the message this time.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: We'll end up putting up a sign: 'No pigeons allowed'!

meaning: bruit produit par un coup violent.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: See that garage door? It's stuck again, it's a real headache.

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: If I hit the bottom a bit, maybe it'll come loose. Hand me that old broom.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Go easy, last time you almost bent the whole thing!

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: *[thunk]*! Well... it moved more than I thought.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Unbelievable, it's going to fall apart if you keep that up!

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: Let's just call it Victor-style DIY...

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I was in the kitchen, and suddenly, I hear a huge [crack] coming from the living room. I almost dropped my cup!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No kidding! With a noise like that, I would have jumped out of my skin. Did you see what it was, in the end?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Yes, the big window slammed shut by itself because of the draft. It really startled me, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The window, always the window... You were lucky nothing got broken!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Just a few knick-knacks got moved, but nothing serious. I’ve learned my lesson: block the window next time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, there’s never a dull moment at your place, that’s for sure!

meaning: bruit d'une batterie d'orchestre.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I haven't been able to get that chorus out of my head since last night, can you believe it?

dialogue.speaker: Samir
dialogue.text: I had the same problem, it keeps looping, especially the part where it speeds up!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Do you remember when everyone clapped their hands during the big '[clap boom]' in the song? I got chills!

dialogue.speaker: Samir
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, the atmosphere was electric at that moment, it really stuck with me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's crazy, the whole room was vibrating together, no one could stay seated.

dialogue.speaker: Samir
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it makes me want to jump up for the chorus again!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you close your eyes, it's like the whole scene is vibrating around us, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Totally, it feels like every musician is giving it their all on their instrument tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh wait, this part, do you hear it? [bam boom]! It gives me goosebumps.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's intense, right? I love this energy, it's enough to make you lose track of time.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: We really should come to concerts like this more often, it's always a different experience.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: With a show like this, it's hard to come back down to earth. We're not going to forget this night anytime soon!

meaning: bruit soudain et sec d'un déclic ou d'un coup, notamment d'un coup de fouet.
pour marquer une ablation brutale ou une mort violente, notamment par décapitation.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: So, Laetitia, do you want to try the press today? It looks more complicated than expected.

dialogue.speaker: Laetitia
dialogue.text: Hand me that lever there, you'll see... and there, *[clack]*, the safety's off.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: The way you tinker, you'd almost make me believe you do this every weekend!

dialogue.speaker: Laetitia
dialogue.text: With all these machines, you have to have a few tricks up your sleeve.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: I have a feeling you're going to make me rediscover working out, your way...

dialogue.speaker: Laetitia
dialogue.text: As long as you don't scream at every weird noise, you should survive!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was just under the shelf looking for the sugar when, out of nowhere, [clack], the lid of the old cookie tin snapped shut!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: You were lucky, that tin always has a trick up its sleeve.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I almost felt like I was being watched... even the cat jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: That just proves we're not the only ones getting surprised in this kitchen full of mysteries.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm getting the sugar with a headlamp, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: With you, even baking a cake turns into a detective novel adventure!

meaning: bruit soudain et sec d'un déclic ou d'un coup, notamment d'un coup de fouet.
pour marquer une ablation brutale ou une mort violente, notamment par décapitation.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: It looks like this hatch hasn't moved in ages. Did you see the layer of dust?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it's impressive! Do you think it will still open or is it going to resist us?

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: I'll try to pull it, but you really need some strength... It's already creaking a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't give up, I feel like it'll give in if you keep at it.

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: I'm changing my angle... there, I think this might work. Get ready, just in case...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [crack]! Ah, there we go, the hatch finally gave way. You almost made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I found the old binder from the attic, but the clasp is stubborn as usual.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Look, if I press right here and turn... [click]! See, it finally moves.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, that almost made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: This binder definitely has a mind of its own, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It looks like it hasn’t lost any of its sturdiness over the years.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Even memories put up a bit of resistance sometimes, apparently!

meaning: bruit produit par l'aspiration d'un liquide ou d'un aliment semi-liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This lemon tart is like a cloud, just wait and see!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: I have to admit, the cream looks super smooth... will you give me a nice big slice?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Grab your spoon, it's absolutely to die for when it's still warm.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Careful, if I love it, I'll have seconds without any shame.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: *takes a bite, quiet sound* [slurp]... Oh, that texture!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Looks like it passes the test with flying colors, even without a jury!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: (She sips with her straw) [slurp]! Well, I think this mix has decided to give me a run for my money this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now that's a competition: your straw versus the toughest breakfast!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Every sip is a victory. Apparently, the blender couldn't win this time...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Tell me, is there more fruit or more patience in that glass?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At this point, I'm tempted to grab a ladle or call for backup.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hang in there, soldier! The morning better watch out with you around.

meaning: bruit produit par l'aspiration d'un liquide ou d'un aliment semi-liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Did you see the texture of the soup tonight? It's like a caress in the spoon.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll try it, just talking about it is making my mouth water.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: *[slurp]* Mmm, each spoonful is softer than the last.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It almost looks magical, the way you savor it.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I have to say, your recipe really brings out the flavors.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'm glad you like it, we should do this more often after a long day.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at this bowl of soup, it's almost as colorful as my favorite sweater!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Bet I can finish it in less than two minutes?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you manage it without getting it everywhere, I'll give you my dessert.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Careful, I'm taking a big spoonful... and aiming for perfection.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: (Lucas noisily slurps his spoon) [slurp]! That sound is like a machine!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hold on to your dessert, I think you're going to have to share it!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Well, it looks like the garden air caught me off guard!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: What an entrance, really, you sure know how to liven things up.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: I think my nostrils decided to join the tour without warning me.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If they keep signing up like that, I suggest we give them a medal.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Only if you promise not to give them an official speech!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Scout's honor, no ceremony, just a bouquet of tissues!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at all these blossoming trees, I feel like I’m in an explosion of colors!

dialogue.speaker: Yacine
dialogue.text: It’s true, but my nostrils aren’t thanking spring—I can feel it tickling more and more…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you want, I always have tissues in my pocket, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Yacine
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s good… wait a second, I feel it coming...

dialogue.speaker: Yacine
dialogue.text: [Achoo]! There, it just happened on its own, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you ask me, today is the start of a real nose festival for you!

meaning: bruit produit par l'aspiration d'un liquide ou d'un aliment semi-liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: So, Lucas, ready to try my new culinary creation? Don’t pretend you’re scared, okay!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Your experiments have almost turned my tongue into a rainbow before... but alright, here I go!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Careful, it’s really creamy... *[slurp]* Oops, I think the texture caught me off guard a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wow, just from that sound, I wasn’t expecting to be transported to a miniature swamp.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: That’s how you know it’s a homemade recipe worthy of a chef’s competition, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Definitely, and I even get the full sound effects—perfect for the immersive experience!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope you're hungry, I invented a new soup recipe!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, so this is the famous secret you were talking about all day?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: ([slurp]) Here you go, nothing like a big spoonful to discover the surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wow, the texture is surprising! What did you put in it, honestly?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If I tell you right away, it ruins the mystery…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, then I'll have some more, I'll investigate spoonful by spoonful!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, d'un geste brusque.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If this staple pops off again, it really means this file has it in for me.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: Let me see, I think you didn’t use the stapler the right way.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here, try it yourself. For me, it always slips at the last second.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: Watch closely, you have to press here and hold the paper, but it’s really not easy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, before the paperwork flies everywhere, I’m holding my breath...

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: There we go, a good push... [clack]! This time, it’s sealed for good.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: This drawer still refuses to open, it's starting to drive me crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: No kidding... It's been stuck for days. Let me try something.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Go ahead, but be careful not to lose your fingers in there this time!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got this. I'll give it a quick jerk, let's see what happens.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: If you manage it, I'll buy you coffee for a week!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Watch closely... *[thunk]*... Ah! There we go, it gave way!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, d'un geste brusque.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Hey, Victor, are you sure this shelf will hold up under the weight of the books?

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: No worries, I just checked the anchor... But we should lift it a bit, it's leaning.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Alright, to the left like this... Is that better now?

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: Don't move, Nadia! Now's the time to secure everything with a good push.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: One, two... and there: [thunk]! Let's hope this time it doesn't move a millimeter.

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: Now we can line up the whole collection without worry, mission accomplished like pros.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you keep squeezing between all these boxes, you're going to end up knocking everything over, Camille!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's just that the box at the very top looks like it has my old magazines... I absolutely have to get it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Be careful, that old stool doesn't look very stable under your feet.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Too late to back down, look... [thud]! Oops, I think it fell behind the box.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You really have a knack for getting yourself into impossible situations, seriously.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: One more adventure to tell, and I finally got my famous box!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, d'un geste brusque.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey Marc, did you see how wobbly that board was on the terrace?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I put my bag on it this morning and bam, [clang], the board really shifted from the impact!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, it didn’t look very sturdy, did it?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I think it’s just waiting for the right moment to send someone crashing to the ground.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: In that case, we’d better put up a ‘caution: stunt zone’ sign before tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: And maybe get the inflatable cushion ready—you never know with our guests!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Careful Paul, if you make another [thud] against the wardrobe, it's going to collapse eventually!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry, I thought I had my movement under control...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Try to go easy, it's already creaking everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I'll lift this box instead of dragging it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good idea, at least we'll still have furniture tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Promise, gentle mission from now on!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, d'un geste brusque.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Well, this box refuses to fit through the door. Do you think if we force it a bit, it'll work?

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Honestly, with how wide it is, I wouldn't bet on it. We might end up getting something stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: If I tilt it to the right and push all the way, it should work.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Wait, slowly, it's wedged right between the handle and the wall now!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Too late, it's slipping—*[thunk]*—it went through but it hit something.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Oh wow, with that noise, I hope the paint didn't get damaged!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Paul, are you sure you want to lift the table by yourself?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, it’s not that heavy. I’m just tilting it a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Careful with the tiles, last time you almost chipped them all.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: *[thunk]*… And there we go, the leg just hit the baseboard!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh no, I hope it’s not damaged—we’re going to have to fix that…

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I’ll be more careful… if the table survives until then!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, d'un geste brusque.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: You feel the tension, huh? It’s not every day we make it to the last piece.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: Stop it, you’re doing it on purpose, I’m trying not to shake here…

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Look, everyone’s holding their breath… It’s your turn!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: One second, I’m steadying my hand… If I mess up, it’s a disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: The more you hesitate, the riskier it gets! Come on, we want a show!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: *He places the piece in the center of the tower* – [clack]! And there we go, mission accomplished… I think.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Here, hand me the big board, I think we're starting to see the shape of the furniture.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: Wait, there's one screw left to put in here, it's a bit stuck in the corner.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Try giving it a little tap, maybe that'll do the trick.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: There we go, I'm pushing... [thunk]! Oh, that reacted pretty strongly all of a sudden, I hope that's a good sign.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Look, the board is standing straight now, it looks like your technique worked.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: If the whole piece holds up this well, we'll be able to have dinner on it tonight, ha!

meaning: bruit d'un mécanisme à air comprimé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The compressor is acting weird again today, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Wait, look, if I press here… *[hiss]*… see, it reacts right away now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: These reactions always surprise me, it’s like it has a personality.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It likes it when we talk nicely to it, that’s the key!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll try giving it a compliment to see if that softens it up.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Go ahead, but be careful, it can get touchy when it’s hot in the workshop!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Look, when I press the pump... [pssh] ! Did you hear that sound? It's really typical of old compressed air gadgets!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that's the most satisfying moment when you're reinflating a tire.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Do you want to try? You need a bit of strength at first.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'd like to, but don't make fun of me if I don't get it on the first try!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I promise, I'll be good. Go ahead, show me your muscles.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Watch out, here we go! I'm doing my best, boss.

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look, Pierre, [shh shh]… [shh shh]… Do you feel the power of the machine when it passes right in front of us?

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: It gives me goosebumps every time, it's almost like a living creature breathing.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I remember the first time I saw it, I thought it was going to come straight off the tracks and cross the square.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: My little brother would do anything to sit next to the driver, he's fascinated by these metal monsters.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Come on, let's walk along the platform before it leaves again, maybe we'll get a wink from the engineer.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: And if we slip near the barrier, we'll have the best view for when it starts up again – it's unmissable!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at the rails, they're sparkling in the morning light—it almost makes you want to go on an adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen to how it echoes when the wheels get closer... [chug chug]... it's almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You're going to end up making me feel like I'm in a nineteenth-century novel with all your sound effects!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think I missed my calling as a stationmaster with all these special effects.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: If we ever change our lives, we'll take the Paris-Vienna trip on an old train—it's settled.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal! With or without period costumes, that's a promise—watch out!

meaning: bruit sec produit par un choc, une chute, un coup, un déclic ou un mécanisme.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Since this morning, I haven’t been able to open the toolbox under the shelf—it’s so frustrating.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you try pushing on the left side? Sometimes that unlocks the latch.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If I keep at it, I’m afraid I’ll break it... But I admit I’m starting to lose my patience.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, hang in there, you’ll get it this time. You just need a bit of muscle!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: *[click]* Ah, see? It really was stuck…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The box put up a fight, but it finally gave in—well done!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: See this old toolbox? It hasn't opened for weeks.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Look, I'm taking the screwdriver... [click]! Did you see that? It gave way without warning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it just needed a bit of persistence... or a lot of strength!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Or maybe it was just waiting for the right moment to cooperate, who knows.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If everything could get unstuck that easily, life would be a lot simpler.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Well, now we can finally tackle that wobbly shelf!

meaning: bruit d'un marche féminine rapide.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, something unexpected always happens at this time...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Totally! Some days it feels like the building comes alive on its own.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, there it goes again, that little [click clack] going down the hallway has become our Thursday signal.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I love it, it usually means a wacky story or some juicy scoop is coming.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Last week, it was the delivery of giant plants, so today... anything's possible!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm keeping my eyes wide open, nothing gets past me in this office, Sophie’s honor!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm pacing in front of the bakery window, I almost gave in for a tart... Are you getting close?

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: If I keep weaving like this, I'll deserve two desserts! Almost there, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There it is, the famous [click clack] crossing the square—I’d recognize your footsteps anywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: That's my superpower for dodging crowds!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not bad! Come on, the tart is waiting for us. Want to bet we won't leave a single crumb?

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, but only if you share your fork!

meaning: bruit sonore, d'origine métallique, produit notamment par un choc, par un déclic.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Honestly, this shelf just refuses to cooperate today...

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Wait, hand me that flathead screwdriver, I'll give it one last try.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Here you go, but be careful, the screw on the right is already about to pop out.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I'm holding the panel with my hand, aiming right at the corner…

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, [clank]! Sounds like it suddenly gave way.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It's sturdy, but what suspense every time we touch it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The old trunk still refuses to open... want to try your luck with me?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Clearly, it's not going to give in easily. Should we push together on three?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Perfect, get ready... one, two, and...

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: *Strains on the lid* And now, [clank]! Looks like it knows who's boss.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: About time, I almost lost my grip on it.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Mission accomplished, and we didn't come out too badly!

meaning: bruit sonore, d'origine métallique, produit notamment par un choc, par un déclic.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: [clank clunk]! That's what happens when I try to force this old wardrobe, it still puts up just as much of a fight...

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Whoa, that echoed all the way down the hallway! Are you really going to keep at it?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I'm stubborn, you know that. And who knows, there might still be some photo albums stuck in the back.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: With your persistence, even the most stubborn doors better watch out!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: A rusty handle isn't going to discourage me, you know me.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: I admire the boldness, but if you want me to stand guard against splinters, just let me know!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look at that old padlock on the shed door, it's still hanging on but it looks like it's about to crumble to dust.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wait, let me try the key... [clank clunk]... Well, it's still got a bit of resistance!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: What a contraption, it almost sounds like a pirate chest with all that noise.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Yeah right, I bet there are more cobwebs than treasures inside.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we find even a single nail that's still solid, I'm keeping it for good luck!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Deal, but you clean the handle if it's sticky, okay?

meaning: bruit sonore, d'origine métallique, produit notamment par un choc, par un déclic.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: So Martin, can you confirm we're starting to put this panel back in place now? There's only one screw left.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: I'm ready! Hand me the nut, and try not to pinch your fingers this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got this! Look, I'm positioning the plate... there, it's lined up nicely.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Hold it steady... and there we go, a good turn of the wrench and... [clang]! Looks like it caught well.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That kind of noise always makes you jump, but at least nothing moved.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Let's say that's the signal to start on the next side, if you're up for it.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: [clang] There you go, that’s what happens when you try to juggle a pot and a strainer at the same time...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That was spectacular, I thought we were filming a commercial for shockproof utensils!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: And you still haven’t seen my spatula throw: worthy of an Olympic final.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful, you’re going to end up sending the freshly washed dishes flying!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: If something goes flying across the kitchen, it’ll probably be because I tried one acrobatic move too many.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: For now, I’m going to keep my apron as a shield, just in case a lid decides to make a run for it!

meaning: bruit, ponctuel et sonore, produit par un choc, par un mécanisme.
bruit produit par les lèvres ou par le claquement de la langue contre le palais.
bruit de claquoir annonçant une prise de vues.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know this briefcase has been lying around here for two weeks, Arthur?

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've often wondered what's inside, but it's stayed locked.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look, there's some kind of latch on the side, try pulling it toward you.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm pressing it—the latch is a bit stuck, that's odd…

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: [click]! There we go, it just opened without much effort.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Finally, the mystery is solved… Let's see what's inside!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And there we go, case closed! ([clap]) It's not every day I wrap up a tricky file like that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, you almost made me spill my coffee! You can tell you really put your heart into it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, I had to mark the occasion. I was starting to think that report would never leave me alone.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you only knew how many times I've dreamed of doing the same with my spreadsheets!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: So, shall we both unplug? I almost feel like celebrating with a little craziness—impromptu toasties?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With pleasure! I'll make you the first toast, speedy-closure champion!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, le plus souvent d'origine métallique et produit par le déclic d'un méchanisme, d'un dispositif.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Marc, are you still keeping your keys in that old tin box?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Ah, it's been with me since high school! But that darn lid gives me trouble every time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, if you press here and then there... [click click]... and there you go, mission accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That's amazing, you've really got the knack!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Years of opening secret boxes builds up some skill, believe me.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Maybe I should trust you with my toolboxes—who knows what you might find!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That darn pen is still missing from the back drawer—could you hand me the metal box?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, hang on, I'll grab it from behind the printer... This box is a bit stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know, last time, that tiny padlock held me up for five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Want to try your luck today? I hear you're the champion of impossible unlocks!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, the latch is turning and... [click click]... there, it finally gives!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Victory, you've just accessed the official hiding spot for lost things!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, le plus souvent d'origine métallique et produit par le déclic d'un méchanisme, d'un dispositif.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: This darn lock still won't open, do you want to give it a try?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hand it over, I think there's a trick with the bottom dial.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I'm turning it slowly... wait... *[click click click]*... it's reacting, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds promising, keep going like that!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: There we go, it's done, the hatch is finally opening!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You just had to tame the mechanism, well done, expert!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look at this old Polaroid, Paul, do you think it still works?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It looks like it hasn't seen the light of day in ages, but I really want to give it a try.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Here, put in a film, I think it still has a bit of battery left.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Wait... look, I'm closing the flap and... [click click click]... did you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Incredible, it's still alive! Should we try taking a photo?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Get your best smile ready, we're about to take a real trip back in time!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, le plus souvent d'origine métallique et produit par le déclic d'un méchanisme, d'un dispositif.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see that old spice box? It’s never wanted to cooperate with me.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Let me see, I bet it’ll give in to my expert fingers.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good luck, last year even Grandma gave up against its stubbornness!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Ah, so this is the cupboard’s tough one… Let’s see what happens.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, wait... I heard that little [click clack]!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: There we go, the fortress has finally revealed its secrets!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Say, Marc, have you ever seen a box as stubborn as this one?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Never! Look, I'm trying every trick but this thing just refuses to cooperate.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let me see... If you hold it firmly, maybe I can twist it a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Come on, maybe we'll have better luck together. Careful, I'm going slowly!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah! Hey, did you hear that? Just now, that little *[click click]*... We must be making progress!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: We're almost there, I knew it! Just a bit more and we've got it.

meaning: Bruit sec, bref (alternant parfois avec clac).
Pression du doigt sur le bouton d'une souris ou sur un écran pour activer une commande.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If I have to fill out this form by hand again, I'm going to lose my patience, Lucas.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: One moment, I'm grabbing this old pen from the drawer, it should still work.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: How much do you want to bet it won't write from the very first line?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We'll see... sometimes you just have to press a little on the tip.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, listen, there was a little [click]... I hope that's a good sign for your pen.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like the ink is finally coming out, you'll be able to fill out your famous form!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: You see the drawer that always gets stuck? I'm trying to put the rail back in place, but it won't stay.

dialogue.speaker: Thibault
dialogue.text: Wait, hand me the screwdriver, I think there's a tab to snap in right here.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Here you go, I left it behind the toolbox, it kept sliding everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Thibault
dialogue.text: Perfect, hold the drawer straight while I insert the piece.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Okay, it's steady now, go ahead.

dialogue.speaker: Thibault
dialogue.text: There, the tab just locked in... [click]! Your drawer should slide better now.

meaning: bruit répété ou à deux temps, souvent d'origine métallique.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you see that strange suitcase under the stairs? It almost feels like it's hiding a secret.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It looks like it hasn't moved in ages... Come on, let's try to figure out how the lock works!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come closer, look: the mechanism is a bit bent, and everything seems stuck. This might take a bit of finesse.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Let me try with this old spoon, I almost feel like a little burglar.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait... listen to that, [click and clack]... Something's finally happening!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yes! The suitcase is opening, get ready to discover a real treasure or a dust nest.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: This trunk under the cobwebs looks like it’s been through generations, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It seems almost indestructible! Do you think we’ll manage to uncover its mystery today?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: The rusty latch is holding fast… I wonder when it was last opened.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: There must be a tool in this old box somewhere, wait, here’s a piece of metal, try using this.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Perfect, I’m sliding the blade in gently… Be ready, you never know what we’ll find inside!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: There we go, listen… [click and clack]! The trunk is finally ready to reveal its secrets.

meaning: Onomatopée exprimant un claquement sec et répété.
Canapé-lit transformable qui se plie en deux (en faisant ce bruit).

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, [click-clack], [click-clack], it starts up again as soon as I handle the cookie tin!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I was just about to ask what you were doing with it—are you hoping to find the secret cookies?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I thought there was still one left, but apparently you got there before me...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, you should never leave a cookie tin closed for too long.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The way it's resisting, I wonder if it's protecting treasures or memories.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Or maybe it's just testing you to see how persistent you are when it comes to treats!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If you see my blue binder, don't panic, it just moved itself somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, so it's the one hiding under the pile of invoices to your right?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Exactly, it loves that spot. I wonder what it dreams about when I'm not here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Probably about a vacation far away from paperwork! Need a hand tidying everything up?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Thanks, I’ve got chaos under control. But get your ears ready, the stapler isn’t done making noise.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at it go, the artist! [click-clack], [click-clack]… This office has heard plenty of end-of-day symphonies.

meaning: bruit répété ou à deux temps, produit par de petits chocs.
bruit des sabots d'un cheval.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It feels like even the walls are holding their breath tonight, don’t you think, Lucas?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, but there’s still this little something slipping into the quiet... I just can’t put my finger on it.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Isn’t it the window moving? Or maybe it’s that old piece of furniture again?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Nothing’s moving over here… I just have this strange feeling there’s a tiny orchestra hidden somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Ah, do you hear that? [click-clack]… I bet it’s coming from the corner near the radiator.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You’re right, now it’s almost hypnotic… It’s like the house wants to join in the conversation!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Still inspecting that mysterious box under the window?

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: Don’t you think there’s a strange mechanism inside it?

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: And every time you turn the little key, everyone in the house starts turning their heads!

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely… [click-clack], [click-clack], do you hear how it echoes all the way down the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: It’s like that box has something to reveal.

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: I bet it’s from a time when every object knew how to tell a story.

meaning: bruit léger et ponctuel, souvent d'origine métallique ou résultant d'un choc contre un verre.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: I admit, the pie looks so good, I'll go ahead and get the plates out while you cut it.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Did you get the little spoons too? I have a feeling this dessert is going to disappear fast.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: They're right here, ready for action! Careful, I'm putting the glasses next to you.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Ah – *[clink]*… Oops, that's what happens when we're too eager for sweets.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Good thing nothing broke, or the pie would have ended up in time-out!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: I promise, I'll calm down… but there's no way I'm slowing down on the pie!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This terrace reminds me of our evenings last summer. Have you noticed how lively the atmosphere is tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it almost feels like a spontaneous party. Are you tempted by a mojito like usual?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Tempting, but I'm going to switch it up with a craft beer tonight. And you, sticking with your fruity white wine?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know me too well! It's always my little treat when the air is this mild. Ah, the drinks are here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Come on, let's toast to the habits that change and the ones that stay! *[clink]*

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: To all these evenings, and to the ones we haven't even imagined yet.

meaning: bruit léger et ponctuel, souvent d'origine métallique ou résultant d'un choc contre un verre.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: I feel like the coffee machine is our best ally today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: A powerful ally! Start the first round, I'll get the cookies ready.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Here you go, two coffees almost worthy of a barista. Do you want sugar?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Always one spoonful, otherwise it’s not really the little luxury of break time.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Here’s to our ever-resilient minds, even on a Tuesday! *[clink]*

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If we survive this week, next time it’s my treat for chocolate croissants!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This table almost makes me feel like I'm sitting at a café terrace in Montmartre, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I was just about to say that! With this view, all that's missing is a little accordion music in the background.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So, Lucas, ready to taste the best hot chocolate in town?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: (Sliding his spoon in the saucer, a soft [clink] rings out) Always ready for a gourmet break, especially among experts!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Want to bet you won't be able to resist asking for a second cup?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you have another, it's already over for me, I admit!

meaning: bruit sonore produit par des chocs; bruit à deux temps produit par un mécanisme.
bruit produit par des pas.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Are you pressing a bit hard on the pedal, Maxime?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Listen, as soon as I press it, it goes [click clack], isn't that great?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That kind of thing always surprises me on your old bike!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It's got character, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Definitely, with all that racket, there's no way we go unnoticed.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Perfect for letting everyone know we're coming around the corner, as usual!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ever since you brought out that old toy, the atmosphere in the room has completely changed.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: It had been sleeping at the back of the attic for years. I hope it still works.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, as soon as I press here… [click clack]… it starts up again, it’s incredible!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: It takes me back years, I can see those winter Sundays when we used to play together.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We should have brought out these treasures more often instead of letting them gather dust.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I’ll take you with me to explore the attic’s treasure chest.

meaning: bruit léger, à deux temps, produit par un petit choc, une chute.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, it seemed like Émile was slipping just now, he barely caught himself!

dialogue.speaker: Émile
dialogue.text: Not even scared, it's just the tiles trying to trip me up.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Be careful, with those shoes, you could almost break into an improvised dance routine.

dialogue.speaker: Émile
dialogue.text: Wouldn't be bad, a little show during the coffee break, right?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Watch out, if you keep this up, you're really going to end up catching everyone's eye!

dialogue.speaker: Émile
dialogue.text: Listen, with every step I hear that famous little '[click clack]', it's almost a catchy beat.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: This old floor will never stop creaking, even without a storm.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sometimes I feel like it has a life of its own, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: It’s true, even Gaspard refuses to walk on it at night, he stops dead at every suspicious noise.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He must imagine creatures under the floorboards, I wouldn’t even be surprised.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Wait, did you notice the shadow near the wardrobe? I think something moved.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, it’s just the little wooden marble rolling again, listen to that little… [click clack]… it stopped under the chair!

meaning: petit bruit sec et sonore, produit par un déclic, par une légère explosion, par un petit choc.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, I found grandma's old paperweight hidden behind the books!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wow, that's crazy, I thought we lost it during the move.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, I want to see if it still works… [click]! The mechanism still moves, that's amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It reminds me of when grandma used to scare us with that sound!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Her favorite little trick, every Sunday afternoon without fail.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Even after all this time, some objects still keep their mischief, it seems.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Look at this jewelry box, it's impossible to open without forcing it a bit... Want to bet we'll find a treasure?

dialogue.speaker: Sylvain
dialogue.text: You know I love a challenge! Hand me the box, I want to give it a gentle try.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Here, if I press here and turn... [click]... Oh, something just happened!

dialogue.speaker: Sylvain
dialogue.text: Wait, set the box upright again, it looks like the lid moved a millimeter.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Try prying the latch this time, I feel like we're getting close!

dialogue.speaker: Sylvain
dialogue.text: Hold your breath... If it opens, you get to pick the first piece of jewelry!

meaning: petit bruit sec et sonore, produit par un déclic, par une légère explosion, par un petit choc.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If I turn the little key here… [click]… see, it reacts instantly!

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: Wow, you just impressed me. This system is super precise.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It might not look like much, but you really have to know the mechanism to get it right on the first try.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: I have to admit, I was expecting something a lot trickier—you really have it down.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's all about practice, you know! Plus, I've always been drawn to this kind of challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: No doubt, there are no secrets for you… I'll have to practice!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: This music box is driving me crazy, it got stuck for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Let me see, I bet I can do something with a fine pair of pliers.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Be careful with the cylinder, it's super fragile—one wrong move and everything goes flying.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I'm moving slowly. There, if I can just pry this lever apart…

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I'm holding my breath, this must be a trick you have to know by heart.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: *[click]* There, there was a kind of click—try turning the key now!

meaning: bruit ponctuel et sonore, produit par un mécanisme, par un appareil.
bruit ponctuel et sonore, produit par un coup violent, par un choc.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If we try to get a coffee out of this antique, do you promise not to make fun of me if it doesn't start?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, I can't promise anything, but I encourage you to give it a shot—you never know, a legend might come back to life!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: *Claire presses the button* [clunk]! See, it can still surprise us...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I admit, I wasn't expecting that little effect... It reminds me of my old childhood alarm clock!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, it'll end up purring and give us a real espresso.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'll get the cups ready, just in case a miracle happens; you keep an eye on the dashboard!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You know, this old typewriter always surprises me—the keys get stuck without warning.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If I try pressing the space bar gently, maybe I can unstick it.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Go ahead, but get ready to face the mechanics of another era!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: *He suddenly presses down and you hear* [clunk]! See, that's the kind of reaction that makes me jump every time.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Admit it, you didn't expect it to react so energetically.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I'm starting to think this machine has a soul, I swear.

meaning: bruit ponctuel et sonore, produit par un mécanisme, par un appareil.
bruit ponctuel et sonore, produit par un coup violent, par un choc.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Look, if I press here… [clang]! It’s like everything suddenly comes to life.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: It always gives me a little jolt when this thing starts up, like the machine wants to get noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That’s true, it never goes unnoticed. You can tell it’s got some punch.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: With a reaction like that, you don’t need an alarm to know it’s working.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Exactly, its personality shows from the very first moment—I really like that raw side.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: You could almost think it wants to join the conversation, in its own way!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This old washing machine still gives me chills, especially when I start the spin cycle.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I jumped when it suddenly went [clang], like it was trying to escape the laundry room!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It does that as soon as we put in more than three towels, that's its thing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Mine sometimes dances, but it’s never claimed its place in the house quite so well.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: We should almost give it a name with all the tricks it plays on us.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Next time it pulls a stunt, we’ll throw it a washing machine star night, promise!

meaning: bruit ponctuel, léger et sonore, produit par une chute, un choc, un arrêt, brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you ever find my bracelet under the couch, I owe you a coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'm reaching in... but aside from a handful of dust, nothing so far.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Careful, that old wobbly vase is still back there!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got surgeon's hands today.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll turn on my phone's flashlight, maybe that'll help you see something.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah... and there we go, the vase made a nice [clunk] on the floor. I swear, I didn't see that coming!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, that salad bowl is balancing precariously on the shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No way, it's fine, look, I'm moving it gently...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh! Now it went [clunk] on the counter, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I admit, I got a little shiver when I saw it move suddenly.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If it jumps again, you're the one cleaning up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal, I'll take the risk like a budding tightrope walker!

meaning: petit bruit sec et sonore, produit par un déclic, par une légère explosion, par un petit choc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If we put this shelf just under the window, does it look straight to you?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: A little more to the left… There, now it's perfect!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'll take the small piece out of the bag, can you remove the protective cardboard?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: All good, everything's clear, you can go whenever you're ready.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm positioning the piece… Careful, I'm going to press down firmly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, nice move… [clack], it's fixed!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [clunk]! Well, that surprises me every time—this old drawer hasn't lost its character.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That famous drawer really gives you a hard time, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It puts up a fight but always gives in eventually, with a little patience.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Want me to handle the next ones? I've got a secret technique.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Go ahead, show me this famous trick of yours—I could really use it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Get ready to be amazed, I've tamed more than one stubborn drawer in my life!

meaning: le bruit des genoux de Serge, dans la flaque d'eau qui couvre le parquet.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: What a mess under the window, there's practically a little pond here!

dialogue.speaker: Serge
dialogue.text: Last night's rain really soaked the floor, this is going to be fun to clean up…

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wait, I see some newspapers, I'll try to soak up a bit with them.

dialogue.speaker: Serge
dialogue.text: Oh darn — [splash] — now I've ended up on both knees in the water…

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: This is turning into a circus act, at this rate we'll need flippers!

dialogue.speaker: Serge
dialogue.text: Don't make fun, I already feel like a frog!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at this makeshift swamp, right at the foot of the sideboard!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Serge jumped in without hesitation, he probably thought paper towels would be enough.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: How much do you bet he'll get it everywhere kneeling down like that?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Ah, there it is... You can clearly hear '[squelch]', '[squelch]' every time he bends over. It's almost hypnotic after a while.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Poor guy, if this keeps up, he'll end up painting his pants with aquatic patterns...

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: That's it, next time I'm getting him waterproof knee pads for the housewarming.

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Do you feel how fresh the air is by the water tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: Yes, and the twilight makes everything feel a bit magical, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait… [ribbit]… did you hear that? It’s coming from the bush over there!

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: There you go, you’ve found tonight’s musician!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: What an atmosphere—now all we need is a campfire and a few stories.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: With little sounds like that, we’re definitely getting away from it all tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Last night, while walking near the marsh, there was an incredible atmosphere with the mist and little splashes of water.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I could almost imagine little figures appearing and a sudden '[ribbit]' slipping into the air without warning.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Nothing like it to bring the landscape to life, it felt like being in an old legend.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You know, with the darkness, I thought I saw the water move right when that sound came out.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Of course, the magic of damp evenings keeps on working.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Nothing beats these outings, everything becomes mysterious and a little funny at the same time.

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come on, the evening light on the pond is incredible, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It’s true, it changes everything—it looks like a different world just after sunset.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to the silence settling in, it’s almost magical here at this hour.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I love these kinds of suspended moments, it’s like time stands still.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, stay still… something’s about to happen, you’ll see.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: There! Do you hear that? Right at the edge… [ribbit]… it’s the perfect soundtrack for our getaway!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: This bench by the pond is really the perfect spot after a long day.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, it feels like even the air gets lighter when the sun disappears behind the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Wait, do you feel that strange atmosphere settling in, with the little shadows stretching out?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen... [ribbit]... [ribbit]... do you hear how it echoes among the reeds?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: It almost makes you want to dance under the moon, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With this soundtrack, anything seems possible—even making up an improvised dance.

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, while walking past the pond this evening, I heard a "[ribbit], [ribbit]" that blended perfectly into the peaceful night.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: To think that some people find country evenings too quiet... You got a real show!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Yes, and there was a kind of rhythm, as if everything was perfectly orchestrated over there.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: That almost makes me want to bring a chair and enjoy the show, with a little blanket on my lap.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Perfect for forgetting the city and letting yourself be lulled by those unexpected sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll even bring hot chocolate, just to savor the atmosphere to the fullest!

dialogue.speaker: Celine
dialogue.text: While walking around the old lake last night, I felt like I was stepping into another world.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's funny, I always feel something strange there too, as if everything is a little bit magical.

dialogue.speaker: Celine
dialogue.text: The mist was settling in gently, and it was as if every sound floated in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can just imagine the atmosphere with that golden light and the reflections on the water—everything becomes almost unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Celine
dialogue.text: Even the little shapes at the water's edge seemed to be part of the scene, each in their own way.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And suddenly, in that setting, an echo rose up among the reeds: [ribbit]... [ribbit]... it makes the night unique, don't you think?

meaning: Chant du coq.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, I had barely opened my eyes when I heard a [cock-a-doodle-doo] coming from the garden, it got me out of bed in a second!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You really live in another world—it's the hum of the heater that pulls me out of my dreams.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's true, things are pretty rustic around here; I imagine your mornings are a lot less lively.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let's just say no animal gives me that kind of noisy surprise, and my nerves are better off for it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And to think some people look for unique alarm clocks, when all you need is a weekend in the countryside!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Noted, next time I'll go for the country option—even if it means jumping out of my skin at dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Last night, did the calm of the countryside inspire you, or rather surprise you?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think it surprised me more… There was a real concert before sunrise.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Ah, that famous [cock-a-doodle-doo] echoing through the shutters… He’s got energy to spare!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Him and his whole crew—no way to ignore the morning fanfare!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That’s the charm of the countryside: you’ll never be woken up by a smartphone here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We certainly can’t say we’re lacking authenticity during our stay!

meaning: bruit du chant du coq.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hey, that sunrise was really something special this morning, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: It’s true, it’s such a change from the city vibe, everything feels more alive here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Did you manage to sleep despite the little morning surprises around here?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: I had quite a unique wake-up call, it almost made me smile under the covers.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait, are you talking about those sounds that come through the shutters at dawn?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Exactly, as soon as I opened my eyes, I heard a [cock-a-doodle-doo] echoing in the distance!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The night was still deep, and yet dawn pulled me out of bed without warning.

dialogue.speaker: David
