dialogue.text: That’s a sign you can’t escape the village rhythm, even under the covers.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Impossible to fight with all that racket outside; apparently, some people get used to it!

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: At my place, the windows shake every time the neighborhood champion gets going.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This morning, he let out his famous [cock-a-doodle-doo], I think even the trees shivered.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: A real natural alarm clock—only the countryside can offer that kind of surprise.

meaning: Cri du canard.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see the light on the water? It looks like the pond is sparkling with a thousand lights today.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: Yes, and the ducks seem to have decided to hold a general meeting—look at all that commotion!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [quack-quack], I think that one is trying to get all the attention, he’s the undisputed leader of the group.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: With a presence like that, he could put on a show all by himself!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I have to admit, we should almost buy tickets to attend their aquatic concert.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: And to think we just planned to take a quiet walk—now we’re invited to an impromptu performance.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's impossible to concentrate with all that commotion outside, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It all started when Émilie opened the door to the courtyard: [quack-quack], everywhere, like a mini protest!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It reminds me of the day one of them barged into the teachers' lounge, it caught us all off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, we thought it was a student's prank! That one wasn't afraid of anything.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet they're just waiting for someone to drop a piece of brioche.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Definitely, they're the real kings of the place when it comes to food.

meaning: Chant du coq.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The mist over the fields this morning was magical, it felt like being in a painting!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Nothing like a sunrise to make you feel alive. Did you notice all those little sounds around?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, especially over by the old chicken coop, there was a lot of rustling around at dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At my place, it's always a commotion as soon as it starts over there... You can quickly tell when they're out putting on their show.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And at one point, right outside the window: [cock-a-doodle-doo], blaring like a marching band, it made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can picture it, no mercy for anyone hoping to sleep in.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The light barely filtered into the room and already the silence was broken, as if nature had decided it was time to get up!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: And suddenly, [cock-a-doodle-doo] echoes behind the open window, impossible to stay under the covers!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I had forgotten how much you can rely on that morning punctuality, so different from my electronic alarm clock!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It definitely has more flair than a buzzer crackling straight out of the drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: And to think that in the city, we barely have the sound of pigeons to announce a new day.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: At least here, you know right away who sets the tempo from the very first light.

meaning: bruit du cri du courlis.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, listen to that strange echo drifting through the mist... [coo-loo], [coo-loo], did you hear it too?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think so, yes. It always comes from the same spot in the marsh, just behind that grove.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's fascinating how that kind of sound carries so far, even with all this fog.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's like nature is sending us signals. I love this slightly mysterious atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And every morning has its own rhythm, but this one really has a special feel.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: There's nothing better than these suspended moments to start the day, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look over there, near the reeds, there's something moving!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: You're right, and listen to all those strange sounds in the air, it's like a real hidden orchestra.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: There's one that really stands out, a cry that cuts through all the others—did you hear it?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Yes, it echoes above everything... I wonder what kind of animal could make a call like that.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If you had to imitate it, how would you do it? You seem pretty inspired by all these sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Hm, let me try: [caw-looee]... [caw-looee]... There, it almost gives you chills, doesn't it?

meaning: bruit du cri de la poule.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, didn’t you notice how good the air smells this morning? It’s like the garden wakes up before we do.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, when I crossed the yard, there was a real [cluck cluck] concert behind the chicken coop! I think they were in a great mood.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It’s probably thanks to the fresh seeds you sowed last night.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wonder if they recognized the sound of the bucket—they rushed over like it was a party.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Those greedy girls are more punctual than my alarm clock!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At this rate, I’ll end up organizing my day around their schedule—it’s them setting the pace for me!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, Eric, the red hen is running all over the place between the lettuces—she's going to end up turning everything upside down!

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I left the gate open... Do you think she's looking for a place to lay an egg?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Maybe, she always puts on her little show before finding the perfect spot.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Listen, just behind the fence... you can really hear: [cluck cluck] cluck! She must have found a nest.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That's her specialty! Every time, she surprises us with her unbelievable hiding spots.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: I bet we're going to be hunting for eggs in the garden again tonight!

meaning: poule, surtout quand elle a pondu.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, this morning, I almost spilled my coffee when I heard a commotion behind the barn!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It must have been lively to compete with your morning coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, I thought a little festival was starting among the feathered crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Your feathered girls sure know how to set the mood!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: When I got closer, one of them was strutting like a star on the red carpet.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: And then, right in the middle of her act, she went: [cluck cluck cluck], loud enough to wake up the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Julien, did you hear that racket behind the shed? [cluck cluck cluck], it just wouldn’t stop!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, so it was coming from over there? I thought the tractor was acting up again.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No, the tractor is behaving today. That was some real impromptu entertainment in the yard.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The feathered troupe is never afraid to put on a little show, that’s for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With them, mornings are always a bit lively, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If only they knew how much they brighten our days...

meaning: bruit du cri rauque du corbeau et des corvidés.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The bench under the trees has been calling to me for a while, look how nice it is here.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I get it, the calm and that scent of freshly cut grass—it's perfect for relaxing.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, there's a crow watching us so intently, it must be wondering what we're doing here.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: That one? It jumps onto the branch and... [caw] [caw]! It looks like it's challenging us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It feels like we're about to witness a whole improvised show.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: With these feathered actors, you never know what surprise is coming, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The trees are really lively today, don't you think? There's always something happening in this park.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Look up there, there's one who seems to be watching over the whole group. He's really impressive!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? It went '[ribbit] [ribbit] [ribbit]', right as we walked by! Does he think he's a conductor or something?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It's true, it looks like he wants us to react to his show. That one has some personality.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Between the calls and their little jumps on the branches, it really livens up the walk.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: With them around, it's impossible to get bored, that's for sure!

meaning: Son faux et discordant dans une ligne musicale.
Maladresse, incident qui rompt l'harmonie d'un processus.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: If there were an award for the biggest surprise last night, it would definitely go to the rehearsal of the final song!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No kidding, even the conductor almost dropped his baton from waving his arms around so much.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I thought we were going to burst out laughing with the basses—I could see your stunned faces from my stand.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, but you too, you were trying so hard not to laugh! But what exactly happened in the middle of the piece?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I heard a [squawk] so unexpected that even the altos looked up—we lost our place for two bars.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, that deserves to be told at the next group dinner, just to lighten the mood before the concert.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At the beginning of the piece, my finger slipped and I made a loud [squawk], everyone must have heard it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, but you recovered quickly, no one really reacted, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I felt my heart stop for a second, luckily I just kept going without thinking.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's in moments like that when practice pays off, you handled it really well.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I think from now on, I'll look at Raymond with admiration—he always gets through pieces without faltering.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With enough practice, we'll reach his level too, I'm sure of it!

meaning: bruit du cri du canard, parfois de l'oie.
bruit d'un avertisseur sonore.
son nasillard, parfois musical, produit par une personne ou un objet manufacturé.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, it's making that "[quack quack]" sound behind the hedge again! I told you something funny was going on around here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You really have a sharp ear! Maybe we've got some new feathered neighbors.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It's been nonstop since this morning. I wonder if they're getting ready for a big secret gathering.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if we discovered a private club just for them, with a password and everything?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: That would explain why they hide as soon as we get close, those little sneaks.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We should put up a sign for them: "Strictly for beaked insiders only." Who knows, maybe we'd get invited next time!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look near the reed, [quack quack], they're all still huddled around the water!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It looks like they're waiting for us to pull out a bag of bread crumbs like regulars.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet if I walk up quietly, they'll follow me with their little mischievous eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And you'll end up surrounded like last time—it was epic!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That gang never gets distracted, the call of bread is stronger than anything.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With such a welcoming committee, we should think about opening a real bird café here.

meaning: bruit du roucoulement de la tourterelle, de la colombe.
bruit du cri du furet.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Jules, close your eyes for a second and listen around us—do you feel all this calm wrapping around the park?

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: You're right, it almost makes me feel like I'm far from the city, somewhere completely different.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, over there, on the old oak tree... that little feathered visitor is keeping us company.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I see it, puffing out its chest as if it wants to make an announcement to the whole park!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? Right next to us... [coo coo], [coo coo], it's found its own melody.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: It makes you want to lay out a blanket and just stay here without saying a word, just listening to its improvised music.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, everything seems so much more peaceful here—even the leaves barely dare to move.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: It's true, it feels like even time slows down when you sit in the shade of this old linden tree.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This spot reminds me of summer afternoons at my grandmother's house—there were always strange noises in the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: I like trying to guess where all those sounds come from; it makes you want to listen closely to every little creak.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And sometimes, you just hear a little "[coo-coo]" coming from behind the bushes out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Those little sound surprises make me smile—you almost forget about the city.

meaning: petit bruit aigu produit par divers animaux.
petit bruit grinçant, crissement.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Hey, there's that little noise from the garden again, did you notice it?

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Yeah, I jumped the first time, it goes like [squeak squeak] right under the window.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: It's true that it echoes, especially when the house is all quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Plus, it stops as soon as we try to open the door—pretty clever!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Maybe with a little patience, we'll manage to see what's hiding there.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: We'd better keep an eye out from the terrace tonight, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: I love it when the trail is still all damp, it feels like the forest is breathing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, and look over there in the branches, there's a squirrel!

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: It's jumping from tree to tree, it looks like it's in a hurry, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you think it spotted something to eat? It's searching everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Listen... there, did you hear that? Right next to the stump, it went [squeak squeak]!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's subtle but it seems like that's how they meet up, those clever little guys.

meaning: bruit du cri du canard, parfois de l'oie.
bruit d'un avertisseur sonore.
son nasillard, parfois musical, produit par une personne ou un objet manufacturé.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you had seen the mess by the pond this morning, it was quite a show!

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: What happened? An impromptu swimming match between the web-footed ones?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Almost! They were all fighting over a piece of bread as if their lives depended on it.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: So typical... They never share quietly, those performers.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And suddenly, a loud [quack-quack] burst out from the group—even the seagulls retreated!

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: That must wake you up better than an espresso, that kind of morning fanfare!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look over there, they're all rushing to the shore looking so hungry!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, they're just waiting for a crumb of bread. It looks like they're having a little meeting!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: By the way, listen to that chorus of [squeak-squeak] rising up—it sounds like they're each taking turns to speak.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's honestly the best aquatic orchestra around!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With such a chatty conductor, they deserve to have a song written for them.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet they'll all argue over the solos—this is going to be quite a show.

meaning: bruit du cri du canard, parfois de l'oie.
bruit d'un avertisseur sonore.
son nasillard, parfois musical, produit par une personne ou un objet manufacturé.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I hope the stale bread will be enough for our feathered friends—they seem extra hungry these days!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, every time we get close to the pond, they come running as if they know us.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at them, they're all huddled together on the bank—it's like a little meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: They're all moving forward in a line, and it sounds like they're making [quack-quack] noises to encourage us to share!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It's impossible to resist this bunch—every time I give in and hand over all the bread.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, we should just bring a whole loaf—it’s the least we can do with the noisy welcome they give us.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at that sunshine! It was totally worth swapping the couch for this little path by the water!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Wait, did you just hear that [quack-quack] behind the reeds? I think we've been spotted!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Every time we come here, it's the same concert—I love this spot.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If I'd known I'd get a feathered marching band, I would've brought my camera.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: With all this commotion, even the fish must be used to it by now!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: We're going to end up famous, you'll see—official reporters for the neighborhood ducks!

meaning: petit bruit aigu produit par un animal, particulièrement un petit oiseau, une souris.
petit bruit de couinement produit par un objet manufacturé.
pour annoncer ou pour marquer une mort brutale, notamment par strangulation.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There's something wriggling behind the fireplace since this morning, I feel like we're not alone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's the third time I've felt something brushing against my feet, it must be hiding around here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look, the box just moved by itself… I think the creature is right there!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen… [squeak]… did you hear that too or did I imagine it?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No, no, I promise, it's coming from under the shelf!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It does liven things up a bit in this old living room, after all!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice that behind us, just as I was opening my bag?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Yes, that's the second time it's happened! It feels like something is spying on us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look in the bush, there's some movement. I bet a little creature is hiding there.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Shh, listen... [squeak]! It's subtle but you can still hear it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There must be a tiny ball of feathers nearby, it's so cute.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I swear, with surprises like this, our relaxing break is taking an unexpected turn!

meaning: bruit du cri du courlis.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at these vast stretches, it’s amazing how the birds seem to rule here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, and there’s one making a really loud noise near the reeds, do you hear it?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: It really cuts through all the other sounds, impossible not to notice it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Every time, I try to figure out which one it is… It sounds like it’s calling someone.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: There! That famous [caw-caw] again, did you catch that one? It echoes all the way here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s like it’s marking its territory, it really gives a wild atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, Paul, do you hear that kind of '[chirrup]' piercing through the misty morning? I love these suspended moments.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It's strange, it always pops up when the air is still cool. Do you think it's coming from near the river?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's quite possible, there are plenty of them hiding around here at this hour.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to climb up the little hill, just to get a better look at what's happening over there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you really listen, you'll notice the sounds echo from one bank to the other.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It makes the landscape feel alive, as if every corner of nature has its own secret orchestra.

meaning: bruit du roucoulement de la tourterelle, de la colombe.
bruit du cri du furet.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It sounds like there's life in the trees this morning, do you hear that strange song?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it adds a special atmosphere to our breakfast on the terrace.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I love the way it just goes: [coo-coo]... It cuts through the silence like a gentle breeze.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That's true, it's almost like an old vinyl playing on repeat, with that steady sound.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It makes you want to slow down, don't you think? As if time itself wanted us to listen for a while.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: How about we stretch out this moment, just to enjoy this peaceful atmosphere a little longer?

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: This bench is really perfect for watching everything happening around us, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, with the breeze and all the greenery, I could spend the whole afternoon here.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Wait, listen, there's a gentle little tune right now, through the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's light, like a secret traveling from tree to tree.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: I love that moment when you just hear [coo-coo] somewhere, without really knowing where it's coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It almost feels like the park has its own whispered stories, don't you think?

meaning: bruit produit par des craquements.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look at that old wardrobe in the corner, it always creeps me out a bit at night.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Do you think it still hides some of Grandpa’s things? We’ve never dared to open it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That’s true… He always said not to poke around in there too much, but now I’m curious.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Alright, I’m going for it. With a bit of luck, we’ll discover some amazing stuff.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Don’t forget to push gently, it hasn’t moved in ages!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: There we go… I’m pressing… oh, do you hear that? [creak creak]… This wardrobe definitely hasn’t lost any of its mystery!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: It's crazy how the stairs here seem to tell their own story, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With every step, I hear that "[creak creak]" that makes me jump—it feels like we're waking up the house.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm definitely bringing slippers!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Even then, I feel like we'd still attract attention…

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Look, there's a light at the end of the hallway—let's move really quietly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It feels like the start of an old movie, I swear, but go ahead, I'm right behind you!

meaning: Mot imitant un bruit sec (choc, rupture), ou évoquant un évènement brusque.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I was trying to open this old book and then... [crack]! It really slipped out of my hands.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looked fragile, with all those damaged bindings.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, the cover is almost split in two now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like that book only had a few years left to live.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I feel guilty, it was my grandfather's favorite.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We could try to fix it together, it would be worth a shot.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Get on the other side of the old branch, I think with a bit of momentum we can move it.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm pushing... [crack]! Uh, did you hear that noise too?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wait, what was that? The branch suddenly looks different.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I think it split on the side, look right here.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Honestly, this forest walk is anything but relaxing.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: At least no one can say we didn't give it our all!

meaning: bruit produit par des ciseaux, par un couteau.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Ooh, listen to that, [snap snap], every time I go over this branch, it's almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: You’re really in your element with those pruning shears, it’s like the garden is telling you its secrets.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It’s mostly these rose bushes, they take over if I don’t keep them in check a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: In any case, you have a lighter touch than me, my stems always end up a bit crooked.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It just takes patience… and a good dose of determination, believe me.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Good thing you’re here, our flower bed is going to look great in the contest photo!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: This box isn’t easy to cut. Do you think I’ll need some backup?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hand me the box cutter, I’ll try a different technique!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Just try not to let everything fly all over the living room…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’m aiming for perfection this time!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Oh, listen to that: [crunch crunch], it sounds like you’re really roughing up that poor box!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: But look, it’s going super fast, mission cut-almost-complete!

meaning: Entaille faite à un corps dur et destinée à accrocher, à arrêter qqch.
Entaille où s'engage une pièce mobile.
Entaille servant de repère.
Trou servant d'arrêt dans une sangle, une courroie.
Ondulation (des cheveux).
Audace, courage.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There we go, my grandmother's old wardrobe still refuses to open the bottom drawer, even after everything I've tried.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe how many old pieces of furniture pull the same trick on me! It's almost a family tradition, this kind of jam.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But I sanded the edges and oiled the rails... There's still a spot where it always sticks, like something's catching.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, hand me the flashlight, I'll take a closer look at the back of the cabinet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Be careful, last time Vincent ended up with a splinter just trying to force the drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, here's the mystery! Right here, there's a [click] in the wood that's holding everything back, that's why it gets stuck every time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: This darn toolbox again! The pliers won't come out of their slot—this is the third time this month.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Try sliding it to the right; mine always sticks a bit if I go too fast.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I've lifted it, pulled it, slid it... Nothing works, it's stuck worse than ever.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Look closely on the side, there's a little [click] sticking out—this is when you need to apply a bit of pressure.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, yes, I feel something under my thumb! Maybe that's why I was struggling every time.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: That's the whole secret of this mysterious box—you have to master all its little tricks.

meaning: bruit produit par des ciseaux, par un couteau.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Watch your finger, Luc, it looks like you're heading straight for the string!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: No worries, look... [snip snip]... it slides right along the ribbon by itself!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: You should be a master cutter, your movements are as precise as clockwork.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's all practice: every party at home, I'm the one who does it.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: If you keep this up, you'll end up opening your own gift-wrapping shop.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Why not? With your decorating ideas alongside, we'd be unbeatable!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: See the garland over there? It's way too long to fit on the door.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, we can shorten it; did you also keep the old red ribbon?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, it's right next to the colored papers. Take it, I trust you to adjust it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: *[snip snip]*... There we go, a piece less, that should do it now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That changes everything, honestly! It'll finally stay up without slipping.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: A little fix here, a little fix there, and the home decor is done!

meaning: bruit du chant du grillon, de la sauterelle ou de la cigale.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look how the sky is blazing, it makes you want to lie in the grass all evening.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Honestly, with this light and the warm air, I could stay outside until tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: When I close my eyes, I just hear that soft [chirp] slipping between two breaths of wind.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: There's a kind of mysterious rhythm settling in, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It almost makes me feel cut off from the world, in the middle of some kind of secret concert.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: The kind of moment you want to keep to yourself, like a well-hidden treasure.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Do you feel this gentle breeze? We should enjoy the garden at night more often.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true, the atmosphere completely changes as soon as the house lights go out.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: There's like a little concert in the grass over there, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, I love this kind of improvised music under the stars.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Listen, it goes like: [chirp], [chirp], [chirp]... It makes me feel like I'm out in the countryside, far from everything.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Those little details make the night feel a bit magical, don't you think?

meaning: Appareil permettant de soulever à une faible hauteur certains fardeaux très lourds.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this, the old wardrobe won't budge an inch, no matter how hard I try.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wait, I actually have a [jack] in the garage—you'll see, with that, this pile of wood won't stand a chance!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You really have one? Looks like you think of everything.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Always ready for the big operations! It actually comes in handy more often than you'd think.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, let's see if it works miracles on all that dust too!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Get ready, action starts in three, two, one…

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Mélanie, do you see that metal thing over there by the wheel? That’s the famous [jack] my uncle always used during the holidays.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Oh yes! I remember that story, it’s almost become a family ritual to tinker around here.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Exactly, and every time, he’d find a way to complain about the old toolbox he refused to replace.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Since then, I always check that all the equipment is there—you never know what might be missing!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Looks like we’re ready then, nothing else should stand in our way now.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: And to think, back then we always had to improvise with next to nothing... We’re much better equipped now, that’s for sure!

meaning: bruit produit par un craquement ou un grincement.
bruit de cle, souvent un double tour, dans une serrure.
bruit du mécanisme d'une pendule qu'on remonte.
pour exprimer la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This attic always gives me the chills, you know. Even the dust smells like old stories.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I've always dreamed of opening these old trunks; it looks like they haven't moved an inch since Grandma's time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Watch out for the third step, it's trapped me more than once.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Even the light hesitates to come in here, it's fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There it goes again, as soon as I set foot here, it's [creak crack] under my shoes!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It's like the house wants to remind us it hasn't forgotten we're here…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: This reminds me of the stories Grandma used to tell about this old attic. Don't you find the atmosphere strange, Léa?

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Strange, yes... especially with this wind sneaking in everywhere. Look, even the dust is dancing in the light.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: These old trunks must be full of forgotten things... Should we dare to lift the lid?

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Wait, listen... [creak crack]... This chest hasn't moved in ages, it seems!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It looks like it's keeping all its secrets tightly locked away. Do you smell that old paper scent?

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: If we find a notebook or a photo, I swear I won't scream. But you're searching first!

meaning: bruit grincant et répétitif.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: There you go, listen to this—every time I try to grab a pot, it's back to the [scrape scrape] festival!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Ah, the unbearable evening melody... Are you putting on a concert in the kitchen or what?

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: I swear, this cupboard has always played its own tune—it doesn't make things easy when I want to cook in a hurry.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: We could hire it as a percussionist for parties, but seriously, do you want me to check if there's a screw missing?

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: If you find something, you deserve the handyman of the month medal!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: And so the quest against the stubborn cupboard begins, armed with my screwdriver...

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Every time I push this door open, I always feel like I'm waking up the whole building.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, [creak creak] [creak creak], it's almost become the soundtrack to your entrance!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Every time, I tell myself the neighbors are going to end up mistaking me for a giant mouse.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: A mouse or a little train missing its tracks!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Well, it's high time we did something before this door becomes a star in the building.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Get ready, I'm grabbing the screwdriver and starting Operation Stealth!

meaning: bruit grinçant et répétitif.

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: Oh no, there goes that darn [creak creak] starting up again right in the middle of my meeting…

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Honestly, our apartment really loves to make itself noticed at the worst times. Do you think it’s the shelf moving?

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: I already checked, it hasn’t budged an inch. Maybe it’s the desk chair acting up today.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, that chair definitely has a knack for noisy surprises. We should have replaced it last year!

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: A bit of DIY and maybe it’ll regain some dignity, who knows?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: If you fix it, I’ll make you your favorite dessert, Elodie’s word!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Hey, do you feel how the atmosphere is different tonight in the apartment? I feel like something has been moving around for a while.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, listen, there's that persistent [scritch-scratch] behind the couch, it's really getting on my nerves.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wanna bet it's that old chest acting up again?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, I'd rather check, you know me... I can already imagine something unbelievable hiding underneath.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Your legendary imagination! I'll grab my phone as a flashlight, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With you as the detective, no mystery stands a chance for more than two minutes!

meaning: bruit de crissement.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look, it’s like the whole neighborhood put on its big white comforter this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I’d forgotten how snow could transform the street so quickly, even the trees are hidden.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Be careful, it’s slippery here, walk slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Hear how my boots go [crunch-crunch] with every step, it makes me smile for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Come on, let’s hurry before my toes turn into icicles.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Good idea, the promise of hot chocolate is more motivating than ever!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look at how thick it is—the snow really covered everything last night!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And to think we could still see the grass yesterday... Walk slowly, it's really slippery here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Too late, my boots are already full of snow... Ah, I can even feel it in my socks!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At least it's a change from all those rain puddles. Do you hear what it sounds like under our feet?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: With every step: [crunch-crunch], [crunch-crunch], as if the snow wants to answer us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Keep walking like that and you'll wake up the whole neighborhood with your impromptu concert!

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, Marc, right next to the water lily... [ribbit], [ribbit], it really breaks the evening silence.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: There must be more than one, it sounds like a real impromptu concert!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Between that and the scent of the river, you know, I almost feel like I’m far away from everything.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: It makes me want to stay here and watch the mist settle over the water.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: What if we stopped walking for just a moment? I really want to listen to everything.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: You’re right, let’s enjoy this natural theater while it’s ours.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: The atmosphere here really makes you want to take your time, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it’s like nature is whispering secrets tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: There was a little movement right next to the water lilies, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Yes, I noticed, it surprised me! What do you think it is?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: With all this humidity, it could be one of those famous local residents.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Look, over there, near the stone! It looks like it’s coming closer… [ribbit], [ribbit]... what a show from this little performer!

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With all this mist tonight, the pond looks almost mysterious, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It’s true, and there’s a special atmosphere… it feels like it’s teeming with life.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, there are little waves, right there, just next to the water lily.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet something’s moving in the water, it even feels like we’re being watched!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you listen closely, you’ll surely notice a strange sound echoing among the reeds.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait… [ribbit]… there, it’s getting closer. That’s exactly what I was hoping to hear tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I tried out the old trail tonight, just after the rain. The atmosphere was strange, almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That kind of vibe is perfect for feeling transported somewhere else! Did you notice anything unusual?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: All of a sudden, just as I stepped on a stone, a huge '[ribbit]' echoed right next to me. I swear I jumped.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That must have really gotten your adrenaline going! That place never stops surprising.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Definitely, I almost thought it was a mysterious message from the woods.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm coming with you, just to experience those little nighttime thrills!

meaning: bruit du roucoulement de la tourterelle, de la colombe.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you feel that gentle breeze drifting through the garden? There's a special atmosphere this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, it's peaceful, as if nature is taking its time today.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Right there, at the top of the old apple tree... listen closely, [coo-coo], [coo-coo]... that little tune goes perfectly with the cool air.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, it adds a charming touch to the morning.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Between the sunbeams and that background sound, it almost feels like we're in another country.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If we could capture this moment, I think I could stay here for hours.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Look over there, on the branch—it looks like it's going [coo-coo] just to get attention.

dialogue.speaker: Éric
dialogue.text: That's true, what a little show-off, he looks so proud with his ruffled feathers.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Have you ever tried to imitate that kind of sound? I'm sure we'd get just as much attention.

dialogue.speaker: Éric
dialogue.text: With my acting skills, maybe he'd believe there's a hidden rival in the bushes!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Ah, just imagine the scene: all the birds around here secretly spying on you.

dialogue.speaker: Éric
dialogue.text: See, activities in this park take on a whole new twist thanks to your imagination.

meaning: bruit de grincement, de crissement, de craquement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This attic door is resisting me again. Want to bet I'll end up opening it?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With all the times you keep trying, it'll give in eventually! Go on, show me what you can do.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: *[creak]* There we go, looks like it finally decided to cooperate today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think it complains with every move! That door really has a personality.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good thing we don't have to open it every day, or my arms would give up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you want, next time I'll bring my toolbox and we'll silence it for good.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that attic hatch, do you bet it hasn't moved in ages?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With all the dust in here, I wouldn't be surprised if it's stuck...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let's find out right now, I'm grabbing the handle.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Be careful, if it's too hard to open, let's just leave it, okay!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: *[creak]*... There we go, it's coming, but what an atmosphere, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I almost feel like I'm in an old adventure movie, this is promising!

meaning: bruit de grignotis.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: So, are you hiding more treasures in your bag or what?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: (pulls out a packet and takes a bite) [crunch]! A little secret to survive the afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: With that suspenseful sound, it's impossible to stay focused!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I admit, it does grab attention! Want to find out what's making all that racket?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Of course, curiosity got the better of me.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Welcome to my network of little guilty pleasures!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look what I found at the bakery around the corner, it really caught my curiosity.

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Oh, that smells amazing... Are you planning to keep it all for yourself or will you share a little?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Grab one, they just came out of the oven, still warm inside.

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: They look so nice, the color makes you want to bite right in without waiting.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Careful, you get hooked fast, this is the kind of thing where you eat ten without even noticing!

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: *bites* [crunch]… You’re right, it’s impossible to resist this!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wow, your big dog made me jump earlier behind the gate! He really looks like he's guarding the place.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh, you ran into Tyson? He doesn't miss a thing—even the mailman's delivery gets him all excited.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if he saw an intruder at night? I bet he'd be really intimidating!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh, that's nothing compared to what he can do when he really feels threatened. He almost transforms.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Seriously? But how do you manage him? Does he always listen to you?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Watch, if I come closer and just do this... [psst psst]... you'll see his reaction, he understands right away.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at the neighbor's dog! If I go "[pss pss]", he goes on alert right away, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, he notices everything happening on the other side of the fence, it's crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: He doesn't miss a thing! He can even hear a breath.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: With a nose like that, he could be a full-time security guard.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I bet he keeps watch better than the neighborhood alarm system.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: When it comes to the mailman, he probably knows before the doorbell rings, for sure!

meaning: petit bruit aigue produit par un animal, particulièrement un petit oiseau.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look up there in the cherry tree, there's a whole commotion among the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Oh yes, do you see? You can even hear little [chirp] sounds echoing through the leaves, it's such a funny atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's true, mornings like this make me want to stay outside all day.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: We should sit under the tree and see if one of them comes to peck nearby.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, they'll land on the railing—it would be perfect for a photo.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I bet with a few crumbs, we'd quickly become their favorite spot.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen, do you hear that little [chirp] outside? I think we have a winged visitor this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yes, it's adorable! It adds a cheerful vibe to the terrace.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I wonder if it's the same bird as last year—do you remember the one that nested over there?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it used to come back often; it became our natural alarm clock.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's the kind of detail that makes mornings here so special.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It makes me want to stay outside for a long time, just to enjoy this peaceful moment.

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau ou d'un jeune oiseau.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With all this greenery, you could almost forget we're in the city.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I agree, it's really calming. Every corner of this park holds a surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, did you see that little movement in the branches over there?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: There's a series of [chirp chirp] sounds, really close by... It seems like it's coming from that bush.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's amazing how nature makes itself heard as soon as you take the time to listen.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Makes you want to sit here for a while and enjoy the show, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at that blue sky—it was just waiting for us to take a walk under the trees!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With the smell of fresh grass and a bit of sunshine on top, I couldn't have dreamed of a better afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen, every step brings a different atmosphere to life—it's almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, do you feel how it crackles around us? It's like the bushes are coming alive.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Shh, wait... do you hear that? [chirp chirp]... right there, just by the low branch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, I smiled to myself! It's the kind of surprise that makes these walks unforgettable.

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at that brute in front of the door, it looks like he's watching the whole street!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Well, with those muscles, even the delivery guys don't dare bring mail to this side anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Do you think he'd react if someone made a sudden move, like just for fun?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Last week, a kid waved a stick a little too close, and he showed him he wasn't joking.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I once saw someone go '[psh psh]' behind the gate, and the dog got all worked up in two seconds!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's better not to test his limits, that dog's got a sharp eye.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wow, Charly has no limits as soon as he spots a ball!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true! I sometimes wonder where he gets so much energy, especially after yesterday's walk.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Once, he pounced on his toy as soon as I made a little '[squeak squeak]!', he was unstoppable.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, that explains why he gets so excited at every high-pitched sound!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: His reaction is instant, he must have gotten used to it over time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: In any case, with that trick, you could almost sign him up for a speed competition!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Your German shepherd is staring at me, it looks like he's waiting for a signal. He really has an impressive face when he focuses like that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Watch closely, Julian, if I go '[tsk tsk]', you'll see his reaction, he loves it.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, his eyes are narrowing, he's ready to pounce. It instantly makes him look like a real movie dog.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He's clever! After playing with him so much, he anticipates all my moves, even the tiniest ones.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: With a companion like that, you must feel safe even when it's pitch dark.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely! And he's such a sweetheart at home, you can't imagine how gentle he can be once he's calmed down.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look Félix, the neighbor's dog is already in position, he doesn't miss a thing from his kennel!

dialogue.speaker: Félix
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that's his evening routine! As soon as he spots someone, he doesn't take his eyes off them.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you remember last summer, when Luc was playing in front of the gate?

dialogue.speaker: Félix
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it was like he was playing with fire, he was looking for trouble!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: All it took was a simple gesture and everything went haywire with that dog.

dialogue.speaker: Félix
dialogue.text: And sometimes he would make his little "[psh psh]" behind the gate, it was instant, did you see the dog's reaction every time?

meaning: bruit d'une cloche ou d'une horloge qui sonne.

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: There it is, just now, I felt the ‘[dong]’ go through the house!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Incredible, even I thought the window was going to shake all over.

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: It seems that old bell tower can still surprise us after all these years.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It never misses its appointment, not like my alarm this morning…

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: If only it could be used as an alarm clock, I’d be on time for once!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: We could almost organize our days just by its sound, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It reminds me of my childhood, eagerly waiting for this exact moment in front of the old village clock.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: I totally understand. The silence just before, it's almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, the hand is finally reaching the top, everyone stops talking for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: The air suddenly gets cooler, it's like even the wind is holding its breath.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [dong]… [dong]… [dong]… the vibrations go through me with every chime, it's fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: You never get tired of it, it takes you away in just a few seconds.

meaning: bruit de sonnette, de clochette, de grelot; bruit d'une sonnerie, notamment celle du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: If you swap the last two puzzle pieces, I'm sure it'll work out better.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Wait... [ring], [ring]... Something just happened behind you, didn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I completely forgot my timer on the counter!

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Looks like it picked the perfect moment to get us out of that dead end!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Exactly, a break is a must before I end up mixing up all the pieces.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'll take the opportunity to grab some drinks—this adventure definitely deserves it.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Can you believe it, I’ve been waiting an hour for a reply to my message…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, [ding] [ding]! Something’s finally happening, something’s going on!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: My heart is racing, maybe this is the sign that everything’s about to work out.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Go on, check what it is, you won’t be able to stand it otherwise.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed—if it’s the news I’m waiting for, you owe me a coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal, but don’t forget to let me know right away!

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie de cloche(s) d'église.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that too? There's a strange sound crossing the street, it feels like the air is vibrating.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's weird, it sounds like it's coming from the old neighborhood, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It reminds me of Sunday afternoons when we used to walk past the big stone building.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Exactly! There’s always been a special atmosphere at that place, especially when the sound echoed for a long time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's crazy how those kinds of details stay with you, no matter how many years go by.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know, in my head, it still goes '[ding dong ding]'... and everything comes back to me like we're still there.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The shutters are still closed on almost every house; it feels like a peaceful morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look at the old linden tree in the square—it hasn't changed much since we used to play here as kids.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I bet even the pigeons know the neighborhood routine by now, since they keep coming back.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, [ding dong]... Without that, we'd lose track of time, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That's true, it's exactly those kinds of details that bring the village to life.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And every Sunday, it's become our signal to start the walk—almost a ritual for us.

meaning: bruit de tintement.
bruit de sonnerie, de sonnette, de clochette, de grelot.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: And there we go, my ring just slipped off onto the tray again—how clumsy of me…

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Ah, that little '[clink]' slipped in between two bursts of laughter, right at the perfect moment.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: This piece of jewelry always manages to draw attention wherever I put it.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to start a collection just for the unexpected sounds they make!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Imagine an orchestra made up only of chatty rings—that would be something.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: We'd never be bored during coffee breaks with such an impromptu concert at hand!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: These shelves are really too high, I have to stand on tiptoe every time.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Be careful, if you miss, we'll get a porcelain concert!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, did you see? I almost dropped the cup, my heart skipped a beat.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Yeah, and that little [clink] really made me jump, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Luckily, the saucer cushioned the blow, otherwise my collection would have been done for.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Well, you deserve a medal for your skill, but next time, I suggest a step stool instead of such suspense!

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie de cloche(s), d'un carillon de clochettes, d'une sonnette électrique.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you beat me at this puzzle again, I'll give you the last piece of cake.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Careful, this time I'm focused—you might lose your bet.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: We'll see, I just have two pieces left to place and... mission almost accomplished.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I admit you've taken a good lead, but next time I'll get my revenge.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Keep dreaming, I'm not going to make it easy for you.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: [ding dong]... Wait, something's happening in the hallway, do you hear it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wow, it's getting late—did they forget about us or what?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, [ding dong]! That should put your mind at ease, the suspense is over.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That timing is almost perfect. I'll let you guess who's going to rush to the door.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If I were you, I'd elbow my way through, with all this waiting.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Goodbye patience, I'm off before you change your mind.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And I'll count the steps to culinary victory!

meaning: bruit de tintement.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: It looks like this stack of plates wants to challenge me today.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You can tell—they know you don’t like playing the tightrope walker.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Here, catch the little cup before it slips—you’re more nimble than I am.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Got it! Your reflexes never cease to amaze me.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: The porcelain menagerie held strong this time.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, the little spoon is missing… [clink]! There, now everything’s in place.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ah, [clang]! You see, it's always when I try to hurry that this happens…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Careful, at this rate you might turn the kitchen into a concert hall.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's the third time this morning my utensils have slipped out of my hands—I think they're mad at me.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Or maybe they just want to join in for breakfast, who knows?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: In that case, they could at least be useful and stir the coffee themselves.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With you, the morning is sure to be lively—I'll keep an ear out for the next symphony!

meaning: bruit de tintement d'une sonnette, d'une clochette.
bruit de verre brisé

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, [ding dong] just as I'm pouring the tea, it's always when you least expect it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's perfect, you predicted a day full of surprises!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'm betting it's Émilie, she loves to drop by unannounced with her cakes.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If it's her, get ready to make some room on the table.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: In that case, the table will quickly look like a real pastry shop!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I just hope she didn't forget her little cream puffs this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look at the sunbeams this morning, it almost feels like they're trying to come in and greet us.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It's true, it feels like we're in the middle of spring even though November is coming.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, listen! [clang]—did you catch that strange sound by the window?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: That came from the garden, right? Maybe Felix is playing with his finds again.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: What a cat, he always manages to get our attention even early in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to go see if he's discovered a new treasure while rummaging under the hedge.

meaning: bruit de tintement d'une sonnette, d'une clochette.
bruit de verre brisé

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: *[ding]*! That’s exactly the kind of atmosphere that puts you in a good mood, that little sound welcoming you at the entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I admit, it brings some life to the shop. Are you here to fall for another new plant again?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: They don’t call me the green collector for nothing! But today, I’m looking for something to give as a gift.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: In that case, I got some adorable little succulents in this morning, the kind everyone falls for.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That’s exactly what I need. You really can read my mind.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: With you, I’ve learned to anticipate! I’ll put together a special arrangement for you.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Look, they've hung up new garlands behind the counter, it really adds some color!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's true, it really changes the atmosphere... [ding]... ah, it makes me smile every time it rings.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: There's always something lively here, even the little sound surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: By the way, I like how everyone looks up every time it happens.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: We could almost start a contest to see who can guess the fastest who's just come in.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That would add a bit of excitement to these quiet afternoons, don't you think?

meaning: bruit de tintement d'une sonnette, d'une clochette.
bruit de verre brisé

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [ding-a-ling]… Ah, that kind of detail really adds charm to your little bookshop.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: It's the kind of entrance that makes you look up, even when you're lost in a book.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It interrupted my admiring of the window display, but I assure you, it was for a good reason.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Surprises are often welcome here, especially when they come through the door with such enthusiasm.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you had seen my planner, it would have applauded this impromptu visit just as loudly as I did.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: So, tell me everything—what's drawing your eye today on our shelves full of secrets?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: One more floor to climb... I hope you didn’t hide the cookies too far away, Maxime.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: [ding dong]! Ah, we haven’t even set foot in the kitchen yet and you’re already thinking about cookies!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: In my defense, the vanilla aroma already tickled my nose!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I outdid myself, you’ll see. I even tried a new recipe with cinnamon.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Ooh, you’re playing with fire now. If it’s good, I’ll have twice as many.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! Make yourself comfortable, I’ll bring the treasure.

meaning: bruit de tintement.

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: If you had seen the cat's face this morning when he spotted the mailman… You'd think he'd just discovered an alien!

dialogue.speaker: Clement
dialogue.text: No kidding, with that neon hat on his head, even I would have jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: Look, I think we're going to have to make some room, the waiter is crossing the room like he's carrying treasures.

dialogue.speaker: Clement
dialogue.text: Yeah! And seeing how he's juggling his tray, I hope our glasses make it here in one piece.

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: [clink]... There we go, mission accomplished, our drinks arrived safe and sound!

dialogue.speaker: Clement
dialogue.text: We could almost give him a round of applause, that acrobatic service was worth seeing!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: You're handling the dishes, champ, I can already smell the hot chocolate that's keeping me motivated!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it gives me the energy to finish this mountain of plates.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Hey, that blue mug over there—are you using it or is it waiting for the next magic trick in the dishwasher?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, that one! It's survived three moves, it definitely deserves a break.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: *[clink]* Oops, I hit the spoon when I set down the bowl, everything's fine!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As long as no pieces are playing hide-and-seek, we're safe!

meaning: Grand oiseau de bassecour, dont la tête et le cou sont recouverts d'une membrane granuleuse, rouge violacé ; spécialement le mâle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This morning, near the watering trough, I was startled by some unusual commotion behind the shed!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh, that! I thought I saw a plump figure sneaking between the hay bales, all covered in feathers.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At one point, it let out a huge '[ding dong] [ding dong]', I swear, I almost dropped my bucket!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Honestly, between that and the rooster losing his mind at dawn, no two mornings are ever the same around here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If the farm was looking for an official entertainer, I think we've found one.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: No wonder the kids stay glued to the fence every time he pokes his beak out!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Over here, it looks like everyone has come out to enjoy the sunshine, even the noisiest ones!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: That's true, and look, over there by the old apple tree, what a character!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, with his kingly walk and that little superior air... [ding dong], he really has his own style.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: He draws attention every time he passes by, you just can't miss him!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Even the hens seem a bit jealous of such presence, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: If only we could walk like that too, the other animals would be really surprised!

meaning: Onomatopée évoquant un tintement, un coup de sonnette.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I feel like my stomach is going to start singing before the dessert comes out of the oven!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if we could speed up time just by wanting it badly enough?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't tempt me, I might invent a machine just for that!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, [ding]! That's the oven saving us, I'll go check if it's ready.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Go quickly, before I take a bite out of the table!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Promise, if the cake turns out well, I'll let you have the first slice!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at this mug, it’s straight from my trip to Lisbon, it brings back so many memories!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wait, do you hear that? *[ding]* That’s strange, it’s coming from the entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It always happens right when we start telling something interesting!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It’s like timing just loves to make our lives complicated...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I’ll go before curiosity makes me pace in circles.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I bet we’re not done with surprises today!

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie de cloche(s) d'église.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look over there, the light from the bell tower is reflecting so beautifully on the rooftops tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's true, it feels like the whole square is waiting for something, it's almost solemn.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Wait... listen closely, there's that little silence just before, it's always the same every time.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, there it is... [ding-dong], [ding-dong], it's starting! It's almost like a call to look up at the night.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: That feeling, it's as if the whole village is breathing in sync during these moments.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And every time, I feel like time slows down just a little, just for the blink of an eye.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It feels like the whole village is holding its breath just before the big moment.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: The air even feels fresher on this bench, especially with that old church watching over us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see the first guests walk by with their bouquets? It really smells like a celebration today.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait... there’s the signal, [ding-dong], [ding-dong], it’s started!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It’s magical every time; everything stops for just a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Nothing like it to give this Sunday a special feeling, don’t you think?

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie de cloche(s) d'église.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, listen to that, Pierre, [ding-dong]… It’s coming from over there, just behind the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: I think we stopped at the perfect spot without even meaning to, it’s perfect for the picnic.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Don’t you think it gives the park a kind of magical atmosphere, all of a sudden?

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: Yeah, it almost feels like we’re in an old movie, just with that background sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I love these little unexpected moments, they transform the whole day.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: And with our homemade pie, it’s the cherry on top, literally!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look how clear the sky is today, it makes you want to stroll near the square.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Great idea! We could have a coffee on the terrace, right next to the church.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I love seeing the colorful shutters and smelling the scent of fresh bread in the street.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And here, there's always that little bit of village bustle, even in the morning!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, listen… [ding-dong], [ding-dong]… do you hear how it echoes between the houses?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's true, it almost makes you want to stop and just enjoy the moment.

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie de cloche(s) d'église.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You wouldn't think so, but the square in front of the church is really lively this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's true, there are even children running everywhere with their colorful ribbons.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look, almost all the benches are taken and the big door just opened.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet the priest isn't far, everyone is looking around for him.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Wait, I think something's about to happen, everyone is suddenly so quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, do you hear that? [ding-dong]... There it is, the long-awaited moment is starting!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [ding-dong]... That kind of sound always makes me feel like the morning is really starting.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, that sound surprises me every time I walk past this square, even though I almost expect it.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: There's something comforting about it, I think – like the whole village is waking up at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, this neighborhood wouldn't be the same without it, you get used to it over the years.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
