dialogue.text: I wonder if the kids running around the square feel the same magic we do.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Come on, let's go sit on the bench by the old linden tree, just to enjoy this moment a little longer.

meaning: bruit de sonnette, de clochette, de grelot; bruit d'une sonnerie, notamment celle du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at that pink sky, it almost looks like a Monet painting, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I've rarely seen colors like that right before breakfast.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If the rest of the day could be as peaceful as this morning, I think I wouldn't move from the couch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And of course, it's at this exact moment that — [ring ring] [ring ring] — something comes to disturb our peace.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I bet it's Tom calling again to tell us about his latest sports achievement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With him, adventure never waits, even before eight in the morning!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I put everything on the table; I just can't concentrate until that darn call comes in.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It's bothering you that much? If I were you, I'd be pacing around the living room by now.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I'm stopping myself from checking the screen every thirty seconds, that's how bad it is!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: They say watching the phone makes it ring even slower...

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Ah, if only you could buy patience at the pharmacy!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh look, [ring ring], [ring ring], there it is—I think your suspense is about to end!

meaning: bruit de tintement d'une sonnette, d'une clochette.
bruit de verre brisé

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: On a rainy Saturday like this, there's nothing better than waiting for a surprise at home, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Especially if it comes by mail! Come on, tell me, what's this mystery in your mailbox?

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Patience, my dear. I gave in and bought that book I was talking about yesterday, but apparently the delivery can be nerve-wracking.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: I hope they didn't pull the old 'package pending' trick on you. With your luck, that would be the last straw!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: And there you go, just as you mention it... [ding]... looks like the suspense has just been broken.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Want to bet you'll fall for the cover? Go on, I want to see this famous treasure!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: *[ding]* That announces my arrival! I hope you’re not in the middle of repainting the living room, Lucas.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It’s definitely you, no doubt about it—always making an entrance. I was waiting for you for the riddle of the century.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: If this is about your last failed pie, I’d rather declare myself out of the running right now!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, this time there won’t be any kitchen disasters… at least, I hope not.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: In that case, I’m willing to risk my reputation to taste today’s mystery.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Make yourself comfortable, I’ll kick things off in the kitchen right away!

meaning: bruit d'une cloche ou d'une horloge qui sonne.
bruit produit par un gong.
bruit d'un signal sonore introduisant un message aux voyageurs dans une gare ou un aéroport.
bruit d'un choc sourd, d'un déflagration sourde, qui résonne.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I thought we had more time, but the sun is already going down…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, you think so too? I feel like the afternoon is slipping through our fingers.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look over there, the square is coming alive—maybe something's about to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, do you hear that? [dong]… [dong]… [dong]… [dong]…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That reminds me of the last time we stood here watching the pigeons take off.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If we hurry, the bakery should still have chouquettes—just the perfect moment.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen, [dong]... It's like the whole city holds its breath for a moment!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's crazy, it still surprises us, even after all these years here.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: You know, every time it rings out, I think back to those long summer afternoons when time seemed to stretch on forever.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: There's a kind of ritual in this atmosphere, between the park benches and the pigeons suddenly taking flight.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Come on, let's cross the square before the next sound surprises us in the middle.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm right behind you, this city still has a few mysteries left to reveal to us.

meaning: bruit de sonnette, de clochette, de grelot; bruit d'une sonnerie, notamment celle du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, Luc, did you remember to prepare something for Leo's birthday tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: I took the cake out of the fridge and hung up the streamers, but I'm wondering if we have enough drinks.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Worst case, we can improvise with whatever's in the cupboard—you know how they are.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Exactly! With them, there's always a way to party even with three glasses and a few chips.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Anyway, if everyone shows up at the same time, it's going to be quite the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Hey, [ding-dong], looks like it's starting!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you only knew what kind of weekend I had, I almost lost my cat in the garden!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Oh no, did he try to climb the cherry tree again? He'll never stop, will he.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Exactly, and just when I thought I'd caught him... [ring-ring]! That's when something else barges into my story.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: It's like in a movie where nothing ever goes as planned at your place!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Between this acrobat cat and all the surprise noises, I should write a book.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: I'm already reserving a signed copy, with a special mention for Minou the stunt cat!

meaning: bruit de sonnette, de clochette, de grelot; bruit d'une sonnerie, notamment celle du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [ring ring]! And there it is, always right when I start pouring the coffee...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's crazy how you attract these interruptions. Do you think it's someone from the office again?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let's hope not, I was hoping to finish my breakfast in peace for once.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With your luck, you'll have to get used to eating with surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe we should make a rule: no messages, no calls before the first sip!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I approve, that's the best idea you've had all week!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I spilled my whole bag all over the floor, what a disaster!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, [jingle] [jingle]... Looks like something else is happening in your life today.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Seriously, this can't be real—nothing wants to stay calm around me.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: At this rate, we'll end up writing a novel just about your morning.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: With a dose of suspense and a pinch of clumsiness, it could work.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: I'm already reserving my signed copy—it sounds like it'll be lively!

meaning: bruit de la sonnerie du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, I finally managed to book that little cabin by the lake I told you about.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Seriously? That’s awesome! Have you already looked into the activities there?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [ring], [ring], [ring]. Ah, of course it starts acting up right at the interesting part!

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: It's always at the worst moment... Hold on, I'll check real quick.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Take your time, I'll use the chance to see if I got the confirmation email.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, everything will sync up right now!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: If we don't wrap up the presentation tonight, it's going to be tight for printing tomorrow morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've almost finished the graphics part, I just need your final corrections.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Oh, [ring], [ring]... Hold on, that's my phone going off right in the middle of editing!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously, it picks its moment! Want me to send you the updated version in the meantime?

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Yes, go ahead, that way I can take a look while they're chatting away on the other end.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Perfect, and if it's the coffee machine, ask it for a boost for both of us!

meaning: bruit de sonnette, de clochette, de grelot; bruit d'une sonnerie, notamment celle du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at that apricot tart, it's been calling to me for ten minutes. It's just begging to be tasted!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: If you only knew how much I understand you... My stomach is growling just looking at all this.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Plus, it's Friday—we've definitely earned a little sweetness after this hellish week.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: [grumble], [grumble]! Oh, that really came out of nowhere, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I swear, sometimes I feel like we're in a comedy sketch!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Exactly, all we need now is a clown and the show's complete.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This cake smells so good, it's almost a shame to cut it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With a smell like that, I doubt it will stay whole for very long!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I hope it's just as good on the inside... Do you want the first slice?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yes, but only if you take the biggest piece right after.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Deal! Pass me the plate, I'll serve you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, [rumble], [rumble], [rumble]... sounds like someone else is eager to taste it too!

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie ou d'une sonnette.

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: I think I finally managed to find that old photo I told you about. Do you want it in digital format?

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Oh yes, absolutely! Is it the one from the summer when we lost the car in the parking lot?

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: Exactly, with your floral shirt and that old orange backpack.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Wait, listen... [ring], [ring]... there's something in this apartment that makes me jump every time.

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: Bet you it's the neighbor again with her lost package?

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: No doubt, I'll go take a look. This whole package thing is starting to become a routine!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: You know, I managed to grab the last croissant at the bakery this morning, it was just in time!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With your luck, you'll end up making people in the neighborhood jealous.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: [ring] [ring]! Listen, that just killed my appetite instantly, did you hear that too?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: That came from the entrance, looks like someone is waiting for us impatiently.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I bet it's the delivery guy, this time he's actually early for once!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Get ready to receive your lightning-fast order, I'll go see who it is.

meaning: Onomatopée évoquant le bruit d'une sonnette (surtout électrique).

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: The pie smells almost ready, do you want to take a look in the oven, Paul?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I'm on it, but I hope it hasn't overflowed like last time...

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: [ding dong]! Oh, looks like we have visitors at the worst possible moment.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: As always, it happens right when everything is balanced.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I'll go open the door, can you watch the pie?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Got it, I'll keep an eye on it while you play the unexpected hostess!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you know I spent twenty minutes looking for my keys this morning? I thought they had vanished into thin air!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe it, yesterday I searched everywhere for my wallet, and— [ring ring] —do you hear that? It's coming from the hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh, perfect timing! Maybe it's the delivery person I've been waiting for for three days.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Your persistence with online orders is finally paying off, apparently!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: After all this waiting, if he finally found our door, that's an achievement worth celebrating.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I just hope he hasn't swapped your package with my organic cereal again!

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie ou d'une sonnette.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With this silence, you could almost hear a pin drop in the apartment.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That’s rare for us—usually there’s always a bit of commotion, even some background music.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [ring], [ring]! There goes the mood changing... do you think it’s for us?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It always happens when you least expect it, huh.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I hope it’s not the mailman again with another bad surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I’ll go check, but if it’s another package for the neighbor upstairs, you owe me a coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, if I keep turning the whole apartment upside down, I might end up creating a brand new surprise storage space.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [ring] There you go, a sound effect, just to spice up your treasure hunt.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If that's the reward for my quest, I hope it's not the neighbor and her mysterious packages again.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With her, you never know if it's a book or a cat waiting at the door.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Alright, door-opening mission activated, and without my armor this time.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Good luck, brave explorer, I'll be providing moral support from the couch!

meaning: bruit d'un grelot, d'une sonnerie ou d'une sonnette, notamment d'une sonnette électrique.
bruit de la sonnerie du téléphone.
bruit d'un petit signal sonore.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It still smells like apple pie in this living room, you know! It’s really tempting.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: Wait until you taste it, I added a bit of cinnamon this time. But you’re right, the smell already makes you hungry.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, [ring], [ring]! That noise startled me, it’s the first time today.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s the neighbor wanting to borrow some sugar again…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’ll go open the door, otherwise she’ll wake up the whole building with her perfect timing.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: Good luck, and save us a slice of pie anyway!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I put the croissants on the table, but there’s still some jam left if you want some.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, [ding dong] [ding dong]! Do you think that’s Marc already?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It’s possible, he said he’d drop by early this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I’ll take a look, you never know with him—sometimes he comes in through the window!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Good luck if it’s another one of his costumes!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If he shows up with his feathered hat, I’m taking a picture for posterity.

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.
bruit de bourdonnement ou de sifflement d'un appareil, d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look at that, it's like the sun showed up just in time for our break!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: This is exactly what we needed after this week, this patch of grass is perfect.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If you want to bite into the strawberries before they get mushy, now's the time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, don't you feel a bit of a commotion behind you?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ah, here we go again... [bzz] [bzz], right by my ear, looks like we've got a fickle admirer.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If she dares touch my strawberries, she'll have to deal with me, gourmet's honor!

dialogue.speaker: Aminata
dialogue.text: Look near the curtain, there's something flying around in zigzags like it owns the place.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, do you hear that? [bzz], [bzz], it really seems determined to explore the whole room!

dialogue.speaker: Aminata
dialogue.text: If it ever decides to land on my book, I'm running away.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'll try to guide the intruder toward the window, we don't need a new winged roommate.

dialogue.speaker: Aminata
dialogue.text: Just be careful it doesn't sneak under the couch, it already made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No worries, I'm keeping an eye out. Insect evacuation mission activated!

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.
bruit de bourdonnement ou de sifflement d'un appareil, d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look, just above the tablecloth, there's another one that's crashed our picnic.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Oh no, I was hoping we'd have some peace this time... Do you think she'll leave if we ignore her?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With all these sandwiches and jam, I bet they'll all end up swarming around us.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Wait, here comes the famous [bzz] circling my head, it's actually tickling my ear!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Try to stay calm, I'll move the jar of jam farther away, maybe that'll distract her.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Let's hope she prefers the jam to my hair!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: If only the sun's rays chased away insects as well as they do clouds, we'd have peace on this terrace!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Seriously, just one sip of juice and I almost had to share my glass with a winged intruder.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Their radar for sweet drinks is truly foolproof... They never miss a chance, it seems.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Someone should invent a drink that makes them flee, or at least glasses with built-in lids!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Wait, look, there's one heading straight for your hand...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, too late... [bzz] [bzz] [bzz]... That one is determined to taste my lemonade!

meaning: bruit produit par des cymbales.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [boom boom boom]! I think my heart is trying to keep up with the beat.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It looks like you're completely letting yourself go, I love seeing you get so into it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I can't help it, the music goes through me from head to toe.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: The rhythms are so powerful here, it's impossible to stand still.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If we slip closer to the stage, we'll enjoy this moment even more!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Good idea, with this energy, we'll end up dancing in the front row without even realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Saturday night, there was no way I could stay seated during that concert—it was pure energy!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: You let yourself get carried away, huh? Tell me about it, you still seem all excited.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Totally! There was this moment when everyone was holding their breath, the musicians were giving it their all.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: That must have been crazy! What gave you those chills, the rhythm?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Exactly, all of a sudden, I hear "[boom boom boom]" right behind me—I thought the stage was going to take off!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: You know what, just listening to you, I feel like I was there too—it's contagious!

meaning: bruit brusque et cinglant, produit notamment par un coup, par un choc.
bruit d'instruments de musique, notamment de cymbales.
bruit de scie électrique.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, I was thinking of trying out my old coffee maker today—it's been catching my eye since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Ah, the famous coffee maker you inherited from your grandmother? Hold on, I'll get you a cup from the top cupboard.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look carefully, it's the cup with the blue pattern—it's my favorite, it's survived all the hectic breakfasts.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Careful... Oh no! [clink]! I think the bowl just gave up.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, looks like it didn't survive the morning this time!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I promise, I'll grab the next cup with kid gloves... and maybe both hands.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you see the salad bowl up there? I can never reach it without climbing on the chair.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll climb onto the counter... [clang]! Oh shoot, it slipped out of my hands.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I knew it, you should have let me try.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: It was risky, but I thought I could handle it better than that.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, now we have an emergency repair mission before Mom gets home.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: We'd better hide the pieces, or we'll get caught as soon as she walks in!

meaning: bruit des cymbales et de la grosse caisse.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Clément, did you see yourself last night during the encore? It was like you were transported somewhere else!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: It was impossible to stay still with that atmosphere. I had chills and my heart was pounding like crazy!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It hit me all at once, especially when the whole band exploded on stage at the same time, [bam boom boom], I almost dropped my glass!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Ah, that's why you made the floor dance around you! No one missed that moment, even the servers stopped.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Between the crowd in a trance and all those bass lines, for a moment I thought we were part of the show.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: We should have filmed it! The experience was one of a kind, I want more nights like that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This morning, while crossing the square, I heard the neighborhood band musicians rehearsing.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh, I was there too! At one point, there was a huge '[clang boom boom]' that echoed right down to my sneakers.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, so it wasn’t just my imagination, I really did jump!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: You bet, even the pigeons suddenly flew off—it was epic.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If rehearsals are already like this, the concert is sure to be lively.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: We’d better stand far from the front rows that day, just to avoid another jump scare!

meaning: bruit brusque et cinglant, produit notamment par un coup, par un choc.
bruit d'instruments de musique, notamment de cymbales.
bruit de scie électrique.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Impossible to forget that moment in the kitchen: I just brushed the pot, [clang], and it bounced off the sink!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I jumped on the spot, you almost made me drop the spatula!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I promise to handle the pots like they're porcelain.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you want to keep your toes intact, that's for the best.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Lesson learned... but I have to admit, that kind of scare really wakes you up!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You can say that again, I think even the cat still hasn't recovered.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Of course it had to happen to me today—the shopping bag decides to tear at the worst possible moment.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: Wait, let me give you a hand before the apples roll all the way to the intersection.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Grab this jar, quick—oh no, [clink]! Now the lid is acting up too.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: I have to admit, this jar really knows how to get attention, it's unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: At least nothing's broken! I've already had my share of acrobatics today.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: If you ever want to teach a class on handling food disasters, sign me up right away!

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un objet qu'on lance.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, throw this stick and listen closely: [whoosh], it goes straight to the bush!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, you really make things fly, don't you!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You can try too, if you aim well.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Are you challenging me? I'll take this stick!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Go ahead, show me what you can do!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch out, you're about to see a real champion in action!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look at this empty box—if you can hit it from here, I'll do the dishes tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Here goes, I'm trying... [whoosh]! I really look like a pro, don't I?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Not bad at all, it almost grazed the edge!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I told you I had a precise wrist.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Your turn to impress—the bar is set high now.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Watch out, you're about to see something amazing!

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement d'un insecte ailé: abeille, frelon, guêpe, mouche, moustique, etc.
bruit de bourdonnement ou de sifflement d'un appareil, d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This checkered tablecloth really makes me feel like I'm in an old movie, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Absolutely! All that's missing is a basket full of fresh croissants.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Watch your bottle, there's something flying right above it...

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [bzz]... [bzz]... oh shoot, this one's persistent!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At this rate, it's going to end up in your salad.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: At least we won't be short on entertainment for the meal!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Paul, I swear, something's been circling around me by the couch for a while now!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Do you think it's another one of those little adventurers from the garden?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Maybe... With the window cracked open, everyone thinks they're invited in here.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Wait, don't move, I'll grab a glass and we'll see if she's willing to cooperate.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Whoa, [bzz], [bzz], she just flew right by my shoulder, it gets me every time!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Looks like she's decided to test my reflexes today... Capture mission initiated!

meaning: bruit de rire.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: So, Paul, have you finally recovered from your unforgettable tumble in the cafeteria yesterday?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: You bet! I kept finding lettuce in my shoe all afternoon, and no one felt sorry for me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [hehehe], just thinking about it, I keep replaying the scene in my head!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Even the cook asked me if I was inventing a new recipe with my acrobatics.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Admit it, you just wanted to spice up lunch with a little show!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Who knows, next time I’ll try balancing on a tray... but no salad option.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I never would have believed we’d manage to get out of the maze before closing time!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I mean, your sense of direction… should we talk about it? We went around in circles at least six times.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Blame the sign that pointed to the exit but led straight into a wall… I have an excuse, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: My favorite part was when you greeted that bush, convinced it was someone ready to guide us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [hehehe], you know perfectly well that from a distance, that bush almost looked like it was wearing a cap!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If we do this again, next time I’m bringing a compass and dressing up as a tree—let’s see if you recognize me!

meaning: bruit du cri du paon.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Listen to that, it sounds like it's going [ee-aw], [ee-aw], echoing all through the park!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It must be coming from those trees over there... It almost sounds like a natural alarm, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: It's really surprising, this kind of sound gives a strange vibe to our walk.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It makes me want to find out where it's coming from, it feels like we're in a movie!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we'll discover a little hidden scene, who knows?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I admit, it awakens the explorer in me, let's go see what nature has in store for us!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Another Sunday where I find myself face to face with our feathered neighbors' gang in the garden!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: You mean the ones who strut around like they own the place? They almost blocked my way yesterday!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Yes, real performers! One of them even spread its feathers right in front of the window—what a show.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: And did you hear earlier, that big ‘[honk]’ that echoed across the yard? It was like he wanted all the attention.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Every time, it surprises me—it’s like they’re putting on an impromptu concert just for us.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: If they ever start doing the wave, I promise I’ll applaud from my terrace!

meaning: bruit du rot.
marque la nausée physique.
marque le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, Paul, don't you think their lemonade is almost too fizzy today?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: [ugh]... shoot, really sorry! That tickling sensation is so unpredictable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You're breaking records without warning, it's still impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I barely had time to realize what was happening, that's how fast it was!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe we should give you a medal for subtlety.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Or a trophy... as long as it's not full of bubbles, I'll take it!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh wow, this raclette, I can't take any more! Do you still have a piece of cheese?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Of course, but careful, you're going to end up rolling under the table!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's so good, I can't resist... But seriously, I can already feel it swelling up in my stomach.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I swear, I feel like I've swallowed a balloon too!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [urp]... Uh... well, that wasn't planned but it just slipped out.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Well done! Let's just say that's a compliment for the cheese, right?

meaning: Marque l'embarras, le doute, l'étonnement, l'hésitation.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, would you be interested in trying the molecular cooking class tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You mean mixing stuff with nitrogen and all that?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly! Apparently, you even make smoky chocolate spaghetti.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, do we actually eat that or is it just for show?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We taste everything at the end, it’s included in the workshop. So, are you coming?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [uh]... I think I need a little time to digest the idea.

dialogue.speaker: Aurélie
dialogue.text: So, are you finally coming with us for the quiz tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: I was thinking about it, but I admit I'm still not totally sure.

dialogue.speaker: Aurélie
dialogue.text: Is it because you can't find your legendary luck, or is there another reason?

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: Honestly... [um]... I completely forgot the theme and my movie knowledge is honestly pretty limited.

dialogue.speaker: Aurélie
dialogue.text: But that's what makes it fun! We're counting on you for the impossible questions.

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: We'll see if I can manage not to mix everything up, then...

meaning: bruit du rot.
marque la nausée physique.
marque le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Next time I eat fried onions with soda, remind me to stop halfway through the dish!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: No kidding, just thinking about it, I can already feel that explosive cocktail in my stomach!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: It was so good though, but the side effect is way less glamorous…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: The worst is when you try to talk and you feel the pressure building up, it’s so awkward!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Exactly! And then you catch someone’s eye, you hope you can hold it in, but you know you’ve already lost.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [ugh]… Oops. There, I couldn’t hold it back, it was that or explode. We really do share everything, don’t we?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This homemade burger reminds me of our high school nights… do you remember those eating contests?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: How could I forget? That was epic… [yuck]… Oh, oops, I just broke my own noise record without meaning to.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Some habits really never go away, huh!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Must be the nostalgia effect, I guess!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At least you know how to liven up the table!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Someone's got to put on a show during dessert.

meaning: bruit produit par l'expiration.
bruit produit par un pétard, une fusée.
marque d'indifférence, de désinvolture, de dédain ; marque de lassitude.
bruit de crachement du chat en colère.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With this report due tonight, I feel like we're tightrope walkers on a wire!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: It seems like every time we proofread, it adds a new challenge... We're practically juggling.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And seeing Paul show up with his corrections at the last minute was the icing on the cake...

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: I thought my computer was going to shut itself off just from reading his comments.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [whoosh]... It feels like a weight lifts off my shoulders just thinking about it.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: For sure, we're holding up! We need a break—want to grab a croissant from the vending machine?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Well, that was quite a workout today... [phew]... I feel like I need to walk a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Totally, I felt like we were going around in circles forever.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Did you see Sophie's face when the director asked his last question?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Unforgettable, she clearly wanted to disappear under the table!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Shall we talk about it over a hot chocolate at the machine?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Gladly, I've been dreaming about it since the start of the meeting.

meaning: bruit de l'expiration.
bruit d'absorption rapide d'une boisson.
pour marquer ou accompagner un départ rapide, une disparition.
pour marquer l'indifférence.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I told you, this move was going to finish us off… Three floors with no elevator, seriously!

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: And your bookshelf weighs a ton. Who keeps that many books at home?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: They're my treasures, you know. If you want, we can take a break with these boxes.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: [phew]… Seriously, I feel like I just ran a marathon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We haven't even started on the kitchen yet, get ready.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Honestly, for you I'd even carry the fridge… well, almost!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If someone had told me that climbing three flights of stairs would feel like scaling Everest…

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I have to admit, my legs feel like jelly, I can’t feel them at all anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [huff]... what an adventure, we almost deserve a medal!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, and maybe a welcome snack too, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The idea of a hot chocolate suddenly feels absolutely essential.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Seriously, let’s go conquer the kitchen, our reward is waiting!

meaning: Onomatopée, bruit d'eau ou de chute à plat.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look at this pond, it looks like a perfectly smooth mirror.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if we threw something in, it would break all this calm.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wait, I actually have an old apple in my bag that's just waiting to end up here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: An apple? This should be good, go ahead, aim for the center, let's see what happens.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Alright, watch closely... three, two, one...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: There it is, [splash]! The pond will never be the same after that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful Thomas, if you take one more step too far, it'll go [splash] and we'll have to fish you out!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, you're exaggerating! I've got perfect balance, just watch…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, we'll see about that in two minutes when your sneakers are soaked.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Very funny, but so far, I'm still dry, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's only because it's not raining, otherwise I wouldn't say the same!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It's like you're just waiting for me to fall so you can make fun of me!

meaning: bruit d'un coup, notamment d'une gifle.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Are you still practicing telling bad jokes, or does it just come naturally to you?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, very funny, Chloe... but I have a loyal audience, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Loyal? If we're talking about your houseplant and your cat, that doesn't really count.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Alright, personal attack, I'll remember that... but you know there's a limit to provocation.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Noted, but admit it—your laugh sounds like a squeaky door.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [creak]! That was for the squeaky door...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what happened to me on the subway today!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [thud]! Oops, sorry, I dropped my notebook while listening to your story… What were you about to say?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, you startled me—I thought it was another disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No, I promise, this time it's just my bag overflowing a bit too much!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With you, there's always something wild going on.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's adventure or nothing, you know me!

meaning: pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you had seen our coworkers’ faces at noon, I think we set a record for silence in the open space.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, [freeze], everyone froze when the director suddenly came out of his office!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We didn’t even have time to breathe, instructions were flying everywhere, it was exhausting.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can imagine the atmosphere—even the coffee maker stopped humming, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Not far off! Then we all rolled up our sleeves, it was almost comical how improvised it was.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The next coffee break will be well deserved after a day like this, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This neighborhood never stops surprising me, even when I think I know everything about it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: What happened to you this time? Tell me, you know I love your unbelievable stories.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was walking, headphones on, and [splash]! My coffee spilled on someone I hadn't even seen coming.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh wow, straight out of a movie! What did he or she say to you?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He just gave a little smile, luckily nothing got on his white shirt.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's official, you attract stories like a magnet to metal!

meaning: bruit léger et ponctuel.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With all this wind, is your hat still holding up?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's kind of racing with my hair today!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen, right there... [whoosh]! It looked like it was trying to fly away.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It probably wants to go explore the paths just like I do.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I can just picture your cap making a lap around the park before you even get up!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If it comes back to me, I'll name it wind champion!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, did you see that? My notebook just opened by itself with a little "[flip]" right next to my cup!

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: That's strange, I thought I laid everything down flat earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe the air from the fan is starting to make itself at home with our stuff…

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: With how hot it is, I wouldn't even be surprised if it decided to move my papers too.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like our supplies want to come to life before we've finished the report.

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: If the pencils start dancing, I'm demanding an immediate coffee break!

meaning: bruit de coups répétés, en particulier d'une double gifle.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: If you had seen Manu's face this afternoon, you’d have thought he just walked out of a cartoon!

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: Wait, what happened to him to make him look so shaken up?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Right in front of the bakery, he ended up between Louise and Éric at the worst possible moment…

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: I swear, it echoed down the street: [splash splash], everyone stopped in their tracks!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: He tried to act like nothing happened, but even his baguette looked surprised.

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: With Manu, something’s always happening—it’s almost like a free show every time we go out!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, I keep thinking about that dinner at Émilie's on Saturday… what an electric atmosphere around the table!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, especially when her cousin started telling that embarrassing story in front of everyone!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was inevitable: Julie couldn't handle it, and her expression was priceless.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I still remember that moment when suddenly, [slap slap], her hands landed on the tablecloth!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Talk about a way to cut the conversation short—everyone froze instantly.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The tension was palpable, even the dog slipped under the table. What a memorable meal!

meaning: bruit de coups répétés, en particulier d'une double gifle.
bruit de coups de fouet.
bruit d'eau, de clapotis; bruit d'une marche dans l'eau.
bruit d'éléments qui s'entrechoquent.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: So, did you see what happened near the counter earlier?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I was there, you bet, I just heard a huge [splash] behind me, everyone turned around!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Unbelievable, I never would have thought it would take that turn!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Even the waiter jumped, he didn't know where to put himself.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Apparently, the evening still has some surprises in store...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With this electric atmosphere, we're not going to get bored anytime soon!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Do you see the kiosk near the square? Guess what, there was quite a scene there just now!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No way! With the grumpy vendor or someone else?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Exactly, it was a customer who got heated over some change. Things started to escalate.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Who would have thought it would blow up so fast over a few cents... I bet everyone was watching.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And then, all of a sudden, [snap snap], it was so sharp even the pigeons jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I've never seen anything like it, I might end up setting up a chair there just for the show!

meaning: bruit de coups répétés, en particulier d'une double gifle.
bruit de chute ou d'éléments qui s'entrechoquent.
bruit de clapotis.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Honestly, Théo, you could at least pretend to listen when I'm telling you about my chaotic day.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Wait, do you think I'm staring at the ceiling for fun? I'm just trying to protect myself mentally, that's all.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ha, very funny! Keep it up and you'll end up with ringing ears.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Oh, you wouldn't do that... Not in front of the houseplant!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You asked for it... [splash splash]! There you go, it happened without warning.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Ah, you can really tell the day was chaotic... Message received, boss!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I swear, the moment they came face to face, we heard a strange "[splash splash]" that made everyone on the bench jump.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that must have been lively at that exact moment!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: No one understood what was happening, everyone was watching without daring to step in.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: That’s just like the square: there’s always something unexpected going on there.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And to think I only came to read quietly on a bench!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Next time, pick a novel less lively than real life—you’ll be less surprised!

meaning: bruit d'une goutte d'eau ou de la pluie qui tombe.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look at those clouds, it looks like they're going to swallow up everything in their path.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet my bike is going to take a beating again tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Listen, [plop]... right on the leaf, it's starting off gently.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, that sound, that's the signal! We're going to end up soaked if we don't do something.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Our sneakers are going to squeak all the way to the living room, I can feel it coming.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: So much for being discreet, tonight it's an impromptu pool party.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The sky is really getting angry, look at those clouds!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Of course it threatens to rain the most exactly when I forget my umbrella…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: We’re going to get soaked soon if it really starts.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, [splat]… right on my shoe, as if the rain aimed on purpose!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This is just the start of the attack—at this rate, we’ll have to improvise a raft!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If the wind picks up, I say we build a shelter out of our bags, just to survive the urban downpour.

meaning: bruit d'éléments qui s'entrechoquent.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright, shall we tackle the mountain of dishes before it overflows from the sink?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If we survive this, we can face any storm!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'll take the delicate glasses, I'll leave you the pans and plates.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Careful, with your juggling skills, I have a feeling things are going to get lively.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And there you go, [flip-flap]... I told you porcelain knows how to make a statement!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: In this kitchen, every evening is a real improvised symphony!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It looks like the plates have organized a meeting on the table!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: They were probably trying to stop me from finding the countertop, those rascals.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet they're plotting with the cups; look at this unbeatable mess.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I declare the meeting over... [flip-flap] ! There, everyone back in the cupboard.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That should put an end to their little revolution.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With all this commotion, I'll end up being elected president of the dishes!

meaning: bruit de coups répétés, en particulier d'une double gifle.
bruit de coups de fouet.
bruit d'eau, de clapotis; bruit d'une marche dans l'eau.
bruit d'éléments qui s'entrechoquent.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wow, out in the courtyard earlier, it was like a puppet show—[slap-slap], it echoed almost off the walls!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wow, that noise must have caught everyone's attention! Were you right next to it?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Right behind the supervisors' bench! I thought even the pigeons would fly away, it was so loud.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With all that commotion, the supervisors must have stepped in, right?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: They came running, but in the end, everyone just caught their breath like nothing had happened.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Well, if the afternoon starts like that, I can't imagine what's coming next!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, what happened in the locker room goes beyond anything we've seen this week!

dialogue.speaker: Malick
dialogue.text: Oh really? From out here, it sounded almost like [splash-splosh] through the door, I was wondering what was going on!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Totally, even the gym teacher almost dropped her whistle, it was so unexpected.

dialogue.speaker: Malick
dialogue.text: I saw Lou back away like she'd seen a ghost, it must have been something.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Even Lisa hid behind her bag, that's how intense it was.

dialogue.speaker: Malick
dialogue.text: Well, we're going to be hearing about this all week, that's for sure!

meaning: Exprime le bruit d'une chute dans l'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: How peaceful it is here by the river.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yes, I love hearing the murmur of the water and watching the dancing reflections.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Listen... [plop], a frog just jumped near the water lily!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I saw it! It really picked a great hiding spot.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: It looks like it enjoys the tranquility as much as we do.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Definitely, here you really feel far away from the world.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Look, I found a really flat stone, perfect for trying to skip it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Go ahead, I bet it'll bounce at least three times... oh, [splash]! Missed on the first try.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: See, you jinxed me with your prediction, for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Or maybe the stone just ate too much this morning, who knows...

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Next one, you throw it. We'll see if you do any better!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Watch out, the expert is stepping in!

meaning: bruit produit par un corps dur qui heurte une surface molle ou par la projection d'un liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that puddle, it looks like it’s gotten bigger since yesterday!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Now’s the perfect time to test my old sneakers… can you hand me the bag?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Here you go... and [splash], the shoe goes right in!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh great, I have a feeling I’ll be looking for that one for a while.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well done, genius, always so accurate with your throws.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: At least it adds a bit of excitement to our walk!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hurry up, Maxime, the cookies aren't going to make themselves!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I'm coming with the mixing bowl! Want me to let you put the dough on the tray?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Watch closely, I'm making little mounds... Ah, and there it is, the famous [splat], that was inevitable!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Let's just say the cookie shape is our homemade artistic touch.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If we win a prize for originality, it'll be thanks to you!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: And your famous wrist flick... a real show every batch.

meaning: Bruit de chute (notamment de choses molles).
Échec.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey Théo, be careful with that squishy bag, it's full of fresh brioche.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’ve got an exemplary grip! Watch how gently I set it down on the table.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet you’ll drop one before you even reach the basket.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Ouch, I shouldn’t have taken up the challenge… [plop]… there it goes, escaping.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s so you! Even the brioche makes a run for it when you’re around.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: At least it landed softly, that’s what matters for a successful snack!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Shoot, my blanket just made a huge [thud] on the rug... It slid right off my knees by itself.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It really went all out to reach the floor, it seems. You lost your source of warmth, sorry for you!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's okay, it seems to have preferred the carpet over me tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: At least it won't blame you for bothering it...

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: True, I could almost see if it starts crawling toward the couch now.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: In that case, let's keep an eye on it during the movie, just in case it has other plans!

meaning: bruit produit par un corps dur qui heurte une surface molle ou par la projection d'un liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Grab the ladle, Pierre, the soup looks like it's thickening faster than expected!

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: Watch out behind you... oh shoot, *[splat]*! I dropped the ball of dough into the creamy soup bowl.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, that adds some suspense to the recipe! Are you planning to invent a new soup?

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: That wasn't in the book, but we improvise in the kitchen, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: As long as you don't do that when we're cooking for Mother-in-law, it's all good.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: Promise, next time I'll avoid the artistic dive!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you mind repotting this ficus while I clean up the potting soil?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No problem, I’ll take care of it… And there we go, *[splat]*! I think this pot was tired of being empty.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, looks like it’s going to need a good shower now, too.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: They say a little whimsy helps plants grow better.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I’m counting on you for the enchanted garden, then.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Mission accepted, the plant crew is going to surprise you!

meaning: bruit de barbotement dans l'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look what happens, [swish swish], every time I move my feet in the river.

dialogue.speaker: Gabriel
dialogue.text: You’re amazing, you always find a way to turn a simple walk into a little aquatic adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It’s way more fun like this, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Gabriel
dialogue.text: At this rate, I’ll end up soaked before I even really dive in!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, I’ve mastered the artistic splashing version even better!

dialogue.speaker: Gabriel
dialogue.text: If you keep going, I say we start a contest for the most impressive wave!

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Look how the light dances on the surface, it looks like a living painting.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It's magical. Do you want to try guessing if the water is as cool as it looks?

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Hmmm, I'm not sure... If I start whining, promise you won't make fun of me!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh, scout's honor, I'll just give you a knowing smile.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Okay, here goes... One foot, then the other, nice and slow...

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Listen to that, the [splash splash] under your feet, I can tell it's your grand entrance!

meaning: bruit ponctuel d'un corps dur qui heurte une surface molle ou qui plonge dans un liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This cake is starting to look like something, Clara!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Haha, good thing, because right now it looks like a volcano!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you want, I'll hand you the eggs. Ready for a bit of acrobatics?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Wait, let me get a good grip... uh, wait... It's slipping!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh no, aim carefully, or you'll redecorate the countertop!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: And there we go... [splat]! Well, it landed right in the bowl, saved!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Renaud, could you toss the apples into the bowl for the compote?

dialogue.speaker: Renaud
dialogue.text: Get ready, watch out... and there we go, [splash]! That one didn't see that dive coming.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I almost thought it was going to bounce, it landed right in the center!

dialogue.speaker: Renaud
dialogue.text: Aiming for the mash is an art, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Next time, will you try with the pears?

dialogue.speaker: Renaud
dialogue.text: Only if you do the sports commentary, deal!

meaning: pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see? [whoosh], that leaf fell right in front of us all of a sudden!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I really wasn’t expecting that. It’s crazy how suddenly it happens.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I love these little unexpected moments in nature, it makes it feel alive.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s true, every walk has its share of surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It almost feels like the park is trying to get our attention today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And it’s working, I really feel immersed in the present moment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at those papers on the table, they haven’t moved an inch since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That’s strange, with all the wind we’ve had, I was expecting a real disaster here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe they’re sticking to the wood as if by magic?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Or maybe it’s the calm before the storm, who knows?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If I were you, I wouldn’t bet on their luck… wait, there’s a draft coming up!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh! Did you just see that? The papers, [whoosh], gone all at once!

meaning: bruit ponctuel produit par un choc étouffé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Last time, the poster peeled off after an hour—this time, we're not messing around!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm using the strong adhesive, I swear, nothing will budge! Look, I'm rolling it well before sticking it on.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There, I'll press the corner here... and... [whoosh], done!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You have a knack for making everything stick on the first try—I should let you decorate more often.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With my secret techniques, we could organize exhibitions anywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Perfect, the room looks great now—we're ready to impress everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Oh, listen to that! [whoosh]... just when I wanted to sit quietly on the beanbag...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That beanbag is going to end up surprising us if this keeps up!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Still, it looks just as stuffed as ever to me... or maybe it's getting mischievous with age.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe it's a sign it needs a little rest too!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Noted: give it a nap after lunch, right?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Exactly, that way no one will get caught off guard by a prankster beanbag again!

meaning: bruit de pataugeage dans la boue.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If I had known, I would have worn my rain boots—this path is out to get me!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Move carefully—at this rate, we’ll come back looking like camouflage patterns.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at this mud pit... how much do you bet I’ll lose my sneaker in there?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch out on your right, the mud looks deeper over here.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And there we go... [squelch]! Oops, too late for the sneaker...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like you just invented the custom eco-molded shoe!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: How much do you bet I'll lose my boot before the end of the trail?

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Given their condition, I give you ten minutes before one flies off!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I get stuck, promise me you won't post it on social media.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Too late, the mud has already made you a local star.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm going for it—there's no other way.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: And now... [squelch]! Looks like nature decided to play a trick on you.

meaning: marque d'indifférence, de désinvolture, de dédain ; marque de lassitude.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Did you see the poster in front of the gym? Apparently, they want to organize a costume race on Saturday morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I spotted it as I was passing by. Are you going to sign up?

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Honestly, after last time, I'm not sure... It was kind of a mess.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [pfft], honestly, running in costume while everyone is dragging their feet doesn't really appeal to me.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Let's just say it doesn't really make me want to take my costume out of the closet...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you come up with a more fun idea for Saturday, I'm all ears!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [sigh], another invitation to that karaoke tonight, I’m really not sure if I want to go.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: But why not? It’s been a long time since we did something different.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, everyone always ends up singing the same songs…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We could spice things up a bit, pick something other than the classics, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I come, do you promise we’ll avoid the cheesy songs?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Promise, we’ll team up and set the mood in a different way!

meaning: son produit par divers instruments de musique, notamment guitare, tambour de basque, violon.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Guess what, my brother dragged me to their music session yesterday, and I swear I still have those tunes stuck in my head!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? Tell me everything—what kind of instruments were on stage? I bet there were some real surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Between the guitar swirling around and the violin playing its heart out, honestly, it was impossible to sit still.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Just imagining the fingers running, [strum strum], and the drumsticks bouncing, I almost feel like I was there!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: That's exactly it—everyone was tapping their feet, and some people even broke out into a few improvised dance steps.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m telling you, I’m sneaking into your pocket so I don’t miss a thing!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The audience is already captivated, can you feel how the energy is flowing? Even the trees seem like they want to dance!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen closely, this is the moment when it goes '[thrum thrum]', I always feel like it takes me somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It’s like the stage is breathing to this rhythm, every note brings everyone closer together.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Do you notice how the musicians exchange knowing glances? It’s unique at every concert.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The magic is in full effect, I could stay here all night just listening.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With this atmosphere, I feel like we’re floating a little above the ground.

meaning: son produit par divers instruments de musique, notamment guitare, tambour de basque, violon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sounds like things are already buzzing from the apartment across the hall. Are you planning to set the mood tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: A band is coming to play at my place—it's the perfect chance to bring out the instruments lost in the attic.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope you won't leave the dust on the violin this time!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Promise, even the guitar will be vibrating out into the hallway—you might hear some unexpected things.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Curious to see who'll get the neighbors dancing on the floor tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, there'll be that [scritch scritch] sliding everywhere and making people smile for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Well, I see you've brought out the violin—looks like we're in for a big musical evening!

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: That's right, it's impossible to resist when the mood is right. I'm still hesitating between something lively or something softer.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Surprise us—you know your fingers always work wonders on the strings.

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: In that case, get ready. I'm starting right away, and keep your ear out for the little details.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Ah, that little [scritch scritch] at the very beginning, that's exactly what I love—you always put it in at just the right moment.

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: That's my secret for drawing everyone into the melody—it works every time!

meaning: bruit de crachement du chat en colère ou en rut.
bruit que fait le chat pour manifester un grand contentement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Another restless night: Simba woke up the whole building with his meowing under the window.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It must be something to see him put on his show every time another cat dares to walk through the yard!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He leaps onto the ledge, his fur all puffed up, and his stare could scare anyone away.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can just picture it: a big jump, sudden tension, and then that sharp '[hiss]' comes out of his throat.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I thought the glass was going to shake with how intense he was.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With him, even the night turns into a feline theater!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh wow, listen to that, he did his famous '[whoosh]' behind the couch again! This cat is going to give me chills.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: You'll see, he'll hide for hours again—last time it was the same after that kind of stunt.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's crazy how he suddenly gets so animated, I didn't even understand what bothered him this time.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Maybe the shadow of the broom scared him, or just a draft that irritates him every time.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: He really has his own personality, impossible to tame when he's in that mood.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Come on, let him grumble in his corner, he'll come back asking for pets later as if nothing happened.

meaning: Bruit léger produit par le frôlement ou le froissement d'une étoffe soyeuse.
Ornement en tissu d'un vêtement féminin.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Lucie, with every step, you can hear the little [swish-swish] of your dress, it’s really charming.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: I can even feel the fabric sliding when I move, it’s so light.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It’s like your dress is dancing with you every time you move.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Yes, it almost feels like it’s floating around me, like a soft veil.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It’s as if the slightest breath of air makes it ripple gracefully.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: I love this feeling of lightness, it makes me want to twirl even more.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I think this skirt is going to turn some heads at the opening tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With that cut and that color, you're going to steal the show, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I hesitated all week before buying it, but I told myself I had to go for it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sometimes you just have to listen to your instincts and treat yourself, right?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen, when I walk, it sounds like the skirt sings a little [swish-swish] around me, it's almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That detail makes all the difference; you really shine, I promise.

meaning: son produit par divers instruments de musique, notamment guitare, tambour de basque, violon.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look at this scene, it’s like each musician is setting off on their own sonic adventure, it’s fascinating to watch.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Did you see how they communicate just with a glance or a little smile, and things go in every direction, but always together.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: And as soon as one of them speeds up the rhythm, boom, everyone joins in, it’s like a current passing from one instrument to another.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Sometimes, you can almost feel the floor vibrating, it pulses so much, it’s impossible to stay still.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Do you hear this part? Right there, that’s the moment when it goes '[whoosh whoosh]' just before everything bursts into melody, I love that effect!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, that kind of feeling makes you want to jump in and dance with them, you never get tired of it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you want to play some music tonight? I dug out my old violin and my fingers are already itching to play.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Great idea! I can set up with the tambourine, if your neighbors don't mind?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'll start softly... listen to this [scritch scritch] of the strings warming up, it sets the mood right away!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I love this vibe, it's lively from the very first note!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Your turn now, bring up the rhythm a bit, let's improvise together.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, here we go, we're going to make the walls dance with our duet!

meaning: bruit de de froissement, de frottement.
bruit de déchirure.
bruit de crachement du chat en colère ou en rut.
bruit que fait le chat pour manifester un grand contentement.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I hid the bag of chips behind the cushions—want to bet I can open it without causing a scene?

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: If you manage it without the cat lifting its head, I’ll give you tomorrow’s dessert.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Careful, mental prep activated… I’m going for a championship-level opening.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: Look, even the cushion is shaking with you, you’re feeling the pressure now!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Moment of suspense… I’m just peeling up one corner, ninja style.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: There it is, the fateful '[crrk]', even the cat caught you!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely… *[shff] [shff]*, it's amazing how it echoes in the backpack!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I knew you'd find another weird thing in your pockets, you never cease to surprise me!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: You're joking, but look at this notebook, it was stuck all the way at the bottom, I thought I'd lost it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, that's the one you write in when you want to draw in the city, right?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Exactly, and at least it survived my adventures on the subway!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It looks like a relic, you could write a novel just from finds like that.

meaning: bruit léger signalant une apparition ou une disparition rapide d'un animal sauvage.
bruit produit par un froissement, un frottement, un glissement.
bruit pour chasser un animal.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look over there, something just moved behind the stump.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, did you see that? [whoosh], it went by so fast I barely had time to see the tail!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: That startled me! Maybe a fox? The color looked reddish to me.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Possible, they love to walk along the embankments around this time.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It feels like the forest is winking at us today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We’d better keep our eyes wide open, things always happen when you least expect it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
