dialogue.text: The leaves are still wet, it smells like earth, do you smell it? It’s like the forest is holding its breath this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yes, and look at those tracks there, freshly marked, it’s barely been an hour since an animal passed through here.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You and your habit of spotting every little clue! Last time, you guessed there was a fox around just from a feather stuck in a bush.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It sharpens your eye, you know... But today, everything seems frozen, even the birds seem suspended in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, keep your eyes open, with a bit of luck we might get a surprise appearance behind those ferns.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Listen, that little '[rustle]' over there… It was so quick! Like a shadow slipping between the trees.

meaning: bruit de crachement du chat en colère ou en rut.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, I thought the shutters were going to be ripped off with all that racket, and then I see Félix standing up on the railing.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Félix never misses a chance to put on a show, especially when the moon is full like it was last night.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And then, without warning, he leaps, fur bristling, tail huge, as if he was about to face a monster.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, I know exactly what you mean… it turns into a whisker ballet and suddenly it’s [whoosh] [whoosh] under the window, worthy of a miniature action movie.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know even Biscotte hid behind the door, she didn’t want to risk a single whisker.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Honestly, with their tough guy attitudes and their moonlit escapades, those cats deserve an award for best screenplay.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, I found Noisette all crumpled up under the dresser earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Really? She seemed fine this morning... did she let you get close?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As soon as I reached out my arm, she let out two big '[hiss] [hiss]' without warning, I still have chills!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: She's making you pay for closing the balcony door last night, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And to think she's supposed to be the sweetest one in the neighborhood... she's got quite the personality, that one.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Next time, I suggest we lure her with some tuna kibble, it's better for our nerves.

meaning: bruit produit par un souffle d'air.
bruit produit par un pétard, une fusée.
marque d'indifférence, de désinvolture, de dédain ; marque de lassitude.
bruit de crachement du chat en colère.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at those leaves spinning, it’s like they’re dancing along the path!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Maybe they’ll end up flying all the way to that old oak tree over there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, I felt something brush past my ear…

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Did you hear it too? [whoosh], [whoosh]… it’s like the forest wants to whisper something to us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It gives me chills, but it’s a pleasant feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: With the branches moving and that little effect, it feels like we’re the only ones in the world here.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at all those candles on the cake! It reminds me of when we used to try to blow out as many as possible in one breath.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and it was almost mission impossible with those little candles that relight themselves.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Try this one, it doesn’t seem to want to cooperate either!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! I’m going to put all my breath into this one.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Careful, all the candles are just waiting for a real champion!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes… [whoosh]!

meaning: bruit de l'expiration.
bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Three more flights to climb... and my motivation already stayed on the ground floor!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: With the bags, it's basically a workout worthy of a mountaineer.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [huff]... I think my calves are going to hate me for two days after this.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: The upside is, we've earned our break—at least hot chocolate and the couch!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If anyone says the word 'stairs' before the end of the week, I'm turning around.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: Deal, I won't say another word about it until further notice!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet you that tomorrow, I won't even be able to go up the stairs without making a face!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Honestly, your effort today was worthy of a marathon, not just an ordinary gym session.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Even my t-shirt is soaked, look... [squelch]... It's official, I'm out of commission.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If your t-shirt could talk, I think it would ask for early retirement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We could almost justify a giant round of smoothies, right?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I'm saying yes right away, but you're the one carrying the glasses—I'm staying on the floor a bit longer!

meaning: bruit du cri du dindon, parfois du pigeon.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look behind the greenhouse, there’s a commotion that’s attracting all the neighborhood cats.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, and that strange noise has been repeating since sunrise—it’s almost become the garden’s soundtrack.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Last year, my uncle said he saw a flock of birds almost as noisy, but I thought he was exaggerating.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Looks like he was right. I bet it’s that same group coming back to snatch the seeds.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen closely… do you hear, in the background, that little “[cheep cheep]” among the rustling leaves? It almost makes me want to laugh!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s unexpected, really! You’d think the vegetable garden had turned into an impromptu stage.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that funny [gobble gobble] behind the bushes? It sounds like a turkey has joined us on our walk!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's amazing how they know how to get noticed, even when they're hidden under the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That reminds me of the chickens at my grandmother's place—they always had a surprising call too.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, country animals sure know how to liven things up, even in the middle of the city.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's true, just one unexpected sound is enough to brighten up a walk.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And it gives us a great chance to watch how people around us react!

meaning: Onomatopée qui exprime le fait que l'on tremble de froid.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: What an idea to meet up on this bench in the middle of February, you always go for originality!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I think I'm going to end up carved out of ice, [brr brr], this date is a real Arctic expedition.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait, I haven't even dared to take my hands out of my pockets, just imagine how cold it is!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Honestly, if you tell me we're going to run a marathon, I'm out right now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I can picture us much better sprawled out next to a radiator than running around anywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Let's head to the café on the corner then, before I turn into a walking icicle!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at these frozen puddles, it almost feels like we're walking on mirrors!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Totally, even my breath is making steam, it makes me feel like a dragon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [brrr]... with every step I feel like my teeth are going to chatter all on their own!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Come on, let's huddle near the bakery, maybe the heat from the oven will save us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Gladly, and if the baker gives me a nice warm loaf, I won't say no!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Hang in there, the smell of fresh bread is almost like a cozy sweater already!

meaning: bruit d'un récipient qui se vide ou qui se remplit de liquide.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, Claire, this pitcher never seems big enough for our summer drinks.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'm pouring slowly... Do you want me to add a bit more syrup?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen to that little [glug-glug], it reminds me of snack time at my grandma's!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, there are some sounds that just make you hungry, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet if you serve like that all evening, we'll have to make a second batch.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No problem, I've got the stash under control: no one will go thirsty under my roof!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, look what I found in the fridge: a bottle of homemade lemonade! Want to give it a try?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Oh yes, with these ice cubes, it'll be perfect. Can you pour me a big glass?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: (pours the lemonade into the glass) [glug-glug]-glug... I love when it makes that kind of sound, it's like a mini brass band in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Oh definitely, it makes me want to add a slice of lemon just for the show!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good idea, here you go, pop, a slice! The show goes on.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With this, it almost feels like we're sitting out on a terrace, don't you think?

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, souvent d'origine métallique, produit par un choc.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Another morning where the coffee machine will be running at full speed, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: As usual! (He puts his spoon in his cup a bit too quickly) [clink]! See, even my cup is begging for its fix.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If the dishes start asking for coffee, we're really in trouble!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe it's a sign that it's time to invent automatic coffee delivered straight to the office.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That would definitely prevent those impromptu concerts on the countertop!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Or we could create a new musical style, just for open spaces!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh darn, the ladle slipped between the pots at the bottom of the shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That made a nice [clang] that woke up the whole kitchen—you’ve mastered the art of the impromptu concert!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If only that kind of performance attracted Michelin-starred chefs…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: For now, you’ll have to settle for your hungry audience—me.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As long as you’re okay with soup served with a slightly dented ladle.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: As long as it doesn’t change the recipe, you can count on me to scrape the bottom clean!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, souvent d'origine métallique, produit par un choc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This drawer still refuses to open properly—how much do you want to bet we’ll find half of our missing utensils in here?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: You know, nothing surprises me in this kitchen anymore. Last time, I found a grater behind the coffee maker.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: So if I get my hands on the bottle opener, it’ll be almost a miracle tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Try at the back, between the bent cutlery and the salad tongs—it must be hiding somewhere around there.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, something’s stuck… If I just force it a little…

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Ah, there it is, the famous [clink clank] of the protesting drawer—it’s like we’re in an impromptu marching band!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Did you hear that weird noise in the kitchen earlier?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think it came from the bottom drawer. I was just about to check what's going on.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Wait, listen... [clang clatter]! Sounds like something hit the pan.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, I see! It must be the little spoon that slipped between the dishes.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: That drawer is a real puzzle, maybe we should organize it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good idea, it'll be easier to find our things... and avoid more surprise noises!

meaning: bruit du cri du dindon, parfois du pigeon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, listen to that strange racket near the vegetable garden, it's really got me curious.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh, you hear it too? It's not the first time I've heard that kind of commotion here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to go take a look. Sounds like some animal is putting on a real parade!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I bet if I tried to do the same, it would go: [glug glug], [glug glug]!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ha ha, you should see your face when you do that, it's priceless!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: If I keep hanging around this garden, I'm bound to get along with all the local wildlife, that's for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you hear that commotion near the vegetable garden at noon? I thought it was the wind rustling the leaves, but then…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Not really the wind, no! It sounded more like "[glug glug]", as if someone was trying to get attention behind the hedge.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, so you heard it too! I was starting to wonder if I’d imagined it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hard to miss, with all that racket. I even jumped and dropped my watering can.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I really wonder what’s going on—maybe we’ll end up discovering a secret guest at the back of the garden.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Looks like it! That spot still has plenty of surprises for us, apparently.

meaning: bruit ponctuel de succion rapide, de déglutition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at this dessert—it looks like a chemistry experiment! Want to bet I can taste everything in one go?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: *[gulp]* Oops, I think I sucked up more foam than I meant to...

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Well done, at this rate you'll end up with whipped cream on your nose.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's still better than getting gelatin stuck in the straw, right?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Yeah, next time you won't be so cocky with your challenge!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Just admit you want a rematch with the glowing cheesecake!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: This strawberry milkshake looks like it came straight out of an ad, it almost makes you want to turn it into a poster, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait until you dip your straw in, it’s even better than it looks!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You know how to convince me… Okay, here I go!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: (loudly slurps a long sip) [slurp]! Wow, it’s even thicker than I thought.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: What a sound! It’s like we’ve found the audio version of the perfect dessert.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And just wait for the finishing touch with the whipped cream, it’s going to blow your taste buds away!

meaning: Bruit que fait un liquide qui coule dans un conduit, d'un récipient, etc.
Cri de la dinde et du dindon.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, when I pour the bottle, it goes [glug glug] every time, it's impossible not to notice.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You do it like a pro, you’ve mastered the art of pouring without spilling a drop!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: After so many years of handling picnics, I had to learn something.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We’re going to end up organizing a decanter competition for you, watch out.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Haha, I accept the challenge, but only if the winner gets the best piece of cake.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal, but you might have to share if I win too!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey Martin, the bottle is still full, do you want me to open it?

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: With pleasure! My glass has felt quite empty for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Grab your glass, I'll try not to spill anything this time.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Haha, everyone's holding their breath!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful, here we go... There, slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Ah, that little [glug glug], it means we're in for a good time!

meaning: bruit ponctuel de succion rapide, de déglutition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that foam on the hot chocolate, it's almost criminal not to dive in right away.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: *[gulp]* Ah, I couldn't resist, that stuff is just too tempting.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You really went for it—I actually heard the cup vibrate!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: When it's this cold, I just go for it, I can't help myself.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I get it, on winter days, every sip is a victory.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, next time we battle the foam, I'll let you lead the first charge!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [gulp]! Paul, did you see how I downed that coffee in one go?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I think you’ll be done before mine even cools down.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It’s the tiredness, I needed a quick shot of energy!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Careful, at this rate you’ll be levitating before the meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: No, I promise, I’ll sit down and savor the second one slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Good idea, we have plenty of time to chat before getting back to work.

meaning: bruit ponctuel de succion rapide, de déglutition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Well, Maxime, aren’t you brave with that glass? It looks like a wizard’s potion.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It’s fermented hibiscus juice, apparently it gives you a real kick, but the look is… surprising.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Will you dare to take on the challenge, or would you rather quit before even trying it?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I’m hesitating… it smells a bit like jam forgotten on the radiator.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Come on, show you can handle it, Maxime! The whole terrace is watching you.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Well, so much for being discreet… [gulp]! Wow, it’s not as sweet as it looks!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: [gulp]! Honestly, this mango milkshake is a real blast, I wasn't expecting it at all.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: See, I told you it was something special. Wait, this is the first time you've reacted like that to a drink!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I think it caught me off guard, and the texture is seriously creamy too.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This one has a way of surprising everyone, even my mom made a face the first time she tried it.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I need to learn the recipe, it would be a hit at my game nights.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'll give you the secret tip if you promise me a double serving of fries next time!

meaning: pour marquer la surprise, l'étonnement, la stupeur.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Wait until you hear what I saw this morning when I was taking out my trash.

dialogue.speaker: Hakim
dialogue.text: Tell me quickly, this sounds like it's going to be unexpected!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: My neighbor from the third floor came down the stairs... wearing a wetsuit and flippers.

dialogue.speaker: Hakim
dialogue.text: You're kidding? That's not like him at all to do things like that.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: I swear I'm not, and to top it all off, he was carrying a pink parasol on his shoulder. [gulp]...

dialogue.speaker: Hakim
dialogue.text: Looks like my morning coffee has less of an effect than your building today!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [gulp], you'll never guess what I saw in front of the town hall this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No, tell me quickly, you're making me curious…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The mayor was riding a unicycle while throwing confetti!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can't believe it… He really goes further every year.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The whole street stopped to watch, even the police officers were laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wish I'd been there, you can never get bored in this town!

meaning: bruit ponctuel de succion rapide, de déglutition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: *[gulp]* Oh no, I barely touched my smoothie and it’s already gone!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like you were really hungry this morning, that was impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That’s what happens when you use fresh fruit, it never lasts long…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No kidding, next time make a whole pitcher, I think that’ll be safer!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Good idea, but you’ll have to keep an eye on my hands... they’re too fast for you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, I’ll position myself strategically near the blender next time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Lucas, do you want to try the new weird drink I invented?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Uh, your concoction looks suspicious... What is it supposed to taste like?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you dare, down it in one go... [gulp]! Then tell me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll try it for you... It's refreshing but wow, what a surprising flavor!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Admit it, you didn't expect something so spicy in a purple drink!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, it's definitely original... and I feel like I'm awake for the whole week now!

meaning: accompagne un chatouillement, notamment sur un bébé.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look how Leo is staring at my hands, he knows something's about to happen!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Ah, I love this suspense! He’s going to crack in five seconds, for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I try my famous secret move, do you think he’ll handle it?

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: I bet with a little [tickle-tickle] on the side, he’ll fall apart!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: His cheeks are already turning red, he’s done for!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Looks like he’s asking for a rematch, watch out—it’s your turn!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, Zoé looks like she's having a blast on the rug today!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You should have seen her earlier, she was laughing so hard she almost fell over.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's amazing how she bursts out laughing at the smallest thing, that little one.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I swear, all I have to do is bring my hands close and she already knows what's about to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That must be so cute to see, will you let me in on the secret?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Look, if I put my fingers here... and do [tickle-tickle], it's crazy how she bursts into giggles!

meaning: bruit de grignotis d'un animal qui ronge.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Something happened in the kitchen, you'll never guess what.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, did you spill the rice again or is it something else?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No, no, it wasn't me this time. It was coming from the corner under the sink. I thought I heard a faint, persistent noise.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Under the sink? I hope it's not that old leaky faucet again.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I checked, everything's dry. But the noise kept getting more and more regular, it was really strange.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Right then, I heard something like [creak creak]... It gave me goosebumps!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear to you, Paul, there was that strange little noise under the sink again last night.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Did you hear it for a long time or was it just for a moment?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It lasted a while, it seemed like it started up as soon as the house was quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Ah, I thought I heard, you know, that famous little '[scritch scritch]' through the walls, it made me jump.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hm, if it happens again tonight, I'll try to film it, just to be sure.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Perfect, with a bit of luck, we'll finally get to the bottom of this and be able to sleep peacefully.

meaning: bruit de grognement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: With this golden light, the park makes me feel like I’m in another world!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Exactly, look at that dog over there, he looks completely absorbed by whatever he’s watching behind the hedge.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: He’s impressive, with his thick fur! I wonder if he’d come over if we called him.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Wait, listen, he goes [grrr], [grrr] when I put my hand close... Better not risk it, right?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Alright, it looks like he’d rather watch over his spot than play the star.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: We can keep exploring, there are surely more surprises in this park.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look, every time I walk by the fence, I always hear that '[grrr] [grrr]' behind the bush, it's impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? That must really startle you every time!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: At first, it made me jump, but now I try not to pay too much attention to it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Apparently, he's decided it's his territory.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, I guess he feels like he's on a guardian mission.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: His days must be pretty busy keeping an eye on the whole neighborhood like that!

meaning: bruit de grognement du lion, du tigre.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Look, Chloe, this is the time when they get really active—we're in for a treat!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we might actually witness a real show today.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Oh, listen! Right there, [roar]! You can feel it all the way down your arms.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: I swear, I almost dropped my camera—it's so impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: It's almost like the glass is going to shake every time he makes a sound.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: You forget about the crowd—you only see him. What an incredible moment!

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: Honestly, yesterday's outing will stay with me, especially in front of the big cats' enclosure.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You among the big cats? That's a change from those romantic movies!

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: No, seriously, there was a tiger pacing the enclosure like it was watching us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't tell me you stayed in front—I would've backed away right away.

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: Too late, it suddenly came closer, it looked like it was hesitating to pounce. Guaranteed chills!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And then, everyone holds their breath... then [roar], it puts on a show and everyone jumps!

meaning: bruit de ronflement d'un dormeur.
bruit de grognement du porc ou du sanglier.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Last night, I counted sheep until two in the morning, without success.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh wow, you're giving the neighborhood insomniacs a run for their money! What was the obstacle this time?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There was a very peculiar atmosphere in the room... let's just say it wasn't exactly dead silent.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Was there an impromptu concert or an animal hiding under your bed?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: More like a [oink-oink] festival, it echoed through the whole room!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The symphony of the undercover conductor, I suppose... Quite a night for your ears!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Paul, last night there was quite a concert: your famous [oink-oink] totally stole the show from the wind outside.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, it must have been a real festival then! Even the rain probably felt outdone.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I almost wanted to applaud, but I was too afraid of waking up the conductor.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: For the next performance, I'll add earplugs to the program for you, I promise!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: A silent ovation is all I ask for.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Deal, but careful, I might get into it and add a solo!

meaning: bruit de grognement du lion, du tigre.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet you've never jumped like you did in front of the tiger just now!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's those piercing eyes, don't you think? But mostly the noise it made all of a sudden...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Could you do that noise again? I didn't really catch it in the panic.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait... it sounded something like... [growl]! It almost made me fall backwards.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not bad! If you keep going, I'll end up believing there's a beast in here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At least I've mastered the art of sending chills down your spine in a tropical greenhouse...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If we get any closer, we’ll end up meeting their piercing gaze.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, listen... [growl], [growl]! You can tell the beast is watching over its territory.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You startled me, I really thought there was one right behind us!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Imagine if the keeper suddenly opened the door—I don’t think I’d even move.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good thing there’s this reinforced glass, otherwise you’d already be hiding behind the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let’s just say I prefer to act brave when there’s a solid wall between us!

meaning: bruit du roucoulement de la tourterelle, de la colombe.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [coo-coo]... It's coming from really close by, it sounds like they're having a little secret meeting in the old cedar.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: After coming here so often, I'm starting to believe they live in this park all year round.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, they know how to pick their spot—it's always cooler under this tree.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It creates a strange atmosphere, have you noticed? As soon as things get quiet again, they go right back to their routines like nothing happened.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's their territory after all, we're just passing through their makeshift living room.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I admit, it's better to walk quietly—we might disturb a whole council of wings.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look how the sunlight shines through the branches—it feels like we have our own secret spot just for us.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And yet, this bench is rarely empty. Do you think we're disturbing their routine?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Shh, wait... Do you feel this atmosphere? It's like everything is breathing softly around us.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Listen closely, behind the leaves, it's going [coo-coo]... It's like that's become the soundtrack of this place.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: All we'd need is a little orchestra, and it would be almost magical, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: With a soundtrack like this, I'd sign up to spend all my Sundays here.

meaning: bruit produit par un borborygme.
bruit du cri du porc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? [grumble]... I think my body is asking for a little more attention today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's a protest that doesn't go unnoticed!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm starting to think that this kind of noisy accident is an invitation to reinvent my lunch break.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With motivation like that, it's the perfect time to try something new at the bakery.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm going for the surprise cake combo—should satisfy every craving.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you're taking me on your culinary adventure, I'm in with my eyes closed!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, did you hear that too? My stomach just made a huge [growl]… how embarrassing!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I think everyone's stomach here is growling with hunger.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, but mine sounds like it's trying to talk to the kitchen staff!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With all these people ahead of us, I hope they'll serve us soon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm dreaming of a plate floating right over to our table…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we have to wait any longer, I'm ordering double right away!

meaning: bruit produit par un borborygme.
bruit du cri du porc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at the time—if this keeps up, we'll end up having lunch at snack time!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, just thinking about a fresh, warm baguette is making my mouth water already.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, wait a second... [grrrowl]... that perfectly sums up how I feel!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Sounds like it's starting to talk on its own—your thing is contagious!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That just shows how ready that savory tart in the fridge is to make its entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let's go before a whole symphony starts up under the table!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The line really isn’t moving, I can already feel my legs turning to concrete.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And now, right this second, there it goes—'[gurgle]'... super subtle, couldn’t have picked better timing!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: All we need now is a round of applause, that would be the grand finale!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet if we keep waiting, we’ll get an encore.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright, five more minutes and if nothing changes, I’ll make up an excuse to go grab a snack.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal! At this rate, we’ll end up opening an imaginary bakery here.

meaning: bruit de ronflement d'un dormeur.
bruit de grognement du porc ou du sanglier.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at Eric on the armchair, he didn’t even take off his shoes!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you listen closely, you’ll hear: [snort], [snort]… It’s his own private Saturday afternoon concert.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He’s going to end up waking up the whole building with that hidden talent.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You have to admit, our Eric is one of a kind.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Anyway, he wins the award for most spectacular rest today.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We should give him a medal, for the loudest nap!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I swear, last night, I thought the room was going to shake from how much I could hear '[snort] [snort]' right next to me!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: But you were super tired yesterday, did it keep you from falling asleep?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Honestly, I really tried to ignore it, but there was just no way to tune it out!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's epic... It’s like nights like that are made to test your patience.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Or maybe to prove that my pillow isn’t soundproof...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Personally, next time, I’m coming prepared. You’ll see how much I value my sleep, even in the middle of a real nighttime racket.

meaning: bruit de grognement du chien.
bruit de grognement du lion, du tigre.
marque l'irritation, l'agressivité d'une personne.
bruit du cri de la grenouille rousse.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, did you see that dog over there by the fence? He looks like he's standing guard.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Yeah, he really looks like the boss of the neighborhood, that one! I wonder if he'll let us through easily.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'll try walking slowly, maybe he'll understand that we don't want to bother him.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Whoa, listen... [grrr]... Sounds like he's starting to get impatient, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I give up, I'd rather go around! Let's take the path next to it.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Good idea, no need to get stuck in front of such a fierce gatekeeper.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look, Maxime, that dog behind the hedge has been staring at me for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, its ears are really perked up, it looks like it's guarding its territory.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I'm going to slow down, its fur is standing up like it's trying to tell us something.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Wait… do you hear that? Right there, [grrr], it's really making itself heard.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Things are heating up, it's definitely not joking around!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: If we avoid making eye contact, maybe we can avoid a scene straight out of an action movie.

meaning: bruit du cri de la grenouille rousse.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, right at the edge of the pond, things are really lively tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, with all this commotion, it feels like the pond is throwing a surprise party.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There must be a whole bunch of little creatures gathered there, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wouldn’t be surprised, especially at this time of year when every patch of water turns into a real stage!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [croak croak], do you hear that chorus? It’s getting more and more rhythmic!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, it’s tonight’s concert—we should have brought chairs to enjoy the show.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, the pond is almost hidden under all those leaves. It's crazy, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen for a second... [grr grr]... something's sneaking through the reeds, don't you think it's a strange vibe?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's like nature decided to give us an impromptu concert—I love this mysterious atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we stay quiet, maybe the sound will get closer, do you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we'll catch a glimpse of the conductor of this wild place!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't forget to keep your eyes wide open, it could pop out suddenly from between the rushes!

meaning: accompagne un chatouillement, le plus souvent sur un bébé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look Arthur, Pauline is wiggling her little feet as if she’s dancing the samba!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: She has incredible energy for her age, she’s a real little whirlwind!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet you came up with another trick to entertain her like that.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You should see her reaction when I bring my fingers close: [tickle-tickle], and her eyes light up instantly!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s amazing how she waits for your little surprises, it’s like she can guess the show ahead of time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With her, every moment becomes a comedy scene, she gets me to improvise nonstop!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, Leo, he's bringing his little hands closer—I can tell he's about to launch a surprise [tickle-tickle]!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, that's the kind of move that turns Leo into a fountain of laughter.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: His joy is really contagious—it's impossible to stay serious when you see him do that.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you think he gets that from you or from Maxime, this passion for making everyone laugh?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you only knew, at our place it's almost a real competition to see who can make the other laugh the most!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I love it! At your place, laughing is almost a sport.

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel souvent d'origine métallique, produit par un choc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you just hear that little [jingling]? I wonder if it's coming from the workshop drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With everything that's in there, it wouldn't be surprising. We almost need an inventory just to keep track of it all.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's crazy how tools always find a way to make themselves known at the least expected moment.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet if we dig around a bit, we'll end up finding a part you've been looking for for weeks.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Or maybe an old screw that's decided to make a run for it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Add that to our list of unsolved workshop mysteries—we'll be able to write a novel soon.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Ouch, something just went [clink] right behind me! How clumsy, I surprise myself every time.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You're incorrigible, Elise, always an unexpected adventure... Have you identified the culprit yet?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Not yet, but judging by the racket, it must have rolled all the way under the sideboard...

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If it's the spice box trying to escape again, we might end up having to tie it down!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: That would be just like it... I'm heading out on a rescue mission, recovery operation engaged.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Good luck, explorer of the day! May the sideboard reveal all its secrets to you.

meaning: bruit ponctuel de succion rapide, de déglutition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that, Maxime, the Ferris wheel is spinning full speed today! Want to try it?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh, do you really want to go all the way up there? Honestly, I’m a bit afraid of heights…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, you’ll see, the view is amazing, it almost feels like we’re in a movie!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I don’t know if I should believe you or run away, but it does sound wild.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, bet you can make it without closing your eyes!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Let’s go… *[gulp]*… but if I scream, you can’t show the video to anyone!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this, they just posted the list of keynote speakers and… your name is at the top!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh… [gulp]… wow, I really wasn’t expecting that at all.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Clearly, it’s a morning full of surprises for you.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I can feel the adrenaline rushing all of a sudden, it’s intense.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With the energy you give off, you’re going to make a big impression on them.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Alright, I guess I’ll have to believe in the magic of live events then!

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice there's that weird noise in the kitchen again tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Listen, every time I open the fridge door, it goes [bzzt] [bzzt] nonstop, I'm starting to think it's trying to talk!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, that fridge definitely has a personality of its own. At this rate, it'll end up asking for a coffee break!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Anyway, it's the conductor in the apartment tonight—did you hear how steady it is?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I'll end up dancing to its moods…

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: As long as you don't imitate the fridge on the table, I'm fine with it!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Have you been hearing that weird noise on the table for a while now?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, every time I get a notification, my phone goes [bzzt], it's subtle but really sets the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was actually wondering if it was coming from the ventilation or some electronic device.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alas, it's just the result of too many WhatsApp groups...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You should put it on silent before the whole office thinks we've got a hidden beehive in here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Good idea, I'll quiet the hive right away!

meaning: bruit produit par le bâillement.
bruit produit par le suffoquement.
bruit d'une personne qui pleure, qui sanglote.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at the time, we really pushed it tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can't see straight, my eyes are stinging, that's a sure sign.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Should we leave the rest for tomorrow? I think my brain is saying stop.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And to think we only planned for a quick hour... What a team of night owls!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I run into a pillow, it'll have me out in a second, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh wow, it's hitting me too... [yawn yawn yawn]... There you go, it's contagious, you got me!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: *[yawn yawn yawn]*… These morning meetings are really not for me.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Looks like early wake-ups leave their mark, not the best way to tackle the schedule.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: I feel like I already miss my pillow.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: If your pillow could serve coffee, maybe we'd make it to noon!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: I'd sign up for a pillow-café right away.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll bring you an espresso right at the first slide!

meaning: bruit de morsure.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So, do you see these homemade cookies? They just came out of the oven, I'm warning you!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I can't resist the call of gooey chocolate... Pass me the one all the way at the end, there!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: (hands over the cookie) Go ahead, try it! [nom]!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Hey, it crunches when you bite it, it's amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That's my secret: a little extra walnut, just for that.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: You'll have to make these for every picnic now, it's settled!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Ah, you're almost making me want to sneak a bite now.

dialogue.speaker: Theo
dialogue.text: Bet you'll give in to this croissant?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I can feel it, you're tempting me way too much…

dialogue.speaker: Theo
dialogue.text: Come on, try it, the melty center is waiting for you!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: OK, here I go… It just looks absolutely irresistible!

dialogue.speaker: Theo
dialogue.text: *[nom]* See? Impossible to resist.

meaning: bruit de morsure.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you see these croissants? They just came straight out of the oven, the whole bakery smells amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: I’m drooling just looking at them, there’s no way I can resist!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That one looks especially golden. Want to take the first piece?

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: You read my mind! Here I go, I’m diving in.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Careful, it’s almost a crime to miss a single crumb.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: *[crunch]* Mmmm… the texture is even better than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This baguette just came out of the oven, look how golden it is.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, the crust looks perfect! You should try a piece, it must be amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: *[crunch]* Well, that's exactly the kind of crispiness I can't resist!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watching you, I almost feel like I can smell the fresh bread.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The crumb is still warm inside, it's pure happiness with every bite.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Save me a piece, or I might just steal it from you right now!

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement d'un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: As soon as I set foot on the path, I heard a big "[woof] [woof]" behind the door! It’s like he was just waiting for this moment.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I think he can spot guests faster than I can, it’s almost like an improvised alarm.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It really sets the mood right away, anyway! You’ve got a one-of-a-kind welcoming committee.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: He’s decided the house is a fortress, so he always announces the arrival of a knight... or a dragon.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I’ll make sure not to scare the guardian, I promise. Do you want me to offer him a biscuit or is that risky for my fingers?

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: If you chew a biscuit and pretend to share, he’ll understand you’re one of us. Shall we try?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, just next to the bench—do you see that white dog over there? He hasn't taken his eyes off me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it looks like he's waiting for us to come closer! He's wagging his tail so much he might take off.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The last time a dog stared at me like that, he had hidden a ball under the bush.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He really seems like he wants to play, but I bet he's about to put on a show.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Shall we give it a try? Maybe he's a champion at fetch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we get a little closer... there, I knew it: [woof]! [woof]! He never misses a chance, that one.

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement d'un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I think the Town Hall street always has its little surprises, especially at the end of the afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Impossible to forget that blue gate today: all of a sudden, it went '[woof] ! [woof] !', I almost dropped my groceries!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You jumped too? I was starting to think it was just my imagination.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Anyway, my bag of apples almost ended up on the ground, it really startled me.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: And to think I didn't even dare look on the other side of the gate...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With a welcome like that, it's no wonder the mailman takes the other sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With this silence, you'd almost think the street is asleep today.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That's true, even the neighborhood kids haven't taken over the sidewalk yet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, suddenly [woof] [woof] [woof], the atmosphere changes all at once!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Looks like someone isn't fazed by the calm around here, apparently.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He must have spotted a passerby—it's his favorite moment to make himself known.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Between surprises like that and the creaking shutters, our neighborhood will never run out of new things!

meaning: bruit d'une personne qui pleure.
bruit de rire.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's weighing on me too much today, Léa. I feel like everything is slipping away from me.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Do you want to take a breather here? You can let it all out, I'm here.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Even when I try, I get stuck... And the more I go on, the emptier I feel.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Breathe, you're not the only one going through storms like this.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I wish I could stay strong, but right now, I think I'm really breaking down.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Come here if you want... [heh heh]... it'll pass, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You have that lost look, like the world has been weighing a bit too much on your shoulders lately.

dialogue.speaker: Mounir
dialogue.text: Ah, it's just that I'm going through a pretty stormy time right now. But I'm managing, don't worry.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Sometimes, facing the storm together makes it a bit more bearable, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Mounir
dialogue.text: It feels like everything's been conspiring against me these last few days, it's hard to take.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I'm staying close to you, even if words fail, I can at least share this heavy silence with you.

dialogue.speaker: Mounir
dialogue.text: It's... it's nothing, really... [heh heh]...

meaning: Interjection qui exprime généralement le doute, la réticence.
Note une petite toux, un raclement de gorge.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: [ahem]... I have to admit, this report leaves me puzzled on several points.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: What’s bothering you so much about this analysis?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Some of the numbers don’t match our results from last month, and I wonder if we’re missing something.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You know, we could compare with last year’s raw data—it might clear things up.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That’s an idea, but if that’s not enough, we’ll have to review the whole methodology—I can feel it coming.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Well, we’ll tackle it together. You’ll see, it won’t resist us for long.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Tell me, did you see there's still a spot left for the photo workshop tomorrow evening? I'd really like to book it with you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [ahem]... I admit it falls right in the middle of finishing my report, so I'm not too sure.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I didn't know you were under so much pressure right now.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, things are a bit tense at work, but I'm still tempted, I'm hesitating...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's up to you, but it could help take your mind off things too.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'll let you know later today, I'll check if I can get a bit ahead tonight.

meaning: bruit d'une personne qui pleure.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You seemed so confident this morning, Arthur. What changed your mood?

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: I thought I had everything under control, but it didn't go as planned at all…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [sniffle]… [sniffle]… I didn't want to break down in front of you but now, I just can't hold it in anymore…

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Oh, shoot, I can see this is really heavy for you. I'll stay with you, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It had to happen today, when everyone was counting on me…

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: You don't have to carry all this alone. We'll get through this together, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You've been lost in your thoughts, Elodie, I notice it a lot these days.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It's nothing, don't worry, I just think my batteries are drained.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It's not like you to keep everything to yourself, you know how much it gets to me.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I tried to be strong but... [uhh]... I feel so overwhelmed, even breathing feels hard sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Take this tissue, breathe with me for a bit. You don't have to handle all this alone.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I didn't think it would come out like this… thank you for staying, I appreciate it more than I can say.

meaning: bruit que l'on fait pour s'éclaircir la gorge ou pour attirer discrètement l'attention.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Did you see the sales chart this morning? I think there's an inconsistency on the March row.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I noticed that too, but I haven't figured out exactly where it's coming from yet.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: [um]... you didn't forget to include the special promotion we ran that week, did you?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, good question! I'll check, it's possible I skipped that column in the source file.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: That would explain a lot, actually.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Give me a minute, I'll dig into it and straighten everything out.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: [ahem]... so, I have a little problem with the coffee maker, it's acting up on me this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Is it making that weird noise again or is it something else?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: No, this time it won't even turn on, it's completely silent.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Did you try unplugging it and plugging it back in? Sometimes that brings it back to life.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Yes, I tried everything, nothing works... and without my coffee, the morning is going to be rough!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Hold on, I've played repairman for it before, I'll go check out its mood today.

meaning: bruit du rot.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think the raclette got the better of us—the table looks like a real battlefield.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But it was impossible to resist! Your cheese was perfect, and those potatoes... I’m still dreaming about them.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You deserve credit—no one’s collapsed onto the couch yet. Want some cake?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Phew, if I have one more slice... [urgh]... oh, oops, that slipped out.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There you go, the raclette has officially spoken for you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let’s just say that’s the ultimate sign of a successful feast...

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: We should have brought seatbelts for our stomachs with this cassoulet, right?

dialogue.speaker: Mounia
dialogue.text: [urgh]... See, just talking about it gives me uncontrollable reactions!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Well, that's grandma's recipe speaking—it's part of the tradition!

dialogue.speaker: Mounia
dialogue.text: I admit, this meal deserves a medal in the explosive dishes contest.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll bring a fire extinguisher instead of bread, you'll see!

dialogue.speaker: Mounia
dialogue.text: Deal, but only if you promise to try the spicy version!

meaning: Onomatopée qui, répétée, figure le rire et, parfois, les pleurs.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I swear, this is the third time this week I’ve stepped in a puddle right after putting on clean socks.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: You must really attract puddles, that’s a real talent at this point!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Last time, it was in front of the bakery—everyone looked at me like I did it on purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: [ha] [ha] [ha], maybe you should consider wearing boots even when it’s sunny!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Colorful boots, too—that would add a bit of cheer to my unexpected aquatic adventures.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: With you, all that’s missing is a rubber duck to parade around town, honestly!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you remember that famous day in high school when the gym teacher made us do trampoline in front of everyone?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I can still picture you taking off and landing right next to the mat!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Impossible to forget... [hee hee hee], my legs were like jelly and I collapsed like a pancake.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And everyone burst out laughing, even the teacher, he couldn't stop.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Since that day, I avoid all the gym workshops, too scared to put on the same show again!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's memories like that which make those moments unforgettable, you should be proud of it!

meaning: bruit d'un rire souvent niais, contraint ou égrillard.
bruit d'une personne qui pleure.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If you had seen Sylvain’s face in front of the yogurt aisle, you’d have thought he was facing a major political decision.

dialogue.speaker: Roman
dialogue.text: To be fair, choosing between red fruits and apricot can really shake a man!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Anyway, he looked so serious, I thought he was about to pull out a calculator to compare the tubs.

dialogue.speaker: Roman
dialogue.text: Maybe he was hoping for a secret promotion by finding the ultimate yogurt.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: When I walked by, he hid his basket like I was coming to spy on his strategy… [hehe].

dialogue.speaker: Roman
dialogue.text: We really should give him a medal for gastronomic suspense, he’s just too much!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If anyone asks me again why I avoid buffets, they’ve clearly never seen the cake incident last Sunday.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: [hee hee], it’s true that the slice landed right on the teacher’s coat… such unintentional precision.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I would have preferred to hit the table instead of Mr. Dupin’s new jacket…

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: But it turned the break into an impromptu fashion show—it looked like a pastry runway!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And to think I didn’t even get to taste that famous strawberry cake, everything went faster than expected.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: For once you were the life of the party—we won’t forget this snack anytime soon.

meaning: bruit de hoquet.
bruit de hoquet d'une personne qui a trop bu.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That chocolate cake was way too good, I went back for three more slices without even thinking.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: With all that, you might burst before the movie's over!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wait—[hiccup]! That just slipped out, I wasn't expecting it.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Well, that's a surprise that could set the pace for the rest of the evening.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: As long as no one decides to count every time, I'll survive.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Promise, I'll only keep score in my head... for now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was just trying to focus on my writing and suddenly, [hiccup], it completely threw me off!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, doesn't it always happen at the most unexpected moment! You looked so focused.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, it just had to happen right when I was feeling inspired…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's Murphy's law for you… the more focused you are, the more likely it is to catch you off guard!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If only it could at least boost my creativity, then I'd get something out of it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, that's a rather unexpected source of inspiration, but why not? It makes writing more lively!

meaning: Onomatopée évoquant le cri de l'âne.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Tell me, Paul, do you remember that walk in the countryside when we came across a herd near the old mill?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh yes, especially the moment when, right behind us, there was a loud "[hee-haw]" that almost made me drop my bike!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I can still see your surprised face—you turned around as if a monster was coming out of the ditch!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: That was epic... it was like even the birds went silent for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Walks in the countryside are always unpredictable with you, I never get bored!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Just wait for our next outing—who knows what we'll run into between the hedges!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Have you recovered from our trip to the farm? My shoes still have mud stains on them!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, for sure, but I still can’t stop thinking about how hard we laughed by the pen near the barn.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Yeah, that spot with the funny animals—you didn’t know where to look first!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: When one of them came up to the fence and went "[hee-haw]" right next to you, I thought you were going to jump out of your skin!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: I have to say, I almost spilled my hot chocolate—good thing you had a firm grip on your cup.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: For a first adventure at the farm, we set the bar high, especially with surprises like those noisy ones!

meaning: bruit du cri de l'a^ne.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey Paul, did you feel the wind change when we walked past the old barn?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Yeah! And right then, I heard a loud ‘[neigh]’ behind the hedge, it almost made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think it's a sign we should pick another path?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Honestly, I wonder if this place doesn't have a few hidden surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Want to bet we find the source of this mystery before the end of our walk?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Deal! And whoever finds it first gets a slice of pie when we get back!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: If you had seen the state of my pants when I came back from the field, I thought they were done for the day!

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Tell me it’s that story again with the neighbor’s animal hanging around your place…

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Exactly! It charged straight at me, out of nowhere, like it had seen a ghost.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: I’m not even surprised anymore… but honestly, that thing makes the craziest noises. Can you imitate the sound it makes?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Listen, it’s something like: [hee-haw], [hee-haw], hee-haaaaw! Are you still surprised it makes me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Your impression almost sounds like a warning siren, you have to show that to the village!

meaning: bruit produit par un engin manufacturé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at all this commotion, even the floor is vibrating under our feet!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? [whoosh whoosh]... It's echoing so loudly today, you'd almost think they're having a machine parade.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It reminds me of my grandfather's workshop, it had that same unmistakable rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: The old-timers really knew how to get used to all this. Me, I still need a bit more coffee to handle it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No wonder the whole neighborhood wakes up before the alarm at this rate!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Instead of a regular alarm clock, here we live to the tempo of concrete and steel...

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You see, they got that old cement mixer running again faster than expected.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Listen, as soon as it starts up, it goes '[screech screech]' all through the warehouse—it's impossible to concentrate!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I almost dropped my bucket, it startled me so much!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: You'll get used to it—it's been part of the scenery here for years.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Anyway, as long as it's running, we're making progress on the site.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Exactly, it's what sets the pace, even if it's not a classical melody!

meaning: bruit de hoquet.

dialogue.speaker: Lena
dialogue.text: If you take the last piece of pie, I'll tell the others on you right away!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: That's a serious threat... But I think I'm going to risk it anyway, it's calling to me!

dialogue.speaker: Lena
dialogue.text: Ah, your courage will be your downfall! Wait, let me serve you a bit of cream with it.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Thanks, but—[gulp]—well, that's surprising! It's honestly the first time a piece of pie has ever talked back to me.

dialogue.speaker: Lena
dialogue.text: Legend says only the best pastries know how to defend themselves...

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Honestly, your sense of humor is almost more dangerous than the pie itself!

dialogue.speaker: Zoe
dialogue.text: Maybe I shouldn't have chugged my glass of sparkling water like that... what was I thinking.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: You always have this habit of gulping everything down too fast, you know that!

dialogue.speaker: Zoe
dialogue.text: That's true, but it's so refreshing... Don't you think the bubbles sometimes go straight to your head?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Just yesterday, Mathieu almost spit everything out during a meeting because he got the giggles and was drinking lemonade.

dialogue.speaker: Zoe
dialogue.text: Wait... [hic]... oh shoot! Just thinking about it makes it happen!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: There we go, it's started! Let's count how many times you make that noise before the picnic is over.

meaning: sons indistincts émis par une personne qui est dans l'impossibilité d'ouvrir la bouche.
bruit de grognement d'une personne mal réveillée.
bruit de marmonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come on, Thomas, take a bite of this cake, you'll see, it's even better than last time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Are you sure about your recipe? The dough seems even thicker, careful I don't choke…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [mmm] [mmm] [mmm]…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It's impossible to guess what you're trying to say with your mouth full!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Apparently I should've gone easier on the filling…

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: No, it's perfect, I'll just have to chew a bit longer!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Alright, settle back into the chair, I'll adjust the headrest.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I think the light is a bit bright, but it should be fine.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'm opening my tray, we'll start gently — open wide, there we go…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: (cheeks puffed out, he tries to say something)

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If it ever hurts or you want to take a break, just raise your hand, alright?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [mmm] [mmm]…

meaning: bruit d'un cri étranglé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The stage is right there, look... honestly, it feels like it's swallowing us up, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and every time I look at it, I feel like my legs are going to give out. I hope we can just tune out all these people.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Bet you in two minutes we won't even be thinking about it? Once we start, everything else fades away.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Easy for you to say... I can already feel the moment coming when I open my mouth in front of everyone and... [ugh]... nothing, not a single word comes out!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, that's not like you at all! Have you seen how you explain everything in the workshop?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's not the same, this time there are a hundred eyes staring at us. Okay, deep breath, I'll try not to turn the stage into an aquarium!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I swear, Léa, my morning could shake up a disaster movie plot!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Spill it already, you’ve got me curious with that look—you look like you’ve run an emotional marathon.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The bus slammed on the brakes, everyone lurched forward, and I saw my coffee go flying… [ugh]… there was no way I could react the way I wanted in that moment!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: What a mess, your poor sweater—did it survive the flood or not?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Direct hit, Léa. The sweater bears the scars of this morning’s battle.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Honestly, you deserve a medal for bravery on public transport today!

meaning: Interjection servant à appeler.
Servant à exprimer l'étonnement, l'indignation.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Look at this path, I bet it leads to the old mill you were talking about the other day.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you want us to take it? I can already see some tracks, it looks promising.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Wait, let me tighten my shoelace, my foot almost slipped earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hurry up then, I’m starting to hear water in the distance, it’s got me curious.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: [whoa], Julien, you’re about to walk past a salamander, don’t move!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, really? I’ll take a closer look, thanks for pointing it out!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see where Rémi went? He had our tickets for the concert.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No, I thought he was talking with Léa near the kiosk.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, he must have slipped away, I can't find him anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you want me to take a look on the other side of the park?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good idea, I'll check near the entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [hey]! Rémi, come here, we're waiting for you!

meaning: bruit de rire.
bruit d'une personne qui pleure.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I swear, Christophe’s face when he spilled his coffee on his file—that’s an image that’s going to stick with me all day!

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: You mean when he tried to act like nothing happened, even though the cup was still dripping onto his shoe?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: [ha ha], and the worst part is, while wiping it up, he got some on the carpet too. He’s going to end up on the office wall of shame!

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: We should get him a bib next time—I think he’d find it useful.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: For that, he at least deserves a medal for best open space acrobat!

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: At this rate, he’s going to start the portable coffee trend. Always on his shoes!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Can you imagine, at lunch today I spilled my tray right in front of the whole cafeteria.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That could only happen to you, honestly! Did the pasta survive?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not even! Everyone just stopped dead, and I just burst out: [ha ha], what a scene!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: You always put on a show, it's unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Gotta entertain the coworkers, right?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: With you, meals are never boring, you have to admit!

meaning: bruit du cri du coucou.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at the light through the leaves, it’s almost unreal this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
