dialogue.text: It gives the forest an enchanted vibe, I love when everything feels suspended like this.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: All that’s missing is a hint of mystery, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we’ll get a surprise sound from a winged visitor.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Shh, listen... There’s something... Do you hear it, there, behind the trees?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: [hoo hoo]... That’s really the kind of moment that gives me chills!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I never get tired of the atmosphere in the woods after it rains—everything suddenly feels so much more alive.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's true, it's like every leaf wants to tell its own story... and the birds are really having a field day today.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: You know, there's always that strange noise, almost rhythmic, in the clearing near the old willow. It surprises me every time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, really? Does it come from above or from the undergrowth? I've noticed some sounds that seem to come from nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It's hard to pinpoint, but it echoes between the branches, especially late in the afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Sometimes, if you really listen... you can hear that famous '[hoo hoo], [hoo hoo]' coming from right above our heads... It keeps a bit of mystery, I love that.

meaning: Interjection pour railler, faire peur ou honte.
Servant à appeler.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Imagine, right in the middle of my presentation, my phone rang with that old duck ringtone... everyone turned around.

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: Wait, the duck ringtone, the one that goes quack-quack really loud?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly... and of course, I couldn't find it at the bottom of my bag, it kept quacking while Mrs. Durand stared at me.

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: Oh no, you really lived THE nightmare! I can just imagine the looks in the classroom...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You bet, some people even started going: "[boo], [boo]!" like in a movie when someone gets called out...

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: That's it, you're the star of the day now! Next time, set it to silent mode before people start imitating you in the halls again.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Honestly, I can't believe you dared to come to the party in that neon sweater yesterday!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Come on, style can't be explained, you have to dare to stand out!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [boo], do you think you're a fashion designer or what? Even the disco ball was embarrassed!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At least people talked about me all night, not bad, right?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Come on, next time try a sequin cape, that'll really make a splash!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, get ready to put on your sunglasses!

meaning: bruit d'un cri d'oiseau.
bruit d'aboiement ou de hurlement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Shh, listen! Did you hear that "[hoo hoo]" coming from the trees over there? It almost made me jump.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that's a bit out of the ordinary. Looks like the forest has some surprises for us tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I love when things like this happen during our walks—it gives the place a mysterious vibe.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Honestly, if we move slowly, maybe we can find out what it is without scaring anyone off.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'm walking on tiptoe, are you coming? We're going to uncover the secret tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Always up for a bit of unexpected adventure, especially when it's this intriguing!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that sound in the distance? [hoot hoot]... It really sounds like the call of a nocturnal bird.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, it's fascinating. The forest completely changes when night falls.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I find it both a little unsettling and very soothing at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, we discover sounds that we never hear in the middle of the day.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Walking here at dusk feels like entering a secret world.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's why I love these evening walks—there's always a surprise around every corner.

meaning: bruit d'un cri étranglé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Take a look, I don’t even dare set foot in this café anymore after what happened yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, tell me quickly, just the look on your face is preparing me for the worst!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Imagine this: I tripped over a customer’s bag and… I toppled over, spilling her coffee all over myself in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [oof]! I can picture it, everyone must have turned around at once.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was worthy of a blooper reel, there was no way to be more discreet in that situation.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You should be awarded a medal for composure, because I would have run out of there in giant strides!

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: I never would have believed these stairs would creak so much at night... Do you think there's still someone downstairs?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, I heard something dragging around, right where the light never reaches.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Wait... I think I saw a shadow, just behind the railing. [umph]!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Marion, tell me you're joking, are you trying to scare me or what?

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: No, I swear, my legs just froze on their own...

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm going ahead with the flashlight, but if I run into a ghost, you're going first next time!

meaning: bruit du souffle du vent.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Look at those clouds rolling down the hill, it feels like we’re in the middle of an adventure movie!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: We should walk a bit faster, it smells like a surprise downpour is coming…

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Did you see the leaves suddenly start dancing? The weather forecast wasn’t kidding.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: I can feel the wind coming, it almost makes me want to run down this trail like a kid.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: [brr]… it tickles the back of my neck, that shiver that comes with the breeze!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: If only we could bottle up this moment, just for the feeling!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It seems like the forest is still keeping its secrets today… Look at those clouds over there.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yes, they're moving fast, you could almost believe an adventure is waiting for us behind every tree trunk.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you feel how the air rushes between the trees? This feeling is almost strange.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's true, sometimes it feels like we're being watched just because everything is moving around us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Nature really has its own way of wrapping around us… Do you hear that? Right there, that passage between the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Listen closely… [whoosh]… it goes through everything, as if the path is secretly opening just for us.

meaning: bruit qui accompagne souvent les pleurs.
bruit de rire.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, your eyes are all red, Camille… did something happen?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's nothing, just a bit of a long night yesterday, really.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: But look, you're hiding your face and… [sniffle]… that's not the kind of tired you were talking about, is it?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I didn't want to break down, but now everything's overwhelming me, I can't control anything anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, I'm putting everything down and staying here, you're not going through this alone.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Thank you, that's exactly what I needed, even if I didn't say it.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You've been staring at the cup without moving for a while now, Lucas... What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's a bit silly, but... sometimes, everything just feels too heavy all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know, it's okay to feel overwhelmed. We can talk about it if you want.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Everything's piling up, I can't catch my breath anymore, and I feel like I'm letting everyone down.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No one blames you, you're much stronger than you think.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I wish I could believe that... [sob sob]...

meaning: bruit d'un hoquet, le plus souvent d'un hoquet d'ivrogne.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You celebrate your victories like you play foosball, Arthur: always all in, never halfway!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: When the foosball table lets you down, you have to fall back on shots!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Look at you, you're almost mixing up the street and the bar—watch out for the curb!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: [hug]... ah, that damn cobblestone, it moved under my feet, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, blame the ground; come on, let's get going before that streetlamp challenges you to a duel.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: If I run into a bench, I'll warn it it doesn't stand a chance against me tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Hey, did you just spill half your beer on the table or is that a new way to enjoy it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Bad aim, it happens to the best of us, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: At the rate you're going, the bartender's going to have to set up a barrier in front of you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No way, I... I promise, I've got everything under control, loo— [whoosh]! —k, not even a drop on the floor this time.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: "Control"—is that a competitive sport now? I feel like you're winning the style medal tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No medal, but you owe me a pack of peanuts to make up for it!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau ou d'un jeune oiseau.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look over there, on the cherry tree branch, there's another one sneaking between the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? Right when it hops, it goes '[tweet tweet]', it's almost subtle but it slips into the air.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I wonder what it's looking for, maybe it's hoping to find a few forgotten cherries.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With this gentle breeze, everything seems more alive, even these little searches feel like an adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Every time I watch this scene, I feel like I'm being invited into their little world.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We should linger here more often, it really changes the flavor of a morning in the garden.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The air smells nice after the rain, it's pleasant to sit here under the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, and you can hear all those little lives coming to life in the bushes, it's fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Under this branch, do you see? There's a little movement, right there, look closely.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it's wriggling! It looks like something interesting is happening in there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, it goes [cheep cheep]... They seem wide awake at least!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We could stay here for hours just watching them, it's like a little show just for us.

meaning: Interjection qui exprime généralement le doute, la réticence.
Note une petite toux, un raclement de gorge.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There's a new Italian restaurant that just opened in town, do you want to try it out on Friday night?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: An Italian place? Is it the one near the cinema that everyone’s talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [hmm], not really, I’ve heard mixed reviews so I’m a bit hesitant to go.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe we could check the reviews online first?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, good idea, that’ll help us decide.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Perfect, let’s keep each other posted then!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Would you come with me to the opening on Friday evening?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, an opening? You know I don't know anything about art...

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Exactly, it's a chance to discover it without any pressure, and we can chat quietly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I see, you want me to be your excuse so you don't have to stay alone.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [ahem]... let's just say I was really hoping not to go all by myself.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll think about it, but I'm not promising anything, okay?

meaning: bruit d'un cri étranglé.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Did you just see the boss's email? He wants our report on his desk before the lunch break.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: I just opened it, and honestly, my heart skipped a beat.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: We don't have a choice, we'll have to hustle and cross our fingers we don't forget anything.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: This is going to be intense... especially since last time, he pointed out every detail.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [ugh]... every time he does that, I feel like there's no air left in the office.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Promise, after this, I'll buy croissants if we survive this sprint.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, you didn’t happen to mess with my drawer by any chance, did you?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Huh? No, why are you asking me that?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Because someone left a strange box in there, and honestly it’s got me a bit worried.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: A box? This isn’t one of your jokes, I hope...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Not at all! Look, if I press here... something weird happens.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [umph]!

meaning: bruit du rot.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I knew that cassoulet was a bad idea after three servings, but I just couldn't resist.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see how many beans there were? It felt more like a challenge than a meal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And that wasn't even dessert! I think my stomach is begging me to stop.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, I feel like something wants to come out on my end too, this isn't looking good.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You'll see, this is the kind of meal you'll remember for hours…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Mmmf… [bleh]… ah, there we go, that's better! We're really not cut out for eating contests.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Wait… [blech]! Wow, this apple juice definitely has more kick than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It seems like this juice wakes up more than just your thirst, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Apparently, yes! I think next time I'll just stick to water...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh no, it would be a shame to deprive the table of your sparkling enthusiasm.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: As long as my glass doesn't decide to play in the marching band, I'm fine with it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Promise, if it happens again, I'll join in on the chorus with my own fizzy drink.

meaning: bruit du cri du chat.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, I spilled a cup of coffee right on my new rug this morning… total fiasco.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh no! That's exactly the kind of stroke of luck that puts you in a great mood first thing in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly… And now, I keep hearing those weird noises behind the bookshelf.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Don't you think it's that old attic ghost story starting up again?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'd rather bet on something alive, after the mess last night…

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Wait… listen, it's starting up again, really close… [meow]!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you just hear that noise behind the living room door, or am I imagining things?

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: No, I definitely heard something too… I have to admit, it gave me a bit of a chill.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Maybe a draft knocked something over, like last time…

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Or maybe your kitty is trying to get attention again, that seems very likely to me.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: She always knows how to get noticed at the most unlikely hours.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Exactly, listen… behind the couch, [meow]!

meaning: pour accompagner un mouvement vif.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, that ball stuck up there has been calling to me for ages!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watch this, just a second… [whoosh]! It's already back on the ground.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You're amazing, you've got the timing of an acrobatic cat!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I was afraid it would get away again—you never know with the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll give it a try, just so I don't lose my touch.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal, we'll see who's fastest at the next challenge!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Let's go, Thomas, we need to get this wardrobe around the corner without scratching the floor.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: OK, I'm right behind you, watch out for my fingers... ready for the turn!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: As soon as I say, you lift your side towards me. Should we try it on three?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [whoop]! There, I lifted it up in one go, it fits without even forcing it.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Perfect, you saved our toes and the wardrobe!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With moves like that, we could start a moving company!

meaning: bruit du cri de douleur d'un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, that dog under the tree, he's all curled up.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He's barely moving, it looks like he's waiting for something or someone.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe he's trying to get attention, do you think he's hungry?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe... wait, I'll try to get closer without scaring him too much.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, he suddenly sat up when you reached out your hand!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I just heard a little '[yelp yelp]', I think it's better not to get any closer for now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look over there, Django stopped dead in the middle of the sidewalk.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: He's staring at his paw, do you think he stepped on something?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I don't see anything on the ground, but he's been turning in circles for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Did you hear that little '[yelp yelp]' earlier? It sent chills down my spine.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's not like him... There must really be something wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: We should see if Camille has tweezers at her place, just in case he has a splinter.

meaning: bruit du cri du canard.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, there's a whole group swimming toward us!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: They look determined to come and ask for something...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, do you hear how suddenly they're getting excited, [quack quack]!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It's true, it really livens up the shore right away.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: They know they'll end up getting a crumb or two, those rascals.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With their enthusiasm, it's hard to resist them!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look, Juliette, this spot by the water is perfect, and listen to that little impromptu band... [rat-a-tat], it's a real picnic soundtrack!

dialogue.speaker: Juliette
dialogue.text: Don’t you think it feels like a fairground? It’s like they want all the attention on them.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: If they keep this up, they’ll end up attracting all the kids in the park, for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Juliette
dialogue.text: Either way, it really makes me laugh. We should come back here to draw them one day.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Oh yes! And this time, I won’t forget my pencils, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Juliette
dialogue.text: With or without drawing, their improvised acts are as good as any show in the neighborhood.

meaning: bruit du coassement de la grenouille.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, near the water lilies... [ribbit ribbit]! It sounds like a frog is greeting us.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: You have sharp hearing, I almost missed that sound.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's amazing how lively the pond gets at dusk.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Yes, the light is fading, and all the life seems to come out of hiding.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Let's stay a little longer, who knows what mysteries will be revealed?

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Good idea, I bet we'll meet more evening singers.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Last night, I walked by the old mill, you know, just after the rain, and the atmosphere was unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that spot always transforms sounds, especially when night falls. It's like everything suddenly comes alive.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: And suddenly, it went: [ribbit ribbit], [ribbit ribbit], all around me, like a little hidden orchestra in the reeds!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Those kinds of moments are magical, you almost can't tell if it's nature or just your imagination!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: We should go back one evening, just to see if the orchestra performs again.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'm already itching to pull on my boots and head over, just saying!

meaning: bruit léger, à deux temps, produit par un petit choc, une chute.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Do you really think these marbles will stay on the table for long with Simon running around everywhere?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: With the way he runs, I bet they won't last three minutes... You might have to sweep up!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If you helped me pick them up, we could limit the disaster...

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm grabbing one—are you ready? It's rolling toward you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Careful, it's going behind the bowl!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Too late... [clack clink]... Ah, it finished its run against the chair!

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Do you really think that pile of pencils is going to stay like that on the edge of the table?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: As long as nobody shakes the table, it should be fine…

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Your cat just jumped onto the chair, this has disaster written all over it.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, look… [clatter clink]… There you go, everything's on the floor now.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Told you, the laws of gravity never spare your desk.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: At least there are still some markers under the couch for backup!

meaning: petit bruit aigu produit par divers animaux.
petit bruit grinçant, crissement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The mist over the pond makes it feel like we're far from everything, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, it's almost unreal. It's like even the trees are whispering in the silence.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, there's a little movement in the bushes, right there!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That startled me. Do you think we'll see something come out of there?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Shh... do you hear that? It sounded like... [squeak squeak]... really close.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I'm going to end up believing we're being watched from the reeds!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, the light through the trees really gives a unique atmosphere here.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Listen, there's a little "[squeak squeak]" very close by, just behind the tall grass, do you hear it too?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, it's subtle but it really stands out from the other sounds around.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It reminds me of those summer afternoons when I listened for every whisper of nature.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With your imagination, everything becomes a sensory adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: So, shall we keep going to the old bridge? Maybe we'll come across other strange melodies along the way.

meaning: bruit du cri du corbeau et des corvidés.
marque d'anticléricalisme primaire.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look up there, there's another one that landed on the twisted branch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? Right then: [caw], [caw], he made himself heard like a boss.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It almost made me jump, it’s like he’s watching over the whole park.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With those bright eyes, he looks like he’s plotting something sneaky.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The old city crows, always loyal to their post!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It’s impossible to go unnoticed under their gaze, especially with this kind of atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at those clouds gathering—the park almost looks like a scene from a noir novel today.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It really does, and those dark shapes in the branches add to the setting, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, right there: [caw], [caw], [caw]... it's like they're creating an atmosphere all on their own.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It almost makes you want to pull out a magnifying glass, detective style, to follow their movements.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If there's a mystery here, I bet they're at the center of the story.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: With such chatty witnesses, the case would be solved in no time!

meaning: bruit de crachement du chat en colère.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, your Aristide is crouched on the rug like a lion lying in wait!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Haha, he takes his guard duty very seriously—come closer if you dare.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, you little furball, a cuddle wouldn’t hurt you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ooh, listen to that '[hiss hiss]', he’s making his intentions clear—watch out!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, he gave me a look that could freeze your blood—no cuddles today!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Aristide has his off days—it’s his royal way of reminding us of his rules.

dialogue.speaker: Noémie
dialogue.text: Well, it looks like Pistache has found his spot on your favorite sweater.

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Ah, that cat... he doesn't share easily when he takes over something, just so you know.

dialogue.speaker: Noémie
dialogue.text: Do you think he'd let me get at least one sleeve back if I try?

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: I tried earlier, result: [grr grr]! He looked at me like I'd just committed a crime.

dialogue.speaker: Noémie
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I know the type, Pistache, emperor of the living room... better keep your distance.

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: As long as he doesn't demand his throne, peace is maintained in our home.

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: He sniffed around the whole garden again this morning, that dog doesn't miss a thing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, I bet he could smell even the tiniest ant if he had to!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. Last time, he started growling just because a hedgehog was passing behind the hedge.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If I were that hedgehog, I would have felt watched, for sure! Want to see if he reacts like that with people too?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Why not, go ahead, get a little too close to his bowl and you'll see!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: *slowly walks toward the bowl, then whispers while looking at the dog* [psst psst]... come on, then, [psst psst]...

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Wait, Zoé, look over there behind the hedge... Max, [pss pss], stay close to me, okay!

dialogue.speaker: Zoé
dialogue.text: But why are you doing that all of a sudden? Max jumps every time you call him like that.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Honestly, I got a bit stressed when I saw that figure move.

dialogue.speaker: Zoé
dialogue.text: Looks like you watch too many movies. Max doesn't even seem worried!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Yeah, he's got nerves of steel. Me, I get worked up over nothing…

dialogue.speaker: Zoé
dialogue.text: If you ever want to take Max's place watching the neighborhood, I'll hand you the leash without hesitation!

meaning: bruit du cri du paon.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Impossible to miss the bird corner this afternoon, it was a real colorful parade!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh, so you saw the tall gentleman with the shimmering blue train? That must have been the main attraction today.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: He even stood right in front of me, spreading all his feathers, as if he wanted to be the star.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I can just picture the scene... And then suddenly, [honk] ! [honk] ! All the visitors turned around, right?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Honestly, I felt the whole pond pause for a second, it was almost solemn.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: What presence, that king of the garden! He really knows how to captivate his audience.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to that sound behind the bushes… [roar], [roar]! It feels like we're in another world here.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s crazy how the atmosphere changes as soon as we pass through that wrought iron gate.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should have come here more often to admire this spot, there’s always some detail that surprises you.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: The colors in the sunlight—it’s almost magical this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I’ll bring something to draw this unbelievable landscape.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And I’ll bring the binoculars so we don’t miss any of the show, even the little hidden scenes.

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look, they're all gathered under the apple tree—it would make such a beautiful photo.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If you approach slowly, maybe you could even pet one.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait… oh, that one is coming toward me and goes [baa]aa, it's so cute!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It looks like it recognizes you, or maybe it senses you have an apple hidden in your pocket!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Even without treats, they seem so comfortable that I want to stay here all day.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If you settle in with them, just promise me you won't start chewing cud too!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, Julie, there's a whole group coming toward the fence, it's funny.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: They seem to be attracted to our bags, don't they? Maybe they're hoping for a treat.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you think they're reacting to our voices or just the sound of the plastic?

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Oh, listen to that, that one just went '[baa-aa]' while jumping onto the little rock! What a character!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's amazing how every movement of the herd instantly becomes a little live show.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Definitely, we should come here more often to enjoy these kinds of spontaneous scenes.

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I took the little path behind my house, and suddenly came across a huge pasture down below.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, you must see all sorts of surprises over there! Did you run into anyone in that pasture?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, a whole bunch of woolly animals were lounging there peacefully, and one of them let out a big '[baa]aa' that echoed all the way to the path!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It feels good to hear that, I can just picture the scene!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It almost made me want to stop and join them, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With you and your love for animals, nothing surprises me!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: We're getting close to the farm. Do you smell that fresh grass, Matthew?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Yes, and listen: "[baa] [baa] [baa]!" It sounds like the goats are welcoming us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: They seem full of energy. Do you think they'd like a snack?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: If you pull out an apple, I bet they'll all come running to you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Then next time, I'll bring a basket for our four-legged fans!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Good idea! But be careful, they're faster than you think.

meaning: bruit du bêlement des ovins et des caprins.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: What a beautiful getaway through these meadows, it's like a living impressionist painting!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's true, and look at those sheep, they almost seem to be dancing in the fresh grass.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I love scenes like this, it makes me want to sketch everything in a notebook.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between two pencil strokes, did you hear that little [baa] coming from the back of the field?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, and you have to admit they know how to grab attention better than many street performers!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With such an audience, it's no wonder they never miss their cue.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to that sound in the meadow, [baa], it sounds like the sheep are greeting us!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: They must think we're bringing them food, that's why they're all gathered together.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that one, he's shaking his head as if he's waiting for something.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe he's hoping for a pet or a bit of bread.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wonder if they remember the people who come to see them often.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'm sure they recognize the regulars, especially when it comes to treats!

meaning: bruit de marmonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’re staring at that screen like you’re waiting for it to reveal a secret, Marc.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Let’s just say this Excel file is giving me more trouble than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It almost looks like a duel… Need a hand, or would you rather battle it out solo?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I appreciate the offer, but I feel like I’ll figure it out soon enough.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful not to use up all your energy on one stubborn cell!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: [hmm] [hmm] [hmm]… ah, maybe if I change this formula…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Lost in your thoughts again, huh... Are you trying to break a concentration record today?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, you startled me... I'm just sorting things out in my head, nothing serious.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you need a rope, or are you going to untangle all that by yourself?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let's just say I'm taking my time, moving at my own pace...

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Because if you keep frowning like that, you'll end up drawing chalk lines for wrinkles.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [mumble] [mumble] [mumble]... You know you talk louder than my thoughts sometimes?

meaning: bruit de miaulement du chat, notamment du chat en chaleur.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice what happened in the hallway last night? Someone was making a real scene!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and that famous "[mrowww]" echoed all the way into my room, I thought it would never stop.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I even thought it was a baby crying, it was so high-pitched—I jumped in my bed.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I peeked out the door, and surprise: Mimine was standing right in the middle of the tiles, looking inspired.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Poor thing, she really looked wild... We’ll have to do something before the whole building joins in.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I think I’ll go buy some catnip and hope it calms her down a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This morning, again, at three o'clock, I heard right under my window: [meowww], [meowww]... Can you imagine what I looked like going to work!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Honestly, that must have been epic... Didn't you try using earplugs?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Even with my ears plugged, it's like the window was vibrating! That cat has quite a voice.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: At this rate, the whole street will be awake before dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You can't imagine the conversations at the bakery this morning, everyone was looking for the furry culprit.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I bet someone will end up writing a letter of complaint... to the cat, not the owner!

meaning: bruit du cri des bovins.
bruit du cri du lion.
bruit d'un avertisseur sonore.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Walking past the old farm this morning, I felt like I was being watched by a whole army of round eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, if you get too close to the fence, you'll hear a "[moo]" come out of nowhere, guaranteed!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's exactly what happened to me! I jumped and thought they were about to start a concert.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: They're experts at playing the country choir, especially when they spot someone with a picnic bag.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll surprise them with some apples; we'll see if I become their conductor!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Don't forget your boots, they might want to add you to the pasture band!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at the size of that cow, Sophie, she looks impressive in the middle of the herd.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? [moo]... It sounds like she's talking directly to us, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, with that look, I think she spotted the apple you're hiding behind your back.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's impossible to resist her, she melts my heart every time with those gentle eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you keep this up, all the others will come asking for their share too!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I planned ahead, there's a whole bag of apples in the car.

meaning: Onomatopée imitant le meuglement de la vache.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wow, I don’t think we’ve ever walked so much between the fields as we did this weekend! I still have dirt on my shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: And you’re forgetting the spotted calf that kept watching us! I felt like I was being stared at with every step.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The one that came up to the fence, you mean? With her little bell jingling, it was almost solemn.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Exactly! I got a loud '[moo]' right as I was taking the photo. I almost missed my shot!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: She really had a sense of timing, that little star! We should think about inviting her to our next photo shoots.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: With talent like that, she’d be a hit on social media, I’m sure of it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It looks like your t-shirt still has traces from our countryside adventure yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Impossible to get out! And to think it’s because you sat down near the cow fence.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I admit it, but I absolutely wanted to see if they would come over to me.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: They were curious, especially the one that stared at you with those big gentle eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I even thought she understood what I was telling her about galaxies…

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Maybe she was waiting for you to answer her with a "[moo]" so you could really communicate!

meaning: bruit produit par un baiser appuyé.
sons indistincts émis par une personne dont l'élocution est entravée par un corps étranger, qui est dans l'impossibilité d'ouvrir la bouche.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: You know, without your mood, the apartment really looks gloomy.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, you're exaggerating... Still, I brought the sunshine just for you!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Well then, come see if your weather works up close too.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: *leans in, a sly smile, and makes a [mwah] right next to Nina's ear*

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Ah yes, it's definitely brighter now, I can confirm.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Careful, I've got a whole arsenal of special rays in reserve.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You’re right on time, and I was already imagining everything we’re going to do tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With you, it’s impossible to get bored—I’ve been counting down the minutes all day.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Come closer, you won’t get away without... [mwah]!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, that kind of surprise makes the wait even sweeter!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So, are you ready for an evening full of surprises and stolen moments?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: More than ever, especially with a start like this!

meaning: marque une appréciation gustative favorable.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I got these croissants fresh and warm this morning, [yum yum], you'll see, they're delicious!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, you know how to make me happy, they smell so good!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Make yourself comfortable, I also made us some good coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Thank you! There's nothing better to start the day off right.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Would you like to try chocolate croissants next time too?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I'd love to, as long as breakfast is shared with you!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [nom nom], this mushroom risotto has an amazing flavor, Maxime, you really outdid yourself tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: That’s a relief, I improvised a bit with the spices, I hope it’s not too strong.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No, it’s just perfect! Where did you get the idea to add grated parmesan at the end?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It’s a trick from my aunt, she always said it ties all the flavors together.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Your aunt knew what she was doing, I’m making a note of that tip for next time!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: If you want, next time we can try her asparagus version, how does that sound?

meaning: bruit du cri des bovins.
bruit du cri du lion.
bruit d'un avertisseur sonore.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey, there's a lot going on near the fence today!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to that... [moo]... it sounds like the ladies really want to get noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: They never stop, it's almost like a country concert, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, and you should hear them when they spot the farmer coming with the bucket!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: These little daily shows could almost put you in a good mood.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, life on the farm definitely has its musical surprises!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know what? I spent the whole morning trying to help my cousin out in the fields.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wow, that's a change from the subway! So you really got your boots muddy, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and as soon as I arrived, a cow followed me everywhere, like I was some kind of celebrity.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Totally! I can picture it—you're the star of the herd.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You have no idea—at one point she stopped, tilted her head, and then, "[moo]" while staring me right in the eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I'm still laughing! Your farm adventures are better than TV.

meaning: bruit du cri du chat.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen, there's another [nom-nyaow] coming from the kitchen... I bet he'll show up any second now.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With timing like that, you'd think he knows the time better than I do.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I think even the weather isn't as regular as his little routines.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Makes you think he's secretly training for a perfectly choreographed show.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And to think he claims to be discreet—he'd get spotted from ten kilometers away.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You should give him a medal for the art of getting noticed without even trying.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at that, Oscar—Biscotte just climbed up on the shelf again without a moment's hesitation.

dialogue.speaker: Oscar
dialogue.text: That's incredible, she's afraid of nothing, that one. Did she spot some hidden treasure in the plants or what?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And right after she got up there, she turned to me and let out her famous [meowmunch].

dialogue.speaker: Oscar
dialogue.text: Only she could come up with a sound like that at the top of her kingdom!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Biscotte never misses a chance to get noticed, especially when she feels like the queen of the living room.

dialogue.speaker: Oscar
dialogue.text: That cat is really going to make me write a novel one day, I swear!

meaning: Exclamation qui exprime le plaisir de manger.
Chose à manger.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The smell coming from this bag is incredible... Are you sure you ordered our favorite burgers?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I promise you, with fries too! They’re already crunchy just looking at them.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, open it up for me, [yum-yum], I’ve rarely been this hungry!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: If you start like that, I have a feeling there won’t be anything left in the boxes!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know me, the smell of fries and cheese makes me lose my mind.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Let’s dig in before everything gets cold, otherwise it would almost be a culinary crime!

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Look at this plate of tagliatelle, just the smell is making me hungry!

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: It's true, they look amazing... But my four-cheese pizza is literally melting, this is going to be good.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: If you want to swap a forkful, I'm in, it'll make this meal even more colorful!

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Great idea! Take a piece, and I'll grab some of your tagliatelle too.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: [yum-yum], this pizza is just incredible, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Looks like we really made the right call coming here today!

meaning: Groupe de langues d'Asie du sud-est.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: While flipping through this guide on Asian culture, I found a map so colorful it looks like a real linguistic patchwork!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, every time I read travelers' stories about Asia, they always mention incredibly different languages within just a few kilometers.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Can you imagine having to switch languages from one village to the next? It must be confusing, but fascinating at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, it makes me want to learn a few words just to travel differently, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, while checking out the map, I noticed an area called [meow]; it caught my attention right away!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that term pops up a lot in specialized books, and you see it in all sorts of different contexts too.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Every trip to Southeast Asia makes me want to understand their languages. Don't you find that intriguing?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Just walking down the street, you already hear an incredible variety of accents.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Yes, and sometimes it sounds completely different from one city to another. I wonder how they manage to understand each other.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It seems like they do it naturally, probably because some languages share common roots or borrowings.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: There must be some typical sounds that come up often in the region, right?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Actually, the other day at a market, there was a group who kept saying "[meow]" while talking—it really sounded like the identity of an entire region.

meaning: bruit du cri du chat.
bruit du sifflement d'un obus, d'une grenade, d'une balle.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Listen to that, just behind the door… [meow]! He's at it again, you know what that means.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Ah, this must be his favorite time of day, it seems. He never misses a chance, that rascal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: He quickly figured out where the treats are, that's for sure. A real little alarm on legs!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Let me know next time he decides to be a singer, I love those moments.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Remember the time, it's like this almost every evening. It really livens up the house!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: I'll bring some treats next time, just to stay on his good side!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Did you catch that '[meow]' coming from the kitchen? He really knows how to pick his moment.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He definitely knows when to put on his show! Maybe he's waiting for the kibble festival?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Usually, it never fails: he's got a clock in his belly.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I wonder if, at this rate, he'll end up announcing human mealtimes too!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: With his sense of timing, he could start his own personalized alarm service.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We should patent his system—it would be a hit with morning people.

meaning: bruit du cri du chat.
bruit du sifflement d'un obus, d'une grenade, d'une balle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Paul, come look under the table, your cat is staring at me weirdly.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, he does that when he's waiting for something, probably some kibble.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, if I shake the packet, he immediately goes: "[meow]!" He can never resist.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It's crazy how he recognizes the sound, he's faster than an alarm.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And then he sits there all proud, like he orchestrated the whole thing.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With him, every meal turns into a show, we never get bored!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Something just moved behind the living room door, I’m sure of it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I knew it, that little whirlwind never stops…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With the cushions knocked over and the plants shaken up, there’s never a dull moment here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And to think you wanted a calm pet… Come on, let’s take a look.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Caught! He’s trying to sneak ever so quietly under the table.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And now, the star’s sound performance… [meow].

meaning: pour inviter à manger; pour exprimer le désir ou le fait de manger.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's rumbling a bit over here, I think my stomach is asking for some attention!

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: I get you, my morning left me hungry too. Do you have something in mind?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If you want, we can grab a [nom nom] together, I spotted a nice place just downstairs.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds great! Discovering a new spot with you is perfect.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Get ready, I heard their dish of the day is really worth it.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: I'm coming right away, my taste buds are already celebrating!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: All I’ve had today is a coffee... My stomach is already growling.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Same here, the morning wore me out, I feel like we could devour the whole bakery downstairs.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Team up? I’m suggesting savory tarts, unless you’re in the mood for something sweet?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: [yum yum], savory tarts, they’re impossible to resist!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Got it, let’s hurry before there’s nothing left on the counter!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: I can already smell the delicious aroma at the bottom of the stairs, there’s no mystery where we’re headed.

meaning: marque une appréciation gustative favorable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look what I just took out of the oven—do you feel like digging in with your fork?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's impossible to resist this chocolatey temptation filling the whole place with its aroma!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful, it also hides some caramel bits for extra crunch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm digging in right away, your description is making me crave it even more!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, give me your foodie verdict—I want to know everything about that first bite.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [nom nom]... the texture, the taste, it's all there—you really nailed it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here you go, I made my famous gratin dauphinois for tonight. You’ll have to tell me what you think!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Just looking at that golden crust, it looks promising. I’m digging in right away!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: [nom nom], you really have a secret for seasoning, admit it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe I do... but I can see you like it, so mission accomplished.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: With such a success, you’ll have to make it for me more often.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Deal, but next time, you’re making dessert!

meaning: bruit du sifflement d'un obus, d'une grenade, d'une balle.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Look, as soon as I lifted my head, I heard, like... [whoosh]... flying through the air right next to me, I got a real scare.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: Oh man, you couldn't make that up! Did it freeze you on the spot or were you able to move?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: I swear, you don't even think, everything just happens on autopilot, it's such a weird feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: No kidding, it reminds me of the time I almost slipped running down the ravine during the night recon.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Yeah, except here every little detail grabs all your attention, you basically turn into a walking radar.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: For sure, nothing like a quiet Sunday at home, huh!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: That smell of damp earth reminds me of our hours in the rain, crouched down, counting the seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Impossible to forget, especially when the mist floats by—it almost looks like it's still hiding shadows in the distance.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: My heart still races when lightning splits the sky, as if everything is about to start all over again.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Nerves tense, eyes fixed ahead, every crack sends me years back.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: And that night, just before the ground shook, you shouted something—I remember.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: I warned you in time… there was that strange [meow] in the air, fleeting but impossible to ignore.

meaning: marque une appréciation gustative favorable.
marque une appréciation olfactive favorable.
marque une appréciation gustative et olfactive favorable.
en contexte métaphorique, marque une expression de satisfaction.
sons indistincts émis par une personne qui est dans l'impossibilité d'ouvrir la bouche.
bruit de grognement d'une personne mal réveillée.
bruit de marmonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look what I just took out of the oven! Do you want a slice of apple pie?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [mmm], this puff pastry is amazing and the apples are caramelized just right.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's my grandmother's recipe, I knew you'd like it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: She really has the touch, you can tell there's real skill in this.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Plus, I added a hint of cinnamon this time, a little nod to your preferences.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You're spoiling me, this is everything I love in a homemade pie!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at this berry cheesecake, it’s my first try!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, did you use fresh raspberries? It looks amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Yes, and there’s also a hint of lemon. Go ahead, grab a spoon!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With that color, it’s impossible to resist. I’m tasting it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [mmm]… this creamy texture and the tartness, it’s a success!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Your verdict makes me smile from ear to ear, it was worth putting in the effort!

meaning: Symbole chimique du manganèse.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If we manage to get through this table, I'll buy croissants tomorrow!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Deal! Your turn, hit me with a tough one about the elements.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Okay, what's the atomic number of the one right after chromium?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Let me think... 24 for chromium... right after... uh, it's not iron, but I'm stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, it always goes [hmm] when we hum through the elements on the table, right between chromium and iron. That helps you remember!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I get it! Perfect, let's keep going—make it harder if you want your croissant!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Paul, don’t you think learning these chemical symbols is a real headache?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Yeah, honestly, especially when you mix them all up!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, want to play a game? I’ll say one, you give me the symbol.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Go ahead, give it a shot!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Okay, which one has the symbol [mn]?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Manganese! This time, I didn’t get it wrong.

meaning: bruit de marmonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Are you planning to break the world record for sleeping in, Maxime?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I'd rather not be famous for that, but right now, I'm not moving an inch.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Look at the time, it's already daylight! Even the cat finished its nap.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: The cat doesn't have any obligations. My comforter is the only meeting I'm accepting this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: If you don't get up now, I'm bringing the coffee maker into the bedroom, watch out!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: [mrmph]... [mrmph]... yeah, yeah... [mrmph]...

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You've flipped your notebook three times in five minutes—are you looking for a secret code or something?

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's easier to find treasure than to get this chapter.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Come on, try me—I might have the clue that saves the day.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: I'm stuck everywhere... the dates, the names, everything's getting mixed up—you know the drill.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [ugh]... another page turning into gibberish, [ugh]...

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Don't panic, it's just the study effect—we'll tame all this with two brains.

meaning: marque une appréciation gustative favorable.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Mmm, [yum yum]! This cherry clafoutis is absolutely wonderful, you really outdid yourself today!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I'm glad you like it, I was a bit worried it would be too sour because of the cherries.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Not at all, the balance is perfect, honestly you should make it more often!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I followed my grandmother's old recipe, maybe that's the secret.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You really have to show me how you make it, one of these days.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I'd love to, and next time, we can try it with apricots!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look what I just took out of the oven—my grandmother's apple pie! It fills the whole kitchen with its aroma.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Just the smell is making me hungry. Are you cutting a slice right away?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Grab a plate, the crust is still hot, watch your fingers!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Wow, the apple just melts in your mouth... You really have a family secret here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: When I hear feedback like that, it's simple: [yum yum], I feel like I'm a kid again too!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Keep treating your friends like this and we'll end up hanging out in your kitchen every Sunday.

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The deck chair, the sun... all that's missing is a book to complete the picture.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: If we're lucky, we'll get the playlist of next door's noises too—remember last time?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Impossible to forget, considering how it turned into an impromptu concert, especially around six o'clock...

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: I admit, it really set the mood! But today, it's pretty much radio silence so far.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, wait... [meowww]! Did you hear that? There it is, the star is making their entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: We couldn't have dreamed of a better soundtrack. He always picks the perfect moment, that famous four-legged neighbor.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's crazy how the street looks so different once night falls, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, and with this fog, everything seems even more mysterious. I bet something's going to jump out from a bush.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen... [meowww]! It's coming from right behind the hedge, did you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I jumped! It really seems like he loves surprising passersby tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's like he's watching over the neighborhood in his own way, with custom sound effects.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Now we know who deserves the title of the most original guardian around here!

meaning: bruit de miaulement du chat, notamment du chat en chaleur.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Impossible to get any sleep with all the commotion at home last night.

dialogue.speaker: Yassir
dialogue.text: Was it your little wildcat making another surprise return to the couch?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If only it were just that... But this time, he started going "[meowr], [meowr]" behind the door, like he was calling to the moon!

dialogue.speaker: Yassir
dialogue.text: I can picture it—it must have felt like you were in the middle of the jungle.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Now my head feels fuzzy; I’m dreaming of a night without a performance worthy of a feline opera.

dialogue.speaker: Yassir
dialogue.text: At this rate, you could almost sell tickets for the next nighttime show!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, last night I thought I was going crazy with that endless [meowww]!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh no, is the cat acting up again?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, Charly wandered all over the apartment, I couldn't get a wink of sleep.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That must be exhausting after a while. Didn't you try to calm him down a bit?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Of course, I petted him, gave him some treats, but nothing worked.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Maybe you'll have to invest in some earplugs if this keeps up!

meaning: bruit de miaulement du chat, notamment du chat en chaleur.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Looks like your Félix is putting on an impromptu concert—he's really setting the mood tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: He decided this living room is his main stage; there's no stopping him once he gets going.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: His somersaults, those wide eyes... He's going to end up dragging everyone into his madness.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Wait, that's nothing compared to what he does at three in the morning—he thinks he's a real orchestra conductor.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With those "[mrrrow]" sounds, even the walls must be shaking!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: And still, you didn't see last night... I thought he was going to set off the burglar alarm!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wow, last night I almost thought Luna had invited all the neighborhood cats into the living room.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, tell me about it! I thought the door opened onto a jungle, there was so much commotion everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: She kept going back and forth like she was waiting for someone important.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And that little show in front of the window—it looked like a real late-night performance.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: By the way, at one point, she turned to me and let out a big ‘[meowww]’ that made the whole room vibrate.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Honestly, if she keeps this up, I'm going to have to sleep with earplugs!

meaning: bruit de miaulement du chat, notamment du chat en chaleur.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Last night, I just couldn't get any sleep with all that racket under my window.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The same nighttime troublemakers again? Did you manage to see anything?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Barely, but there were shadows zigzagging near the bushes.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let me guess, they were circling around the cherry tree?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, and suddenly I heard this loud '[meow]' that echoed across the whole garden.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wow, they really stop at nothing to make themselves known, those neighborhood performers!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, it’s been building up outside for a while now, can you hear all that racket too?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s impossible to concentrate, honestly. It’s like a choir has set up in our alley.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I checked, there’s no one outside, just that shadow darting by and disappearing under the car.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Did you notice that persistent "[meow]" every time it circles the lamppost? It echoes so strangely on the pavement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With all this commotion, the neighbors are going to end up thinking we’re running a zoo in here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet it’ll camp out on our steps all night, loyal as ever.

meaning: bruit de miaulement du chat, notamment du chat en chaleur.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you hear that strange '[mrrrow]' coming from the bedroom? Sounds like Chacha is putting on a show again.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, she's been getting really expressive lately.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's always the same circus every evening, she just won't stop.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: I bet she's just trying to get your attention for some petting.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Or maybe to steal another piece of ham from the fridge, who knows!

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: With Chacha, anything's possible, I wouldn't even be surprised anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Camille, put that book down for a second, did you hear that strange thing coming from the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, let me listen. Isn't it just the fridge acting up again?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: No, listen closely... it goes "[meowrring], [meowrring]" right behind the door, don't you think that's odd?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, now that you mention it, there really is something unusual.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I bet we're about to see something funny when we open it.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Get ready, there are always surprises in our house anyway!

meaning: marque une appréciation gustative favorable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Last night, I made homemade cookies. Do you want to try some?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh yes, [yum yum], they smell amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: So, what do you think? I added a bit of hazelnut this time.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Honestly, that's a great idea—it adds some crunch.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm glad you like it. I was worried it might be too sweet.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Not at all, it's perfectly balanced!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I just took the apricot tart out of the oven—can you smell how it fills the kitchen?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Just looking at it, my mouth is already watering! Give me a slice, quick.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Here, taste this... [yum yum], the crust is perfectly crispy!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, you're making me want some with your reaction—hold on, let me try.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I think you'll want to make this one again and again.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With a taste like this, I'll volunteer every time!

meaning: bruit du cri du chat.
bruit du sifflement d'un obus, d'une grenade, d'une balle.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Paul, did you knock over a cushion again while looking for your keys?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It wasn't me this time, I'm betting it was Oscar's claws...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, that [meow] is coming straight from under the table, I bet he's up to no good.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With him, anything's possible, especially when it comes to settling where he shouldn't.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We should hide the cookies, otherwise he'll end up eating them all!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Good idea, he's way too clever for his own good, that one!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [meow]... There goes Felix starting his little act under the table again.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He really has a knack for picking his moments—right when we start cooking.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And you know what? He knocked over the bag of kibble just before you came in.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That one’s a real whiskered tornado!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If only he cleaned up as well as he makes a mess...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With him in the house, it’s impossible to get bored, that’s for sure!

meaning: marque une appréciation gustative favorable.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, I made some crepes for snack time. Do you want to have one?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, they smell so good! Did you make them yourself?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yes, I followed my grandmother’s recipe… [yum yum], you’ll see how soft they are!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I can’t wait to try one, I can already tell it’s going to be delicious.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here, have one while it’s still warm.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Thank you so much, you always know how to make me happy!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I warned you, the flan from this bakery has a reputation for winning over even the most skeptical.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh wow, [yum yum], this melt-in-your-mouth texture is almost unreal!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Admit it, you didn't expect to find such a treasure around the corner of a little street.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, it's definitely worth a few detours in the neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The secret is the touch of vanilla, but shh, that's just between us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: From one foodie to another, I'll keep that tucked away safely.

meaning: pour exprimer une incrédulité, une réticence, un refus, une mise en garde; pour couper la parole à quelqu'un.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you ask me, we could push the file to Monday. I have a feeling no one will be focused tomorrow with the game.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Everyone would like that, but don't you think it might delay the next steps?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [sigh], it's not like we're going to save the world in one evening, honestly!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, but the boss really wants to move forward, you know how she is.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, if I could just hide behind a screen tomorrow, I'd sign up right away.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Okay, let's give it a shot, but you're taking the heat if people complain in the office, alright?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You know what? Tonight, let's try that new Japanese restaurant in the little alley behind the library.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The one no one talks about, with the half-hidden door? Aren't you worried it might be a bit sketchy?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: That's exactly why—it must be a secret spot. Plus, that's often where you find the best stuff!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [hmm], honestly, this sounds like a recipe for trouble... What if we end up with a menu with no pictures and weird dishes?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: That's the adventure! We order at random and discover new things—it makes memories.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If we end up with a bowl of pickled jellyfish, I'll remind you whose idea this was, okay?

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: What a restless night, my whole book lost its thread because of those noises outside!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Me too, I jumped when it went '[whoo, whoo]' right under my window!
