dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It seems like the neighborhood animals decided to have a noise contest.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If only we could offer them a nighttime truce…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Can you imagine a sign: 'Please keep quiet after midnight' just for them?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That would be quite a challenge, but at least we'd have tried!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice the racket coming from the alley?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Impossible not to hear it, it echoed all the way into the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I bet something has bothered old Medor again.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Probably... earlier, there was a big "[woof] [woof]" so loud I spilled my glass of water.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ha! Even the walls must have shaken with that racket.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Between Medor and the rain that's coming, tonight's not going to be restful!

meaning: bruit de rire.
bruit d'une personne qui pleure.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: This story is going to make you roll your eyes: I tried to impress my coworkers with my cooking skills, and the result was the cake ended up on the floor before it even reached the table.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh no, not the infamous slippery Monday morning cake! Do you think they thought it was a style choice?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Style choice, I’m not sure, but the floor loved the frosting. Half the team came to see, but no one dared to taste it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: At least you managed to create a real gathering without warning anyone—that’s already quite an achievement!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I’m thinking of renaming the recipe 'disaster tart' next time, just to really own it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [haha], with a name like that, I’m definitely signing up for the next snack time!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: So Chloé, do you remember the village costume contest? The photo resurfaced today!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Oh wow, the giant banana costume—I thought I was going to choke, it was so hot in there!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You should have seen your face when the wind almost blew you away in the square… it was quite a show!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: You weren’t bad either, the pirate with the cardboard sword that broke during your very first heroic pose.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Admit it, you wish you still had that felt hat—honestly, you were the life of the party all by yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: [ha ha], just thinking about it sends me right back into a fit of laughter! We were unstoppable back then.

meaning: bruit d'une personne qui pleure, qui sanglote.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Jules, are you brooding over something by any chance? It looks like you're carrying a gray cloud over your head.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: If only I could talk about all this as easily as you solve a Rubik's Cube... it's more complicated.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I admit… it just hit me all at once… [whimper]… (curls up a bit, pulling her knees in)

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Hey, come settle in over here, you deserve a break with no questions or judgment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just having you here helps me more than you think.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I'm not abandoning ship—we'll row together.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, your smile has disappeared, hasn’t it? What’s bothering you like that?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It’s nothing major, but I’ve got this knot in my stomach that just won’t go away.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know me, you can tell me anything. I promise I won’t play therapist!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I had another argument with my brother… I feel like nothing’s getting better at home.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s tough… but you’re not alone, you know? I’m here.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: And now, I just can’t help it… [sob]… [sob]…

meaning: bruit d'un cri étranglé.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I hope you're walking fast today, the sky is starting to look really scary with those clouds.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I'm right behind you, but stop looking up! Watch where you're stepping instead.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: What if it suddenly started pouring rain? We'd end up soaked, I'm sure of it.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: We can just run under that porch if it starts coming down. See, I've got it all planned!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Watch out in front of you, Marc! There's a huge branch on the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: [oof]... That was close, I almost wiped out in front of the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Careful, Marc, you just brushed the vase with your elbow!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got everything under control, I'm just making a bit of space.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No, wait, the cord behind you... [oof]!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Ah shoot, I tripped over it!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Are you okay? Nothing broken except your pride?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Just a bit shaken, thanks. Next time, I'll listen to your advice!

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: What a strange atmosphere outside tonight, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I know, I thought I saw a shadow near the gate, it startled me!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It must be something that caught Mélo's attention, he's been pacing around for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Do you think he spotted a hedgehog or is it just his wild imagination again?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No, but listen to him now, here we go again with a festival of [woof] [woof] behind the hedge!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: With him, our evenings are anything but quiet, it's impossible to go unnoticed…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The wind is cooler than I thought it would be today, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, they’re forecasting rain for tonight, I wouldn’t be surprised if we get caught in a shower on the way home.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, just behind the fence… [woof] [woof], it echoes every time we walk past that house!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Looks like we can’t hide anything from him, this spot must be his favorite territory.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: For sure, he’s got an eye—or rather, a sharp ear!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good thing he’s not the type to jump over the fence, I would’ve leapt out of my skin!

meaning: aboiement d'un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Last night, when I got home, I went "[boo], [boo]!" right in front of the door and Lucas jumped on the couch, he really wasn’t expecting it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, you caught me off guard, I admit I didn’t see it coming.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I couldn’t help myself, I just had to give you a little scare, you looked so focused on your video game.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The worst part is, I was in the middle of a crucial match, you can imagine the panic!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll warn you… or maybe not! You never know when inspiration will strike me again.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I feel like I’ll have to keep watch at home from now on, just to survive!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Another strange racket in the garden, he really can't sit still tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ever since he spotted the mailman earlier, it's been a show—there's no stopping him!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And now, listen, you can clearly hear: [woof] [woof]! It's like he's warming up for a contest.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: He'll end up thinking the whole neighborhood is here to cheer him on, that champion of noise.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet he's posted himself behind the hedge again, all proud of himself.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Let's go see this conductor before he starts a standing ovation!

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Justine, did you hear that weird "[eww]" coming from the garden over there? It gave me a little chill, didn’t it do the same to you?

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: Totally! It sounds like something out of an adventure movie, I never get used to it.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Every time we walk past this house, something strange always happens…

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: Honestly, one of these days we should almost take a peek behind the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Oh, you want to play explorer, huh? I’ll keep an eye on you if you try it.

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: Anyway, with you I know there will always be a story to tell on the way back!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That racket outside again, I thought we’d have a quiet evening!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I jumped on the couch, I admit… It echoed all the way into the hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I almost spilled my tea, that’s how bad it was. Sounds like it’s coming from the backyard.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you think it’s that old gate getting stuck in the wind again?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: No, look out the window: it’s the neighbor’s dog jumping all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen to him… [woof], [woof], it’s like he wants to join the conversation!

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.
bruit de bateau à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: If you had seen the chaos in front of the bakery this morning, you would have burst out laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Was it another story about a stolen snack, or did you run into your favorite four-legged friend?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Guess what, Biscotte was there, watching everyone who came out with a baguette.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: He must have done his famous act, right?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Absolutely! He slipped between people's legs and suddenly, [woof], [woof], the whole crowd jumped.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With him, it's impossible to go unnoticed—that's exactly what I love about this neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Impossible to listen to my podcast this morning, there was so much commotion in the park.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, you were at Lafontaine Park? There's always something happening over there.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, and right next to the maple bench, kids were playing and running around everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet the dogs were having their share of excitement with all that activity.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, just as a ball rolled near a huge labrador, he let out a very loud [woof], and everyone turned their heads.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: To think some people complained that nothing ever happened around here!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Guess where I spent all of last evening, without being able to stop for even a second!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: Wait, are you kidding me? It must have been an amazing place!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I swear, I just couldn't tear myself away! I discovered a pottery workshop in the neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: That's awesome! So, did you manage to handle the clay?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe it, I actually managed to shape a vase that really looks like something!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: [wow], you amaze me, Nadia! I'd love to see the result in person.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you know what happened this weekend at the park? I still can’t believe it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, you’ve got me curious! Tell me everything, I’m intrigued.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I ran into Léa with a marching band, and suddenly they invited me up on stage in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously? And you said yes?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, and then, [wow], the band started playing my favorite song while the whole audience applauded!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You had a truly magical moment, that’s incredible!

meaning: bruit de gros rire.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’ll never believe what I saw when I came out of the metro this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: Tell me, this neighborhood is always full of surprises, I’m ready for the story of the century!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Picture a guy in a three-piece suit, being chased by a flock of hungry pigeons…

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: Wait, stop! Was he really running? With the pigeons right behind him?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear! He was desperately trying to save his sandwich, it was like a movie scene.

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: Just picturing it, [honk honk], I’m about to fall off my chair!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hey, Leo, do you remember when I mistook the cake decorations for modeling clay?

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: Of course! I was wondering what you were up to in the kitchen—there was flour even on your shirt.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: The worst part is, I proudly served my creation to everyone, convinced I’d made a culinary masterpiece.

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: I think no one dared tell you it tasted weird… We were all giving each other side glances!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: But when I saw cousin Pauline trying to discreetly spit it out under the table… [pfft pfft], I was cracking up!

dialogue.speaker: Leo
dialogue.text: Honestly, it was unforgettable—we’re all waiting for your next culinary stroke of genius!

meaning: marque soit un mépris goguenard, soit le recule que l'on entend prendre par rapport à ce q'on observe ou à ce qui vient d'être dit.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Tell me, did you see Luc's latest find at the office? He installed an app that's supposed to revolutionize everything, but it glitches as soon as you press a button.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: [woof], honestly, with his big announcements, we should've expected this kind of crash…

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: At this rate, he'll end up making us miss good old pen and paper.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: And to think he's still strutting around as if everything's working perfectly.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I have a feeling we're not done laughing behind his back about this circus.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: As long as he doesn't turn into a magician, we'll keep our little jokes!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [woof], did you see how Marc is getting all worked up again over the famous 'innovative plan'?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, he's clinging to it like no one has already tried it three times.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's crazy, every time we end up redoing everything at the last minute.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He must be the only one who still believes it could work.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Or maybe he just likes living dangerously.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: In that case, he's going to have us running around again, that's for sure.

meaning: marque la nausée physique.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you remember the seafood platter from Saturday? I think some of those shellfish were really suspicious...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, don’t remind me, just the thought makes me go [yuck]... I almost spit out my bite.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That bad? But you seemed to really like it at first…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At first, yes, but then the texture—suddenly, I just couldn’t... It stuck in my mind for a long time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Promise, next time we’ll go for pasta—nothing slimy or weird.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Great idea, I’m all for it, and so is my stomach!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I thought my plate was going to run away on its own when I saw the main course yesterday…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You mean that thing with the shiny sauce?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Exactly, and that’s not all, there was a lingering smell that reminded me of low tide.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh man, even from far away it stung my nose a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: When I stuck my fork in it, I felt a rubbery texture… I closed the tray right away.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Just hearing you describe it, [eww], I’ve got goosebumps!

meaning: Interjection exprimant le soulagement.

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Can you believe it, it took me all night to finish that report, my eyes were shot this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh no, did you manage to send it before the deadline after all?

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: I was convinced I'd be missing a section, and on top of that my computer started lagging at the worst possible moment.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, guess what—Isabelle just said in the meeting that your file arrived right on time and was super thorough.

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: [phew], I think my heart is beating normally again!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Congrats, champ, now you can think about something other than Excel sheets!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I swear, my heart was racing a mile a minute when I heard the fire alarm in the building.

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: Oh man, it must have been total chaos, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Totally, everyone was rushing to get out and the stairs were packed.

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: So, did anything actually happen, or was it just a false alarm?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Luckily it was nothing serious, just a finicky detector... [phew], I thought it was going to be way worse.

dialogue.speaker: Yannis
dialogue.text: Wow, you really had quite a scare, that explains why you're still so shaken up!

meaning: Exclamation exprimant la douleur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I tried to hang up a picture frame this morning, and it didn’t go as planned.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You ended up in one of your DIY adventures again, huh? Tell me about it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I pressed a bit too hard and the nail slipped out of my hand… my finger won’t forget it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [ouch], just imagining it makes my finger hurt too!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I think DIY hates me—it’s getting personal at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, leave the hammer alone and go for adhesive putty—it saves fingers!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you saw the step I missed going down the stairs, it's a miracle I'm still standing.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [ow!] Just hearing about it, my knees are already protesting for you.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I thought I was going to catch myself, but nope, it was too late…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Are you entering balance competitions without warning now?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Apparently, I still need more training to reach expert level.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, think about wearing a helmet—you never know!

meaning: Onomatopée exprimant un bruit de pleur, de sanglot.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: This sounds like a real mess—did you have another crazy adventure?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I swear, I spilled my coffee all over my file right before the meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: The famous Monday morning bad luck—you’re breaking records!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That, and my computer crashed at the worst possible moment… it’s a real circus.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [wahh], life just keeps piling it on, you get what I mean?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: If you keep this up, I’ll have to give you the trophy of the year—special tough luck edition!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's one of those days where even my cat avoids me, you get the picture...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oof, sounds rough, do you want to get it off your chest?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I messed everything up at work and got into a fender bender on the way home... the full package.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: So how do you even stay on your feet after all that?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, right now, I think I'm just going to... [sob]... it just comes out, I can't fight it anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Breathe, I'll get you some ice cream and we'll watch something silly together, okay?

meaning: bruit cinglant ou sifflant d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, if you beat your record today, drinks are on me afterwards!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Deal, but watch out, I’ve sharpened my shot since last time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Show me what you’ve got, I have a feeling you’re going to surprise me.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Get ready to count the points, I’m not going to hold back.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: *Looks at the impact* [whizz]! Not bad, that one—right near the center.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Told you, there are going to be a lot of accurate shots today!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Check out this bottle—bet I can hit it on the first try with the slingshot?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, acting all cocky! Show me if you can really handle the aim this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Eyes open, now’s not the time to blink!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Go on, it looks like your reputation’s on the line with this shot.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [whoosh]... Did you see it fly? I think there’s no suspense left now.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I admit, you impressed me there—it went straight to the target!

meaning: pour marquer la douleur.
pour marquer une situation fâcheuse, une surprise désabréable, une contrariété.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think this old shelf would hold if I put a few more books on it?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Uh, it's already creaking a lot... go easy or it'll fall on your feet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, [ow]! I just banged my knee against the corner of the drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ouch, that caught you off guard, huh? This piece of furniture attacks without warning!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Totally, it's getting revenge because I keep adding more novels to it.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, don't move, I'll get a protective cushion before you lose your leg to it!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It had to happen to me—I banged my knee against the corner of the table while looking for my phone.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: No way, another accident like that? Is it the same knee as last time?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yes, always the same one. I feel like it attracts trouble every time I rush.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [ow], just thinking about it gives me chills! Did you at least manage to stop the impact?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Luckily, I put a cushion on it right away—it would have been worse otherwise.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Maybe you should think about installing corner protectors at your place, don’t you think?

meaning: Interjection qui exprime un bruit de chute, de coup.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You won't believe it, I reached out to grab this book, and then, [wham], it literally fell on my head.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ouch, that must have hurt! At least you didn’t break anything, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No, just a bit surprised! The worst part is, everything started falling like dominoes after that.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, there were other things that started falling too?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, the pen, the papers… everything ended up on the floor, it was a real disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, next time, I’ll come help you tidy up before you end up buried in an avalanche!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know what? While trying to grab the cereal bowl from the top of the cupboard, my hand slipped and [wham], everything fell onto the counter!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's exactly the kind of thing that only happens at the worst possible moment, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, just when I was already late for work.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can just picture the mad dash to pick up all the cereal rolling everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I almost slipped on a puddle of milk too—it was the full package.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The kitchen turned into a mini ice rink—what a way to start the day!

meaning: bruit d'un coup de feu.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: We could hardly have picked a calmer day—look at that sun shining through the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? [bang]! It went off all of a sudden just behind the hill.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: That stopped me in my tracks—I really wasn’t expecting that… Maybe it’s some kind of farm equipment?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Could be, or maybe an old tractor acting up nearby.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Between nature and these mysterious noises, there’s never a dull moment here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: As long as it doesn’t interrupt our picnic, I bet everything will be just fine.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Didn't you jump too when that noise burst out in the woods?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, I almost dropped my bag, seriously. It came from right behind the barn, didn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly where we saw tracks this morning. Maybe a deer got scared.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Weird, it was too sharp to be just an animal…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With the season, do you think a hunter showed up without warning?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it snapped all of a sudden, like "[bang]" right in the middle of the silence!

meaning: bruit soudain, bref, plus ou moins intense, produit notamment par un choc, une détonation, une explosion.
sons produits par un instrument de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You know, it was while I was trying to put up that shelf that something went totally wrong — [bam]! — I thought everything was going to fall.

dialogue.speaker: Mohamed
dialogue.text: I bet your face was priceless at that moment!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, I jumped on the spot, I thought the wall was going to collapse!

dialogue.speaker: Mohamed
dialogue.text: Quite an adventure for a simple shelf, you never do things halfway, do you.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Guess what, I’m never touching the drill again without supervising the whole scene.

dialogue.speaker: Mohamed
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll bring popcorn to watch the show, promise!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hey, were you asleep when the whole building started shaking last night?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: No way I could get any sleep after all that racket, even my cat dashed under the couch!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The vase on my dresser almost fell over, I thought it was an earthquake.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: My upstairs neighbor turned on all the lights, she was walking around like nothing happened.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Honestly, I jumped so hard I dropped my book.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I wish I could have recorded that moment: everything was quiet and then suddenly, [bam], nobody dared to move.

meaning: bruit produit par un coup, une chute, un détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yesterday, I thought the tablet was going to end up flying with how fast you were tapping on the screen!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Maybe I should have slowed down, but we were almost at the end of the level—the pressure was huge!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: So today, we're going all the way. I even ate cold pizza to keep going.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Perfect, get ready not to blink—this is where it all happens.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh no, the creature's coming, right, right!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And then... [wham]! I forgot about that trap, it always hits at the worst moment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you hear that strange noise again in the hallway last night?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Yeah, all of a sudden, there was a [bang] that echoed on the door, I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, this building has surprises for us every week.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I still wonder if it's a neighbor or maybe those old radiators...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Or a mischievous spirit having fun scaring us every night!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Honestly, I'm tempted to set up a camera to solve this mystery.

meaning: bruit de l'avertisseur à deux tons des véhicules d'urgence: pompiers, police, ambulances.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Did you feel that shaking in the shop window? It was almost like a mini-earthquake just now!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Totally, it made me jump! I almost spilled my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Every time I feel that, I always picture a big truck barreling through.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Yeah, or maybe it’s the Saturday van making a show as it goes by!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wait, the light is flickering on the walls, look!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I can clearly hear: [thump-thump], [thump-thump]... You never get bored on this avenue, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: One more minute watching the bikes go by—it's like a real choreography.

dialogue.speaker: Said
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, on this square, we could write an entire novel just from what we see every day.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: And that ice cream truck over there is almost more popular than the corner café.

dialogue.speaker: Said
dialogue.text: But when it comes to atmosphere, nothing beats this intersection: surprises guaranteed at every moment.

dialogue.speaker: Clemence
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that thing coming up so fast?

dialogue.speaker: Said
dialogue.text: Whoa, it's going [vroom vroom], [vroom vroom]... It puts everyone on edge all of a sudden!

meaning: bruit de l'avertisseur à deux tons des véhicules d'urgence: pompiers, police, ambulances.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see all that commotion in the street? That was something else!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With all those cars stuck, I thought they were shooting a movie!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And in the middle of it all, there was that [thump thump] [thump thump] echoing between the buildings.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It made everyone perk up their ears—even the neighbor’s cat jumped in fright.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I wonder if they sorted it out quickly, because people were running everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With that kind of hustle and bustle, you can tell the city never sleeps, huh!

dialogue.speaker: Charlotte
dialogue.text: The line of cars this morning really made me feel like I was stuck in a never-ending traffic jam, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Oh, totally! I even saw several drivers weaving in and out just to gain a few extra meters.

dialogue.speaker: Charlotte
dialogue.text: Right in the middle of all that chaos, a vehicle suddenly appeared, cutting through everyone. It was almost unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, the ‘[honk honk] [honk honk]’ sent everyone into panic mode! It looked like a messy ballet on the asphalt.

dialogue.speaker: Charlotte
dialogue.text: I almost spilled my coffee on the dashboard, it startled me so much.

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: It’s in moments like that you realize the city is never really quiet, huh!

meaning: bruit d'une chute, d'un coup soudain.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I really need to stop piling everything onto this shelf, it's getting risky.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You know, I've already had some acrobatic surprises with mine—it's a real challenge every time I look for a book.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah! Here we go again... [crash]! Looks like a binder didn't like staying balanced.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Perfect timing, we couldn't have illustrated the problem any better!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, at least it reminds me that it's really time to sort all this out.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If tidying up turns into an adventure, let me know—I'll bring a helmet next time!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: So, Thomas, are you still blindly organizing your stuff or do you actually want to find your key in that pile of papers?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait... [crash!] There, just as I feared, everything just collapsed behind me.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I knew that stack wouldn't survive your method, it was inevitable!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It's a chaos-sorting technique, you just wouldn't understand.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: An unstoppable technique, I admit, but if it ever digs up your key, coffee's on me!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, better get the coffee maker ready—things might get shaken up around here again.

meaning: bruit produit par un tambour, une grosse caisse.
bruit produit par les sabots d'un cheval.
sons produits par le tambourin.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, it's starting again! The musicians are passing under our windows like every year.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I recognize the sound of the brass... the neighbor across the street is already out on the balcony filming.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: This is the moment when you feel the vibrations all the way down to your shoes, especially when they arrive in front of the building.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Exactly! The shutters shake every time they pass by, it's quite a show!

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Last time, you laughed so much you started dancing in the living room. Would you dare do it again?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watch out, here we go again... [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat]! And there go the neighbors at the window!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Look, Leon, did you see how the whole ground shakes with every [thump-thump]? You can almost feel the music in your feet!

dialogue.speaker: Leon
dialogue.text: Amazing, right? Even from far away, it's impossible to stand still with that kind of energy running through the square.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: It really makes me want to push through the crowd and see exactly where it's coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Leon
dialogue.text: Yeah, and it looks like everyone is getting swept up in it—some people are even making up little dance steps.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Honestly, it creates such an amazing vibe, even the kids are bouncing around everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Leon
dialogue.text: It's the kind of night where you leave with the melody still stuck in your head—I love that.

meaning: bruit produit par un tambour, une grosse caisse.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You should have seen the parade this morning, the whole neighborhood was buzzing, it was crazy!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Oh no, I missed it? With all those musicians?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, the brass and especially the percussionists really set the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: At one point, it went "[boom boom] [boom boom]" all down the street, even the windows were shaking!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to learn to play, just to feel that from the inside.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: If you go for it, I want to be the first to cheer you on from the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at this crowd! It’s like the whole neighborhood is here for the parade.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: No kidding, you can already feel the excitement building with all these musicians setting up.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And to think last year, we ended up in the crepe line right when the parade passed by!

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, this time we’re not missing a thing—I want the best view of the flying stage.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Listen, it’s starting… [boom-boom], [boom-boom], you can feel it vibrating right under our feet!

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: These moments always give me chills, when everything echoes all around us.

meaning: bruit produit par un tambour, une grosse caisse.
bruit produit par les sabots d'un cheval.
sons produits par le tambourin.

dialogue.speaker: Eloise
dialogue.text: Look, it seems like something's happening in the square—did you hear that rhythm in the distance?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it goes [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat], like the city swallowed a bit of madness tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Eloise
dialogue.text: It instantly creates a different atmosphere—you can almost feel the ground vibrating.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: All that's missing is some confetti, and we'd be right in the middle of a parade!

dialogue.speaker: Eloise
dialogue.text: If only I'd kept my old eccentric hat for the occasion…

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Hat or no hat, it seems like the party is coming right to our window tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Did you see all those decorations in the square? You can really feel that the party is about to start.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, and I spotted some drums—they were setting up right next to the bandstand. It promises a great atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: When I walked by, I heard that famous rhythm: [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat], it echoed all down the street.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, that little beat always makes me smile—it reminds me of the festivals from my childhood.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Do you think we'll dare to dance in front of everyone this year?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe! If the rhythm sweeps me up, I won't be able to resist.

meaning: bruit produit par un tambour, une grosse caisse.
bruit produit par les sabots d'un cheval.
sons produits par le tambourin.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Incredible, look at this crowd in front of the stage—we haven't seen the place this packed in ages!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: But did you notice how everyone moves closer as soon as they set up the percussion?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's definitely the main attraction—even the kids are already dancing around.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: It's amazing how much energy they can share just by hitting a few notes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, listen—they're about to start the main song, the one where everyone keeps the beat without even realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Ah, here it goes: [boom-boom], [boom-boom], the whole crowd is suddenly buzzing!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Right outside my place this morning, there was quite a commotion… at one point, I heard a huge [boom] that almost made me drop my coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Really? It had that much of an effect on you? You must not have been expecting it at all!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Not in the slightest, I thought it was just a truck going by and in the end, it was just an event for the kids.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Honestly, it’s crazy how much goes on in your neighborhood, there’s always something unexpected happening!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: See, even a quiet morning can turn into something worthy of a TV drama.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: I think I’m going to end up setting up a deck chair under your windows, you never get bored with you around!

meaning: bruit de galop.
bruit d'une chute.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Look at this path, it's still all muddy from last night's rain.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and yet there are fresh tracks, so it didn't happen yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Do you smell that, like something rushed by here really fast?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen, it sounds like it's starting again, that [crash] echoing just behind the hill…

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Now my curiosity is getting the better of me, I'm off before I miss the show!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I promise, this time I'll keep my eyes open and the camera ready!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, Lucas, did you hear that commotion at the end of the path? It's shaking everything in its way!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's impressive... It sounds like a runaway truck is barreling through!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let's get closer, maybe we'll finally see what's making all that racket!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen, it really goes [crash], [crash], [crash] echoing through the air, it's almost hypnotic!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh look, that group of riders is coming around the bend—no wonder everything's shaking so much!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm bringing binoculars so I can catch this kind of show in advance!

meaning: bruit d'une chute, d'un coup soudain.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Wow, the house just shook as if a giant were having a restless nap in the living room!

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Are you the one making the walls shake, or did you start juggling the dishes?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, I just pulled on the tablecloth, and then... [crash], the salad bowl decided to take flight!

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Ah, the famous flying salad bowl act—always a hit under this roof!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Let's just say the kitchen wanted a bit of excitement—nothing dramatic, just some salad on the tiles.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: At this rate, I'm going to end up installing a safety net on the ceiling.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Léa, could you grab the salad bowl from the very top? My hands are full of dough right now…

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: OK, but seriously, who thought it was a good idea to put it up so high? Hold on, I'm climbing onto the chair…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh no, [crash]! I closed my eyes, I don't even dare look.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Well… it's fine, just the salad bowl doing some acrobatics and me with one foot in the dish towel.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You have to admit, it's an adventure in the kitchen today!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Promise, next time I'll come with my climbing gear.

meaning: bruit de galop.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Look behind the old apple tree, there's something moving!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Ah, you've got sharp eyes! It doesn't look like just a rabbit, do you think?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: No, I heard heavy footsteps, like the ground was shaking with every stride.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: There, listen, it really goes [thud-thud], [thud-thud]... It's getting louder and louder!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It's speeding by, we'd better not stay on the path if we don't want to become part of the scenery.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: With our luck, we'll end up taking part in a squirrel-back race!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: You should have seen the kids this afternoon, Lila, they were running around the garden, all you could hear was '[thud-thud] [thud-thud]' under their mud-caked boots!

dialogue.speaker: Lila
dialogue.text: Oh, I can just imagine the carpet hidden under a layer of dirt... It must have been quite the adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Their energy amazes me every time, we should sign them up for an orienteering race, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lila
dialogue.text: For that, we’ll have to plan for spare shoes... They’d have a field day in the mud, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: We could turn the park into a real adventure course, with even a little prize at the end.

dialogue.speaker: Lila
dialogue.text: With a surprise like that, no one will want to come home before nightfall!

meaning: bruit soudain d'un coup ou d'un projectile ; bruit d'une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Look at that target, Céline, it's been taunting me this whole time!

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: If you miss again, you have to take me out to dinner, that's the deal.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Oh, the pressure! Okay, let me focus...

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: I bet you'll give it your all this time, you got this!

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Alright, here I go, no turning back now.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: *[pop]*! Well, there you go, you just had to go for it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look at that old box in the back of the garage—can you imagine what's inside?

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Do you think it's still last year's firecrackers? Honestly, that wouldn't make me feel any better.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm lifting the lid... let's see if there's anything explosive left in there.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Oh wow, did you see that, [poof]! I almost dropped the lamp, I jumped so much.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Between the dust and our nerves, this box has gotten the better of both of us.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: We should've called this a treasure hunt for people with strong hearts...

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui fuse.
bruit de respiration d'un dormeur.
bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit d'un mécanisme à air comprimé.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It's so hot, look, I brought two cans for our break!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Perfect, wait… *[pssh]* There we go, this is going to be refreshing.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: That sound—I've been waiting for it since the stop at the red light!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's the signal that the reward is near.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: With this weather, it's the kind of little pleasure that changes everything.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely, let's enjoy this in the shade of the big tree, like true break-time experts!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Look, the can is all dented—do you think we can open it without making a mess?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Come closer, you'll see... I'm going for it... *[pssh]*!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? I really thought it was going to explode in your hands.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Admit it, it adds a bit of suspense to our drinks.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: We should almost film ourselves opening cans every time—it would be like a movie!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Next can, we'll do it in slow motion, promise!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui fuse.
bruit de respiration d'un dormeur.
bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit d'un mécanisme à air comprimé.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [pshh] ! Well, this promises quite a show for our experiment, don’t you think, Mathieu?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You’re the one creating all this suspense, it seems! What are you going to add after that?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was thinking of adding this blue dye—it should create an amazing effect.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, now we’re really going to have a little magic show live.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait until you see when I stir it—you might be surprised!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Watch out for splashes, this is my favorite sweater today!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Fanny, could you check the back wheel of my bike? It seems weird to me since I went through those puddles.

dialogue.speaker: Fanny
dialogue.text: Okay, hold on, let me look... *[pssh]* Uh, Lucas, something's happening here!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ouch, do you hear that noise every time you touch the valve?

dialogue.speaker: Fanny
dialogue.text: Yes, and I think the inner tube didn't like our ride in the rain.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That explains why I felt like I was slipping on the road!

dialogue.speaker: Fanny
dialogue.text: We've found the culprit, Sherlock! I'll get the pump and we'll see what we can do.

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui jaillit, qui fuse.
bruit produit par une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit produit par une boisson gazeuse ou mousseuse.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, if I press here... [pshhht]! Did you see how fast that shoots out?

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Oh, it almost splashed me! Are you planning to redo the wall too?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Promise, I'll stick to the pot—no contemporary art today.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Thankfully, your last masterpiece took two days to dry on the tiles.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And you have no idea how much I struggled to scrape it all off afterwards!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: At this rate, we might end up opening a gallery with the way we cook.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful Mathis, I'm aiming right at that plant—and there we go, [psshh] on the leaves!

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: You're going to make the others jealous if you keep this up!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: They were really thirsty, look at those stems perking up already.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: I admit, the one in the back looks like it's thanking you—it almost looks like it's dancing.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A little water and some attention, that's all they needed.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: At this rate, we should open a plant spa!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui jaillit, qui fuse.
bruit produit par une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit produit par une boisson gazeuse ou mousseuse.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this jam stain, it's still holding on despite all my efforts!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Time to bring out the heavy artillery. Hand me the spray, I'll show this stain who's boss.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't miss a single spot, the sugar is everywhere. Make sure you get it all the way to the edge.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Get ready, elimination mission activated. I hope this product lives up to its reputation.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright, here we go, [psshh] on the stain and it has no choice but to surrender!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's foaming right away, look, it's sliding off all by itself now. Impressive efficiency!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wow, look at the state of this plant, its leaves are all dusty!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, I have the spray bottle in the cupboard, this will do it good.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Perfect, try not to get too much on the table, or I'll start complaining again.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I aim like a pro, just watch.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: *[pssh]* Ah! Looks like the plant is already thanking you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s going to shine more than the living room table now, that’s for sure!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui jaillit, qui fuse.
bruit produit par une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit produit par une boisson gazeuse ou mousseuse.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The plants on the balcony look thirsty. Do you think we should fill the watering can again?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, there's almost no water left. Take the bottle next to it, it's full.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm pouring... oh, listen to that [pssh] right when the water escapes from the bottle!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It seems even the watering can enjoys a bit of freshness.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: There we go, half the plants are already taken care of, the others will have to wait a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If they could applaud, we'd have a real concert on the balcony!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: There’s something fishy about that old bottle on the table—it wasn’t dented this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With how hot it is, I’m not surprised. Want to try opening it now?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’m curious to see what’s going on with it, but be ready—you never know!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Careful, I’ve already had a mishap with exploding soda—it splashes everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I’m going really slowly... and now, [psshh], there it goes making a scene!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Looks like we’ll have to taste it with a spoon if we want to avoid flooding the table.

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, I left a bit too much water on the stove at lunchtime.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, so that’s why there was that strange steam in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I opened the lid a bit too quickly, it almost splashed me.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: All of a sudden, it went ‘[fwoosh]’! I thought the pot was going to take off.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll send you to get the dish towel, just to avoid the suspense.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Deal, as long as I don’t end up soaked on the way!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at these drooping leaves, they look like they're begging for a swimming pool!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Grab the watering can, I'll aim for the roots like a pro, just watch.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Careful when you lean over, last time it went [splat] on my new shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Promise, I'll avoid the splashes today... Well, I'll try!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: If you water me again, you'll be the one drying out on the patio!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, but without fins, it might be tricky.

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.
bruit de l'air ou d'un gaz.
bruit d'un moteur en difficulté.
pour marquer un départ rapide, une disparition soudaine.
marque l'indifférence, le dédain.
marque l'aisance, la rapidité.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: If you miss again, I get the last dart!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watch closely, this time I'm aiming between the two chairs.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Oh, we're playing snipers now? Be careful with grandma's vase...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Exactly, that's the whole skill: no room for mistakes.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: *[whoosh]*... Wow, you sent it flying, did you see that?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Admit it, you didn't think I could do it without breaking something!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at that throw, he doesn't even flinch for a second!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: You know, it fascinates me as much as a watchmaker's precision.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So when is it your turn, Mickaël? Will you dare to step up to the circle?

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Last time I tried, my dart flew off to the left, a real "[whoosh]" across the room... everyone jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I admit my throw will probably copy yours, just to liven up the evening!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: With our combined skills, the target better watch out... or run away!

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, I opened a bottle of sparkling water—it adds a bit of atmosphere to the table.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I definitely heard the [psshh] when you poured it, that sound always makes me smile!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's true, it adds a little festive touch even to a simple lunch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And you’ve really mastered the art of pouring without spilling anything!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s years of practice, from serving it to you every day.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Thank you, it’s always a pleasure to share these little rituals.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Are you messing around with your wizard experiments and the soda machine again, Lucas? It's foaming everywhere in here!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I just wanted to try an orange-mint mix, but... obviously, it's overflowing a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh wow, look at the counter, it's starting to spill everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oops... and there it goes, [pfft] [pfft] [pfft], it's coming out of the spout without warning!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like a wild magic potion, you'd better bail it out before it reaches the floor!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Grab a sponge, it's a lemonade sneak attack.

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wow, this can’s been sitting in the car all afternoon…

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, do you think it’ll fizz everywhere if we open it?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: No idea, but I’m thirsty so I’ll take my chances.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Wait, move it away a bit, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Good call, last time this happened to me, the cola ended up on the ceiling.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: There we go… *[pssh]*… phew, just a little hiss, we dodged the geyser!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Here, listen, [pfft]... There you go, it's the old coffee maker acting up again as soon as I pour the water.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Ah, that one has never been very quiet, but it's still loyal despite its age.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Even though I'm gentle, it always surprises me with its unexpected noises.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If it ever breaks down, I think it'll feel strange not to hear its morning racket.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, it's impossible not to notice it—this coffee maker almost seems to have a soul by now!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Let's hope it lasts at least until the end of the week, considering the energy it brings to the whole apartment.

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, notamment d'une gifle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You're starting up with your stories again, always criticizing everyone behind their backs.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Stop accusing me like that, you don't have any real arguments against me!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh really? Do you want me to bring up what you said to Julie yesterday?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Julie knows very well I was joking, you're the one who takes everything literally.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, keep denying it. One day, you'll get yourself into real trouble if you keep this up.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Will you calm down already? [smack]!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: But wait, did you hear that? [splat]! Right behind us, I think something's really going on back there.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that almost made me jump! I barely dare to turn around.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Honestly, with a noise like that, we can't just pretend we didn't see anything.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Totally... Do you think we should go check it out or just leave it be?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I'd rather watch first, you never know who you might run into.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: You're right, let's be careful, but if things get out of hand, we might have to look for help.

meaning: bruit produit par un coup brutal, un choc violent.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you remember when we tried to move the big wardrobe into Léa's place on Saturday?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, especially the moment when we realized it wouldn't fit through the door or up the stairs.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, and then all of a sudden, the wardrobe slipped and made a huge "[thud]" when it hit the wall!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Léa jumped so hard she spilled her coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We all thought the wall was going to collapse—even the neighbor came over to see what had happened.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Luckily, it was more of a scare than anything else, and at least the wardrobe survived the landing!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Samuel, are you sure that shelf is going to hold all those books?

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: Hold on a second, I'm putting the last volume on and... [thud]!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wow, the board didn't last a second!

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: I should've listened when they told me to use the metal brackets.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Now we'll have to pick everything up, and find all the pages that flew away…

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: Adding to my list: reinforce the shelves before trying to act tough!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal, notamment d'une gifle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you really think all of this was going to go unnoticed? I saw you, Lucas.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Stop it, you're getting worked up over nothing. It's not what you think.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm tired of your lame excuses. Take responsibility for once.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, you're getting completely paranoid, Sophie. I don't see what I did wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Say that one more time and you might really see me lose my temper.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Go on then, show me! *[slam]*

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This is the third time this week you've pulled this on me. Do you think I don't notice anything?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: *[huff]* Stop always accusing me for no reason!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You've really got some nerve, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You're the one who's crossing the line, not me.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Good, you've just opened your eyes to who you really are.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Don't push me like this anymore, you know how far I can go.

meaning: bruit d'un corps qui plonge dans l'eau, bruit de plongeon.
bruit de chute, d'écrasement.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look at that water, it's like it's waiting for me! Want to bet I dare to jump from the big rock?

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: If you jump, I at least want to see a real jump worthy of the name, not just a slide!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Alright, get ready... three, two, one... [splash]! Mission accomplished, do you approve or not?

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: That was a masterpiece, I almost got hit by a wave right in the face!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Admit it, you didn't expect that much flair from me!

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Definitely not, but now... you've set the bar really high for my turn!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Look at that water, it looks perfect to try out my new back dive!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: I have a feeling you're about to pull off a dolphin-worthy routine—I'm grabbing a front row seat for this feat.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Okay, you won't be disappointed, here I go... Watch out!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: And there... [splash]! It sounded like a giant watermelon falling from the sky!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: You're exaggerating—just wait until you see your score in a moment...

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, get ready to be surprised, champ!

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look, when I squeeze the bottle, [pff], it squirts everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, you got some on my pants, world champion of accidental splashes!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You should see my hand, it got just as much! It looks like I tried to tame a geyser.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, mission accomplished—you could open a water game booth at the village fair.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'll keep that in mind, but next time, approach at your own risk.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Promise, I'll bring my raincoat. With you, you never know when a surprise is coming!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that, another gutter leaking after last night's downpour.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Oh wait! (presses on the gutter) [pshh] ! There, now the water escapes even more than before…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It seems like this gutter really doesn't want to keep its secret.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: With this morning's wind, it's no wonder it's wearing out.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I keep hearing it grumble every time it rains, I'm going to end up giving it a name.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: If it starts singing too, we'll start a band!

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The bucket is empty, can you help me fill the bathtub?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, hang on, I'll grab the big water jug from the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Great, pour it slowly or it'll overflow everywhere like last time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got it under control this time, just watch.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [phew], that's impressive, did you see the whirlpool at the bottom?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It looks like a mini waterfall in our bathroom, I love it!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: If you're still standing after that gardening session, you must be thirsty too.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'm filling the glasses... [phew], did you hear that? There's nothing better in this weather.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: I bet the water must be deliciously cold, it's going to revive us!

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Grab your glass, I bet you won't want to let go of it once you've had a taste.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: You know me well, I'm going to savor every sip after watering all those plants.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: We've really earned this break, the watering can has worked as hard as we have today!

meaning: bruit produit par un pet.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Honestly, this library seems quieter than my dentist's waiting room.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Don't say that too loudly, we might attract the librarian's attention.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, how much do you bet we'll get noticed before the end of the break?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: [pffft]... Uh... I wasn't planning on that kind of bet, I promise you.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Great timing, Maxime! I think this break is going to be unforgettable.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Maybe someone will figure out one day why I prefer leather armchairs...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Another wild race in the kitchen, Marc... I'm starting to applaud the pan for holding up!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Honestly, at this rate, I'm going to invest in a helmet just to do the dishes.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Tell you what, if you survive doing the dishes, I'll officially crown you king of the chaotic kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Careful, this sounds like a challenge... I feel like something's coming.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh! That "[splat]" wasn't in the recipe!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Promise, next time I'll add that to the list of surprise ingredients...

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.
bruit de l'air ou d'un gaz.
bruit d'un moteur en difficulté.
pour marquer un départ rapide, une disparition soudaine.
marque l'indifférence, le dédain.
marque l'aisance, la rapidité.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look at what I made with some scraps of paper and a rubber band, it could really go far!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Want to bet I can hit the bottle on the table on my first try?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Show me, I'm curious to see if your aim is still as good as ever.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Get ready to be impressed… *[whoosh]* There, here it goes!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Not bad, it almost grazed it… but you missed by a hair!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: One more try and that bottle won't be able to escape.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, Thomas, this time I'm aiming at the can on the wall with my slingshot.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You're bluffing, Sophie, last time you hit the light pole!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Get ready, I'm winding up... This one's going to fly!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Whoa, that shot off, [whoosh], I felt the air move!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not bad, right? See, that's what I call precision!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Awesome! If you keep this up, I'll have to start calling you the neighborhood sharpshooter.

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Be careful, the broth is ready—pour the coulis gently into the center of the pot.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: Here I go... [whoosh], did you hear that? I think we’re at just the right temperature.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: You always nail it with these sauces, it’s like an orchestra now.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: That’s my little secret for giving the dish some character!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: If you keep this up, we’ll end up opening our own bistro.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: Just promise me a homemade dessert and I’m in for this adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, if I blow like this into the straw… [whoosh]… do you see the whirlpool forming in my glass?

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Oh, you're starting your experiments again! I hope you won't spill everything on the table this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got this! And besides, it's so satisfying to watch…

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Satisfying or not, last time we had to mop up for half an hour because of your crazy ideas.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe this time, I'll set the record without making a mess… who knows?

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: I bet you a piece of cake you'll make waves within five minutes!

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit d'une mise à feu qui échoue.
bruit d'un rire contenu.
marque un passage rapide, une disparition soudaine.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at these dishes, it’s like a storm swept through the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, I’m turning on the faucet… [whoosh], see, it never misses a chance for sound effects!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Always so theatrical, this sink—it’s a real show every time a plate gets rinsed.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If only it stuck to the show, but it also likes to soak my shoes…

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Well, next time we’ll hire a stunt double to rinse the frying pan.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Or we could invest in an audience to applaud the splashes—it’s worth the show!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: The faucet is leaking again, look, there's water all over the countertop.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: Oh darn, that one has never lasted more than two weeks. Did you put a bowl underneath?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Yes, but the bowl is starting to overflow. I'm trying to empty it now without spilling everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: Be careful, last time it went everywhere under the cabinets.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: [whoosh], did you hear that? Every time I pour, there's that sound!

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: That's just what the kitchen is like after it rains!

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.
bruit de l'air ou d'un gaz.
bruit d'un moteur en difficulté.
pour marquer un départ rapide, une disparition soudaine.
marque l'indifférence, le dédain.
marque l'aisance, la rapidité.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Right next to me, something went "[whoosh]" and I think my heart skipped a beat!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh wow, did you feel like they were aiming for your head or something?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Hanging around near the park all the time, it was bound to happen to me sooner or later—it was inevitable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's always when you're looking the other way that those things come out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: I'm starting to think it's some kind of initiation ritual for inattentive passersby.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, if you want to avoid becoming a moving target, pick the least risky diagonal next time!

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Oh, look Justine, they've brought out the pétanque set again. It's great to see some pros in action in the square!

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: That's for sure! It looks like every throw is the championship final. Did you see their technique?

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: I can never forget that time I sent the ball into the bushes, with everyone laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: I think about it every time we walk by here! Look at the little one in yellow, he's really concentrating…

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Watch out… [whoosh]! That one shot across the field like a rocket, did you see it fly?

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: Absolutely! With that kind of ease, he's going to impress the old-timers around here.

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.
bruit de l'air ou d'un gaz.
bruit d'un moteur en difficulté.
pour marquer un départ rapide, une disparition soudaine.
marque l'indifférence, le dédain.
marque l'aisance, la rapidité.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see last time? My paper ball grazed the lamp without touching anything.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I admit, you made a perfect throw. Should we try the basket challenge from here this time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I'm aiming just above the blue book on the shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Come on, show me what you can do. I bet you won't make it past the cushion this time!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Watch closely... and [whoosh]! Straight into the basket without touching the stacks of notebooks.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Incredible! Looks like you could aim for the wastebaskets at the back of the classroom now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Catch this ball well, Julie, I'm going to throw you a long pass from the end of the field!

dialogue.speaker: Julie
