dialogue.text: Whoa, I felt a '[whoosh]' right over my head, you’re not kidding about the speed!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's training—you need the ball to go straight if we want to win on Sunday.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Alright, but try to aim right for my hands this time, not the clouds!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Promise, I'll adjust my aim, you'll see the difference.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Come on, show me what you've got in that arm, champ!

meaning: bruit produit par un souffle d'air.
bruit d'essoufflement.
bruit de sifflet, de sifflement.
bruit produit par un pétard, une fusée.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The steam rising from this soup almost makes me feel like I'm in a steam room!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [Whoooosh]... There, nothing beats my technique for not burning your tongue.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Your trick deserves to be taught in every kitchen in France!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, I came up with it after too many impatient ladlefuls.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Seriously though, are you admiring the soup or waiting for it to talk to you?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: For a good soup, you have to give it time to reveal all its secrets!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at the leaves flying away, they're going everywhere today.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [Whoosh]! I feel like they're going to whip me in the face with every gust.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: This is the kind of weather where walking straight almost becomes an impossible mission.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Even my umbrella gave up fighting—it flipped inside out at the first blast.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Good thing I only brought my beanie—at least it can handle it!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Maybe we should sign up for a sprinting-against-the-wind contest, I have a good feeling about it!

meaning: bruit produit par l'expiration.
bruit produit par un pétard, une fusée.
marque d'indifférence, de désinvolture, de dédain ; marque de lassitude.
bruit de crachement du chat en colère.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: The presentation is over, but my heart is still racing.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: It must have been intense up there in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: [phew]... I think my shoulders are finally relaxing.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Looks like you're slowly coming back down to earth.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Just thinking about the questions still makes my hands sweaty.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: You should treat yourself to a little chocolate to celebrate—it really soothes the nerves after a battle!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [phew]... this trail is really steep!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: I can see that, you're giving the wind some competition!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I didn't think my calves would start burning this quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: Just wait, the next switchback has a surprise for us!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope we'll get a view of the lake—that's the little motivation I have left.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: I promise, it's worth all the effort in the world, you'll see!

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.
bruit de l'expiration.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hey, Adrien, could you try to straighten the hose? It seems to be acting up today.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'll give it a little push... [whoosh], it comes out fast all at once!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: And there you go, it's a frog party on my shirt!

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, you'll end up soaked before the flowers do.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: At least it wakes you up more than a morning coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: Note to self: bring a raincoat for watering next time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to this, as soon as I turn this faucet, you hear [whoosh] right away, it's almost become a routine!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I wonder if it's a sign our pipes need a break—they're working harder than we are these days.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, between the weird noises and the water that sometimes changes color, it really gives the place an old house vibe.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At least we never need an alarm—we always know when someone uses the water!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And you still haven't heard the radiator last winter... an impromptu concert every morning!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I think our apartment is trying to communicate—it tells us its stories drip by drip and sigh after sigh!

meaning: bruit du cri aigu d'un petit oiseau.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look over there, just above the bench, there's a tiny bird on the branch.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it's hopping all over and you can hear a little '[chirp chirp]' each time!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It looks like it's discovering the world for the first time, it's so cute.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Life seems so simple when you watch scenes like this, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It makes me want to lie down in the grass and listen for a long time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With a show like this, it's hard to think about anything but the present moment!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look in the branches, Mathieu, there's something moving!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I see tiny feathers sticking out of the nest.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It looks like they want us to notice them, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [cheep cheep]... do you hear how it softly echoes between the leaves?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It makes me want to stay here and watch a little longer.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And to think we could have walked right by without noticing all this little commotion.

meaning: cri du dindon.
marque le commérage, le bavardage.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Guess what I discovered at the back of the garden this morning, just behind the old shed!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Don't tell me it's another animal that snuck in there...

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Well, I saw a whole crowd, and suddenly, there was [chirp-chirp] all around, I couldn't keep a straight face.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Nothing surprising from that spot, it's almost becoming their secret territory!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I wonder if they're holding some kind of weekly meeting we haven't picked up on.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Next time, bring binoculars—you never know what you'll find out there!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hard to believe we're finally going to see the poultry area up close this weekend!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: I've heard about it for so long, apparently some of the birds there are downright hilarious.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I saw in the photos that there are huge turkeys just strolling around.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: It's mostly their look and their little runs that crack me up, it's like they're strutting to impress us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: We're going to have a good laugh if one of them starts putting on a show right in front of us!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we'll get to hear that funny "[gobble-gobble]" everyone talks about, right when I take my photo.

meaning: pour mettre en fuite un animal, notamment un chat ou un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wow, Félix is on the counter again… [plop]! Do you think he'll ever figure it out?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: With him, I feel like nothing can stop him. He almost knocked over the fruit basket yesterday!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'm not surprised, he has a knack for aiming at exactly what he shouldn't.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: If we counted the number of times he climbs up, we'd have enough to write a comedy novel.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, he's going to end up thinking the kitchen is an adventure playground just for him.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: In that case, we'll just have to invent a velvet paw detector!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, look at Felix on the armchair, [splat], get out of there, naughty cat!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Him again? Looks like he's after your favorite plant.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He always manages to find the places he's not supposed to go.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Apparently, he's made the living room his favorite obstacle course.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And all our warnings just seem to motivate him even more.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That cat really has an adventurous spirit... or a real taste for mischief!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau, en particulier d'un poussin.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see the pile of straw, right there, behind the old tractor? It's moving on its own!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely... it goes like '[peep-peep], [peep-peep]' under the straw. Sounds like there's something alive under there!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, do you think there are a lot of them? I bet they're all huddled together to keep warm.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Or maybe they're playing hide-and-seek with the whole farm. There's no way to guess how many just from the sound!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wonder if one of them will dare to venture all the way to my shoelaces this time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Keep your eyes open, this is when the little adventurers are at their cleverest!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Listen, Paul, do you hear that little [cheep-cheep] coming from the bush? It sounds like there are chicks hiding!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh yes, now that you mention it, I think it's coming from right there, very close to us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: We should try to get closer very quietly so we don't scare them.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Good idea, let's go on tiptoe. Maybe we'll manage to spot a nest.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I love these moments when nature reveals itself like this, it's magical.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Yes, it reminds me of walks from my childhood. We always hoped to discover a little miracle among the branches.

meaning: Onomatopée redoublée (ou suivie de paf) exprimant un bruit sec.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I swear, this morning couldn't have been more chaotic!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Another one of your adventures? Go on, I can tell I'm going to laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Picture this: I was trying to put the spice jars away on the top shelf...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And then, [plop] [plop], the pepper and mustard ended up all over the floor!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It turned into a cleaning party—I spent twenty minutes picking everything up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's like your kitchen gets bored if there isn't some unexpected explosion!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Hey, do you think I can still fit this last box right on top of the wardrobe?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You're aiming high, but the stack is already wobbling quite a bit, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: With a bit of skill, I can do it. Watch closely, I've got the technique down.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hmm, I've already seen your 'technique', it was quite the workout last time...

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: There, just one more little move... and now, [tap] [tap] bang! Oops, that didn't go as planned.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Result: the stack couldn't handle your balancing magic, now we're going to play giant dominoes.

meaning: bruit sec d'un claquement, d'un coup, notamment d'une gifle, d'un détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You know, when I walked past the gym, I heard a real racket, actual [wham bam] sounds echoing all the way into the hallway!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh wow, who was inside making all that noise this time?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: From what I saw, it was Hugo and Karim in the middle of a ping-pong match—they weren’t holding back!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, that explains everything! With those two, we get a show every break.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Honestly, they turn the gym into an arena as soon as they grab the paddles.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No kidding, I’m going to stop by and watch them tomorrow—I bet we’ll have a good laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It sounds like there’s a party in the next room, do you hear all that racket?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Impossible not to notice, it goes [bang pow] every couple of minutes!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can already picture balloons popping or a treasure hunt gone wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Or maybe they’re improvising a whack-a-mole contest with whatever they can find.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I might end up going to see who’s keeping the best rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Grab some popcorn, you never know, it could get epic!

meaning: pour exprimer la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, that court case we were following already reached its conclusion!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I’m telling you, I barely had time to grab a coffee before the decision was announced.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But how did everything happen so fast? We were expecting weeks of debates.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: You’ll laugh, but between the parties entering, the judge giving a signal, [bam bam boom], it was all wrapped up.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s impressive—at this rate, they’ll end up handling three cases before lunch!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It might just become the new normal at the court, who knows!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see the verdict this morning? It was settled [bam bam boom], nobody understood a thing!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, even the judge seemed surprised at how quickly everything happened.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’ve rarely seen a hearing wrapped up that fast.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The lawyers hadn’t even finished their arguments before we were already moving on to the decision.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And to think some people had been waiting for this trial for months…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s like they just wanted to move on quickly, without leaving any room for suspense!

meaning: bruit de cri d'oiseau.
bruit produit par un sifflement d'appel.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The benches under the oaks are free today, we don't even have to share them with the joggers.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: That's different, huh? Even the air feels a bit lighter, did you notice?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I love feeling this breeze and watching the leaves dance... And this carpet of light on the grass, it's so soothing.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Wait, listen for a moment... [peep-peep]... you can hear it echo sometimes, right above us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's amazing how some sounds slip through the branches, you'd think they travel with the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: If we stayed a little longer, maybe we could figure out where that curious echo is coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look up there, in the birch tree, there's a whole group perched!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, they seem restless today. It looks like they're getting ready for a concert.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: The one on the thin branch is jumping all over the place, he must have something important to say.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Every time he moves, I feel like the others answer him in unison.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? Right there, it went: [tweet-tweet]... Twice in a row, I think!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If I had wings, I'd go answer them, just to see how they'd react!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un oiseau de proie.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Listen to that… do you hear that high-pitched noise, just behind the hedge? It sounds like it's coming from above.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it goes "[peep], [peep]"! That's exactly what I heard the other morning when I was taking out the trash.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Do you think it's the same bird? We've been hearing strange sounds around here for several days now.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I bet it's hiding in the big oak tree, right over there. Last time, I thought I saw something move between the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: If we don't move too much, maybe we'll get lucky and catch a glimpse of it today.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Get your binoculars ready, you never know with these unpredictable little visitors.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This path always has something magical about it, especially when you walk softly at dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Oh but you know, this morning, I thought I saw a shadow gliding right above the old mill.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That’s the kind of encounter that suddenly makes you forget the rest of the world! What kind of bird do you think it was?

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I’d bet it was a red kite, with its broad wings and the way it spirals in the sky.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it gives me chills. We should go back together—maybe we’ll see it again.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Right at that moment, it let out a [kee-eeeee-arr]! that startled me—I almost dropped my binoculars.

meaning: bruit de cri d'oiseau.
bruit produit par un sifflement d'appel.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look over there, in the big oak tree, something's moving!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Oh yes, did you see how it's moving between the branches? It must be a little acrobat.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It's crazy, it doesn't stop for a second. Do you think it's going to come down?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: With all that energy, it could almost fall right on top of us!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I heard a strange song earlier, do you think it came from him?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Maybe! It echoed in the air like a little '[peep-peep], [peep-peep]' all bright.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Honestly, this old oak always attracts strange sounds, don't you think, Mathieu?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's amazing, every time we pass by, there's always some new little sound surprise in these branches.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Actually, I caught a noise earlier... a kind of sudden [peep-squeak], it made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah! So that's what made you look up so quickly?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Exactly, it's impossible to ignore that bit of eccentricity in the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That's proof you never get bored walking here—the trees always liven up the stroll.

meaning: bruit ponctuel produit par un coup, notamment une gifle, par un choc, par une détonation d'arme à feu, par une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wow, look what I found under the shelf: an old, all-dented tin box!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Whoa, it must have seen a lot of years go by... Do you think there's still something inside?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The lid is a bit stuck, wait, if I pull gently it should come off.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Take it easy, it looks like it's going to pop open all at once!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: One second... There, I can feel it moving—

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Oh, that made quite a [pop]!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you want to try the hammer machine? I’ve seen lots of people miss the bell—it looks harder than it seems.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yeah, absolutely! Hand me the hammer, I’ll show them how it’s done.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Careful... and there you go, [ding]! Did you see? The bell rang with a clean hit.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Wow, impressive! You didn’t leave me much suspense.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come on, your turn—show me if you can do as well, or even better.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Get ready, I’m planning to beat your score and send that bell flying!

meaning: bruit ponctuel produit par un coup, notamment une gifle, par un choc, par une détonation d'arme à feu, par une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I swear, Margot, I still have the adrenaline rushing after that elevator scene!

dialogue.speaker: Margot
dialogue.text: Wait, I’m going to have to check if you don’t have some hidden superpowers. Did you see how he chained those moves together?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly! And the way he threw the briefcase, I thought it was going to explode.

dialogue.speaker: Margot
dialogue.text: Go on, show me how you experienced the scene, give me the full performance.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Okay, I’m switching to secret agent mode, watch: one step to the right, a kick to the left, and then… [bam bam boom]!

dialogue.speaker: Margot
dialogue.text: You really look like you were actually there, it’s almost scary!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait until I tell you what happened to me when I came out of the subway, it was unbelievable!

dialogue.speaker: Yacine
dialogue.text: You're scaring me, what did you run into this time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There were two jugglers, right in front of the exit, and they were drawing a whole crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Yacine
dialogue.text: With that mysterious tone, I can already tell there was a show—tell me everything!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At one point, they pulled out some plates and started spinning them in the air... and then, [bam bam boom], the plates were falling everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Yacine
dialogue.text: That was a real circus scene you witnessed, you always stumble upon the most incredible things!

meaning: bruit ponctuel produit par un coup, notamment une gifle, par un choc, par une détonation d'arme à feu, par une explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I couldn't get a wink of sleep last night, it was like an all-out brawl right under my window!

dialogue.speaker: Hassan
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard the echoes too, it was straight up [bang pow] in the street, I was wondering what was going on!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: The worst part is, even the cat ran to hide under the bed, his tail all puffed up.

dialogue.speaker: Hassan
dialogue.text: Your cat's got instincts—at least he knows when to stay away from trouble.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If only I had that sense, I just stay glued to the window watching everything.

dialogue.speaker: Hassan
dialogue.text: Between you and your cat, nights are never boring in this neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Mathilda
dialogue.text: Did you see that old couch in the attic? It looks like it won't survive a test run!

dialogue.speaker: Lamine
dialogue.text: Wait, let me sit on it. It's already creaking just as I get close.

dialogue.speaker: Mathilda
dialogue.text: Come on, I'm jumping next to you—let's hope its springs are brave!

dialogue.speaker: Lamine
dialogue.text: Careful, it won't hold two people—I can feel the boards squeaking!

dialogue.speaker: Mathilda
dialogue.text: Listen to that: [boing bang]! Sounds like we're making a remix in the house.

dialogue.speaker: Lamine
dialogue.text: At this rate, we're going to wake up all the attic's memories, don't you think?

meaning: bruit de l'avertisseur à trois tons d'une ambulance.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, Mathieu, I bet you can't finish that lemon tart in under two minutes!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, a culinary challenge? Careful what you wish for, you might be surprised!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at you, already focused like a chef in the finals...

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, do you hear that? What a racket out in the street!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's crazy how everything stops as soon as I hear: [wee-woo wee-woo], [wee-woo wee-woo] in the city.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Totally, even the sparrows seem to pause at that moment!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It seems like the street is even livelier this afternoon, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Definitely, between the hurried pedestrians and the bikes weaving around, it never stops.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, look, everyone is suddenly moving off the sidewalk over there.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen to that racket: [ding dong ding], [ding dong ding]! It echoes through the whole city, it seems.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It’s surprising every time, even though we’re used to it here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: For sure, Paris without moments like these just wouldn’t be Paris!

meaning: bruit soudain, souvent d'origine métallique, produit par un coup, par un choc, par une détonation.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With this machine, coffee is going to save my afternoon, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely, I need my fix! Do you want the big mug or the little blue one?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: The big one, I prefer it, it keeps the heat better. Careful up top, they're a bit stacked.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I'm used to it, even though yesterday I almost dropped the whole set on the counter.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, let me grab the one in the back without knocking everything over...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ouch, that made a '[clink]', did you hit the mug against the cheese grater or am I imagining things?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Look at this old padlock, it's still holding strong after all these years!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that little [ping]? I thought something just bounced under there.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It was probably the chain moving when I pulled on it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Looks like your workshop still has a few surprises up its sleeve.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: With all these tools, it's a real sound experiment playground in here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't change a thing, it's almost become your secret soundtrack!

meaning: bruit de l'avertisseur à deux tons des véhicules d'urgencë pompiers police, ambulances.
bruit du signal sonore émis par une locomotive.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It feels like there’s a lot going on outside tonight, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Just now, there was a huge "[nee-naw]" that made the windows shake—I thought they were going to stop right under our windows.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I nearly had a heart attack—I was so focused that I jumped.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Same here! It reminded me of when I used to live near the big avenue—it was almost a nightly routine.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it feels like the city never sleeps, especially with all this sudden commotion.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Between the weird noises and these surprise interruptions, there’s no way we’ll get bored in this neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hey, I jumped just now when I was going down the stairs—did you notice that racket?

dialogue.speaker: Yoann
dialogue.text: I almost dropped my bag, it echoed through the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Plus, all the cars suddenly stopped on the boulevard.

dialogue.speaker: Yoann
dialogue.text: It was impossible to miss: [wee-woo], [wee-woo], speeding right through the lights!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I saw passersby all turn at the same time, like on cue.

dialogue.speaker: Yoann
dialogue.text: With that kind of commotion, it almost feels like the whole city holds its breath for a moment.

meaning: bruit du sifflement d'une balle d'arme à feu.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Those rows of targets lined up in the distance really set the mood right away.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s true, and that smell of gunpowder reminds me of the Arques carnival.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Except here, everyone tries to hit the center with every shot—it’s more serious!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And no stuffed animals to win, just the thrill when you hit the mark.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Hey, listen… it’s started up again at the next lane.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Right there… [pew]… did you feel how it zips between two bursts!

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: Check out this course! Between the tires and the old car wreck, we're going to have a blast.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Totally, you'll have to be agile if you want to catch me. I've got the perfect plan to escape you!

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: Watch your left then... I've got you in my sights!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: (ducks suddenly) [pew]! Whoa, that one was really close, I felt the air!

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: With that shot, I was hoping to make you jump! You move fast, I admit.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Just wait, the rematch is going to be unforgettable. Get ready to run!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau.
bruit du cri du poussin.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look over there, in the bush, I heard a little [chirp chirp] earlier and now I think I see it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, I see it too, it looks so tiny, it's really adorable.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It's jumping from one branch to another, it doesn't seem at all intimidated by us.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You know, it makes me want to stop here for a while, just to watch them.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It's so different from the city noises, it almost feels like we're in a forest, even right in the center.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's true, this place really feels like a little secret hideaway, we should come more often.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The light shining through the leaves really gives this place a magical atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I love this part of the park, you always run into so many surprises here.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see the little brown spots on that branch over there? They're moving gently.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh yes, look, they're hopping from one twig to another without being noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely… [chirp chirp]… They're really just above us!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's amazing how moments like this make you want to stop time.

meaning: bruit de cri d'oiseau.
bruit produit par un sifflement d'appel.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that light through the trees, it feels like everything is shining a little brighter today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, the rays are playing on the moss and the branches, it's almost magical here.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you notice how the air is filled with little sounds? You can almost hear the leaves chatting with each other.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, and sometimes an unexpected sound slips in, it immediately grabs your attention.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I jumped a little earlier, right above my head, and I couldn't figure out what it was.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: There! Do you hear it? Like a little "[peep]" coming from who knows where, that's exactly the kind of moment I love.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look up there, they're especially lively this morning in the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yes, their dance among the leaves is fascinating to watch.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that little cry just behind us?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: The one that sounds like a sharp [pee-weet]? It seems like it's hiding behind the old oak.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It must be clever to blend in like that, I can't even catch a glimpse of it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If we approach quietly, maybe we'll get lucky and it will show itself.

meaning: bruit de cri d'oiseau.
bruit produit par un sifflement d'appel.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look up there in the oak tree, that little colorful visitor fascinates me every time!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Ah, I see! It's waddling as if it has a secret choreography.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, listen to what it's doing: [tweet-tweet], [tweet-tweet]... It almost sounds like a melody invented just for us.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Its enthusiasm makes me want to scamper across the branches just like it does!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With such an atmosphere, it feels like we're plunged into a storybook in the middle of an enchanted forest.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Walks really take on a different flavor when we come across artists like that one.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look how the light shines through the leaves, it creates an almost magical atmosphere, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: It's incredible, it feels like we're in another world. Even the ground smells fresher here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait a second... [tweet], [tweet]... Did you hear that too?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it's probably coming from one of the branches above us. Something seems to be catching their attention.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's moments like these that really make me prefer walking early in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: I'm starting to understand why you always insist we leave before the city wakes up.

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau, en particulier d'un poussin.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look under the hedge, there's something moving between the leaves!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Oh, you're right, I think I see little yellow balls wriggling around.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [cheep-cheep], [cheep-cheep], it sounds like they're trying to get our attention!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It's so endearing, those little timid sounds coming from the nest.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to stay here all day just watching them.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With a picnic, it would be perfect, wouldn't it? And we could enjoy the show nature puts on.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Look behind the hay bale, Paul, there's a little yellow commotion going on!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh yes, they're all huddled together, they look like little animated balls of fluff.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: It makes me want to stay here for hours just watching them, it's so heartwarming.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: If you want, we could get them some seeds; maybe they'll dare to come closer.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Good idea, go slowly, I think one of them is curious about our shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Look how it's coming forward—[cheep-cheep], [cheep-cheep]—it looks like it's greeting us in its own way.

meaning: bruit sec produit par un claquement, par un choc.
bruit de pas.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It feels like a draft has snuck into the room, listen to that racket.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No wonder, the sliding door is half open… I’ll take care of it.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Be careful, last time I almost got my fingers caught closing it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It always sticks like this… you really have to be gentle with it.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Oh, you’ll see, you have to show it who’s boss!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watch, here I go… and [clack]! There you go, mission accomplished.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Hurry up, Romain, it's your turn to throw!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Wait, Nadia, you'll see, this throw is going to surprise you.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wanna bet? Because last time, you missed the target by a good three meters!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: This time, the wind is on my side, I can feel it.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Good luck, aim for the center, not the bushes!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: And... [thwack]! Right on target, see?

meaning: Onomatopée, bruit de chute à plat.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No way to reach the top of the cupboard without climbing on this wobbly chair... Will you cover for me if I give it a shot?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I'm watching you, but don't come complaining if you get stuck up there.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: One second... I've almost got the box in my hands, it's just a little stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Try not to make too much of a racket, that's the porcelain one!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, it's slipping... oops!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And there you go, [thud], it was inevitable... Did you see the result of your acrobatics?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You’re going to laugh, fate is still after me, all because of an old umbrella.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me it ended up in the rain and wind…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Picture this: I’m walking confidently, bag in hand, and then—[thud]—the umbrella gives out right onto my soaked shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: No way, it didn’t actually explode right in front of everyone?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, and with everyone staring at me too—truly world-class style!

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Next time, take my rainbow umbrella, that one’s indestructible!

meaning: bruit d'un roulement de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Watch closely... [click] [click] [click]... now open the box!

dialogue.speaker: Laurence
dialogue.text: Oh, you're dragging out the suspense on purpose! Alright, here I go...

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Well? Do you see the hidden message under the lid?

dialogue.speaker: Laurence
dialogue.text: I can't believe it! You took the time to customize everything, even the inside!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I had to make your birthday special, right?

dialogue.speaker: Laurence
dialogue.text: You really got me, that's amazing, I'm going to keep the box safe!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Attention, [drum roll] [drum roll] [drum roll], I have an announcement to make that will change everything!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Now you’ve got me curious, go ahead, I’m listening!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This morning, I got a job offer to move to Montreal!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You’re kidding? That’s huge! Are you going to accept?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I’m still thinking about it, but the adventure is really tempting.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I get it, it could be an incredible experience—go for it if it feels right!

meaning: bruit produit par un coup, par un choc.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ouch, my elbow just hit the table… [splash], my coffee almost went flying!

dialogue.speaker: Élodie
dialogue.text: Oh no, your sprinter reflexes didn’t help much this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I swear, that table corner is lying in wait for me every time I walk by.

dialogue.speaker: Élodie
dialogue.text: Just think of it as adding to the decor—a new mark of adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Or maybe the table’s trying to get my attention because I forgot to dust it.

dialogue.speaker: Élodie
dialogue.text: Promise it a cleaning cloth and everything will be fine, otherwise it might play a trick on you next time you walk by!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: See this salad bowl? It's been out to get me since the start of the meal.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Give it to me, I've tamed utensils more stubborn than that!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here you go, your turn... But be careful, it's slippery.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, my hands are wet... [splash]! Now that's some improvised kitchen show.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least you liven things up, it's never boring with you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: As long as the salad bowl survives, we can party all night!

meaning: bruit d'un coup violent, d'une chute, d'un corps qui s'écrase.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: Jules, watch where you step, this trail is turning into an ice rink with all this mud!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Oops, too late... and [splat], I end up finishing my run in the mud!

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: Wow, you just treated yourself to a quick mud bath!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: I should have applied for a spa commercial, just look at my pants.

dialogue.speaker: Sonia
dialogue.text: At least you're making the hikers behind us laugh... and me too.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: If it can be entertainment, I'll just stay completely covered!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that chocolate cake on the edge of the table, it's been calling to me for ages!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Careful, it's not very stable, you're going to end up knocking it over…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No way, watch, I'll grab it gently… oh–[splat]!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: There it is, disaster struck!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My poor cake, it's beyond saving…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: We'll have to make do with the crumbs on the counter, what an adventure!

meaning: bruit ponctuel produit par un choc, par un claquement de langue.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look, I managed to flip the crepe with one hand again—ready to beat my record?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, did you see that? The crepe landed right in the center, it even went [plop] on the pan!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That's practice, Thomas. If you do just as well, I'll put away the spatula!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! But if I mess up, do you promise not to laugh?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed... and my camera isn't far away.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh wow, no pressure, just all your followers waiting for the big moment!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Hey, look: *[pop]*... that's the cork popping, looks like we're in for a sparkling evening!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I just hope you won't spray the whole living room like last time!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've perfected my technique: angle, towel, surgical precision.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: We'll see about that... I'm keeping an eye on my new tablecloth, you've been warned.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Promise, not a single drop will escape. And if it does, I'll take care of the cleanup.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Perfect, that'll be the official proof that you truly master the art of the sparkling pop!

meaning: bruit d'un coup violent, d'une chute, d'un corps qui s'écrase.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Romain, you're walking too close to the edge, be careful, it looks like an ice rink in this weather!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Come on, Lucy, you know me, I can stay upright even balancing on one leg!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: How much do you want to bet you'll end up with soaked jeans before you've gone ten meters?

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Watch out, I'm taking on the challenge! Watch closely, I'm going straight without...

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [splash]! That's a win for the sidewalk, not for you!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Alright, you win... Admit it, with style, it's still a little less humiliating, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I manage to cross this courtyard without getting dirty, it'll be a miracle—look at those puddles!

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Oh Claire, you're underestimating the sneakiness of wet cobblestones—one of them is bound to try to trap you.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh no, my new sneakers... Okay, maximum focus, I'm going on tiptoe.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Watch out for the big hole just to the left... [splash]! Too late, that one got you good!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, it's official, I'm going to patent the foggy-sneaker—want to see the effect?

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: With a demonstration like that, you should be invited to the next Mud Olympics!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, d'origine métallique ou produit par des gouttes d'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The sky has really darkened; it's like the day is stretching on endlessly.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Makes you want to pull out an old novel and wrap up in a blanket, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, wait... did you hear that little "[plip]" behind us?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Maybe the window is letting a few drops through...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That would explain the dampness we feel in the room.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Let's go check, before the couch turns into an improvised pool!

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: I feel like there's always something weird going on in this old kitchen, don't you think, Max?

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Wait, listen... [plip]... Did you hear that too or am I just getting paranoid?

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: No, I definitely caught the sound this time, it seems like it keeps happening regularly.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: These kinds of little mysteries always add a bit of suspense to the evening.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we'll be going on a treasure hunt without even meaning to.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Or at least hunting for the source of the puzzle!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, d'origine métallique ou produit par des gouttes d'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: If the thunder starts up again, we'll feel like we're in an old horror movie!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With this atmosphere and the rain pounding, we're really getting the full experience, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wait, do you hear that noise? It's coming from the sink, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it's been going [drip drop] for five minutes, I bet you wouldn't even notice!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: My mind was elsewhere, but now, there's no way to miss it…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between the storm and this impromptu concert, we're really being spoiled tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you hear that [drip drop], like the rain dancing on the gutter?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and it's always right when everything gets quiet in the house.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I really like this kind of atmosphere, it makes me want to settle in with a good book.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true, it's soothing, especially when it's gray outside.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And it's the perfect time to make some hot chocolate.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Great idea, I'll get the mugs—time for a cozy break!

meaning: petit bruit ponctuel, d'origine métallique ou produit par des gouttes d'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We really should think about fixing the kitchen faucet...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I’ve thought about it too! Actually, it seems like it gets worse every night.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, if you pay attention, you’ll hear that famous [drip drop] coming from the pipe.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, now that you mention it, it’s almost rhythmic.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It’s the kind of thing that follows you into your dreams if you don’t do something about it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I promise, I’ll take care of it tomorrow before it becomes my new alarm clock!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Hey, do you hear that strange noise coming from the bedroom?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll turn off the music... Oh yeah, now that you mention it, it's subtle but it keeps happening.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I thought it was the wind at first, but all the windows are closed.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Couldn't it be a pot moving on the stove?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Listen... it sounds exactly like [drip drop], right after the fridge starts up.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I'll take a look behind the counter, just to see if there's a damp surprise hiding back there.

meaning: bruit de coups, de chocs.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, Thomas, this plan makes no sense, I think we put the shelf on backwards.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, don't freak out, look, the piece with the little holes goes on the left, it's clear on the diagram.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: OK, but if it doesn't hold this time, I'm getting Grandpa's toolbox.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Do what you want, but if you break a board, you're the one explaining it to your mom.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, let's do this... *[clink clank]*... There we go, it's done, it's finally fitted together right!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: If the bookshelf is still standing tomorrow, I'll make you pancakes, I promise!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Honestly, the storm doesn’t seem like it wants to calm down tonight…

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: Did you notice? With every gust, I hear a little “[plink plonk]” behind the couch!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: That kind of repeated noise doesn’t really reassure me…

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: If you ask me, we should take a look—it might help us avoid any nasty surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Let’s just hope we don’t find the vase broken this time!

dialogue.speaker: Victor
dialogue.text: If it’s the wind behind all this, it’s really putting on a show tonight!

meaning: bruit ponctuel sonore.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: If the drawing starts on time, I'm really going to believe in my luck tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Is your lucky charm on the table? You never know, sometimes it works.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Of course! But they're taking their sweet time, as usual. Never on time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, listen, [ding]! There it is, that's the signal they're about to announce the numbers.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Finally! My fingers have been crossed for five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here we go, get ready to jump for joy, you never know!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Louis, do you know if the meeting document ended up somewhere at your place?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: I just searched through all my folders, nothing in sight, it's strange.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can't wait to see it arrive, this file is really keeping us waiting.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Wait, [ping], something just popped up; let me take a quick look.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope this is finally the right one, the suspense is killing me.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Exactly, the file just landed, we can finally make some progress for once!

meaning: Bruit de chute d'un objet qui s'écrase au sol ou s'enfonce dans l'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, the pond hasn’t changed, but I bet it’s even deeper than before.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: With all the rain we’ve had these past few days, I wouldn’t be surprised.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I found a perfect pebble, want to see if I can skip it all the way to the reeds?

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Go ahead, show me if you’ve still got it. I’ve got one too, flatter than yours!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch out, here we go… not too bad for a start!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Mine’s going to do better, listen… [plop].

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This spot reminds me of our childhood adventures, right here by the pond.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, do you remember how we used to throw stones to impress the ducks?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll pick one up, just to remember how it feels.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Go on, live up to your reputation as the champion thrower!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There, look... [plop], right in the middle!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You haven't lost a thing, you're even more accurate than before!

meaning: bruit léger et ponctuel, produit notamment par une chute dans l'eau ou par un saut hors de l'eau.
bruit d'une petite détonation.
bruit mat d'un corps qui s'écrase.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: If you want to avoid melting on the spot, an impromptu dip in the lake is the best solution!

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Especially with this weather, it's almost a crime not to jump in.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Plus, the old dock is still standing—it’s just waiting for us!

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: I bet you’ll never dare to jump first, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Get ready to be amazed, watch me closely…

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: And there you go, a little [splash] to mark the big moments of courage!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I bet I can spot a duck on the shore before you do.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, listen to that [splash]! Something just moved near the reeds.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Every time you try to distract me, something actually happens.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's the magic of the lake—always unpredictable.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you think it was a frog or maybe a curious fish?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Judging by how fast it was, I bet it was an adventurous frog.

meaning: bruit léger et ponctuel, produit notamment par une chute dans l'eau ou par un saut hors de l'eau.
bruit d'une petite détonation.
bruit mat d'un corps qui s'écrase.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Oh, look near the reeds, there's something moving.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: It must be the little fish, they always come as soon as there's a bit of sunshine.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I hope I'll be able to spot them without scaring them away…

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Go slowly, the ground is really soft around here.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Ouch, my shoe slipped... [splash]! That wasn't supposed to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Olivier
dialogue.text: Well, now the fish are going to tell their side of the story!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, there are tiny frogs on the bank, it's so cute.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Do you think they'll jump into the water if we get really close, really slowly?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like they're watching us... Oh, the biggest one is hesitating to move.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: There it goes, it jumped — [splash]! Right between the lily pads.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That was fast, I didn't think it would go that far!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That little leap almost made me want to try too, but I think I'd just sink straight down.

meaning: bruit de fredonnement d'un air de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Once again, I catch myself tapping on the table as if I’m conducting an invisible orchestra.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That rhythm really seems to follow you around—it adds some atmosphere while we work.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: The worst part is, I can’t get that tune out of my head, but I just can’t remember the title.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Want to try playing it with a bit of percussion on your mug? Who knows, maybe it’ll ring a bell.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Alright, I’ll improvise… but you can’t make fun of me if I go all over the place!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look, it’s more like this: [plink plink], [plink plink]… it’s like the melody is coming to life in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh, that old piano in the corner reminds me so much of my grandmother's living room.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Are you still thinking about her famous Sunday morning melody?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yes, you know, it went something like "[plink plonk] [plink plonk]"—a bit wobbly, but so comforting!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can almost hear the cups clinking together just from that!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If only this piano could talk, it would have some juicy stories to tell.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And probably a few homemade jam secrets too!

meaning: bruit sonore, ponctuel et discret, produit notamment par une petite détonation, une légère explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look what I found at the bottom of the drawer—you'd almost think it was lost forever.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh wow, is that the old metal box you were talking about? Want to see what's inside?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Of course! I press on the lid and... [pop]... there, it still opens perfectly.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That mechanism is still just as reliable, even after all these years.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: When I think about how I used to keep my marbles in there, it makes me feel nostalgic.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Makes you want to hide a few secret treasures in it again, just for fun.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look what I found at the back of the cupboard: this little jar of homemade jam.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Seriously? How old is that one? Even the label is gone!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No idea, but the urge to taste adventure is just too strong.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Open it up, if it smells right it'll remind me of snacks at grandma's.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [pop]! There we go, the lid finally gave in.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Ah, that little sound, it gives me confidence. Come on, first spoonful!

meaning: bruit de plongeon.
bruit produit par un pistolet à air comprimé ou par une arme à feu munie d'un silencieux.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [splash]! Couldn't you have jumped in a bit more quietly, honestly?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: That's because I always go for the big show!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like the lake gave you a special welcome—admit it, you didn't see that coming.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Exactly, it woke me up right away—pretty effective after a morning like this.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm going to try diving in, but I bet I'll make less of a splash than you.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Go on, show me what you've got, Mr. Calm!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Watch me, Paul, I'm going for the big jump off the board!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, if you do better than your spin yesterday, I’ll bow down!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Get ready, I’m going all out this time!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: And then... [splash]! You totally soaked all the lounge chairs by the pool!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Admit it, you weren’t expecting such a spectacular finish.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With an entrance like that, even the rubber ducks ran away!

meaning: bruit d'un corps qui plonge, qui tombe ou qui est jeté dans l'eau.
bruit d'un corps qui tombe, qui s'affaisse plus ou moins lourdement.
bruit de ressac de la mer.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Watch me closely, you're about to see a legendary jump!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, the suspense is unbearable, I hope you haven't forgotten your secret technique.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? Watch out, it's going to be spectacular!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Come on, brave one, the diving board is waiting for you to show what you're made of!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Take a deep breath... and... [splash]!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That was perfect! It looked like you turned into a dolphin.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Look at that water sparkling, it's been calling to me for a while now!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I don't know if I dare jump from the edge... it's higher than it looks.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Lucas, if you close your eyes and take a deep breath, you'll forget everything!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: What if I mess up in front of everyone? Promise me you'll follow me.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: On three, we'll go together. But you really have to jump this time, no excuses! Ready?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm breathing in... I'm jumping... [splash]!

meaning: bruit de fredonnement d'un air de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The shop windows shining and this melody—it feels like the street is putting on an impromptu show for us!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Ah, it sweeps me away, listen: [plink plink tra-la-la], even my feet are following the rhythm on their own!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful if you start spinning around, the passersby will start filming you!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That would liven things up a bit, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At this rate, you’ll end up starting a group dance without even realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: As long as nobody calls the groove police, I’m good!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’ve had a melody stuck in my head for ages! I almost started clapping my hands on the bus, can you believe it?

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Wait, isn’t that the one they played at the neighborhood party Saturday night? It was so catchy!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, that’s it! I just can’t remember the chorus or the singer… It’s driving me crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Try humming it, maybe it’ll come back to me. Even just the beginning—sometimes that unlocks everything!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh man, it just makes my head start bobbing on its own! But I’m stuck, nothing’s working.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes, I’ll improvise: [plunk plunk la la la]! If that doesn’t help us remember, I’ll hand in my detective badge.

meaning: bruit sonore, ponctuel et discret, produit notamment par une petite détonation, une légère explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, I found this old metal box at the back of the cupboard.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, do you think there's still something interesting inside after all this time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm trying to open it... *[pop]* There we go, the lid just gave way!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, it was tougher than I thought it would be!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you want to see if these old buttons are still in good shape?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's go, maybe we'll stumble upon a little forgotten treasure!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [plop]! That little sound is proof that my experiment isn't a flop.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, you really have mastered the art of sonic suspense!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You're the one who gave me the idea, with your amateur chemist story.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Hey, I know real talent when I see it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But don't you find it fascinating, these kinds of little unpredictable reactions?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it adds a bit of magic to our quiet afternoon!

meaning: bruit ponctuel et léger, produit par un choc, par une petite détonation.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, Antoine, there’s a corn kernel stuck under the table from yesterday’s party.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it’s definitely a popcorn survivor—this one made it through all the sweeping!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet if we push it, it’ll roll all the way to the wall without stopping.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Want to try? If you succeed, I promise I won’t leave anything lying around on my desk anymore!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This is the moment of truth… Here it goes!

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Listen to that little [pop]! Mission accomplished, corn-tossing champion.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: No need for dessert, I have something that's going to change everything.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: You're piquing my curiosity—is it a sweet surprise?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Even better, I found some walnuts from the garden that we can crack together.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Great idea! Hand me the nutcracker, I'm up for the challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Here you go, watch your fingers, the shell is tough.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: There we go, that's it, [pop], another one down!

meaning: bruit soudain d'un coup ou d'un projectile; bruit d'un détonation.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.
bruit d'essoufflement d'un moteur.
bruit produit avec ses lèvres par un fumeur.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With everything we bought, the living room is going to look like a real playroom!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Just wait until you see what I do with these foam balls, you're going to be impressed.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Be careful where you throw them, last time you almost broke grandma's vase.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: I promise, this time I'm aiming for the box, watch closely!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [thud]! See, you did it again—you managed to launch the cushion instead of the ball...

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: But that cushion has an unpredictable trajectory, it's impossible to control!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Careful not to press too hard on the cap, Lamine, it's already struggling to stay on!

dialogue.speaker: Lamine
dialogue.text: No way, look, there's still a bit of space, I can push it in a bit more. You just have to go for it.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: If you say so... I’d rather keep my distance, you never know with you!

dialogue.speaker: Lamine
dialogue.text: Just a little more, and there we go... [pop]!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: What did you just do? Now we've got it everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Lamine
dialogue.text: Oh no... Well, next time, you’re in charge, alright!

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur, par un mécanisme.
bruit de fredonnement d'un air de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: How about we finally put that old Solex to the test? It hasn't moved from the garage in ages—look at all that dust.

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Careful, it's probably going to grumble a bit at first—did you see the state of the spark plugs?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: As long as you promise not to spill oil everywhere like last time, I'll let you have the crank!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Get ready, it's going to shake. Here goes...

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [putt], [putt], [putt]... The rascal wants to live!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Did you see that? This old trickster just wants to eat up the miles!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Eric, did you feel it when I turned the key? It started right up with a weird [thump], [thump], [thump], I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I saw your face, you almost bumped into the steering wheel!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: No but seriously, it's the first time the old Renault has surprised me like that.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: She must want to remind us that your car is still full of surprises!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: That's true, she's never short on imagination... With her, every trip comes with its share of excitement.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Come on, we'll keep an eye on her, but let's keep the adventure going—challenge accepted!

meaning: bruit d'une batterie d'orchestre.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I still get chills just thinking about the solo during the second song yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was crazy, it felt like every instrument had its own little story to tell, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely! At one point, I could almost feel the stage shaking, especially when it went… [boom tchak], right behind the bass!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That exact part! I felt transported somewhere else, it was almost unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The vibrations followed me all the way into the subway, I was still smiling!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s like those notes want to cling to us, even long after the concert.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And then, right before the chorus, I heard a little boy behind me going "[boom tss]" with his hands, he was really into it!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Oh, I saw that kid too! He definitely got the vibe, for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Anyway, it put everyone in a good mood in our row, we couldn't stop smiling.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Totally, just for moments like that, these kinds of nights make all the difference.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should plan another concert, see if we stumble on another gem like that.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Count me in, I'll keep my ears wide open for the next opportunity!

meaning: bruit d'un coup sonore, plus ou moins violent.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Bet you I can bounce this marble all the way to the back of the box on my first try?

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: If you pull it off, dessert's on me tonight! But careful, last time you barely missed.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Exactly, I’ve perfected my technique. Watch the trajectory closely, it’s going to be surprising!

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: Go on, impress me. I’m holding my breath…

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: And there! [boing]! It’s right in the center, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Yanis
dialogue.text: Incredible, you really amazed me! Dessert for Clara then.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: [pong]! I told you my racket had gotten its magic back.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Magic or not, you just sent the ball straight into the flowerpot—nice going, maestro.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: If you manage to get it out without knocking over my cactus, I'll give you a bonus point.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Deal, but watch out—next time, you're the one crawling under the table.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Not scared at all, I've got the agility of a cat—you'll see for yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Go on, show us your skills while I keep an eye on the cactus!

meaning: bruit de fredonnement d'un air de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Ah, that melody in the café, it's been looping in my head ever since earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: It's the kind of tune that really fits the vibe, don't you think? Even the customers seem to be keeping the beat.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yeah, look, the waitress is nodding her head while serving coffee. It's honestly contagious.

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely, it's like everyone is picking up on something invisible.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [pom-pom], [pom-pom]... you know exactly what I mean!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Now you've made me want to snap my fingers too, thanks a lot!

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: If we add a few more balloons, it’s really going to look like a real birthday dance floor!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and with these lights, I almost want to bring out the disco ball!

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Honestly, all that’s missing now is a catchy little tune.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: *[pom-pom]* *[pom-pom]*... The decorations make me want to improvise a cheerful tune!

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: It’s official, you’re stealing the spotlight from the playlist tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’m saving myself just for the big choruses!

meaning: bruit de claquement de lèvres d'un fumeur de pipe.
bruit de bulles qui éclatent à la surface d'un aliment en train de cuire.
bruit de moteur, notamment d'une petite embarcation.
bruit produit par un pet.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: [puff]... This pipe always gives me that little moment of pause, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: It looks like you could meditate for hours just enjoying that calm cloud.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: It's almost a ceremony, really. I love listening to the leaves rustle around while I savor the moment.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: You know, you look like an old sage with all that focus. It really commands respect.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: Ah, if only the world could slow down a bit more often.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: All the more reason not to leave here until the last evening mist!

dialogue.speaker: Lucien
dialogue.text: With your pipe, it feels like we're sitting around an old campfire, François.

dialogue.speaker: François
dialogue.text: It's the ritual that takes me back years, I admit.

dialogue.speaker: Lucien
dialogue.text: It looks like your whole face changes when you take a puff, it's almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: François
dialogue.text: You notice things like that, do you? Wait, listen closely this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucien
dialogue.text: [pop]... there, that sound, it sets the mood like the first drop on the ash.

dialogue.speaker: François
dialogue.text: You'd think that little noise could silence a whole room.

meaning: bruit d'une trompe d'automobile, d'un klaxon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that bike weaving between the cars—makes you wonder if they even know the rules.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: If I were them, I’d never venture out like that in front of all these impatient drivers.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you remember the time a car backed up right in front of me at the crosswalk? I thought my heart was going to stop.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Oh, watch out behind you… [honk honk]! See, that’s exactly what I was talking about.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That made me jump—they really have some nerve on this street, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: I’d bet the next weird noise will come from that same intersection again.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: It's still crazy how many people are outside despite this gray sky, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: People must really want to get out, even the rain isn't stopping them today!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Look at that bike over there weaving through, he's going to get himself in trouble if he keeps that up.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Watch out, there's a bus coming up behind him, things could get heated.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: [honk honk]! Ah, maybe he got the message this time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It looks like on this avenue, everyone has decided to play their own tune.

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that old locomotive in the photo, it really looks like another era.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's crazy, my dad told me he used to take that train to go to his grandmother's house.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
