dialogue.text: I bet it must have made an impressive noise when it started up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and all the steam escaping, that must have been something to see.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, I can just imagine the famous [choo-choo], [choo-choo] of the train fading into the mist.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I love it, you do a great impression! You can almost hear the train passing right in front of us.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Look, Agnès! If I press here with my hand and go "[poof-choo]" like this, it almost looks like it comes to life, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Agnès
dialogue.text: Oh wow, you really haven't changed, always ready to do your wacky impressions!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: But admit it, it livens things up a bit, especially on an afternoon like this.

dialogue.speaker: Agnès
dialogue.text: I have to admit it makes me smile, even if you attract curious looks from the neighbors.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: All the better, the day could use a little whimsy!

dialogue.speaker: Agnès
dialogue.text: Keep going, you could almost put on a show in the village square on market day!

meaning: bruit produit le plus souvent par un objet manufacturé.
bruit de trompe, de trompette.
bruit de couinement produit par un engin manufacturé, notamment un jouet.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I managed to put together Maxime's bike last night, he didn't want to let go of it this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Amir
dialogue.text: He must really love it, especially if it's the one with the rocket decoration.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Yes, and he spent half an hour riding around the house with it.

dialogue.speaker: Amir
dialogue.text: That reminds me of when my cousin used to ride all over the neighborhood on his little racer.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait, look over there, the little one with the blue hat, he's coming toward us at full speed!

dialogue.speaker: Amir
dialogue.text: Oh yeah... listen, [honk honk], there's no way people don't turn around when he goes by!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Look, that's Mathieu speeding in with his colorful bike!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and he keeps pressing it, listen to that [honk honk] echoing through the whole park!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to dig out my old bell from the attic.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: I bet it made a pretty unique sound too.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: It would have competed with his bike, no doubt about it.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: If we organize a sound race, I'm signing it up right away!

meaning: bruit produit le plus souvent par un objet manufacturé.
bruit de trompe, de trompette.
bruit de couinement produit par un engin manufacturé, notamment un jouet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this, [honk honk], and the scooter moves all by itself!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: But it looks even more alive than yours from two years ago!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's the turbo model, the little update that changes everything.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Can you imagine the neighbors watching you zoom by?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm sure I'll become the terror of the neighborhood with my speedster!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: If I ever see a scooter that proud, I'll know who's driving it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, did you see that weird bike that just went by with that kind of shiny horn on the front?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think the guy had a pretty unusual accessory, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I feel like I'm in a circus parade, seriously. It's a nice change from the usual!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: He pressed it like this, and then, [honk honk]! The whole terrace turned around at once.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good thing he wasn't doing that on every street corner, we would've thought we were dreaming.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Admit it, you would've wanted to try it too! Little things like that add a bit of fun to the day.

meaning: bruit de trompe, de trompette.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Look at that crowd arriving—they look like they want to liven up everything in their path!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Did you hear that ‘[honk]’ in the middle of the group? That’s exactly the kind of detail that makes me smile every time.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: We’re definitely not going to be bored. Even the pigeons look like they want to join the party.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: You’re almost making me want to improvise a few dance steps on the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: With the atmosphere here, no one will mind—in fact, they’ll love it.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Alright, if the rain holds off a bit, I promise I’ll join you in the first conga line!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: What a racket in this street today, it makes me want to dance on the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The neighbors on their balconies must think they're at a carnival, it's a real impromptu party.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: You know, it reminds me of Sundays in the square, when everyone followed the music?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I can be louder than the marching band, listen to this performance!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Cover your ears, here comes the big moment: [honk], [honk]!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: What talent! Next step: concert on the big stage, for sure.

meaning: Exclamation exprimant un bruit sourd de chute.
Siège bas, gros coussin capitonné.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think I can reach the book on the top shelf without a stool?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you go for it, at least I'm ready to catch the aftermath!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Watch closely, I'm attempting the Sophie-style acrobatics.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ouch, careful—and there, [thud]! Right onto the rug…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oops, ninja mission failed. Did you see that flying leap?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I saw it, I almost applauded! Good thing the rug softens those improvised stunts.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think you can land softly this time, Paul?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: If I don't end up sprawled out on the ground again, that'll already be an achievement!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Try to aim for the cobblestones and not the curb like earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Watch closely, this is the last-chance jump.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed, you're heading straight for it!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: And now... [poof], I became one with the ground—such grace!

meaning: bruit de couinement produit par un object manufacturé, notamment un jouet.
pour exprimer une mort brutale.

dialogue.speaker: Helene
dialogue.text: Look what I found in the drawer: [squeak]! Impossible to resist this kind of little discovery.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Wow, you really have a knack for stumbling on things like that while tidying up!

dialogue.speaker: Helene
dialogue.text: I swear, between two old batteries and a washcloth, there was this survivor.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: It's the kind of thing that makes you smile for no reason, like a madeleine for your ears.

dialogue.speaker: Helene
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if it started disappearing again, every year like magic?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: No wonder we always keep a bit of a child's spirit, with surprises like that hidden at home!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I still wonder how this colorful thing ended up here on the couch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, that? Maxime left it lying around after his play session last night.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like this thing has survived quite a few adventures.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, if you press right in the middle, something funny always happens.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, [squeak]! I’ll never get tired of that, the sound is just too contagious.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It always attracts the whole gang—even the cat wants to join in as soon as he hears it.

meaning: bruit d'une trompe d'automobile, d'un klaxon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet you we'll run into something improbable again while grocery shopping—you know me!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Given how things have been going since this morning, I wouldn't be surprised if it happens before we even reach the market square.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, what do you want to bet? A chocolate bar if you lose?

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: [wah wah] There you go, I think someone just signaled the start of our adventure. That's a sign, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With you, everything turns into a game—even the sounds on the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: And who knows, if we run into a band, I'm demanding a rematch for the chocolate bar.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: The city woke up in full-on traffic jam mode, you should've seen the chaos earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Salim
dialogue.text: Picture me squeezing between two taxis, and then: [honk honk], out of nowhere! I thought I was about to take off.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: That kind of surprise wakes you up better than an espresso.

dialogue.speaker: Salim
dialogue.text: Didn't even have time to complain, everyone was looking at me like I owned the street.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: At least you became the morning's main attraction, it's the sidewalk's highlight minute.

dialogue.speaker: Salim
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm wearing a neon vest... Or a shield, with this traffic!

meaning: bruit d'une chute plus ou moins lourde; bruit d'un coup, d'un choc assourdi, d'une explosion sourde, d'une détonation.
bruit de moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? [boom], it made the whole floor shake!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It gave me chills, seriously! Do you think it's that old shelf again?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Could be, it was barely standing this morning...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe we should go take a look before we find books in the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I hope no plants went flying this time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With our luck, we're going to have to get the mop out...

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You’ll never believe what happened in the basement this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Oh, this is starting off strong! Tell me everything, I can tell it’s going to be worth it.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I was trying to bring down the old boxes from the attic, but with the darkness and that slippery floor…

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Wait, you didn’t unleash your legendary clumsiness again, did you?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Let’s just say my feet didn’t quite handle the last step…

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Oh boy, and suddenly… [thud]! The whole basement must have shaken, right?

meaning: bruit de fredonnement d'un air de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, as soon as I hear someone mention the beach, that song pops into my head.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Wait, which one? There are quite a few that remind me of our summers there.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The one where you always did imaginary solos at the wheel, remember?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Oh yes, [boom ba ba], [boom ba ba]... I can still see it playing on repeat in the car!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, just thinking about it makes me want to drive with the wind in my hair.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Promise, next road trip we’ll blast it again, no question!

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: [boom ba ba], [boom ba ba]... This park bench always seems to amplify that kind of thing in my head, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That was just what was missing to go along with the birds, you know! It instantly sets the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: It’s crazy how sometimes a simple detail can trigger a whole musical parade inside your head.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It’s contagious, watch out! I think it’s already spreading in there.

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: Wait until it turns into an improvised dance routine—who knows how far it’ll go!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we’ll start a new trend in the neighborhood…

meaning: bruit d'une batterie d'orchestre.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You know what? Yesterday, I discovered a band on stage that really blew me away!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Seriously? What kind of songs were they playing to get you that excited?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It was a mix of funk and groove, with a beat that just wouldn't let you sit still for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can picture the drummer going wild with those [boom tss] beats, it must have been intense!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Totally! It was impossible to resist—I ended up dancing without even realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, you're making me really want to check out those electrifying concerts.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Yesterday, in Baptiste's basement, the session was absolutely wild, you should've seen the vibe!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Seriously? And did you try that improvised piece you've been talking about for weeks?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Yeah, we jumped in without a safety net, and at one point, everyone synced up—it was electric.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Ah, I can already picture you getting into the groove... [boom tss], [boom tss], everyone must've been so into it!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Totally, even the neighbors applauded at the end—we didn't expect that at all!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Next time, there's no way I'm missing it—I want to feel the energy just like you all did!

meaning: bruit produit par la bouche pour appeler une personne, pour exciter.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey, take a look at that ball stuck in the tree over there! Do you think you can get it?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Hmm, you really want me to climb? That’s not a sure thing with my legendary clumsiness.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Come on, it’s your chance to outdo yourself, go for it! I’ll catch you if you slip.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You promise you won’t film? Because if I fall, I don’t want to end up famous for the wrong reasons.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No camera, just me cheering you on! I’ll put down the bag and get ready.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes, I’m climbing… [grunt] [grunt], Lucas, keep a close eye on me!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Did you see how many stalls there are today, Lucas? I lost sight of you between the cheeses and the jams!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm behind the big table with the flowers, but there's no way I can spot you in this crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: *[toot] [toot]* Look toward the little square, near the wicker baskets!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, over there! I just spotted your red jacket thanks to that sound signal.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You're handling yourself like a pro in the jungle of the market, I see!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's the call of adventure... Or melted cheese, if I have to choose.

meaning: bruit produit par un pet.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear that? A real [creak] breaking the silence—totally unexpected in this living room!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Looks like even the armchair wants to join the party... or maybe it has its own moods too.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If the furniture starts putting on a show, we won't need a TV anymore!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: This is turning into an impromptu theater—watch out for surprises during the next movie.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I just hope it doesn't start a whole symphony, because we're definitely not ready for that.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At least we're not bored—this couch has some personality!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just at that moment, while everyone was listening carefully, we heard a long [pfffft] echo through the room.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I was having a hard time keeping a straight face, especially when I saw Paul's expression!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And I was trying to focus on my pen so I wouldn't laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's crazy how that can lighten the mood, even if no one says anything.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: After that, the meeting had a completely different tone, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally, it was like everyone was in on it without saying a word.

meaning: bruit d'une détonation, d'une explosion, de l'orage.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Look at that sky—it looks like it's about to swallow the whole city.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I've got chills down my spine; those clouds aren't bringing anything nice.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: I feel like if we don't move now, we're going to end up soaked to the bone.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ouch! Did you hear that [boom] that shook the whole neighborhood?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: My heart just skipped a beat—I wasn't expecting that!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Get to shelter, champ, or you're in for a cold shower for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Look at those big clouds, Paul, I bet it’s going to rain before we even reach the end of the path.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? [boom]! Feels like we’re in an old adventure movie.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: My heart skipped a beat, seriously! These country walks are taking an unexpected turn.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: We might be better off taking shelter under that big oak tree—this promises some surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: No way I’m ending up like a drenched heroine, I’m heading to the barn!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Perfect, I’m right behind you—we’ll get a free show, big screen style.

meaning: bruit qui ressemble à celui d'un pet ; peut être un tarade.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, if I concentrate hard enough, I think I could hear the cat snoring from here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, watch out… [pffft] ! Well, that was the old chair, it complains every time I stretch.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Your chair has personality! That sound is almost contemporary art.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If only it could be displayed in a museum, we'd become stars of sonic furniture.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Imagine the guide explaining the symphony of creaking seats, that would be epic.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm going to start recording every acoustic feat—who knows, it might start a trend!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Arnaud, do you think we’ll manage to get the dresser through this tiny hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: If we lift it properly on one side, it should fit. Hold it a bit higher, I’ll try to push.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wait… careful… [pffft]… Oh, it’s stuck!

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? The dresser is seriously protesting.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It’s got a personality, that’s for sure. This old beast is almost alive.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: Next time, we’ll roll out the red carpet for it so we don’t offend it any more!

meaning: bruit signalant l'envol ou la disparition d'un oiseau ou d'un insecte.
bruit de ronflement d'un dormeur en phase expiratoire.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look at that robin, it's as still as a statue on the bench.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Yeah, it looks like it's watching us too. It's really close.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I barely raised my hand and... [flutter], it slipped away behind the bushes!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Did you see how fast it darted off? It doesn't give the curious any chance!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It seems like even the birds here know how to avoid the paparazzi.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Come on, let's keep going with our urban safari—surely we'll run into a cooperative model eventually!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that, there’s a real dance of wings around the benches today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: They all seem drawn to the remains of your croissant, I think they’re thanking you in their own way.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This one is coming awfully close, do you think it would dare join us on the backrest?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hey, I once knew a sparrow that almost ate out of my sister’s hand—it was like a little tamed creature!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, it turned its head toward us… it looks like it’s thinking.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Careful, it’s getting ready… [flutter], gone behind the hedge!

meaning: marque un départ ou une disparition rapide.
pour marquer l'indifférence, le mépris, le refus.
bruit produit par la bouche pour appeler une personne.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Hey, do you happen to have an extra pair of hands today? I’ve got a big problem.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, sounds like trouble—tell me what’s going on.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: The tomato sauce exploded in the kitchen and it absolutely has to be clean before my mom gets home.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Already? Don’t worry, I’ll grab the sponge!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You’re really saving my skin here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You got it! And off I go [whoosh], straight to the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Once again, I should have brought my camera—this ginger cat only shows up when I don't have it!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You know, with him, you have to expect anything. He's probably already watching you from some hiding spot.

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: I'm sure he's secretly watching us, just behind that hedge.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait a second... [purr] — did you see that? He slipped away before we could even blink!

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: It's incredible, I'm starting to think that cat is a magician.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Next time, I bet he'll be waiting for you right on the roof, ready to pull his little trick again.

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui fuse.
bruit de respiration d'un dormeur.
bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit d'un mécanisme à air comprimé.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [pssh] There we go, the homemade scrub is ready. The whole bathroom is going to smell like eucalyptus.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You're giving a real spa a run for its money! Are you planning to make this a Wednesday night tradition?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you survive today's session without complaining, it just might be possible!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, but I like a little change now and then, and besides, it's all natural, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, everything's made with ingredients from the pantry. Next time, I'm going to try a citrus version.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let's just hope you don't put lemon peels in the bath too...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you want to try the lemonade I made? I kept it nice and cold.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'd love to! It's been a long time since I've had homemade.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope it kept all its fizz. Wait, I'll grab the bottle.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Open it slowly, or it might make a big [pop] on the table!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I promise, I'll be careful. Here you go, a big glass for you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Thanks, it smells amazing! The bubbles are perfect.

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui fuse.
bruit de respiration d'un dormeur.
bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit d'un mécanisme à air comprimé.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen to that [pssh], that's the guarantee my bike will make it all the way up the hill!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Are you still pumping up your tires right before we leave?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I prefer to play it safe—last time, I almost had to walk up the hill.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: In any case, you really make a ceremony out of it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You always have to respect your gear, especially when it goes everywhere with you.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Noted! I'll let you finish your passionate cyclist ritual—the summit is waiting for us!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to that little '[psst]', I'm opening the lemonade! Nothing more refreshing in this heat.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Thanks, that's perfect timing! I was just craving something cool.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Shall we sit out on the terrace to enjoy a bit of sunshine?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Great idea! And the breeze is nice today too.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We could even bring out the deck chairs—it'll feel like a vacation.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Perfect, all we'll need is a sun umbrella and it'll really feel like it!

meaning: Onomatopée évoquant le bruit d'un liquide qui fuse.
Atomiseur.
Dose de liquide atomisé.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Have you ever tasted my grandmother's homemade lemonade? Apparently, she has a secret.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: No, never! I'm curious, will you let me try a glass?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Get ready... *[psshh]* There you go, it fizzes as soon as you open it.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Oh, that sound almost makes me want to sip straight from the bottle!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait until you smell the lemon aroma, you'll see.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: If it tastes as good as it smells, I know I'll be asking for the recipe!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Looks like it's the perfect time to bring out the famous homemade lemonade, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: Oh yes, nothing better after that walk—I bet it's as refreshing as always!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look, I'm opening the bottle... *[psshh]* This is going to be so refreshing.

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: That little moment right before serving, it's almost a ritual!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Grab your glass, I'll pour you a nice fizzy serving.

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: With this, I feel ready for a second walk right away!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui jaillit, qui fuse.
bruit produit par une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit produit par une boisson gazeuse ou mousseuse.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: I pedaled like crazy, I’d give anything for a drink.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Check the cooler, there should be a can left at the bottom.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Perfect, here it is! Do you want to open it?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Careful, I’m pressing... [psshh]! That little moment always catches you off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: It reminds me of our trips to the lake, just the sound makes you want one.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Pass the cup, let’s share before it gets too warm!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look what I brought in the cooler!

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me there’s homemade lemonade?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yes, and it’s just waiting to be tasted. Do you want a glass?

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Of course! I was hoping you’d say that, especially after that long walk.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Careful, I’m opening the bottle...

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Ah, that [psshh], it makes me even thirstier!

meaning: pour mettre en fuite un animal, notamment un chat ou un chien.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I think our pie is attracting some new furry food lovers—look behind you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Whoa, it's getting dangerously close... [psst]! There, it got the message—what a little rascal.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It doesn't take much to make them back off, but they're never far away, those masters of stealth.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You'd think they're spying on us every time we have a picnic—I've already spotted a second watcher under the bench!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If that's how it is, next time I'm bringing a cheese dome—it does double duty.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Perfect! Between the dome and my technique, nothing will get away... except maybe a few crumbs!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh look, there’s Félix prowling on the windowsill again.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He must be hoping we left something out for him to nibble on.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With that innocent look, he thinks we don’t see him!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He’s clever, but my snack crumbs are off limits.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: A little intervention is needed, or he’ll start feeling right at home!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: *[psst] [psst] [psst]* Come on, time to go home, Félix!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui fuse.
bruit de respiration d'un dormeur.
bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit d'un mécanisme à air comprimé.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Pierre, look, your bike looks all soft at the back.

dialogue.speaker: Peter
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I think the tire lost air again. Hand me the pump, please.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Here you go... [psshh] ! Oops, it escaped all at once, did you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: Peter
dialogue.text: Wow, you almost managed to blow the dust off the sidewalk with that one!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Guess I’m a bit heavy-handed today.

dialogue.speaker: Peter
dialogue.text: Good thing you’re here, otherwise I’d be riding on pancakes every day!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: You see, even after all these years, the old pressure cooker still works wonders. Dinner will be ready faster than expected.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I hope it doesn't explode this time! Do you remember last year?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, but this time I've set the valve properly. I'm going to release a bit of pressure, hold on.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: There it is, that's the famous "[psshh]" moment that always makes me jump.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look at the steam escaping, it already smells like pot-au-feu all over the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Just for that, I want to grab the big ladle right now!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui jaillit, qui fuse.
bruit produit par une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit produit par une boisson gazeuse ou mousseuse.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wow, this bottle of lemonade gave me a hard time the whole way here, it's getting impatient in there!

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Let me handle it, I've got my tricks to keep it from going everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Still, go easy, you know how explosive it can be...

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: I'm turning it really gently... Here, listen, [pssst], it's just waking up enough!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ah, I saw that coming, but you really know how to build suspense!

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: After taming so many of these bottles, I could almost make it a circus act, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know what? I think it's time to take the lemonade out of the backpack.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Good idea, I'll grab the bottle… [psssst]! There we go, that's a great start, so refreshing!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Nothing beats that feeling when you're sitting in the grass with a nice cold drink.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And look, even the sun is on our side today.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's just hope the ants don't join us before the picnic is over.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If they do show up, I'll gladly share a little of my lemonade… but just a little!

meaning: bruit d'un gaz ou d'un liquide qui jaillit, qui fuse.
bruit produit par une locomotive à vapeur.
bruit produit par une boisson gazeuse ou mousseuse.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: When I pressed the siphon earlier, it made a big '[pshhht]', I thought it was going to explode!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? That woke me up instantly! Did you at least manage to get some whipped cream?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yes, but it's all over the countertop, not in the bowl...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Well, let's just say the kitchen needed a new sugary decoration!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: At this rate, we're going to turn this dessert into a work of abstract art.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: As long as we can eat it in the end, that's fine by me!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If we wait any longer, I think I'm literally going to turn into a cactus!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Look, the soda bottle has been sitting in the sun, it's been winking at me for ages.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I'm begging you, set it free! I can already feel the bubbles just thinking about the cap.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed it doesn't explode all over the tablecloth this time.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And now, suspense... [psshh]! You did it, master of foam.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Such skill! I promise, next time I'll try it with my eyes closed.

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement d'un appareil.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Emile, listen for a second, it's been going [pssh]… [pssh]… ever since you turned on the microwave!

dialogue.speaker: Emile
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I hope it doesn't burn my food again like last time.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It's true, that thing can really give you chills with its unpredictable reactions sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Emile
dialogue.text: I'm still keeping my hand on the door, you never know what might come out of a machine like that.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I bet one day it'll surprise us with an impromptu concert in the middle of the night.

dialogue.speaker: Emile
dialogue.text: As long as it doesn't wake me up like a temperamental alarm clock, I'm fine with it!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That strange sound again around here... It's really not normal at this hour.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You're right, it's starting to get intriguing. It started right after I turned on the machine, didn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, I thought it was the oven at first, but maybe I'm wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No, the oven is off... Maybe the coffee maker is having one of its random fits?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: No, this sounds more like a little "[pssh] [pssh] [pssh]" right next to the counter.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I think I see the microwave light blinking. Maybe that's the culprit after all!

meaning: pour encourager la miction.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at the line behind us, you'll regret it if you don't take advantage of this break now.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I don't know, I feel like everyone is listening, it totally blocks me…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, maybe this will help… listen: [psh psh] psh… You won't even notice the sounds around us anymore, you'll see.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Your thing is weird, but hey, whatever works!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, grandma's tricks never fail on bus rides.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If it works, next stop, coffee from the vending machine is on me!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Once again, Léon just stood in front of the bathroom doing nothing—it's mission impossible tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Oh no, is he giving you the nighttime block again? That’s really exhausting.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I tried dimming the lights, singing a little song... but he didn’t budge at all.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You know, with my niece, I come closer and just whisper "[pss pss]"—sometimes that helps her get started.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That’s surprising, but why not! I’ll try your trick during the next attempt.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Sometimes all it takes is a little unexpected trick to get things moving—good luck to both of you!

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement ou de sifflement produit par la bouche.
bruit de conversation à voix basse ou de marmonnement.
bruit de sifflement d'une balle d'arme à feu.
bruit de bourdonnement d'un appareil.
pour encourager la miction.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The tension in this waiting room keeps rising by the minute, don't you think, Hugo?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: For sure... You could almost hear a pin drop, everyone is so tense.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that man in the back, he's tapping on his watch every thirty seconds...

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: [psst psst], want to bet he'll end up sighing within two minutes?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'll take that bet, but I'm putting up my coffee from earlier!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, we're going to have suspense right up to the end here!

dialogue.speaker: Ahmed
dialogue.text: [psst psst], look discreetly behind you, but try to be subtle.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: What’s going on now? You’re making me feel like I’m being followed!

dialogue.speaker: Ahmed
dialogue.text: I’m pretty sure the supervisor has been watching us for ten minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh no, not him… I bet he’s figured out our scheme.

dialogue.speaker: Ahmed
dialogue.text: If he comes over, steer the conversation to the weather—it never fails.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You and your spy movie plans… I love it!

meaning: bruit du cri de l'hirondelle.
bruit de sifflement d'une balle d'arme à feu.
bruit d'un fluide qui fuse.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès, notamment une disparition soudaine.
sifflement bref destiné à attirer l'attentnion ou à appeler une personne ou un animal.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Look how the sky is starting to turn pink, this really is the most beautiful time to be here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen, just above us... [psst], [psst]! It sounds like they're dancing between the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: They're darting so quickly, they look like little black arrows.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's fascinating how they never stop moving, I could watch them for hours.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: With these lights, everything seems even more alive, even the shadows are dancing.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we stay quiet, maybe they'll come really close to us again.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at the sky just above the old sycamore, they're twirling like acrobats, those little ones.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: It's amazing how quickly they change direction, it's like they're dancing with the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Shh, listen... do you hear? [psst]... [psst]... this is my favorite moment, when they skim the rooftops.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: It really looks like they're drawing arabesques with just their wings and those almost secret little sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: A real choreography; even the clouds seem to stop and watch.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: I wish I could keep this picture in my mind for rainy days, it brings a lightness to the air.

meaning: bruit produit par le crachement.
bruit produit par les ratés d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what happened to me at the park this afternoon with my bag of pistachios!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, don't tell me you got into another shell-shooting contest?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes! Except this time, when I aimed for the trash can, a shell ended up landing on a jogger's shoe...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet he gave you a dirty look! How did you get out of that one?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I just pretended nothing happened and tossed another shell, and then it made a "[ptooey]" sound right as he walked by.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, you always pick the best moments to get noticed...

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Did you see that bench in the shade? Perfect spot for a snack break, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Absolutely, and I can finally take out this bag of pistachios that’s been sitting in my bag since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Haha, you’re on team pistachio! The way you do it always impresses me.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s a whole sport! Sometimes I try to go fast and it’s a disaster, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Look, if you do it in one go like this… [ptooey]… there you go, it never fails.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Alright, challenge accepted, but if I make a mess, you’re helping with the cleanup!

meaning: bruit produit par le crachement.
bruit produit par les ratés d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: *takes a sip, suddenly goes* [psst] ! Argh, that thing caught me off guard!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Whoa, looks like you didn't enjoy that... What hit you?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I grabbed the wrong bottle, and it was nothing like what I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It must be the bottle at the back of the fridge, right? It's looked suspicious since yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Well, there you go, I can confirm: that was a bad idea. I still have that weird taste in my mouth!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'll go grab a big glass of water to wash away that memory.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here, try this new ultra-spicy sauce, I bet neither of us can handle a spoonful!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, great... you're always challenging me with your weird stuff. Did you taste it yourself?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Not even. But apparently it's intense. Go on, you're the bravest!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, only because I'm crazy... (she dips the spoon). Oh wow, that's hot!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: So, what's the verdict? Is it worse than expected or bearable?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No way, [pfft]! It burns too much, you can keep your bet!

meaning: bruit produit par le crachement.
bruit produit par les ratés d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look what I found at the bottom of the cookie tin: licorice, those black squares you hate so much.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Oh wow, just the smell makes me wince. How much do you bet I can last longer than before?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You're on! But I want to see this. Go on, tough guy, show me what you're made of.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: *puts a square in his mouth then makes a funny face*... [ptooey]! Still just as disgusting, I really can't handle it...

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, you haven't improved at all! That still surprises me every time.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: You almost deserve a medal for that... but please, not one with licorice in it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see these stuffed black olives? I got them to try something different!

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: *bites into the olive* [ptooey]! Whoa, there's something really unusual in there!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, did you get the extra strong version or what?

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, it's like it explodes everywhere and it tingles your tongue a bit too.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But that's exactly the surprising part that makes it so charming, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Benoît
dialogue.text: If you ask me, it's bold... but I'll go for regular chips next time!

meaning: bruit produit avec ses lèvres par un fumeur ; rond de fumée dégagé.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Always the same bench, with your little break in hand. This spot almost has your signature.

dialogue.speaker: Sabrina
dialogue.text: (she takes a deep breath, then exhales) [whoosh]... nothing better to split the day in two, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: It’s true, it looks like you escape for a moment, as if everything around could wait.

dialogue.speaker: Sabrina
dialogue.text: That’s exactly it, you know me… Here, I feel like time slips by a little more slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Even the pigeons seem to respect your moment, they barely come close.

dialogue.speaker: Sabrina
dialogue.text: Ah, them too, they know where the important rituals are!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: [whoosh]... This weather is exactly what I needed to settle down under the old plane tree.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Under this tree, everything feels lighter. It's like everything slows down.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: This is my secret hideout, you know. Whenever the day gets too noisy, I come here to catch my breath.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should end every week like this. The silence and the breeze—nothing better.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Between the blackbirds singing and the golden light, it's hard to find a better place to escape.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The only thing missing now is your grandmother's old record player, don't you think?

meaning: bruit d'un bref roulement de tambour, obtenu par un coup de la baguette droite suivi d'un coup de la baguette gauche.
bruit de fusillade.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’re going to laugh, yesterday I made this sound on the drum, you know, [rat-a-tat]! With a sharp hit from each stick, it sounds so good.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? I can totally imagine the sound! Does it come easily to you or do you have to practice a lot?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, at first it’s a bit tricky, but once you get the motion, it feels more natural.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: That makes me want to try... Do you think I could pull it off?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Of course! I’ll teach you at the next rehearsal if you want.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Gladly! Get ready, I might hit a few wrong notes before I get it right.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Louis, listen to the drummer, he really has his own way of starting the rhythm!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Yeah, I find his playing super precise, every move matters.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: There, do you hear it? [rat-a-tat], that little roll, it really pops!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh, now that you mention it, you can't ignore it anymore! What an amazing effect.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Makes you want to learn, right? One day, I'll try that kind of move!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: I'll watch you do it and film you, that way you'll see your progress right away!

meaning: bruit de roulements de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Well, everyone’s got their eyes glued to you—are you hiding something or what?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Ah, you caught me! After what I’ve prepared, it’s hard to go unnoticed.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me you’re about to pull out one of your famous acts again?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Even better! This time, I brought a little something extra to make it special.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Well then, wow us. I’m ready to be amazed!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Here comes the long-awaited moment… [drumroll]!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm warning you, Julien, you're going to be surprised in a moment—I’ve prepared something brand new!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: What a mystery! You’ve piqued my curiosity, I’m almost getting chills.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Get ready, the countdown has started, you’ll have to wait just a little longer!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: This tension is unbearable... What are you preparing behind the scenes?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Attention, attention, the stage is yours in three... two... one...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And then, all of a sudden: [ba-dum-tss], [ba-dum-tss], here comes the long-awaited reveal!

meaning: bruit de coups en rafale, bruit de martèlement.
bruit d'une déflagration, d'un choc violent, d'une fusillade, d'une rafale d'arme automatique.
bruit d'un coup brutal.
pour accompagner un élan.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.
bruit de roulement de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, when the house shakes like that, I start to believe we’re living on a hidden volcano.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It’s just me over here, [bang] [bang] [bang], I’m tackling repairs on the old garden bench.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If I hear another tremor like that, I’m putting on a helmet!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Keep your phone ready, just in case I invent a new style of furniture…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m happy to witness the birth of a masterpiece, but I don’t want to end up with pieces of wood in my soup.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’m aiming for art, not the destruction of the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Here we go again, listen to that [thud] [thud] [thud] coming through the ceiling, I almost feel like we're going to get shaken like rag dolls!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The coffeemaker almost fell over earlier, I swear... It feels like we're on an old ferry in rough seas.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Even with my headphones, I can't drown it out. My report is moving at a snail's pace...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We could go crash in the meeting room on the courtyard side, it's a bit quieter over there.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You read my mind! I'll grab my laptop and follow you—heading for some peace and quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Get ready, I'm bringing the pack of cookies too: we're going to need some comfort!

meaning: Onomatopée exprimant le roulement du tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I hope you're ready, tonight we're shaking things up a bit!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, are you setting me up for something like last time with the lanterns?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Not quite, but I bet you really won't see this coming.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious, I can tell this is going to be awesome!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [drumroll], [drumroll], guess what? I managed to snag two tickets for the museum night event, just for us!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously? You're really taking me along for this? I love it, you're amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you feel the electricity in the air? We're about to find out if our project was selected.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: My heart is pounding like a bass on stage, it feels like we're about to play a big concert.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just for the atmosphere... [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat]... We're almost there!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You crack me up with your special effects! Come on, I can't take it anymore, tell me everything!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this: we got the email, it's official, we're moving on to the next stage!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yesss! We have to pop some champagne to celebrate, no question about it!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, last night, I thought the sky was going to fall on my head, it was so unexpected.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Really? Are you exaggerating or did something truly strange happen at your place?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I swear, I was reading when all of a sudden, a huge [boom] echoed through the house, I jumped right off my couch!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: I admit, that would have made me jump too. Did you ever figure out what happened?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was just the old living room shutter that came loose and banged against the wall. More scared than hurt!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Honestly, your living room is never boring... You should almost sell tickets!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you feel how the apartment is breathing tonight? It’s like everything outside has stopped.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? [thud]! It made the table shake, I thought my glass was going to jump.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That was a strong impact... It broke my concentration, I was reading aloud.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I wonder what's happening on the other side of the wall, that kind of jolt doesn't happen every day.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With a noise like that, the neighbors will definitely try to find out where it came from. I bet we won’t be the only ones listening closely.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: It would be a shame to let this mystery slip by without figuring out what’s behind it, don’t you think?

meaning: bruit de ronflement d'un dormeur.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I spent the whole night counting sheep, but nothing worked, my eyes just stayed open!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? I thought the window was going to shake from it all…

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I swear, there was this moment when it went all ‘[growl]… [growl]… [growl]’, like a beast sleeping in the living room!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That’s crazy, we should almost record it, I’ve never heard anything like it.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: We could use it as background noise for Halloween, it’s perfectly terrifying!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I already get chills just thinking about it, we’ve got a real nighttime show on our hands!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wow, it sounds like there’s an invisible tractor in the living room tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: No need to look any further, that’s my dad in the armchair! He dozed off after dessert.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With a concert like this, we could record an ambient soundtrack for a nighttime farm.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Even the walls must be shaking—I’ve rarely heard such a sound show at home.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With every breath in, it’s back to a “[snore], [snore]” that echoes all the way down the hallway!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If he keeps this up, the neighbors will think we’re harboring a mythical beast!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look at this night, it feels like we’re in a movie, it’s so deserted here! Even the shop lights look gloomy.

dialogue.speaker: Omar
dialogue.text: Wait… [whoosh]! Did you catch that? That definitely came from behind those gates, over there.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I jumped, seriously! My heart did a triple flip. Maybe a box made a run for it?

dialogue.speaker: Omar
dialogue.text: Or maybe a ninja cat! Do we get closer or make a run for it, Captain Lucy?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Alright, let’s act brave, but if a pigeon attacks us, you’re on the front line!

dialogue.speaker: Omar
dialogue.text: Deal, I’ll take the lead and you scream if you see a ghost coming out of the boxes!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I saw in the square earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: Go on, spill it, your story sounds serious!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: A guy was moving a huge wardrobe on a dolly, and he was zigzagging all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: Oh no, I can already picture the disaster... Were there people around?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Exactly, he misjudged his turn and suddenly... [crash]! The wardrobe toppled against the lamppost.

dialogue.speaker: Adrien
dialogue.text: That must have surprised more than a few people, for sure—we all heard it all the way down the next street!

meaning: bruit de grognement du lion, du tigre.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I think my heart is still beating even faster just thinking about the big cat enclosure.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Honestly, with the way they were walking, you’d almost think they were parading just to impress us.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Everyone around me was holding their breath, especially when they came up close to the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At that moment, one of them turned toward us and let out a huge ‘[roar]’ right next to the glass—I jumped so hard!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I thought you were going to drop your bag on the ground, you were so startled…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No kidding! We’re not going to forget that anytime soon—it was like something out of an adventure movie.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: [rawr]! You weren't expecting that behind the door, were you?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I almost dropped my bag, you know! It'll take more than that to surprise me.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: I think I have a real talent for dramatic entrances—and without any rehearsal, too.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Between your creativity and my sensitive heart, we're the perfect duo for a soap opera.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: Expect anything, especially if I add special effects next time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: In that case, I'll come equipped with a helmet and a cape... for style, of course!

meaning: bruit de roulements de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, everyone is turning their heads toward the stage, it’s about to happen!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Oh, do you hear that? It’s starting, [rat-a-tat] is echoing through the whole room!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: My heart is racing, this kind of atmosphere makes me feel like I’m in a movie.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It’s like the crowd is holding its breath with every passing moment.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This suspense is unbearable, I feel like I’m going to jump out of my seat!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: No matter the outcome, we’ll all remember this tension in the air!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Listen to me, Samuel, this morning as I was coming down the stairs, all I heard was [thud-thud-thud] echoing all the way into the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: Oh really? You're starting off strong! I wonder what could have caused such a lively morning at your place.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You know, with my cat and his new obsession with cardboard boxes, it's enough to wake up the whole building.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: I think your cat is ready to audition for a show, judging by the effect he has on you!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If he keeps this up, I could start selling tickets to the morning show soon.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: Let me know the day he goes for the drums—I want a front row seat!

meaning: bruit de roulements de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The lights just dimmed, that means it's about to start, look around you!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can already feel my heart beating faster. What do you think they're hiding behind that red curtain?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet there will be at least one acrobat who will keep the whole big top on the edge of their seats.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you see them over there? They're setting up some kind of big glowing springboard on the side.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, that's the signal, the spotlights are moving, all eyes are turning to the center ring…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen up, pay attention: [rat-a-tat-tat], [rat-a-tat-tat]… this is going to be amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Listen closely, André: [rat-a-tat-tat]... the tension is rising in the room!

dialogue.speaker: André
dialogue.text: Ah, you're really making me believe something huge is about to happen!

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Get ready, what's about to come out of this box is sure to surprise you.

dialogue.speaker: André
dialogue.text: I'm holding my breath! I hope this isn't a late April Fool's joke.

dialogue.speaker: Mathilde
dialogue.text: Not at all, look: the attic treasure was real after all!

dialogue.speaker: André
dialogue.text: Incredible, you really pulled me into your story right up to the end of the suspense!

meaning: Onomatopée exprimant le roulement du tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You see, it’s always just as I’m crossing the square that the musicians start their most lively number!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I was right next to them when it started, it went: [rat-a-tat], [rat-a-tat], I caught myself keeping the beat as I walked!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It’s impossible to resist, everyone gets swept up in it, even the most serious people in the neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I noticed—even the florist was tapping his foot behind his stall.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The atmosphere is so unique, I think that’s why I love passing through there on those days.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: We should almost plan our errands around the music schedule, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Look at the crowd starting to gather along the sidewalk, it really feels like something special is happening today!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know we never miss the school parade, especially when the percussionists take the stage.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: That's true, I almost feel like my heart is going to follow all their rhythms, just waiting for them.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And when they come in with their [rat-a-tat] echoing, I get chills all the way down my arms!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: That's the moment when even the clouds seem like they want to dance, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we get a little closer, we might almost feel the energy right through our shoes!

meaning: bruit du tir d'une mitrailleuse ou d'une mitraillette.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: When I saw all the opponents rushing into the hangar, I really thought it was the end for me.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Whoa, that must've been intense! Were you able to do anything or was it a lost cause from the start?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, I dove behind a barrel, held down the trigger, and then... [ratatat] [ratatat] without stopping for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: No kidding, you turned the hangar into a real action scene!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I even heard my heart beating louder than the noise around me, I thought the controller was going to slip out of my hands.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It's in moments like that you remember why you picked this game—nothing beats that kind of adrenaline rush!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Hey Léa, did you notice how I jumped during the chase in the parking lot?

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Honestly, it was impossible not to jump, the atmosphere was electric!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: And when the car crashed into the barrier, then that "[ratatat] [ratatat]" that echoed... I got chills!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: No kidding! My popcorn bucket almost ended up on the floor at that moment.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It made the scene even crazier, it felt like everything was about to blow up.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: It's for moments like that I never miss a screening with you, we really live the movie to the fullest!

meaning: bruit de ronflement d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, the old Peugeot is rolling into the street, as if it wants to announce its presence to the whole neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Every time it goes by, I feel like the walls are shaking.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [vrrr], that sound almost makes you think it's about to take off.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: But no, it keeps going, against all odds!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Seeing it still running is almost a daily achievement.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: If it makes it to the bakery again tomorrow morning, I'll tip my hat to it!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Listen to this, I was this close to arriving and suddenly everything started going [vroom vroom vroom], there was no way to keep going peacefully!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Seriously, another unpredictable adventure with you, it never stops!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Every time I think I'm going to have a calm walk, something happens that surprises me.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Honestly, you should write a travel journal, it would be hilarious to read.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With my luck, it would probably be illustrated with mud stains and sound effects!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That's why I love hanging out with you, there's never a quiet day but at least we never get bored!

meaning: bruit de ronflement d'un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I'm heading to the garage, the bike is eagerly waiting for me.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: How much do you bet it'll act up again this morning?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, it'll start without putting on a show for the whole neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Ah, that moment when it does its famous [vroom] [vroom], it always wakes up the neighbors.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You'd think it does it on purpose just to get noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: In any case, it definitely earned its reputation in the neighborhood, that's for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh look, your uncle's old motorcycle just went down the street, it sounded like a [vroom] [vroom] [vroom] shaking up the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's true, he never goes unnoticed with that machine, it makes everyone smile.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: He should almost come to the Sunday meetings, it would really liven things up!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm sure half the village would guess he's coming before they even see him.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: One day he's going to wake up the whole neighborhood, especially when he comes home late from football.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As long as he doesn't decide to stop right under our windows, we'll survive!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Grab the other side well, it’s slippery, this drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yeah, I’ve got it, be careful, it’s not wedged properly and I don’t really trust the hinges.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If you lift it a bit, I can wedge the box underneath, wait… There, that’s better.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It’s going through, it’s going through… watch out for the outlet behind you.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Okay, I’m backing up slowly, let me know if there’s an obstacle.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Shoot, the handle just gave way—[clink]!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can't believe what happened in the kitchen this morning... The knife was really badly placed.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, are you going to tell me you dropped it again?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not even! When I tried to grab the pan, my elbow knocked the knife, and then, [clang], it hit the oven door!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Are you serious? That must have freaked everyone out in the apartment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Clara jumped and almost spilled her bowl, it was a total mess.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, just imagining the scene makes me want to double-check everything in the kitchen!

meaning: Estrade entourée de cordes, sur laquelle se font les combats de boxe, de catch.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: This weekend, I spotted an event that I think you’d really enjoy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Intriguing! You’ve piqued my curiosity, tell me more.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: There’s an evening where pros go head-to-head in an impressive showdown—guaranteed atmosphere, or so I’ve heard.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can already feel the adrenaline rising. Do you think there’ll be a big crowd?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Apparently, this kind of show attracts enthusiasts and even people who know nothing about it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can’t wait to see the action up close, especially when the fighters step into the [ring] under the spotlights!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I think it's the first time I've ever felt such a rush of adrenaline, my heart was pounding a mile a minute!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That must be something! Where were you to feel like that?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I went to a mind-blowing competition, there was no way I could stay seated in my chair.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Tell me about it, the atmosphere must have been wild, right?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: When the spotlights focused on the [ring], everyone jumped up at once and started shouting, it was like the whole place was shaking!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's the kind of moment that stays with you, I can feel the chills just listening to you!

meaning: bruit de roulements de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hold on tight, I have a surprise that might make you jump!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Whoa, that deserves a [thump] [thump] [thump]... Alright, I'm all ears!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I'm going to Japan next month, and guess who I'm taking with me?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Seriously? Don't tell me I've finally won my spot in your suitcase!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Exactly, get your passport ready, we're about to have an amazing adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: I can already feel the adrenaline kicking in, you've just made my day!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet you’re not expecting what I just discovered today…

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Oh, the suspense! You love keeping me in suspense, tell me!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Patience, patience… You know I like to keep the mystery going a little longer.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Come on, Claire, give me a break, I’m all ears!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Okay, get ready, maximum focus… [drumroll] [drumroll] [drumroll]… I landed my dream internship!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That’s amazing, you’re going to crush it there, congratulations!

meaning: bruit de roulements de tambour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: So Lucas, moment of truth: who found the right key to open the chest?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With all this suspense, my heart is pounding! Go on, surprise us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright, get ready, I'm going to announce the winner's name... ready?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here I go: [drumroll] [drumroll]! Let the magic happen.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Pauline wins the challenge, such insight!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: She really nailed it, the suspense was worth it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Do you remember the bet we made last week?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Of course! I thought about it all night, are you going to tell me who won?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, let me savor this moment, it's so rare that I get to offer this much suspense.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, this is torture, you’re not going to make me stew for another thirty seconds!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, get ready, you might jump out of your chair.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here comes the big moment… [drumroll]… I’m the one who wins the challenge!

meaning: bruit de ronflement d'un dormeur.
bruit que fait le chat pour manifester son contentement.
bruit d'un ronflement sourd et régulier.
pour marquer la monotonie.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, listen to this… [snore]… [snore]… [snore]… we've got some noisy company tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Makes me almost regret taking the room next to the living room, I should've brought earplugs!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You could write a ballad just with that rhythm—who needs a sleep app?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It would be a hit in the top 50 sleep tracks, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We should record it, you know, it would definitely impress insomniacs.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Or we could start a homemade lullaby business—guaranteed hit at our sleepovers!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you notice how suddenly it got quiet? It feels like the apartment emptied out.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, Élodie isn't on the couch anymore... do you think she slipped into the bedroom?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That's very possible, she was fighting to keep her eyes open during the movie earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Want to bet we'll find her curled up under the covers?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come see, if the door's ajar, we'll know right away...

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: (whispering behind the door) Shh, listen... [zzz]... [zzz]...

meaning: bruit du roucoulement de la tourterelle, de la colombe.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Do you feel how gentle the air is here, under the trees?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen, right there, [coo coo]... it feels like we're somewhere else, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to lie down in the grass to enjoy it even more.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We could stay here for hours watching the clouds; with this atmosphere, it's hard to leave.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's like time slows down, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, here, everything feels lighter. We should find moments like this more often.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: What a peaceful spot... Sitting here, I really feel like the city just disappears.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's true, it feels like time slows down, just with the rustling of the leaves around us.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Wait, do you hear that soft little sound near the old oak tree?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Oh yes, that steady [coo coo]... It almost makes you want to listen even more closely, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Yes, it's as gentle as the swaying of a hammock on a summer afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Little details like that can turn a simple walk into a real moment of relaxation, don't you think?

meaning: bruit de grognement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Did you see this garden? It looks like a little jungle right in the middle of the city!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Yeah, and look at that black dog—he's watching everything like a guard.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: He looks intrigued... I wonder if he'd like us to come closer.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: When I got closer a bit earlier, I heard a deep '[woof]' coming from behind the gate.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ah, now I get why he's watching so closely. Better stay out of his area, then!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Exactly, let's keep exploring without bothering the neighborhood guard.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
