dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You read my mind—the next get-together is going to shake the walls, that's for sure!

meaning: bruit de déchirement, de lacération.
bruit produit par un crachat.

dialogue.speaker: Moussa
dialogue.text: Julie, this bag refuses to open, I’ve already pulled it every which way.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Hand it over, I have a secret technique… [pop]! See, all it needed was a bit of conviction.

dialogue.speaker: Moussa
dialogue.text: I’m really impressed, I thought it was mission impossible.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Guess I’m used to stubborn bags!

dialogue.speaker: Moussa
dialogue.text: Next time, you’ll be in charge of the surprise packages.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Deal, but only if you trade me that for a coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But look at this package, did they wrap it for the apocalypse or what? Even my scissors are bending!

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: Let me try with my keys, you never know, it might work.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don’t poke a hole in anything else, okay? Disaster is never far off with you.

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: Alright... a little patience... and if I push here...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [rip]! See, I knew it, now the paper is shredded on half of it!

dialogue.speaker: Nabil
dialogue.text: We might not have the instructions, but at least the contents are finally free!

meaning: bruit produit par un tir d'arme automatique.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Look at this hallway, it looks like it could blow up any second!

dialogue.speaker: Mélissa
dialogue.text: Go left, I’ll cover the door, we can’t afford any mistakes this time.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: I’m moving in slowly, but I bet there’s an ambush around the corner…

dialogue.speaker: Mélissa
dialogue.text: There it is, did you hear that? [clack-clack], things are heating up behind the wall, get ready!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: My heart skipped a beat, looks like we’ll have to play it close.

dialogue.speaker: Mélissa
dialogue.text: Don’t rush in yet, wait for my signal… We’re doing this as a team!

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: The alleys are really deserted, even the cats have disappeared, it's making me nervous.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: It's true, it's like the city is holding its breath, like before a storm.

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: I have a bad feeling, the last time it was this quiet, it ended badly.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Tonight, we stay well hidden, no way we're getting caught off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: Wait, there's something moving behind those containers over there...

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: [clackclack], [clackclack]! Get down, quick, it's coming right at us!

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This old attic hasn't changed; it feels like every time we stir up a cloud of memories... and dust!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between the cobwebs and these old boxes, I just hope I don't wake up any allergies...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, grandma's photo box! We're probably going to come out of here completely covered in dust too.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you find that old scarf, I'll take it right away. There's a smell that's tickling my nose.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't move, I think I see it in the corner, right next to the big teddy bear!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait a second... [achoo]! Whew, that was close. Looks like the attic always wins!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You have no idea how much I struggled to move the old couch, and all the dust that was underneath it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Of course, it hasn’t been moved in years! I bet it was a real cloud.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And when I pulled the furniture, [achoo]! A massive sneeze, all the dust caught me off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I can picture it, you must have spread dust all over the room.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, now I’ll have to clean everything before I get another noseful.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good luck, and remember to open the windows next time!

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Even after all these years, this old station still has such incredible charm, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, and all those carriages lined up... it's like they're waiting for a secret departure.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Come closer, listen with me... [chug chug] chug... it's almost like we're really there!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, you're pretty good at that—it makes me want to hop on board right now.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Every time I walk past these giants, I turn into a fascinated kid again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It must be this place; it really has a way of sparking our imagination.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Wow, look over there, Paul! It's laying the countryside under a blanket of mist and pulling its long trail of smoke behind it.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It almost looks like a scene from a novel, don't you think? These monsters on rails will always fascinate me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Every time it passes, my whole heart leaps—it's stronger than me.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Listen closely, it's coming, [chug chug]… [chug chug]… it's like it's beating out the rhythm of the landscape.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I almost feel like we could jump on board and race to the ends of the earth.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With our heads full of adventure, speeding along, we leave everything behind, just carried by that breath.

meaning: bruit produit par un coup cinglant, par un instrument tranchant.
pour exprimer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'unu procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Grab me that red bell pepper, it's been catching my eye all this time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With pleasure, here you go! You'll see, this one is really firm.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? [chop]! This one doesn't stand a chance against my favorite knife.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I almost felt sorry for the cutting board, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got everything perfectly under control.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you keep this up, dinner will be ready before I finish grating the cheese!

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: So, do you want me to start with the tomatoes or the peppers?

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Go for the peppers, they're tougher—it'll wake you up!

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Watch the pro at work... [chop]! And there you go, one down already.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: You're scaring me going that fast, like a real Michelin chef on steroids.

dialogue.speaker: Amandine
dialogue.text: Don't worry, it's just Sunday training with grandma.

dialogue.speaker: Mehdi
dialogue.text: Grandma must have had quite the wrist, then!

meaning: bruit produit par le cri de la grive.
bruit produit par diverses sources, impliquant le plus souvent eau ou métal.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: What a strange silence, it's as if the forest is holding its breath behind all these branches.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sometimes, all it takes is a breeze to wake up a whole orchestra of wings here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, that little sharp sound piercing through the leaves, do you hear it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yes, absolutely. Not easy to pinpoint, that tone. A blackbird, you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm not sure, but I'd say it's a regular in the clearings.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look over there, just above the holly... did you hear that sudden '[chik]'? Almost exactly when she jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Look over there, just behind the old oak tree, do you see that little bird hopping in the grass?

dialogue.speaker: Étienne
dialogue.text: Yes, I see it! It looks like it's in a hurry, like it's searching for something.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: It's often right at this time that we catch them rummaging around on the ground.

dialogue.speaker: Étienne
dialogue.text: Do you hear that jerky rhythm, right after the leaves crunch?

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Listen closely… [chirp], did you hear it this time?

dialogue.speaker: Étienne
dialogue.text: Yes, it's like it's trying to get noticed on purpose, that's awesome!

meaning: bruit produit par diverses sources, impliquant le plus souvent eau ou métal.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Well, there was still a mountain of pots and pans left after your cooking experiment last night!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: You know, with everything you use, it's impossible to go unnoticed... I can still hear the [clatter clack] in the kitchen this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: All that for a sauce... but hey, at least the meal was worth it!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: You have to admit, no one cooks like you, even if it leaves a mark.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I'll try the minimalist approach: just one pot!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I'll believe it when I see it... but at least the kitchen won't get bored, with or without an orchestra!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: With everything we’ve prepared, it looks like we’ve invited the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: I know, right? The stack of dishes almost reaches the window… Do you want to take care of the glasses or the plates?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: I’ll take the plates, the glasses always stress me out with all the suds.

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: Too late, my hands are already covered in soap! Pass me the big spoon, it’s stuck at the bottom.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Here you go, but don’t do any stunts with it, my mom will hear you all the way from her room!

dialogue.speaker: Amélie
dialogue.text: Haha, listen to this! With every move, the silverware makes its little '[clink clank]', it’s almost hypnotic.

meaning: bruit d'un fluide qui fuse.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maxime, have you been hearing that strange noise near the faucet for a while now?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Yes, it's bothering me too. Do you think it's a leak?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Possible. The last time we had a problem, it definitely wasn't this loud.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll get closer and listen. It really sounds like it's coming from the pipe behind.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh listen, we just heard a little '[drip]', just like a trickle of water passing through.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Well, I really think we need to call the plumber now. I think it's leaking more than we thought.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Does the old coffee maker inspire confidence, Hugo? This is the third time we've brought it out this week.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Listen to that little '[psst]' when I press the plunger, it means it's still got some life in it!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I just hope the foam doesn't overflow like it did yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, the kitchen will stay dry this time.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If you master this, you could open your own brewery one of these days.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I'll keep that in mind, but I promise, I'll start by not flooding the countertop!

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Old train cars really have a different look, don’t you think? They carry a charm you just don’t see anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That’s true, and the scent drifting in the air almost transports me to another era.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Just listen for a moment: [clack clack], it’s moving so gently along the tracks…

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It makes you want to press your nose to the window, like a child, and not miss a single thing!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I bet the passengers take the chance to daydream, rocked by the movement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With all this, it’s hard to resist the temptation to hop on board, even just for a short trip.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Look at all that wild grass on the tracks, it’s like the station has fallen asleep.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sometimes I imagine the colorful carriages that used to pass here, full of children and overflowing suitcases.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: All it took was a little breeze to smell the coal and suddenly hear the platform come alive.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, if you really pay attention, you can almost hear an old [chugga chugga] in the distance.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: You know, you’re almost giving me chills right now. I thought I heard it answer you.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s as if the stones keep a bit of that sound under their moss.

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yesterday, I found the old photo where we were standing in front of that locomotive, do you remember?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yes, with our makeshift engineer caps! That was an adventure like no other.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We must have been what, eight or nine years old back then? I can still hear the wind whistling when we crossed the bridge.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Not to mention the wooden bench that creaked at every turn… What an expedition!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That's true! And then the view of the golden fields… We both dreamed of being train drivers one day, remember?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: How could I forget? I almost have the "[choo choo]" in my head just thinking about it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look, there it is coming to the end of the platform… [choo choo], it feels like the whole platform is vibrating with it!

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: This show is always just as fascinating, even after all these years. I never get tired of it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Every little detail takes me back to when I used to wait here with my grandfather, basket in hand.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: I can still remember the warmth of the hot chocolate he pulled from his bag while we waited for the departure—it gave those moments a special flavor.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: There really is a unique atmosphere today, look at all those amazed faces around us.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: If I could capture this moment, I’d slip it between the pages of a notebook to keep it alive forever.

meaning: bruit d'un fluide qui fuse.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, if this siphon works as well as you say, we're definitely going to impress everyone with our homemade whipped cream.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'm screwing in the cartridge... but get the strawberries ready just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Alright, they're ready, the strawberries are waiting. Do you want me to shake the siphon this time?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Go easy... [psshh] ! Ah, did you see that spray? I got some on my arm!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, even the whipped cream is doing its own thing today.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: We should almost think about wearing a bulletproof apron for these culinary experiments!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Pierre, don't you notice? The coffee is dripping really slowly, that's not normal.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: Maybe the filter is just out of place. I'll adjust the handle, watch.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Go easy, last time this machine already surprised us.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: Don't worry, I've got this! A little suspense never hurt anyone.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oh wait... [hiss]... it's coming from the steam wand! I knew it was going to mess with us.

dialogue.speaker: Pierre
dialogue.text: This one's got personality! With her and us, it's always an adventure, I swear.

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This street is covered with little flowers, did you see? It smells just like spring.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: They're really pretty, but I can already feel my nostrils twitching, can't you?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yeah, and with this wind, it's flying everywhere... Your eyes are already squinting!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You're not wrong... I'm trying to hold it in, but my nose is playing tricks on me.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [achoo]! There you go, it was inevitable with all this pollen around.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Looks like spring is welcoming you in its own way! Do you want a tissue?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This wind has decided to show up everywhere today, hasn’t it? Even my hair has given up.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Tell me about it, I feel like it’s having the most fun in my scarf.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We’ll have to thank April for its surprises… You’re shivering a bit, are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Just a chilly breeze tickling my nose, nothing serious. Or maybe it’s the pollen, who knows?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you turn into a fountain, I’ve got tissues at the bottom of my bag.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, right on cue… [achoo]! Well, I’ll gladly take a tissue then.

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: There we go, we really picked the best spot—look at the track disappearing into the mist...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet we'll spot the chimney rising up near the old plane tree, that's always where the surprise begins.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Listen, it's vibrating a little, isn't it? I feel like it's slowly getting closer...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen closely, it goes [chug chug], can you feel the thrill coming already?

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: My eyes are sparkling, nothing beats this kind of suspense.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It reminds me of Grandpa's stories, where every arrival seemed magical.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Guess what, I almost missed the train this morning—there were barely two minutes left before it left!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: I can already picture it: the steam, the suitcases, and you running along the platform… [choo choo], you jump on board at the last second!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That's exactly it! The doors closed right behind me, I thought my heart was going to give out.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Sometimes time really is against us, you got seriously lucky.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Yeah, and after all that, I watched the scenery go by—it instantly calmed me down.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: That's an adventure that definitely deserves a nice hot chocolate at the next station, don't you think?

meaning: bruit produit par l'éternuement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Maxime, you're piling up tissues on your desk—I hope you're not planning to build a castle!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh, wait... [achoo]! Oops, there goes another one added to my collection. It's all because of that wide-open window.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The spring breeze is sneaky—it really wants to put you to the test today.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I feel like I'm trapped in an invisible cloud—it just never stops!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If you need another barricade to protect yourself, I've got a box of tissues just waiting for you.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Between your emergency stash and my patience, I think I can hold out until the end of the day.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [achoo]! Oh, my eyes have been stinging ever since I walked past the bouquet of irises.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: That bouquet really manages to draw more attention than it should!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I swear, it has an annoying habit of triggering all sorts of reactions in me.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: We might need to put up a warning sign on the door just for you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With my nose right now, even from the other side of the room, there's no way I can go unnoticed!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Looks like we'll have to set up a safety perimeter around the flowers today.

meaning: Onomatopée imitant le bruit du moteur à explosion.
Automobile vieille et poussive.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: You know, while sorting through the attic, I came across that old photo of Dad with his battered 2CV.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Oh, the famous one! We used to say it had almost more coats of paint than miles on the clock.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: That's true! And in the summer, when he came down the street, we all knew it was him just by the sound.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: No kidding! From the corner, you could hear '[putt-putt], [putt-putt]', and the kids would run to the gate to watch him arrive.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: Even Grandma would give a wink from the garden—it became a real neighborhood ritual.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Nothing beats those days... you knew when the day was really starting!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: You know, I got overtaken by something totally unbelievable on the highway earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Seriously? What was it? A customized tractor or something like that?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Not even, it was an old, super colorful Citroën, and it was struggling to get up the hill...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh wow, just imagining it, I can hear the [putt-putt] behind me while everyone else passes it!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: No kidding, it looked like a scene from a comedy, it was so unlikely.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to get my bike out again to see if I can go faster!

meaning: bruit de moteur d'un bateau.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Do you hear that steady [thump-thump]? The boat's engine is ready for a long ride!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, it seems like it was just waiting for us to start.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: With this clear sky, we're going to glide across the water like never before.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I love this feeling, when we leave the dock and everything becomes calm around us.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Look, you can already see the first seagulls following us.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It smells like vacation and sea air, I really can't wait to get to the island.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look, it seems like the fog is dancing just for us this morning on the lake.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: It's crazy, the mist reflects like a mirror all around us, we're moving straight ahead into a dream.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: And meanwhile, we move in rhythm, [thud-thud], [thud-thud], as if the boat wanted to play us a secret tune.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: It would be a shame not to improvise a few dance steps, with such a beat under our feet!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Maybe if we finish the crossing with a waltz, we'll even impress the ducks.

dialogue.speaker: Vincent
dialogue.text: In this floating scenery, anything is possible, even believing we're sailing on a theater stage.

meaning: pour exprimer une incrédulité, une réticence, une mise en garde, un désaccord; pour signifier une interdiction, un refus; pour coupter la parole à quelqu'un.
pour exprimer l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look at that old spiral staircase—do you want to see where it leads?

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: [ting], are you really planning to go in there with that flickering light on the ceiling?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That's exactly it—a bit of adventure! Otherwise, we'd never have any stories to tell.

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: If we run into a giant spider, that'll be your story alone.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Don't worry, worst case, we'll just tell the story at the bottom of the stairs!

dialogue.speaker: Damien
dialogue.text: Alright, but if the railing creaks one more time, you're leading the way.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I saw that the new food truck is setting up in the park tonight, it already smells delicious all the way over here!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh really? Do you really think it's worth going now? There's probably going to be a never-ending line.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's exactly why it's more fun when there are lots of people, we often run into familiar faces!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I get it, but I've had a long day, I was thinking of just enjoying the couch tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, it'll be a nice change of pace. We'll head home as soon as we've eaten, I promise!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: [ding], don't tempt me, I feel like if I go, I'll end up staying up late in spite of myself.

meaning: bruit d'une démarche inégale, bruit des sabots d'un équidé.
bruit de verres qui s'entrechoquent, lorsqu'on trinque.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen for a second, have you noticed that strange sound echoing along the path?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I've been hearing it for a few meters now, and it's making me curious... it's muffled, but it just keeps going!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I feel like it comes and goes, and then suddenly it speeds up.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, it almost sounds like there's an unpredictable rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, right there, do you hear it? It sounds like it's going [tick tock tap] on the cobblestones!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, so that's it! Come on, I have a feeling we're about to run into an old four-legged acquaintance.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Luc, do you notice that noise coming from the old path behind the house?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Listen, it goes [tick tock tap] at almost regular intervals, it's strange…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I wonder if it might be one of the neighbors bringing something back from the market.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Possible, or maybe it's Margot rushing across the path again.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Judging by the pace, it really seems like there are a lot of people on the little paths today.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: With all this coming and going, all we need now is rain to top off this country scene!

meaning: bruit régulier d'un mécanisme, d'un instrument, d'un appareil.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The soufflé is starting to rise, look at this masterpiece!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It sure is, and it already smells absolutely amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I don't know why, but as soon as that timer starts, I always hear that persistent [tick-tock] in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe it's a sign that this recipe has really become a ritual for you.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Or maybe it's trying to remind me not to open the oven door too soon.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At this rate, we're going to end up associating every dessert with its own little sound quirks.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: You could almost hear a pin drop in here, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: It's true... The living room has never seemed so peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: And yet, there's a sort of faint sound presence in the air...

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Hey, could it be some kind of old mechanical memory joining us?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Exactly, something subtle but definitely there.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [tick-tock]... doesn't that rhythm you almost forget calm you?

meaning: son d'une cloche ou d'un grelot, parfois d'un clavecin.
bruit produit par des pièces de monnaie ou des clefs, par un objet métallique.
bruit de verres qui s'entrechoquent, lorsqu'on trinque.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: [ding ding]... Do you feel that too when we walk past this little shop?

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: It's crazy, it gives me goosebumps every time I hear that kind of sound.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It hits me like an unexpected rush, it almost makes me smile for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: It's like even the street dresses up in a different mood when there's that kind of atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I bet there are a thousand little stories behind every sound around us.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: And that's how, in the middle of a walk, we end up swept away by the invisible music of a winter afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh listen, [ta-da], I feel like the party has really started in this alley!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It's true, all this excitement makes me want to join the crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's just what we need to forget the gloom, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Yes, and look at all these smiles around us, it warms the heart.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Come on, I spotted a booth a bit further down that seems to be drawing everyone in.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Perfect, and I bet we'll discover even more surprises around the corners of these streets!

meaning: bruit d'un choc métallique.
bruit d'un signal sonore imitant un coup de timbre.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know, Arthur, stacking all these pots and pans is almost an art!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Yeah, especially with the ones that never want to stay in place—it's a real puzzle.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look at this one, it always slides around like it wants to escape from the drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: It's probably the same one that bangs every morning when I make my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm trying a new arrangement... if I wedge the big pan here, it should hold.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Oh, watch out behind you... [clang]! There we go, should've seen that coming—it's the symphony all over again!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: If you keep piling up all these utensils, you'll be able to open a restaurant soon, Paul!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It would turn into quite a mess eventually, just look at this drawer…

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Come on, let's do it together, or everything will end up like the Leaning Tower of Pisa.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I'll take care of the big spoons—it's less risky, or at least I hope so!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Careful, my dishes like to play tricks, just so you know.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: And there you go, it was bound to happen… *[clink]*

meaning: bruit d'un choc métallique.
bruit d'un signal sonore imitant un coup de timbre.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: And there we go, another screw escaping under the dresser... [clink]... At this rate, I'll never finish this piece of furniture.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: You're becoming the champion of lost parts, that's the third one today, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If only screws refused to roll away so fast, I'd spend less time looking for them than actually assembling this thing.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'll grab the flashlight—we're going on an expedition under the dresser, detective style.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Alright, but if we also find that old coin I lost last week, I'll buy you a coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Deal! I'll take any reward, as long as we stop losing hardware.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: If the pedal is still holding on, it clearly refuses to retire.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: I'll get you the wrench, it must be surviving under that pile of tools...

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: You'd think this old bike is protesting on purpose—it hasn't moved all winter.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Catch, here it is! Try convincing it yourself, the mechanics listen to you more than to me.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Come on, a little bit of mechanical magic and it'll be sorted...

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Oh! Did you hear that [clink]? Looks like your spell worked!

meaning: bruit des battements du cœur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, I replayed this moment in my head all night, I just couldn't get any sleep.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I think I can guess what you mean… My intuition has been teasing me since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I've rarely been this clumsy with words, you might be about to witness a real show.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: It's strange, I can almost hear [thump thump] in my chest just listening to you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it's contagious… because on my end, it's a total upheaval inside.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Looks like we should just let our awkwardness do the talking for us, it's better than any speech in the world!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I have this strange feeling, like everything is spinning faster around me tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: You have that look you only get before an exam... Is something bothering you?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wish I could find the right words, but whenever I try to speak, everything seems to get tangled up in my head.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Breathe, Julien. It can't be as bad as you imagine.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Even if it's a bit overwhelming... I want to tell you that you mean a lot to me.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: I think if you come a little closer, you'll hear [thump thump] [thump thump] right nearby...

meaning: bruit de gouttes d'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, with this rain, it feels like we're in a bubble outside of time.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: That's true, it's almost relaxing... wait, there's a little sound that stands out from the rest, do you hear it too?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, my ear catches it, but I can't figure out where it's coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: I think it's coming from the corner of the window, it's subtle, but regular.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Listen, [tap tap]... that little rhythm just keeps going!

dialogue.speaker: Nicholas
dialogue.text: The house is composing its own melody tonight, we could almost dance just by listening to it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: What a strange atmosphere tonight, it feels like the house is holding its breath.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's true, and the light flickers as if it's part of the mystery.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There's something catching my attention... do you feel it too?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'm trying to focus, but it almost slips between the walls.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen closely, it sounds like... [tap tap], very softly behind the bookshelf.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, so it wasn't my imagination, I was starting to think it was the house itself whispering.

meaning: petit bruit sec et ponctuel, souvent d'origine métallique.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As soon as I turn the dial, a little [click] sounds with each notch... This old music box still has a few surprises left.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: That's surprising, I would have thought it would stay silent after all these years on the shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: See, it's still holding up despite the dust, but this movement intrigues me.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Mind if I take a closer look? Hidden mechanisms have always fascinated me.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Go ahead, I'm curious to see what your skillful hands will discover under that lid.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Alright then, let's dive into this musical exploration worthy of an adventure novel!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Do you think that old padlock will open with your pliers?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait... I'll put the tip here... [click]! It moved, see?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, that startled me! That's a good sign, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think we're on the right track. Just a bit more effort.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Try pressing a little harder, but not too much, or it'll break.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Promise, I've got this! A little patience and it'll open all the way.

meaning: bruit du chant de l'alouette.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look, the first rays of sunlight are already streaming through the curtains—it's amazing how the light dances this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: And do you hear that? [chirp], [chirp], it's echoing right above the old cherry tree—it's almost as if the house is breathing in music.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I had forgotten how mornings here have their own kind of magic—nothing like the city.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Even the smell of coffee seems different when it mixes with all of this.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It feels like every detail is more vivid—even memories wake up with the fresh air.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: How about we have breakfast outside, just to enjoy this atmosphere a little longer?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look how the light gently shines through the wheat, it looks like a living painting.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It makes me want to stop just to savor this calm under the open sky.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Over here, something's moving in the tall grass, do you see?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Oh yes, a little ball of feathers darting straight up into the sky!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Shh, listen closely to that melody rising up…

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It sounds like it's going [tweetle], [tweetle], so light in the air.

meaning: bruit du chant de l'alouette.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, listen for a second, [tweet-tweet], [tweet-tweet]... It sounds like the day has decided to dress itself in light little notes today.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: This place always surprises me, there are surprises everywhere, even in the morning air.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Walking here gives me such incredible energy, it's like every step opens the door to a thousand discoveries.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And did you see the light on the fields? It feels like we're in a living painting, really.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come on, let's sit over there under the old oak tree, just to make this suspended moment last a little longer.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With pleasure, I feel like we're going to catch a piece of the morning just for ourselves.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It's amazing how the grass is still covered in dew, it looks like it's sparkling.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And look at the light shining through the branches, it almost makes you want to walk barefoot in the field.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Wait, stop for a second... Do you hear that coming from the embankment?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's subtle but it really breaks the silence, it surprises me every time.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It's the kind of morning where I feel like I can hear [tweet-tweet] darting through the sky, right above us.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, it instantly brightens up the day, like a promise of adventure.

meaning: bruit du chant de l'alouette.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look how the field stretches out under this gentle light, it’s almost unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you notice? There’s a little breeze floating over there, just above the grass.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, it’s like a melody wandering among the flowers.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen, it goes ‘[trill] [trill]’ right against the wind, it’s fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It looks like it’s dancing in the air, it’s as light as can be.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With music like that, it’s hard not to feel like you could grow wings!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look at that golden light on the fields, it feels like everything is shining a little earlier this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Did you see how the dew clings to the blades of grass? I feel like I'm walking through a painting.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen, right there! [twirlili]... it's strange how some sounds seem to glide through the fresh air.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It makes me want to slow down, as if this moment needs to be savored.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Every morning here holds a little surprise, that's what I love so much about these walks.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I'll bring my notebook to capture little moments like this one.

meaning: bruits de signaux télégraphiques en morse.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Look, this is a real vintage device—I bet it has plenty of stories to tell.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: It makes you want to know what it's heard over the years, doesn't it? I can just picture people gathered around, focused.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Yeah, and that little lever there—do you think it slid easily, or did you need practice to handle it?

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Listen, just seeing it, I can almost hear the [click clack] echoing in the room like in the old days…

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It's amazing how objects can spark your imagination—I feel like I'm in an adventure novel.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: You'd almost think a secret message is about to appear before our eyes, with all this mystery around!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Hugo, do you notice that weird sound that comes back every two minutes in the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I thought it was the dishwasher, but it's not even running tonight...

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I checked, it's neither the fridge nor the coffee maker... I'm starting to wonder if it's something in the wall.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That would be just our luck to have a temperamental appliance! Wait, it's starting again, listen closely.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Do you hear it? It's always the same rhythm, like... [tick tock]... [tick tock]...

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we're going to wake up the whole building with our late-night investigations!

meaning: évocation du slogan Algérie française, sur l'air des lampions.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Do you still feel those summer evenings like the ones from the old days, when the wind carries the sound of a brass band?

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: It hits me right in the face whenever there’s a gathering in town—it’s crazy how some sounds take you so far back.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Sometimes, just hearing a few notes is enough to bring the whole parade back to mind.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: And then, inevitably, I get the [toot-toot ta-ta] stuck in my head—there’s no escaping it.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I almost feel like I can see the old lanterns again, with their dancing shadows on the walls.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Some memories cling much more than others—that’s what makes them so charming, isn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Nadine
dialogue.text: Do you remember those evenings when the whole neighborhood would gather around the bandstand, with the pennants and the old tunes?

dialogue.speaker: Maurice
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it was impossible to miss, especially with that cheerful atmosphere and lanterns glowing everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Nadine
dialogue.text: There was a song we all used to sing, but I just can't remember exactly how it started.

dialogue.speaker: Maurice
dialogue.text: It's on the tip of my tongue, it was one of those songs that stuck in your head all night, but no use, the words just won't come back to me.

dialogue.speaker: Nadine
dialogue.text: Wait, didn't it go something like "[la la la ta ta]" right before everyone clapped along to the beat?

dialogue.speaker: Maurice
dialogue.text: That's right, you're bringing it all back, it's like we're right there again, that was exactly it!

meaning: Onomatopée d'un bruit sec, d'un heurt (souvent répété).

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think the cat climbed up on the living room shelf again?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe... He loves climbing up there, especially when he wants to get our attention.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, there's a strange noise behind the wall, right by the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [knock], [knock]... Sounds like he's trying to catch something that fell behind the sideboard.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wouldn't be surprised, he already knocked over a vase last week.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We should go check before he does any more damage this time.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: If you ask me, yesterday's storm left its mark on the whole building.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [knock] [knock] [knock], there's definitely something happening behind the wall.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, it sounds like it's getting closer.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: I've never heard a noise like that at this hour, it's making me curious.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: We could ask the concierge if she's noticed anything unusual.

dialogue.speaker: Arnaud
dialogue.text: I definitely will, because now my curiosity is really piqued!

meaning: bruit de moteur d'un bateau.
bruit de tir d'une mitrailleuse lourde.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It looks like the old port has emptied out; we'll almost have the river to ourselves.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: This promises a peaceful crossing... Do you remember this spot at night, with the lights on the water?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, I'm starting the engine... and already the [thump-thump] can be heard under the hull.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's crazy how that little sound immediately sets the mood, it starts off gently.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: We're leaving the dock behind us, heading toward those reflections over there.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: With this atmosphere, I almost feel like we're setting off on an adventure far from here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look how the water shimmers with all these boats passing by, it’s mesmerizing.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Listen to that one… [thump-thump], [thump-thump], it’s like it’s keeping time on the lake.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It reminds me of last summer, when we just drifted along with the current without worrying about the time.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: It was magical, especially when the light changed just before sunset.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Nothing like it to disconnect from the world. I’m craving another spontaneous getaway!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If you’re up for it, I’m in without hesitation — who knows where we’ll drift off to today?

meaning: Signal sonore qu'on donne pour déterminer un moment avec précision.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Laurent, will you tell me when to start solving the puzzle? My pen is buzzing with impatience.

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: Careful, keep an eye on the clock... and [ding]!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Here we go, I'm tackling the first line without hesitation.

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: I have a feeling you're going to beat your record this time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I've found the key, that number won't escape me today!

dialogue.speaker: Laurent
dialogue.text: Nothing stops you once you get going, it's impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Do you think we’ll be able to throw the ball at exactly the same time?

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Let’s try! I’ll count, and as soon as you hear '[go]', we’ll throw the ball together.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Okay, my hands are ready and I’m really focused.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: One… two… three!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Oh no, I threw a little too early, we’ll have to try again!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: No worries, next time we’ll be perfectly synchronized, I’m sure of it!

meaning: bruit de galop du cheval.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look at them over there by the old apple tree, they're getting the horses ready for the ride.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: It would be funny if we each picked our own, like when we were kids at my uncle's farm!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I can still remember the feel of the leather reins in my hands, I miss that sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: I bet Justine would still pick the most spirited one in the group, like always.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: And you, you'd go for the one that jumps at the slightest rustling leaf, right?

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Haha, that's right, and suddenly, everyone would just hear: [clip-clop], [clip-clop] behind the bushes.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Hey, is something going on outside, or is it just my imagination playing tricks on me?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Oh no, you're not dreaming, listen to that [thud-thud-thud] repeating, it really sets the mood!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: What's funny is how much that kind of sound reminds me of the stories my grandfather used to tell at night.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Ah yes, I know what you mean, it instantly brings to mind tales of nighttime walks or approaching mysteries.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: We should almost go out and check—with how loud it is, it's going to end up right outside the window!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Come on, put on a coat, or you'll be shivering more than getting answers to your curiosity!

meaning: bruit produit par une sirène de bateau.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: [bang]! Everything jumped [bang] all around, I thought my coffee was going to dance on the bench.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: And I thought you never reacted to anything, and here you are surprised!

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: It's from hanging around here so much that I still let myself get surprised, you see.

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: You'll end up not even noticing anymore, like the old sea dogs at the port.

dialogue.speaker: Sofia
dialogue.text: Oh, I'll never be that unflappable, you can count on that!

dialogue.speaker: Jules
dialogue.text: Stay just as you are, it's much more lively!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you feel how the air is different by the harbor in the evening?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, it's soothing to see all those boats motionless, at anchor.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: But as soon as a big ship approaches, it feels like the whole landscape starts to move.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look, I think that one is about to leave. The sailors are bustling around on deck.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen... [toot]... [toot]... the horn echoes right down to your core!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That rumble is impressive, it makes me want to go on a journey too.

meaning: bruit de la sonnerie du téléphone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, there's a smell of warm croissants drifting through the street below, it's making me want to go out.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Ah, the temptation is strong! We could go on a little bakery adventure, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I'm putting on my sneakers and I'll be ready to go in five minutes, stopwatch in hand.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wait a second... [ring], [ring]! Well, looks like I'm not the only one people want to talk to this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The suspense is killing me—let us know if it's an invitation to brunch?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Promise, if it's a croissant plan, you'll be the first to know.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think I could borrow your Italian recipe book for this weekend?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Hold on a second, [ring], [ring], there goes that darn phone popping up at the worst possible moment again!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, your dishes are as sought after as your phone line.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: So it seems! Between the two, I'm starting to lose track of everything.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, if your book becomes available before your phone does, I'll send you my list of ingredients.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Deal, but you have to save me a piece of lasagna in exchange!

meaning: bruit d'un coup de sifflet, notamment d'un sifflet à roulette.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The crowd is already chanting, this bodes well for the second half!

dialogue.speaker: Aminata
dialogue.text: Look at the coach on the sideline, he keeps giving instructions, it’s intense.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And now, bam, [snap], everyone stops dead, it’s exactly the decisive moment.

dialogue.speaker: Aminata
dialogue.text: Do you think they’ll finally listen this time, or just pretend nothing’s happening like last time?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With this atmosphere, I bet they’ll have no choice but to obey, even the most stubborn ones.

dialogue.speaker: Aminata
dialogue.text: Honestly, I wish I had that much authority over my little cousins when I babysit them!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Look at this crowd, it seems like no one wants to miss a single moment of this match.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Absolutely, the fans are already waving their flags as if the score might change before the kickoff even happens.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I hope the referee doesn't keep us waiting too long, you can really feel the tension in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: With all this excitement, it's like time has stretched out... Yet the players are all in position.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: We're just waiting for that little signal, everyone has their eyes fixed on the center of the field.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: [tweet]! Ah, there it is, it's started—ninety minutes of suspense ahead.

meaning: bruit d'une sonnerie mécanique ou électrique.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [ring], [ring], [ring]... Do you hear that? There goes the phone ringing again just when I wanted to sit down for five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's like we're being watched, it's always the same right when we try to catch our breath.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And of course, it's probably some last-minute emergency.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: I bet it's the tech department again, they never call for nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I just hope it'll be sorted out quickly, I was planning to finish my files today.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: No worries, I'll take the call and let you know if it's important.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [brr]... [brr]... [brr]... There it goes again behind my desk.

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: This time, it's for you, I'm sure of it.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wanna bet? It just seems like the usual Tuesday afternoon routine.

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: Come on, show me your negotiating skills with the receiver.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yeah right, if it's someone from tech support again...

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: Smells like a big announcement or a real headache—get ready!

meaning: bruit produit par le cri de la grive.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's so peaceful here, you can almost only hear the birds!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Look over there, on the branch... There are several of them gathered all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you catch that quick '[chirp]'? That's not the same song as before.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was brief but it stands out from everything else, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I love how some sounds cut through the morning air.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's like the forest has its own secret signals, we should come back here with a sound notebook.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: What fresh air, it really smells like the woods after the rain, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Absolutely, and listen to all those little sounds among the branches, it really sets the mood right away.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There, wait... Look just above the moss, there’s a bird flitting around in the holly!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I see it, it looks nervous... Do you think it’s trying to get our attention?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, did you hear that little '[chirp]' sound it just made? It does it every now and then, it’s funny.

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: With that kind of improv, it almost feels like we’re in a miniature orchestra right in the middle of the leaves.

meaning: son produit par des cymbales, des grelots.
bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look at all these colorful stalls, I almost feel like I’m in a living painting!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I agree, and that troupe weaving through the crowd really adds a magical touch to everyone here.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: The little boy in front of me has his eyes wide open at the show, you can tell he’s not missing a thing.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? Whenever they raise their hands together, there’s this '[ting]' that slips above the noise, it’s almost hypnotic.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It makes me want to get even closer, to catch every nuance of the performance.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Deal! If we stay here, I have a feeling we’ll be offered a part in the next act.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There are really a lot of people here tonight for the parade! The costumes are sparkling brilliantly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Did you see the group just behind the majorettes? They're giving it their all!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, especially the guy with the green scarf, he really knows how to liven things up.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Every time he raises his arms, you hear a little [ting] running down the street, it makes me smile.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just watching his moves makes you want to follow the rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It feels like the whole neighborhood is buzzing with them, that energy is contagious!

meaning: son produit par des cymbales, des grelots.
bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you remember the parade last year, with all those colors and that crowd?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I can still hear the marching bands and the children running around the performers.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: When the juggler jumped onto the stage, every movement made a little [ting] sound, it was magical.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That's true, it made me feel like I was transported to another era.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it makes me want to dive back into that festive atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Maybe we could go see a parade together again this year.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I still have it ringing in my ears, that parade last night… it was impossible to sleep after so many colors and sounds!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Me too, I feel like those rhythms danced around my bed all night, especially the ones that brought a sparkle to the air.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: There was a moment when everyone almost stopped walking, just to listen to those little bursts of light. Is that what you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly! It was like they were playing with the silence, it grabbed all my attention.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Sometimes, I felt like it was as if sparks were flying through the air with every quick movement.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That's it! [ting], [ting], and suddenly the crowd would smile, as if that simple sound could send out a wave of energy.

meaning: son produit par des cymbales, des grelots.
bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, do you hear that little '[ding]' every time the kids grab the horse's tail on the carousel?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Yes, it's that kind of detail that makes the atmosphere so festive.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I love this square in winter, with the lights and the festival music.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: It's true, it almost makes you want to be a kid again and ride the carousel yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The magic of the holidays works at any age, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Absolutely, all it takes is a smile or a little surprise to believe in it again.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at the table next to us, they're opening that strange decorated chest.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, did you see? Every time someone touches that medallion, everyone looks at them.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It must be an old family tradition, it's such an intriguing ritual.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wonder if that piece of jewelry hides a secret mechanism or just a surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen, the moment the lid moves, you hear that little '[ting]' that sparks everyone's curiosity!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It feels like the atmosphere changes with every sound, it's almost magical!

meaning: son produit par des cymbales, des grelots.
bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look at what's on the table, it doesn't look like any other instrument I've seen!

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's intriguing... Do you think we can touch it without a teacher breathing down our necks?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I'll take the risk, listen to this, I'm pressing gently...

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: *[ting]*! Wow, that little sound surprises me every time!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It seems like this object is hiding more secrets than I thought.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: We should try to guess what else it does before someone catches us.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Did you hear that little '[ting]' every time they hit the cymbals? I love this festive atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, it makes you want to move, it feels like everyone is getting carried away by the music.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: The troupe is amazing, they really know how to set the mood in the square.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at the kids dancing nearby, they're so caught up in it.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: This kind of show reminds me of village festivals when I was little.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's such a pleasure to find this simple joy again, especially on a Saturday afternoon like this.

meaning: Interjection comique à la fin d'un couplet, d'un refrain, imitant un bruit de cymbales.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Hey, listen to this: I tried making crepes while juggling the pan... an artistic attempt!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh wow, I can already picture the disaster... Tell me everything!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: When it was time to flip the crepe, it took a flying leap straight onto the cat.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Poor cat, I hope he didn’t decide to go on a diet after that!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Instead, he ended up licking the flour off the floor. Real class, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And now, imagine circus music: [wah-wah]!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Today, I spilled my orange juice on my keyboard... now it smells like vitamin C everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Lucky you! My mug decided to commit suicide right in front of the photocopier.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Ah, the streak of bad luck continues: after that, I tried to erase a stain with correction fluid... now I have an abstract artwork on my sweater.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: The day of little disasters! We could almost open a 'workplace gags' exhibition.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And the grand finale: while trying to clean up, I set off the fire alarm... in front of the whole open space!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: For that, you deserved the soundtrack to go with it: [wah-wah]!

meaning: ponctuation plaisante ou ironique à la fin d'un couplet, d'un refrain.
bruit de fredonnement d'un air de musique.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Guess what, I finally tried making that famous yogurt cake recipe last night.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, I hope for your sake the result was more glorious than last time, when you forgot the baking powder.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Let's just say it rose... then completely collapsed as soon as I opened the oven.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The great suspense... and then, bam, flat as a pancake, [womp womp]!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Exactly: a cake in appearance, but not in taste.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At least it must have gone well with a nice hot chocolate—no baking powder this time, I promise!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Guess what, this morning I tried to make crepes, full of optimism and ambition!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, the champion is back in action! So, is the kitchen still standing, or should we call the fire department?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was on a roll, right up until I mixed up the flour and the cornstarch… and then, [womp-womp]!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Seriously? Sounds like the suspense in a TV movie, with an unexpected twist!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, the texture was so weird that even my dog hesitated in front of the plate.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: We should open a museum of your culinary masterpieces, guaranteed hit for Halloween!

meaning: Interjection exprimant le scepticisme, la perplexité, la désapprobation.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: [tsk], did you hear Thomas? He really thinks he can organize the whole event by this weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard. He’s super motivated, but it seems ambitious to me.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: He always aims really high, that’s his style.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: That’s true, but sometimes it works out… and other times, we have to pick up the pieces.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Well, at worst he’ll have learned something!

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Let’s keep our fingers crossed for him, then!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I saw an abandoned electric scooter right in front of the office door this morning. I thought about bringing it to reception, but I left it there—you never know...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [tsk], you're just trusting luck to sort this out? It'll end up in some corner again or with someone taking it, you'll see.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh but wait, the other day I did that and then security asked me ten questions, it was endless.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's typical here, everything ends up getting complicated...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least this time I won't get stuck in a lost scooter story.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Classic Sophie move—one day it'll come back to you like a boomerang, you'll see!

meaning: pour exprimer une incrédulité, une réticence, un refus, une mise en garde; pour couper la parole à quelqu'un.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I bet you're going to try to finish that file again tonight, aren't you?

dialogue.speaker: Koffi
dialogue.text: [tsk], who do you take me for? A magician? That's three all-nighters in a row now!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: But you always manage to pull through, so I was thinking…

dialogue.speaker: Koffi
dialogue.text: This time, what they're asking from us is really over the top, that's all.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If we both get to work, maybe we can make some progress, right?

dialogue.speaker: Koffi
dialogue.text: Alright, put on a motivating playlist, because otherwise, I'll end up writing my resume on a napkin!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I saw an amazing internship earlier, it could really interest you with everything you're looking for right now.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: [tsk], do you really think that kind of ad is that interesting for me?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I promise, it's exactly what you wanted to do, and on top of that they're looking for someone quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Hmm, I'm always wary of offers that seem too perfect.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But you could at least take a look, right? You never know, maybe it's the lucky break of the month!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Alright, to make you happy, I'll read the description, but I'm not very convinced.

meaning: bruit produit par un coup de sifflet ; bruit d'un sifflement.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Hey, look, the ball is heading straight for the street!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If someone walks by, we'll have to fetch it from under a car...

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Do you think if I make a noise, the kids will stop chasing after it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, listen to this: [beep beep], [beep beep]! That usually gets their attention.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Not bad, they're already turning around... You've got real talent!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Thanks, it's handy when you spend your time watching the playground!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, Julien just dribbled past three players in a row, that's pretty impressive!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: He's really on top form today, honestly. Even his passes are flawless.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ooh, that tackle looks a bit risky to me... Do you think he'll get a card?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Possible... With today's referee, anything can happen. He looks ready to pull out the yellow card.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Things are heating up on the field, everyone is holding their breath!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Listen to that '[tweet tweet]' ringing out, the referee really didn't hesitate for a second!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Even the wind doesn't dare disturb this place, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, everything seems frozen in time… except for those little feathers you can spot between the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Behind that old oak, there's one hopping nonstop, look.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, yes! And there, listen… [tweet tweet]… it sounds like he's announcing his territory.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Such energy for such a tiny ball of feathers!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Even in the middle of the city, he still manages to get noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With this sunlight streaming through the leaves, you completely forget about the city, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: It’s amazing how everything seems more alive here. Look, there’s something moving in the bush over there.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ah, you’ve got a sharp eye! It must be one of those little morning visitors.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: I’ll try to catch a glimpse, but that rascal is hiding well.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Shh, listen for a moment… Maybe we’ll figure out where it is by its call.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: There! Do you hear it? Just behind us, [tweet tweet], really close!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un petit oiseau.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Chloe, look at those sunbeams shining through the leaves, it’s magical here.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It almost makes you want to stop for a moment and just listen to what’s happening around us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You know, sometimes in this spot, you can catch some really surprising sounds if you listen closely.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Listen, it goes [tweet-tweet] over there, like a little hidden wink in the branches!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh yes, you heard it too! It’s amazing how it echoes under the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: That’s why I’ll never get tired of walking here, every stroll has its own soundtrack.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look how the light passes through the leaves—it really gives this corner of the garden a special atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I have to admit, it makes me want to stop here just to enjoy the calm. Do you feel how fresh the air is?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait a second... there's a little commotion in the branches just above.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, you hear it too? [tweet-tweet]! You could recognize that sound anywhere in this silence.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I bet it's the same one that landed right near the bench last time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between the bushes, he's found a kingdom all his own, that's for sure.

meaning: bruit produit par une sirène de bateau.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I love walking along the quay in the morning, there's always something to watch between the fishermen and the birds.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: And that mist on the water, it feels like the port is waking up ever so gently, it's almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, there goes the big cruise ship moving away… [toot]… [toot]… [toot]… It's impressive every time it crosses the bay!

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: You've got a sharp ear, I was just about to notice the ship when it had already made itself heard.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: That's my favorite signal, it echoes all the way to the back of the café across the street.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: We could sketch this atmosphere in a notebook, just to try to capture some of its magic.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: With all these sailboats, it feels like we're on a postcard, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's exactly what I was thinking! The seagulls calling and the smell of salt in the air—it's all here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, [chirp]! I love this moment when everything comes alive on the dock.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It instantly adds a bit of adventure to the air, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I wonder where all those travelers boarding over there are coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe we should try our luck one day and leave without warning, just grab our bags and off we go!

meaning: pour exprimer une incrédulité, une réticence, une mise en garde, un désaccord; pour signifier une interdiction, un refus; pour coupter la parole à quelqu'un.
pour exprimer l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Imagine, we just rush to the concert tonight without tickets and try our luck outside the venue!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: [tsk], wait, do you really want to just show up there like that, empty-handed?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: But that's often how the best nights start, right?

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
