dialogue.text: You say that now, but just wait until we're stuck outside in the rain.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: We'll figure something out once we're there, like we did last time at the festival!

dialogue.speaker: Baptiste
dialogue.text: I'll let you give it a shot, but I can't see myself waiting in line for nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Shall we take on a real challenge tonight? I spotted the high school roof—the view up there must be amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The high school roof? You really want to climb up there? Are you serious, Clara?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Of course! Are you with me or are you scared? We just go up the ladder behind the gym, it’s no big deal.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Your plan sounds sketchy… What if we get caught, what will you do?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, we’ll film everything, and no one will ever know. It’ll take us ten minutes, tops!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [tsk], stop right there! I go along with a lot of your ideas, but this is asking the impossible.

meaning: musique de flûtes et de tambourins.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: You know what? Last night, the market square was buzzing—there were lights everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastien
dialogue.text: Seriously? I must have missed an amazing atmosphere... I bet you were right up front, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Not even, but there was no way to miss the moment when everyone started clapping and stomping their feet to the rhythm of [boom-boom-tap]!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastien
dialogue.text: Just hearing you talk about it gives me chills! Makes me want to get moving too.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I promise you, tonight we absolutely have to go back. That kind of energy doesn't come around every day.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastien
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'll put on my special party sneakers—we're going to shake up the place!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: It looks like the whole neighborhood has gathered in the square, do you hear that racket?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, it's impossible to sit quietly with all this commotion!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: I think they're bringing out every instrument they can find, it must really be something to see.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [boom-bang], it almost sounds like the music is jumping right up to our windows!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: With an atmosphere like this, I feel like my feet want to dance on their own.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Trust me, if we want to see the show, it's now or never, let's go before we miss the best part!

meaning: bruit strident d'un petit instrument de musique ou d'une trompe d'automobile.

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Hey, look at that little impromptu brass band over there by the market! They're really enthusiastic.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's true, and one of them has a funny thing that looks like a chrome funnel, did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Yeah, and he's blowing into it like it's a contest! Their music almost makes you want to dance across the street.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: As long as we don't get noticed by the bus driver speeding up over there...

dialogue.speaker: Rachid
dialogue.text: Exactly, let's move to the beat before we get stuck on the sidewalk!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Come on, Rachid, one more step and... [toot-toot]! Guaranteed atmosphere all the way across the crosswalk!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You see, every time we cross here, it's as if the street wants to tell us a thousand different stories.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I'm almost thinking we should take this route more often, just for the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Between the florist humming and the ice cream vendor smiling at everyone, you never know what you'll come across.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Look, over there, a little crowd in front of the fountain. Someone must have brought out another unusual instrument this time.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, do you feel that energy? It feels like something funny is happening, listen closely.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, there's the culprit, that kid who's fidgeting... [toot toot], [toot toot], he's setting the mood with his gadget!

meaning: bruit ponctuel, souvent d'origine métallique, ou bruit de verre brisé.
bruit d'une cymbale ou d'une paire de cymbales.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Hey, I just can't find that big salad bowl anywhere—do you know where it could have gone?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you're talking about the glass one, it's behind the stack of pots right at the top; you'll have to play acrobat to get it.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: I'm going slowly... wait... No, look, it's not put away prope— [clink]!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oof, that sound didn't bode well!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Next time, you're putting things away, okay? This place looks like a wobbly puzzle!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Promise, but first, let's pick up the pieces before the cat decides to come into the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Tell me, if you can handle the bottom drawer, I'll let you pick the right knife.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'll take the big one, it looks sharp. Watch your fingers!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No worries, I'm keeping an eye on the board and anything that gets too close.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oops… [clink]! There, the handle just slipped onto the oven rack.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: As long as nothing breaks, you win the prize for culinary suspense!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I promise to make less noise than the timer... well, I'll try!

meaning: son produit par des cymbales, des grelots.
bruit de sifflement d'un projectile.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: This room really resonates differently when we play together, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Absolutely, every note seems to bounce off the walls, it gives me goosebumps every time.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: The moment I brushed the little bell, there was that [ting] that slipped right between our chords, it was almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I noticed, it happened so subtly I thought someone had just cast a harmony spell!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It’s in those unexpected moments that we manage to surprise even our own music, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Exactly! Nothing like those little surprises to make us feel the music even more.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This corner of the shop feels like a treasure chest for curious musicians, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Look, there’s even an entire section of instruments you rarely get to see up close.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Go ahead and try that little golden object over there, I’ve always wanted to know what sound it makes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, I’ll spin it a bit… [ting]! Well, that’s a sonic surprise to spark your curiosity.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It almost sounds like you cast a musical spell into the air!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: All we need now is a top hat and we could start our own sensory show.

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un objet qu'on lance.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Watch closely, I'm throwing the ball and... [whoosh], it shoots off at full speed!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wow, nice throw! Have you been practicing in secret or what?

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Maybe a little, but I admit I like to surprise people.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Either way, it makes me want to try and catch your supersonic ball!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Come on, show me what you can do, I'm ready!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You'll see, challenge accepted—get ready to be impressed!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Catch it well, I'm going to try a diagonal throw this time!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: I hope you're not underestimating my speed, I'm ready!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Watch closely... one step back, a deep breath... here we go!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: [whoosh], your frisbee almost brushed my ear, you're aiming tight today!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: At least I know how to surprise you without warning!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Want to bet I can send it back just skimming the ground, just to make things harder?

meaning: bruit léger produit par un glissement.
pour marquer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Sophie, did you borrow my orange highlighter again? I can't find it anywhere in all this mess.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oops, I think it slipped into my stack of papers... Hold on, let me dig around a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: No worries, I'll just grab what's sticking out... [whoosh]... and there we go, mission accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, the desk expert in action! You always know where everything is hiding.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: You have to master the art of tidying up with you around.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Touché! But admit it, it does liven up the table a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Look, if I gently push this card across the table, do you think it will make it all the way to the edge?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely... [swish] [swish], it's moving forward without even hesitating!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: I love these kinds of little challenges, it's almost hypnotic to watch.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Honestly, we should try it with your postcard, see if it slides just as well.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Ooh, challenge accepted! Hand me yours so we can compare styles.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Deal, may the fastest one win a slice of pie!

meaning: bruit léger produit par un glissement.
pour marquer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, when I slide the box across the table, it goes [swish]... do you hear it?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it's the kind of sound that reminds me of school, when we used to move our pencil cases.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly! Just a little push and it slides all by itself.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Gotta say, the table's varnish doesn't help either, everything just slides right off.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's handy for cleaning but not so much when you want to keep things in place.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Maybe we should think about putting down a placemat or a mat to stop the pens from racing around!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Jérôme, look at my shoes, they're really not made for this kind of floor…

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: But that's exactly what makes going down the stairs fun, you'll see!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Hmm, if I end up at the bottom on the rug, I'll say it's your fault.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Listen closely… [swish]… do you feel the difference when you move your foot gently like that?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Oh, that's strange, it feels like dancing on feathers!

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Go a little further, you might start to enjoy those little thrills on the steps!

meaning: bruit d'un sifflement, d'un sifflotement.
bruit de sirène d'alarme.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at that, the sun is really shining right through the branches today.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, and with this light, we can see the birds better. There, on the highest branch, do you see it?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll try to attract it... [coo], [coo], [coo]! It moved its head—do you think it heard me?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, it's watching you now! I love how it's staring at you, it looks like it's wondering about you.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe with a bit of practice I could teach it a melody.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If it ever comes down, you'll teach me your secret, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look how the trees are swaying gently, it makes you want to hang around here all day.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With this breeze and all these sounds, it almost feels like we're deep in the forest even though we're just in the park.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It reminds me of Sundays at my grandmother's, with all the windows open.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [whoosh]... [whoosh]... it's the kind of sound that floats in the air and makes you smile for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Those are the best, those little moments when everything feels light just because of one small detail.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We should enjoy it while we have nothing else to do but watch the sky.

meaning: bruit de déplacement rapide d'un véhicule.
pour chasser devant soi.
pour marquer la rapidité ou la soudaineté d'un procès, notamment d'une disparition.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know the intersection near the bakery? I almost lost my hat earlier!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Wait, don’t tell me it was because of another reckless driver in a hurry...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly! I was walking along calmly when a car came out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it’s like they’re running a secret rally these days.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I just had time to feel a gust of wind and hear a loud "[whoosh]" right next to me.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: We’re going to end up needing helmets just to go buy a baguette…

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I swear, Paul, as I was crossing the street, this scooter came out of nowhere, [whoosh], even my hair moved!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Do you at least watch where you're walking? Moments like that really wake you up!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I think I'm going to scan every street corner now, no way I'm getting caught off guard again.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With your luck, next time it'll be a bike, but hey, at least you'll dodge flying scarves!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I can picture it: me, superhero style, ready to leap out of the way.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Let's just hope your cape doesn't fly off too, or you'll end up just like in the movies!

meaning: bruit soudain produit par un coup

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look at this drawer, it still refuses to go in straight, it's so annoying.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you want me to give you a hand or are you managing your battle on your own?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll force it a bit, it'll give in eventually…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, that noise, [thud], I almost dropped my coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Oops, I promise I won't touch anything else without warning everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Thanks, my heart isn't ready for another shock like that today!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll try to reach the box on the top shelf…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Careful… Oh! [thud]! Did you see that? It almost fell on me.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Good thing you have quick reflexes, that wouldn't have been fun for anyone.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's always when you think everything's fine that things start acting up.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Noted: next time, we'll get the step ladder instead of playing acrobats.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Good idea, and I'll feel less targeted by unidentified flying objects!

meaning: bruit produit par une chose qui s'écrase.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think I can stack one more plate on this pile or is it too risky?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With your tightrope walker technique? If I were you, I wouldn't push my luck.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh come on, if I do it slowly, it should work. Watch…

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You're tempting fate now. I have a bad feeling about this.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And there you go, [crash]! Oops… that wasn't part of the plan.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's just say the kitchen wanted a new look today…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Have you ever seen a more beautiful chocolate cake than this one? I spent my whole afternoon making it!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Honestly, it looks dreamy! We should almost take a picture before we touch it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll carry it to the table... but make a little room for me, I'm afraid I'll slip.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Watch out behind you... Oh, and there—[thud]!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ouch, all my decoration is ruined... It was going to be perfect for dessert.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: We could start the trend of deconstructed cake, you'll make people jealous without even knowing it!

meaning: bruit sec et sonore produit par un coup, par une chute, par une détonation.
pour exprimer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [crash]! Well, that wasn’t planned—the flowerpot just made its own dive to the floor…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: No kidding, it almost made me fall off my chair! Did it shatter?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Haven’t had time to take a close look yet, but it doesn’t seem to have liked that wobbly ledge.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Quite the show for a simple coffee break… Do you always go for the dramatic?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s just say I like to spice things up a bit, even if the plant didn’t ask for it.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Next break, I’ll come with a helmet, just in case you have more explosive ideas!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful with the stack of pots, last time we almost lost everything in a mini landslide.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Well, look what happens when you push a little too hard... [crash]! There you go, I have my answer.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, you just gave the whole kitchen an impromptu concert, congratulations!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: These pots really refuse to stay quiet, it's unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we'll end up installing anti-fall alarms just for them.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Or maybe a sign that says 'turbulence zone,' that would be more realistic in our house!

meaning: bruit soudain et fort, produit notamment par un coup, par une chute.
pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hugo, look, the frame is completely tilted—do you think it’s going to stay up like that for long?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Hold on, I’ll grab a chair and try to straighten it without disturbing the plants next to it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no… careful—[crash]! There you go, I told you it would end up like this…

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: We should have gone with super glue instead of relying on my handyman skills!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least now no one will wonder if the frame is straight.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: And I’ve earned a good scare and some glass confetti on the floor…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Can you believe it, I forgot my keys for the third time this week.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, you really have a knack for unexpected stories!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll check in my bag, but I doubt it...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh! — [clang]! — Uh, did your bag just make the drawer pop open?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I hope nothing's broken this time...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At the rate you're going, your stories will end up redecorating the place all by themselves.

meaning: bruit produit par une chute, un jaillissement, un éclaboussement.
bruit produit par une chasse d'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I thought carrying this full salad bowl would be easier…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: With all those ice cubes, it's a bit slippery, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Careful over there… [whoosh]! Why do I always have such timing?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Looks like the table wanted to join the party too.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Well, now my dress will have a unique pattern for the evening…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: As long as you don't try to make it a trend, it's all good!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Paul! Look behind you, [whoosh]! I don't think your umbrella is going to recover from that hit.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh no, it had just dried out since last time... Looks like it does whatever it wants.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You should patent it as an automatic water launcher—at least it entertains the passersby.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: If only we could make some money from all these surprises, I'd invest right away!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The show is free today, enjoy it—the weather is giving us gifts.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Come on, let's go shelter our shoes before we end up with a swimming pool here!

meaning: pour exprimer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This bench looked peaceful, but I feel like anything could happen here.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You’re not wrong... Do you remember the other day near the bandstand?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, is that when you suddenly started running for no apparent reason?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Exactly, [whoosh wham], a ball came out of nowhere and I almost got hit right in the head!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think even the pigeons were surprised that day.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Since then, I always keep an eye on the sky... You never know what might fall on you!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Guess what, yesterday I almost ended up soaked even though the weather was gorgeous!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, you mean there wasn't a cloud in the sky or anything, and you almost got wet?

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Exactly! I was just walking calmly near the park, and everything seemed normal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This sounds like it's about to get wild, I can feel it coming...

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Well, [splash splosh], a car drove through a puddle and splashed me from head to toe!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now that's a masterpiece! You must have looked totally stunned!

meaning: bruit produit par une chute, un jaillissement, un éclaboussement.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you want to see my new cactus? I put it right on the edge of the table.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, let me lean in for a better look... Oops, [thud]!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Nooo, was there dirt everywhere or just a little on the rug?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It spilled onto the rug and there are little pebbles under the chair.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, it's more lively than a plastic cactus, let's say!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I'll observe the plants from a safe distance.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Oh no, Flo, I spilled the salad bowl and [splat], everything spread all over the tiles!

dialogue.speaker: Florence
dialogue.text: Well, that’ll teach you to try mixing so fast!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I admit, it’s a disaster—there’s some even under the table.

dialogue.speaker: Florence
dialogue.text: It almost looks like a modern mural… but a really, really wet one.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: One thing’s for sure, the cats are going to have a feast when they come through here.

dialogue.speaker: Florence
dialogue.text: As long as they don’t repaint the couch next, it’s all good!

meaning: bruit produit par embrasement soudain.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: The wood refuses to cooperate, I've been striking matches for ten minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe try stacking the logs differently, the air will flow better.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: I've already tried everything, but I feel like this is going to end up as an urban legend—this impossible fire.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don't throw in the whole newspaper at once, or you'll risk waking up the whole neighborhood!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Oh well, I'm going to take a chance with that old bottle of fire starter at the back of the shed.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear that [whoosh] out of nowhere? Even the cat jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, I'm trying again with the blowtorch, but this crème brûlée is putting up a fight!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Go easy this time, you know how it can react with the sugar.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just a quick blast... Oh wait, the caramel is finally starting to turn golden, that's a good sign.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Whoa, that made a real [whoosh]! Did you see the flame? It looked like a mini firework.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I thought I was going to lose my eyebrows, this dessert is giving me chills.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: At least you're going to impress everyone with that ultra-crispy top, worthy of a daring chef!

meaning: bruit produit par un avalement glouton.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Oh look, I brought out the caramel mousse, it’s fresh from the fridge!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: What a smell, it’s making my mouth water just looking at it. Can I dig in?

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Go ahead, take a big bite, now’s your chance.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No holding back then! Here I go, you might not find any left.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: If you beat my speed record, I demand a second batch this weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here we go, [slurp]! And there you have it, mission deliciously accomplished.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know, there’s nothing like a good homemade snack to forget about the rain outside.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Honestly, your smoothie is amazing—it’s almost like a dessert!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I secretly added a bit of banana, it makes all the difference, right? But you’re the type to savor it drop by drop!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: I’m just trying to save some until the end, you know. At this rate, you’re going to finish before me.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, just to show you… *she takes a big sip and you can clearly hear* [slurp] *before she sets her glass down with a wink*.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Careful, your glass is going to disappear at this rate! Even the straw couldn’t handle it!

meaning: bruit produit par une sourde explosion ou par le souffle d'une déflagration.
bruit produit par embrasement soudain.
bruit produit par une chute, un jaillissement, un éclaboussement.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: No way, did you hear that big '[whoomph]' earlier in the garage? I thought the walls were going to shake.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was screwing in a shelf and I jumped! Do you know what happened?

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: It was the old bike tire I pumped up: it couldn't handle the pressure, it deflated all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Phew, I thought a gas canister had exploded, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: No, everything's fine, nothing broken except my pride: I'll have to buy a new inner tube.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That reminds me of last year, my soccer ball burst in the living room... it freaked out the cat for hours!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Hey, look what I found in the garage: Dad's old mini-barbecue. Want to try lighting it?

dialogue.speaker: Matthieu
dialogue.text: Seriously? After what happened last year with the embers?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I promise, this time I'll just use two firelighters and I'll keep everything under control.

dialogue.speaker: Matthieu
dialogue.text: You're a real expert now... but I still think I'll step back a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Okay, I'm bringing the match closer... wait, it's catching!

dialogue.speaker: Matthieu
dialogue.text: Whoa, that cloud just shot out... [whoosh]! Looks like your mini-barbecue wanted some attention.

meaning: bruit produit par un avalement glouton.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: *[slurp]*… Wow, did you put chili in this time? It warms me up all the way to my toes!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Judging by how fast you're digging into your bowl, I'd say yes, it's pretty spicy!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: But it's so good, I could fill an entire bucket with your recipe.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I admit it, you just broke my record—I'm awarding you the medal for indulgence!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hold on, I've still got plenty of room for pie… You're saving me a slice, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: For you, I always leave the biggest piece!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wow, there's still a mountain of cream puffs left! Do you think you can make a few of them disappear?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I accept the mission, but I can't promise any of those poor puffs will survive.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That one looks ready to be bitten... Which one are you going to start with?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: (pretends to gulp one down in a single bite) [gulp]! And that's one less in the battle!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Impressive... Looks like you could hold your own in a food contest!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Give me two more and we'll talk...

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you hear that big '[woof]' outside? I jumped, I think it was the neighbors' dog.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard it from here, that one really has an impressive bark.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Every time someone walks by, he just can't help himself.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I wonder if he at least recognizes the people from the neighborhood by now.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Doesn't seem like it, he even reacts to the mailman every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It must be part of his routine, there's no stopping him!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Last night, I heard strange noises near the hedge. I almost spilled my cup of tea!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, you mean like: [woof], [woof]! I bet it’s Gustave up to his tricks under the window again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s impossible to miss his commotion, it always gets on my nerves.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He’s got sharp hearing, that old rascal. Just a little rustle and he goes on high alert.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Even the wind can’t sneak by anymore with Gustave on watch.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If only he could warn me before I jump out of my skin every time!

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This silence, it's almost scary on our street, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: It's true, we don't even have the usual background noise, it completely changes the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The last time it was this quiet was during last year's storm.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I have a strange memory of that... It felt like the whole neighborhood was asleep.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait a second... did you hear that sound far off behind the trees?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: There it is, the atmosphere is waking up... [woof], [woof]! Now it's starting up again as if nothing had changed.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's strange, something moved behind the hedge when I came home earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: I thought I saw a shadow, but with night falling you can't really make out much anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The last time this happened, we found paw prints in the garden.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: All we need now is a four-legged visitor to keep the compost heap hedgehog company!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen... It's happening again! [wooo]... It even sounds like it's getting closer.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I might end up making a bowl of food for this ghost of the night!

meaning: bruit de déplacement rapide d'un véhicule.
pour chasser devant soi.
pour marquer la rapidité ou la soudaineté d'un procès, notamment d'une disparition.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I swear, yesterday Bastien hit the gas right as we were going through the tunnel.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Oh, it made such a '[whoosh]'! I almost thought the bag of chips was going to fly away!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I believe you, my heart skipped a beat, but Bastien thought it was hilarious.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: With him, every outing feels like an improvised roller coaster.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, next time, I’ll bring a helmet, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Good idea, and make sure to buckle up your chips too!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you notice that red car that sped around the corner? It looked like it was in a real hurry to get somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Yeah, honestly, it almost blew my hair back, it went by so fast.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That must be the third time today we've seen one like that—people just don't know the speed limit anymore!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: And then, all of a sudden, right behind us... [whoosh]! It disappears at the end of the street, like a shadow.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think even my coffee didn't have time to cool down before it was gone.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm timing it—at this rate, people will think we're on a racetrack!

meaning: bruit de sifflement produit par un projectile, notamment un couteau ou une flèche.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh look, the knife shot straight toward the target, we heard a "[whoosh]"!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I got chills, that kind of throw always fascinates me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You have to admit, that's almost surgical precision.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like he's been doing this forever, everyone holds their breath every time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If I were you, I wouldn't stand too close to the target, that's for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not even in my dreams, I'd rather keep all my shirt buttons!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: So that's how you hold the knife? It looks harder to handle than it does on TV.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Yes, but with a bit of wrist action, you can really surprise everyone—even yourself!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Alright, here I go... three, two, one... [whoosh]! Oh, it shot off like a rocket, did you see that?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That was impressive, it skimmed past the target at an incredible speed.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I thought it was going to find a new home in the straw behind!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: With style like that, you'll end up dethroning the club champion.

meaning: bruit produit par un engin manufacturé.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear to you, Élise, the garage was shaking this afternoon, the whole neighborhood was listening in.

dialogue.speaker: Élise
dialogue.text: No kidding! I heard it all the way in the kitchen, it was making a real [vroomvroom] in there, I even thought something was about to take off!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I went outside to check, I couldn't focus on my book, it was unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Élise
dialogue.text: For once it's not a car alarm waking everyone up...

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We should almost organize a guessing game with all the noises we collect around here.

dialogue.speaker: Élise
dialogue.text: At least we don't need a radio, the neighborhood soundtrack is more than enough!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that crane swinging over the street—you don't see that every day!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true, they've brought out their biggest machines today. I bet the neighbors are going to complain.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you remember the construction site near the library? That lasted forever, it was impossible to hear yourself think.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Compared to what's coming here, that was almost relaxing!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Careful, the foreman is signaling everyone to step back—they're about to start.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, here comes the [vroom-vroom] that reminds me of those early mornings with construction in the projects. Here we go again!

meaning: bruit d'un bref roulement de tambour, obtenu par un coup de la baguette droite suivi d'un coup de la baguette gauche.

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: Look, they brought out the old drum set from the attic, it smells like an impromptu jam session tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, we'll wake up the neighborhood like in the good old days.

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: Do you remember how we used to string together transitions between songs? Sometimes it was downright wild.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Wait, let me try... [bam]! There we go, the vibe is already picking up!

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: That's exactly what we needed to kick off the party, you've still got rhythm in your bones!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: You know, all it takes is a little craziness and a magic drumstick to get everything going again.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see the drummer's solo last night?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was absolutely impressive!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The moment when he suddenly sped up, I still get chills thinking about it.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's right before the last chorus, did you catch that too?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Of course, everyone seemed to be hanging on his drumsticks.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Then suddenly, that '[crash]' hits, and you can feel the explosion of energy in the room!

meaning: bruit d'une déflagration, d'un choc violent, d'une fusillade, d'une rafale d'arme automatique.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, are you going to tell me you missed all that racket in the street earlier?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: What, that wasn’t your dishwasher giving up the ghost, I hope?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: My dishwasher could never have made all the windows in the building shake, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, I was right in front of the window when [crash], everyone froze all at once like time had stopped.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Even my cat hid under the couch, that says it all!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And here I thought a simple rubble delivery didn’t impress anyone around here anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: Tell me you didn’t almost fall out of your bed last night…

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: You bet! All of a sudden, [crash], it just started like that, I thought my window was going to shatter.

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: My heart skipped a beat, I grabbed my pillow like a shield.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: Even my cat hid under the couch, that says it all!

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: At this rate, we should almost get a hard hat!

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: Or maybe invest in double glazing, the way things are going in the neighborhood…

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look at that car go by, [vroom], we barely had time to see its color!

dialogue.speaker: Élodie
dialogue.text: It's crazy, it looks like the road belongs to it alone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know, last time, I almost missed my turn because I was so captivated by the show.

dialogue.speaker: Élodie
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that's the kind of moment when even the birds get out of the way!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we keep going a bit further, there will surely be more to admire.

dialogue.speaker: Élodie
dialogue.text: Let's go, I have a feeling we won't be bored today with this parade.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Did you see what Pauline was driving this morning in front of the bakery?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Impossible to miss her, everyone turned to look as she went by.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Honestly, between the orange paint and her smile, she really livened up the square.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: What made me laugh was when she went '[vroom]' as she started up—it looked like she was about to take off.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Even the pigeons scattered, it was epic.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Pauline should think about inviting the mailman to try it—he's always dreaming of a little excitement on his route!

meaning: bruit produit par une chasse d'eau.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You know, last time, I thought we’d invited an orchestra just for those little waiting moments.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Oh wait, listen closely… [whoosh]! Impossible to miss that one.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That sound has almost become the official signal at home.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: We should almost play a jingle every time to go along with it, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Or we could put on a show: sound and light, home edition.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: With the soundtrack to match, we’ve already got our first special effect!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Honestly, that thing in the bathroom makes me feel like I live next to a hydroelectric dam!

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: There's no way to ignore it, even at the other end of the apartment. Want to try a test?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Alright, here we go, I'll press it and we'll see what happens.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: Wow, that "[whoosh]" is worthy of a physics experiment!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Now even the neighbors must be wondering what's going on in here...

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: We should have invited the theater troupe—this is more impressive than their special effects!

meaning: bruit produit par un choc violent, par une déflagration.
bruit de moteur, particulièrement lors d'une accélération.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If you had seen the state of the engine, you’d understand why I’m hesitant to mess with it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s exactly what makes it exciting! Hand me the wrench, let’s try it together.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Alright, but be ready to jump back—we never know with this wreck.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No worries, I’m as fast as lightning… Three, two, one…

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Sophie, there’s a weird smell, do you smell it too?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh man, do you hear that noise? [vroom]! It sounded like everything was about to blast off…

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Did you hear that noise? There was a huge [vroom] behind the buildings!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, I jumped! Do you think it was an accident or something?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: No idea, but I saw some lights flashing right after.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Maybe a transformer exploded, that happens here sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Anyway, the street is completely silent now, it’s strange.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Yeah, everyone seems to be waiting to see what will happen.

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice that rumbling earlier near the garage?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I was right next to it when it suddenly went [vrrr], I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I wonder what they're tinkering with in there to make it so surprising.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With them, you can expect anything, especially when they pull out their tools from the back of the workshop.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Last time, the whole neighborhood even smelled like burnt rubber!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: As long as it doesn't end up with smoke over the roof, they can keep doing their experiments.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Did you hear it? That scooter made a scene in the courtyard again this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, you couldn't miss it, it was just going '[vroom] [vroom]' under my window at the crack of dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's become the soundtrack to our mornings here.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: At this rate, I think I might not even need an alarm clock anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: At least it brings a bit of excitement to the building!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: That's true, but I wouldn't mind a quiet morning to sleep in, either.

meaning: bruit produit par un mouvement rapide.
pour marquer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, this stack of files is about to collapse at any second—I barely dare to touch it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Whoa, careful, or we'll have papers all over the office! Are you really planning to move it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I have to, otherwise I'll never find yesterday's... Ready for the rescue mission?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Do it gently, or the whole mountain will end up on the floor!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, if I slide the folder from underneath like this... [swish]! It worked, everything's still standing.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can't believe it, mission accomplished with no damage—you're amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I saw earlier in front of the building!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Really? What happened? You seem really surprised.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hugo was there with his new skateboard, and he's really good at it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hugo, that daredevil? I bet he tried some crazy trick again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes! In a second, he sped past me and I just heard a '[whoosh]' when he turned so fast at the corner.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, that's so him! Always going full speed, he'll never change.

meaning: bruit de moteur, particulièrement lors d'une accélération.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Hey, do you know what crossed my mind when I got home earlier?

dialogue.speaker: Sabrina
dialogue.text: What, another one of your crazy ideas or is it something to do with your old Fiat?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Exactly, the Fiat! It gave me a surprise coming out of the roundabout—I thought it was going to take off!

dialogue.speaker: Sabrina
dialogue.text: Oh wow, did you think you were Schumacher or something?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I pressed the pedal, and then... [vroom]! Even the pigeons scattered off the sidewalk.

dialogue.speaker: Sabrina
dialogue.text: When your Fiat manages to scare the birds, you know something truly unique is happening!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This morning, I almost ended up late for work because of the traffic jams along the quay.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh no, did you manage to weave your way through in the end?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Luckily I had my scooter—once it cleared up near the bridge, I sped up as much as I could.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can totally picture it: you leaning forward, and suddenly... [vroom]! Everyone watches you go by.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think that's my favorite moment—feeling the fresh air and zipping between the cars.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: A real speedster on two wheels—the city is yours when it flows like that.

meaning: bruit produit par un embrasement soudain.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If you ask me, we might end up with sausages that are completely raw.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’ve still got two tricks up my sleeve, just watch.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: In any case, the grill isn’t going to heat up by itself…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m going to add this little piece of paper, that should get things going.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Be careful with the paper, last time it almost went up in smoke!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, now, listen… [whoosh]! It’s off to a good start, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, I added two logs like you taught me, but it still won't catch.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Try bringing the flame closer to the corners—sometimes the air gets in better there and it makes all the difference.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm tilting the match a bit... Oh, it's starting to crackle now!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [whoosh]! Did you see that burst of flame? You'd almost think it was a magic trick.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My heart skipped a beat! It's like everything woke up all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With you, even a fireplace fire is a real show.

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch closely: I press the button, and... [vroom], do you feel that rush?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, what a kick! You must feel like the king of the neighborhood on this bike.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But wait, you haven't seen anything yet... I can push it a bit more if you're not scared.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not scared at all! Take me out on the main road, I want to feel the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Get on, fasten your helmet tight... We're taking off in three, two, one!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If my mom saw this, she'd drop her coffee cup!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, did you see the car that just went by over there? It almost made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally, it made a huge "[vroom]" as it sped by like that, I thought it was going to take off!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm holding my coffee with both hands—you never know when something like that will happen.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe we should pick a quieter terrace next time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With the pace here, there's no way we'll fall asleep in the sun!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: For sure, it gives us a... let's say, lively atmosphere for our break.

meaning: Onomatopée imitant un bruit de moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Guess what, while I was riding earlier, a car sped past me with an incredible [vroom], I thought the street was going to shake!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: That must be impressive, especially with this traffic—you don’t expect that kind of surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, I even felt my handlebars vibrate, that says it all!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: That’s crazy, I never hear anything that spectacular in my neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It seems like urban life sometimes has a few unexpected tricks up its sleeve, even in the routine.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll keep my ears open—who knows what might liven up my street!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Do you remember the roundabout just after the station? I pressed down a bit and then, [vroom], it just took off on its own!

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: I really felt like the car responded instantly, it was exhilarating.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: And that little thrill when we overtook the truck... just thinking about it puts a smile back on my face.

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: If only every Sunday could be like that one!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Next trip, should we try the coastal road then?

dialogue.speaker: Justine
dialogue.text: I'd love to, and I promise to put together a proper playlist this time!

meaning: bruit de moteur, particulièrement lors d'une accélération.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You’re never going to believe this, Leo, I took the keys to my uncle’s old Peugeot this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Wait, you drove that car? You actually dared to take it out of the garage?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I couldn’t resist, I took it for a spin all the way down the road, the speedometer was shaking!

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: Just picturing you, I can already hear the [vroom vroom] under the hood, that must’ve been a rush!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I thought the wind was going to rip my helmet off, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Léo
dialogue.text: You’ve got to do that again for me sometime, I want to see it with my own eyes!

dialogue.speaker: Noemie
dialogue.text: You know, walking past the parking lot this morning, I almost got caught off guard by a guy on his electric scooter.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That reminds me of when my cousin would race into the family yard, shouting "[vroom vroom]" at every turn—you'd think he was a stuntman.

dialogue.speaker: Noemie
dialogue.text: Your cousin had quite the imagination! We used to compete to see who was the fastest, even if it was just on bikes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, those impromptu speed contests... we always brought back our scraped knees as trophies.

dialogue.speaker: Noemie
dialogue.text: So true! And the best part was the snack after the race, feeling so proud to have won, no matter what we were riding.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Nothing could beat those moments, and now, it's just the memories racing through my mind.

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Léa, did you see the old moped my uncle lent me? It's got style, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Oh, it's so charming! Do you think it still starts?

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Watch closely... *[vroom]*! See, it's running like it's brand new.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Incredible, it reminds me of my grandpa's rides!

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Want to take a ride to the canal? I bet we'll turn every head.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: With this bike, there's no way we won't get noticed. Alright, I'm putting on my helmet!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: There's really a village vibe today, don't you think? Even the birds are singing louder without all the usual hustle and bustle.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: That's true, it's different from usual. You could almost hear a pin drop, it's so peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If it could stay like this more often, I'd finally have the courage to read on this bench without being disturbed.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: Oh, watch out... [vroom]... over there, a motorcycle is tearing through all this lovely silence!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: And there you go, the spell is broken. It had to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Loïc
dialogue.text: No escaping the neighborhood surprises, it seems!

meaning: bruit produit par un mouvement rapide.
pour marquer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don't you think this machine is made for thrills?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that, Lucas... *[vrrt]* — did you see it go under the bench?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But how did you get it to slip through like that?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A bit of practice and quick reflexes, that's the key!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, here I go: if I manage to catch it, you let me use the remote.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Deal, but you'll have to sprint to make it!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Look, I tinkered with a little remote-controlled car last night. Ready to test it in the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm turning it on... *[vroom]* It's speeding straight ahead, do you see it going full throttle!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Not bad at all! It took the curve without skidding this time.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's even faster than I imagined.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: If we set up the ramp, do you think it'll take off?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Let's give it a try, it might be spectacular!

meaning: bruit de moteur, particulièrement lors d'une accélération.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you had seen the state of the road this morning, I thought I was going off-roading in my car.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? I dodged three giant puddles before reaching the red light over there.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, just when I thought I was in the clear, a motorcyclist sped past me like an arrow!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Oh, I can already imagine the [vroom] that startled you as he passed right next to your door!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I jumped, I admit it! I was so focused on my windshield wipers that I didn’t see him coming.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: I get it, next time, let’s swap routes, how about that?

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: I spent the whole day thinking about our trip along the ridge road.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it, I can still hear the "[vroom]" echoing between the cliffs!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: You should have seen the faces of the cyclists behind us—they must have thought it was a movie shoot!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it was worth the detour. And that sea air as we took the turns—I never get tired of it.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Promise, next time I'll be the one driving to surprise you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'll be waiting to see that, but first, practice handling those hairpin turns without shaking!

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile avant son point d'impact.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at that trajectory, Céline! I’ve rarely seen a marble shoot across the field so fast.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: You’re telling me! I thought it was going to hit me—I barely had time to hold my breath.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And just as it passed me, I heard a little [whoosh] in the air—it almost made me jump.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: Details like that snap you awake, you instantly switch back into stealth mode!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Exactly, every game gives me a different rush of adrenaline.

dialogue.speaker: Céline
dialogue.text: And to think we just came here to have fun—now it’s basically a commando mission!

dialogue.speaker: Raphael
dialogue.text: Alright, it’s time to show what my arm can do—watch that trajectory closely!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, nice shot! I heard a [whoosh] flying straight toward the target!

dialogue.speaker: Raphael
dialogue.text: For once, I kept my cool and everything lined up just right.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, the target better watch out with you around.

dialogue.speaker: Raphael
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I might end up challenging the instructor.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With that confidence, soon arrows won’t have any secrets left for you!

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile avant son point d'impact.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Phew! A "[whoosh]" just passed a hair's breadth from my shoulder, did you feel it?

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: No, but wait, what are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I swear, I felt like something zipped by super fast right behind me.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: That sounds like another prank from the people playing next to the skatepark, I bet.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: We'd better slide to the right, I'm not in the mood to dodge anything today.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Alright, let's go for the sneaky move, I don't want to be today's target either!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you hit the center again, coffee's on me! Sound good, Sophie?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful, Lucas... Here we go, I'm drawing the bow... and [whoosh]! Right on the red ring, take a good look!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You must have a real archer hidden inside you, it's unbelievable—even the bowstring is impressed.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You haven't seen anything yet, just wait until I really warm up.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, at this rate, I'm going to have to come up with a challenge, or you'll win everything.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Too late, it's your turn to give it a shot now. Try not to shake at the crucial moment!

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile avant son point d'impact.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: If we want to sneak over to the old barn without getting spotted, it's now or never.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll aim for the blue barrel and create a distraction while you crawl to the left.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Hey, Lucas, do you feel the tension rising? Looks like they're tightening their position...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [whoosh]! Did you hear that? Sounds like things are really heating up.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: No way I'm backing down, this is it: I'm going for the window!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I've got your back, go!

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: I was at the paintball session this afternoon: at one point, I pulled the trigger and right away, [whoosh], the ball shot across the field like crazy!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You really know how to aim! Me, I end up shooting at the bushes most of the time…

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Oh, but this time I just got lucky: the ball bounced off Mathieu’s shield—he was convinced he was safe.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hilarious! How did he react when he got hit in his secret hiding spot?

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: He shouted that he wanted VAR, like in soccer, and everyone burst out laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With you on the team, the next round is going to be something! I’m picking my side based on your outfit, that’s for sure!

meaning: bruit de sifflement d'un projectile avant son point d'impact.

dialogue.speaker: Sami
dialogue.text: Did you see that? When I pulled the trigger, there was this thing like [zzzt] right before it hit the back wall!

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Did it give you chills or what? It looked like you’d been waiting for this moment from the start.

dialogue.speaker: Sami
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think I could get used to this. Ready to try and do better?

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Hold on a sec… I’ll show you how to really aim. Watch closely.

dialogue.speaker: Sami
dialogue.text: Take a deep breath, aim straight, and go for it. Maybe the next mark will be your color!

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: You’ll see, this time the target’s going to remember. My turn!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: This round will decide who pays for the crepes, do you feel the pressure?

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Get motivated, but don’t forget that last time, you ended up far from the center.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Yeah, but today my wrist is steadier, just watch.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: We’ll talk about it again once you’ve hit the target, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Shh, I’m lining up... crucial moment.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Ah, that little [whizz] right before impact... you’re really going for the show today!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Guess what? I finally tried that little café on the corner I’ve been telling you about for weeks!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Seriously? So, does it really live up to all the hype?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely, the atmosphere is super cozy and the homemade desserts—you can’t even imagine.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Ah, you’re making my mouth water! Tell me about the best moment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: When the waitress brought out the lemon meringue pie… [wow], I don’t think I’ve ever tasted one that good!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That’s it, you’ve totally convinced my taste buds—I absolutely have to go!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [wow], look at this painting I made this weekend, I'm so proud of how it turned out!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It's really beautiful, you can really see all your hard work in the details.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Thanks, I spent quite a few hours on it, especially to get the light on the flowers just right.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Are you going to exhibit it somewhere? It deserves to be seen by more people.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe at the next local exhibition, it motivates me even more!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let me know if you take part, I'll definitely come to support you.

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: That's it, I finally finished the big mural in the high school lobby, after three weeks of working on it every evening!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, you mean the mural everyone’s been talking about since the start of the term? Tell me what it was like!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly! Yesterday, when it was time to reveal the result, everyone stopped in front of it. Even the principal came to see.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: [wow], you managed to get the whole school’s attention! That must have been an amazing feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It was one of a kind, I felt like I was floating because there was so much positive energy around me.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I absolutely have to come see it tomorrow, you can be sure that mural will be remembered!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: [wow], you know what? I got the lead role in the school play!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: That's awesome, Chloe! You must have been so moved when you found out.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Yeah, I had trouble believing it at first, I was so nervous during the audition.

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: So you'll have to spend a lot of time rehearsing, then?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Exactly, every evening this week. But I'm ready to take on the challenge!

dialogue.speaker: Bastien
dialogue.text: I can't wait to come see you perform on stage, it's going to be a big moment!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Louis, you won't believe what happened to me at the market this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds intriguing... Did you come across something extraordinary?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Guess what—the greengrocer gave me a basket of freshly picked strawberries, and they were an incredible color.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Fresh strawberries make all the difference! Were they at least tasty?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [wow], it was like biting into a ray of sunshine, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Just hearing you talk about it is making my mouth water—you’re really making me want to go this weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You won't believe what happened to me when I left work tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious, tell me!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: As I was walking past the concert hall, I heard music and saw a huge line.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Wait, did you stop to see what was going on?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Yes, and guess what—at the entrance, someone was handing out free tickets to a concert by my favorite band!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: [wow], that's the kind of surprise that really lifts your spirits after a long day!

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Well, even the birds seem to have taken a day off today.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That's true, you could almost hear a leaf fall on the sidewalk.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait... Do you feel that strange vibration under our feet too?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: All of a sudden, a little [whoosh] slipped into the silence just behind the gate.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ah, it adds a bit of excitement, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between that and the breeze, we're never really alone in this place.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Once again, strange things are happening in the alley—I jumped when I heard that racket!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I thought I saw a shadow dart behind the hedge, but there was nothing in sight when I got closer.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly, that's when it starts again: "[woof] [woof]" really fast, I feel like he's standing guard!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, but that's just like him—he always puts on a show in the evening.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He must be watching for the slightest movement—even a falling leaf doesn't escape him.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With a nose like that, we don't need an alarm in the neighborhood anymore!

meaning: bruit produit par une forte explosion.
pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Do you remember that moment at the fireworks when there was that big [boom] and everyone jumped?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I almost thought it was the end of the show, it was so impressive!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I saw kids hiding in their parents' arms, it was so cute.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Even the adults looked surprised, you could see it on their faces.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if we had been closer? Our ears might still be ringing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good thing we stayed back, it was perfect for enjoying the show without getting scared!

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Hey, do you know what happened near the sawmill this morning?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, not another story like 'someone saw smoke,' is it?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: No, this was something else! I was on the path and I almost fell off my bike.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? Tell me, what exactly happened?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: All of a sudden, the abandoned cabin exploded with a big [boom], like out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I would have gotten goosebumps, seriously... What a hectic morning!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You won't believe what happened to me yesterday, I absolutely have to tell you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now I'm curious, tell me everything, what did you do this time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I won a photography contest and the award ceremony was held in a gorgeous castle. [whoa], everything was so elegant!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: A photo contest and a ceremony in a castle? You never do things halfway, do you.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's true that sometimes life brings completely unexpected surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's exactly the kind of story you tell me when I think I've had a good week!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Guess who managed to snag the very last tickets for last night's immersive exhibition?

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: No way, don't tell me you actually went! It was sold out everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Yep, pure luck! And you know what? I even got a private guided tour with the artist.

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: That's incredible! The artist himself, too?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Absolutely, and he even gave me a little sketch he drew right there!

dialogue.speaker: Alexandre
dialogue.text: [whoa], you really had an extraordinary night!

meaning: bruit d'aboiement ou de hurlement.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: It seems like even the moon doesn't dare shine too brightly tonight, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, it almost feels like we're alone in the world... well, if you forget about the sounds of the woods.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: Wait... did you just hear that growl? Or is it just my imagination?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No, I think I heard it too. But there's no way to tell where it came from!

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: It sounded like a "[whoo]", right? Like something is watching us nearby.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, you're giving me chills, I should've stayed under the covers with a good book!

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Didn't that racket coming from the garden make you look up?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Are you talking about the noise right after the light went out?

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Exactly, it sounded like... [whoosh], [whoosh], and then I saw a shadow dart behind the shed.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You really know how to give me chills when you tell stories like that!

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I almost dropped my cup I was so startled.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Looks like tonight's going to be full of mysteries... Want to come check it out with me?

meaning: pour marquer la soudaineté d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was watching the clouds and [whoosh], my hat flew off in the wind!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Your famous red hat? I saw it go by like a shooting star!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you catch it, I’ll buy you an ice cream right now, promise!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Deal! It rolled all the way to the foot of the fountain, we’ve got a chance.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s go, I don’t want a pigeon making a nest out of it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch out for the turns, recovery mission activated!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Say, Marc, I feel like you always come back with stories after your outings!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: You know me well… Yesterday, I went to the downtown market—you know how lively it is there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Another one of your urban adventures? So, what happened to you this time?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I was calmly standing in front of the cheesemonger’s stall and [whoosh], a whole crate of apples toppled over right next to me!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You really attract the most unlikely situations, it’s unbelievable…

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Good thing I have ninja reflexes, otherwise I would’ve been taken out by the Granny Smiths!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you remember the workshop I told you about last week? I finally went this morning, and it was a real bubble of creativity!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You always find the most unusual things, tell me what surprised you the most!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: There was an interactive installation—you could paint with light on a giant screen, it was mesmerizing to watch.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Paint with light? But how is that possible? I can already imagine all the colors dancing everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
