dialogue.text: Exactly, and on top of that, the shapes appeared as if they were floating in the air—everyone stopped to look!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [whoa], just thinking about it gives me chills!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Guess what, I had a pretty crazy day—I still can’t believe it!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, you have to tell me about it, it sounds like something big happened!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: So, you know my application for the photo exhibition?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Of course, you’ve been telling me about it for weeks—what did they say?

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: They just sent me an email: I’ve been selected, my photos are going to be shown among the finalists!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [whoa]! The dream is coming true—can you imagine how proud you must be, you did it!

meaning: pour s'excuser d'un geste malencontreux ; pour parer à une chute, à un faux mouvement.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Did you see the stack of books on the table? It's going to take us all evening to put them away.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Good thing you're here, otherwise I think I would have given up after the second book.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Hand me the ones on top, I'll try not to drop everything.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Careful with the big atlas, it slips off the pile easily.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: [whoops], it slipped out of my hands for a second, but it's fine!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: You scared me, you seem to have ninja reflexes to catch all that!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Ah, [oops]! My notebook just slipped under the chair.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: There it goes, trying to escape again! Do you want a hand or can you manage?

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: I think it really has it in for me, it always slips away at the worst moment.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At this rate, we'll have to tie it to the table to keep it in place.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Or I could just stick a magnet on it and be done with it! Okay, let's pick up where we left off.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds good! Time to tackle those stubborn equations.

meaning: bruit produit par un engin manufacturé.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Look, once again, they're right in the middle of the square with their machine, like it's some kind of parade!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Listen to that, [vroom vroom], it almost sounds like they're trying to communicate with the pigeons...

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: The pigeons look like they couldn't care less, they're just pecking away as if nothing's happening.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Totally, they're unfazed by this mechanical circus.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Anyway, this scene would make a great video for a quirky snapshot contest.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: No kidding, I bet no one would believe this is happening just steps from the bakery!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This thrill ride really looks like it defies gravity! It almost seems like it's about to take off.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: It reminds me of last year, when the roller coasters almost turned my stomach upside down... But this one is really tempting me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Will you dare to ride with me right at the front? I heard the view up there is incredible.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: If you promise not to close your eyes, let's go! Look at the lights spinning around, it's mesmerizing.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, let's do it! With all this noise and laughter, my legs are already shaking.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Listen, when the machine starts up, there's always that [whoosh] that echoes—it's so recognizable!

meaning: bruit du cri d'un oiseau de nuit.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Do you feel how heavy the air is tonight? I think the moon is hiding something.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Yes, everything seems frozen in anticipation. Even the trees are still, it's strange.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen... do you hear that? That [hoo hoo hoo] in the distance... It must be a night bird.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Ah, it reminds me of the stories we used to tell when we were kids, near the old cabin.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I have to admit I have a little shiver, but it makes the night even more fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: With this atmosphere, you almost want to venture further to discover what's hiding in the shadows.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Tonight, the garden looks almost enchanted under the moonlight, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's true, everything seems wrapped in a mysterious veil, it's like another world.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Listen closely, there are always little strange noises when everything falls asleep.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Look, there! Do you hear that "[hoo hoo hoo]" echoing near the old chestnut tree?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Yes, that sound makes me feel like we're being watched from the shadows.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: It's in moments like these that I imagine stories coming to life just behind the bushes.

meaning: marque le contentement, l'admiration, l'enthousiasme, la joie, la surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I cooked last night!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Tell me! Did you try out a new recipe?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I tried a new take on chocolate mousse with coffee… [wow], everyone loved it, it was amazing!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh really? I bet that gives it a really unique flavor!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, it added a pleasant little bitterness, really surprising.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'm going to remember that idea—I think I'll use it next time!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [wow], look at this photo I took yesterday from the top of the trail, it almost looks like a painting!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: The light on the mountains is incredible, it really looks amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I stayed for a long time just admiring the view, it was so peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That makes me want to join you next time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: We could have a picnic up there, what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Great idea, I'm already starting to pack my backpack!

meaning: bruit du cri du chien.
bruit de bateau à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: [woof], that's really the kind of sound that catches you off guard when you start reading a crime novel!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It looks like someone in the building is just as passionate about sound effects as you are.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Or maybe it's the perfect timing for a suspenseful scene, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If the author had planned special effects, they couldn't have done it better!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I just hope there won't be a full orchestra every time there's a plot twist...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Don't worry, as long as we don't get trumpets at the climax, everything's fine!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, look at the scene over there near the bench!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, [woof], that made me jump, I really wasn’t expecting it!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: He’s charging ahead with so much energy, it looks like he’s about to enter a race.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: His enthusiasm is contagious—even his toy can’t keep up!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If I had a tenth of his motivation, I would have finished my marathon ages ago.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Still, keep an eye out; with that kind of energy, the whole park could become his playground.

meaning: bruit de gros rire.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, you absolutely have to explain that mysterious photo you posted yesterday—I’ve been racking my brain about it!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Oh, you mean the one where I look like I just came out of a cyclone? I was trying out a hair mask... and the cat decided it was the perfect time to attack.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Unbelievable, you really attract the most unlikely situations! So, how did you get out of it?

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: Honestly? I ended up chasing the cat all over the apartment with my head covered in foam. The neighbors probably thought it was a musical rehearsal.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [haha]! Just picturing the scene gives me stomach cramps!

dialogue.speaker: Mickaël
dialogue.text: I promise, next time I’ll invite you to be the audience—it’ll be even more epic!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's exactly the kind of fall that makes you want to replay the video ten times!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Do you remember when my cousin knocked over the whole cake while blowing out his candles?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, cream everywhere on the carpet, unforgettable!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: But you know what's crazy? He kept singing, mouth full of whipped cream!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [hahaha], just thinking about it makes my abs hurt!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet he could make a career in the circus with acts like that!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s really different from traditional museums, isn’t it? The whole experience was amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Absolutely, I didn’t expect to see so many original installations, especially in the third room.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The one with the light projections everywhere? I thought you were going to take out your phone to film.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: When the beams started dancing on the walls, I let out a [wow] without even realizing it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Me too, I got goosebumps, it was almost an unreal feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I have to tell Camille about it, she loves this kind of immersive experience, she should come with us next time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: [wow], you know what? I nailed my job interview—they hired me!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That’s awesome, congratulations Lucy! You must be on cloud nine.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Yeah, I can’t believe it, I was so nervous before going.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: You really did great. What position is it exactly?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Communications manager at an innovative start-up—it’s exactly what I wanted.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I’m really happy for you, that’s fantastic news!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Zoe
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what happened to me on the subway this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Tell me, I can already tell this is going to be a great story!

dialogue.speaker: Zoe
dialogue.text: I ended up sitting right next to the Olympic swimming champion, and she even smiled at me!

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: [whoa], you can't make up encounters like that!

dialogue.speaker: Zoe
dialogue.text: Exactly, I felt like I was floating on a cloud the whole ride.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Well, that's quite a start to the day—you've really set the bar high!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Wait till you hear this: yesterday, I tried the indoor skydiving wind tunnel!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wow, I'm really impressed! What was it like, that feeling of being carried by the wind?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Honestly, my heart was racing a mile a minute before I went in, but once I was inside, I felt as light as a feather.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It must be crazy to fly like that, you must have been on cloud nine!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Oh, you can't even imagine, [whoosh], I felt like a real superhero for a few seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Makes me want to try it myself—who knows, maybe we'll fly together next time!

meaning: bruit d'une personne qui pleure, qui sanglote.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, today everything just crashed down on me all at once, it's like the day was having fun testing me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [wahh], I could feel all your distress right down to my socks, it's unbelievable!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And on top of that, the rain showed up right as I was coming home... the full package, really.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We should write a survival manual for disastrous days, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and on the first page: never underestimate the power of hot chocolate.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: To my kitchen, then—I just happen to have some cocoa powder: operation mood boost is a go!

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Everything went wrong today, it's like the universe was conspiring against me...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Go ahead, let it all out, I can tell you're holding a lot in.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Between the boss calling me out in front of everyone and my file glitching, I just can't take it anymore...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh man... you don't even need words, I can already hear that classic '[wahh]' coming on.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: Too late, it's overflowing without warning, I can't help it…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let it out, that's your human pressure valve opening. I'm staying right here, no way you're going through this alone.

meaning: bruit de sifflement produit par un projectile, notamment un couteau ou une flèche.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: If you beat my score on the target, I'll treat you to dessert tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! But get ready to pick out the biggest cake.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Watch closely, I'm focusing—it's my turn to start.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, [whoosh]! That was fast, but the target took it well.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Looks like my throw hasn't lost its accuracy!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: For your pride, we'll see if you're still so proud after my turn!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You should have been at knife throwing this afternoon, Anaïs! I threw, and suddenly, right between two targets, there was a super high-pitched [whoosh] that made everyone freeze.

dialogue.speaker: Anaïs
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that must have really changed the mood all of a sudden, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally! Even the teacher raised his eyebrows, we all held our breath.

dialogue.speaker: Anaïs
dialogue.text: You can tell you put a bit too much energy into your arm today!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Apparently, yeah... next time, I'll aim more calmly, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Anaïs
dialogue.text: You're going to end up being the legend everyone in the club talks about—just be careful not to give them too many stories to tell!

meaning: bruit d'aboiement ou de hurlement.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: No way, did you see the figure that slipped behind the hedge?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wait, I think it stopped right next to the old shed.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Shh, listen... [whoosh]... did you hear that too or am I starting to hallucinate?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No, no, I heard it loud and clear. Something really is happening tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we're going to end up running faster than we ever thought!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At this rate, we'll break the neighborhood record without any training!

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: Can you imagine, I was walking past the path by the park and behind the hedge, suddenly it went '[woof], [woof]' out of nowhere, I almost dropped my bag!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: What a sonic ambush! Did you spot what caught you off guard?

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: I just saw a tuft of fur moving, but there was no way to tell if it was a giant beast or just a four-legged actor.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: There are real performers in this neighborhood, I’m telling you! Next time, keep your bag slung across your shoulder—you never know…

dialogue.speaker: Lina
dialogue.text: That’s it: next time I’m taking the sidewalk on the other side. My heart doesn’t need a dress rehearsal every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And here I thought adventure only happened in novels… We’ve got our share, urban style!

meaning: marque la joie, l'enthousiasme, l'admiration.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what happened to me during my walk in the park this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Tell me, now you've got me curious!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I ran into a group of painters who asked me to pose for their next group artwork.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: You don't get an invitation like that every day! So, did you do it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, I said yes on a whim and they set me up in the center of the canvas, surrounded by colorful landscapes. [whoa], it was an indescribable feeling!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Sounds like that walk will stick with you for a long time—you might end up famous without even realizing it!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Look at what I have in my hands—doesn't it remind you of anything?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, don't tell me that's finally your badge for the festival?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Exactly! Not only am I invited, but I also have free rein to exhibit my paintings.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's amazing, you totally deserve it! Do you already have an idea of what you're going to show?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Yes, they've reserved an entire room just for me, and I even get to create an installation on site.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [whoa], this is your big moment—it's going to be wild to see your world come to life like that!

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey Paul, there was an incredible racket behind the bushes just now.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I was just wondering if you heard it too. It happened several times, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, at one point there was a kind of "[rawr]" right under my window, it made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, I bet! That must have been impressive at this hour.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you think it's coming from Sophie's garden? She always has surprises, that one.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With her, anything can happen. Maybe we should take a look, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: As I walked past your terrace, I jumped—there was such a racket behind the hedge!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You’re talking about the commotion? That’s my loyal Gustave making himself heard again—he just went outside.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, he started up with a big "[woof] [woof]" as soon as he saw me—I almost dropped my bag!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He takes his job as guard dog very seriously, especially after the rain—he’s got energy to spare.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Good thing he’s behind the fence, otherwise I’d be running faster than my bus!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Promise, if you want to win him over, I’ll lend you some biscuits next time.

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, there's still some commotion near the gate, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, and that's the third time I've seen a shadow running behind the bushes.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The last time that happened, I almost spilled my coffee from surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You should see my dad's face when he hears movement here, he jumps every time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, wait—[whoosh]! He just leapt behind the gate.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He really has a knack for picking his moments, that one!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This morning, while taking out the trash, I got a little surprise near the Martins' gate.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Let me guess—the culprit has four legs and a real nose for intruders, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Would you believe that just as I set down my bag, I heard a huge [woof] right behind the fence—it almost made me drop my keys!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That kind of welcome must wake you up better than coffee. Did he calm down eventually, I hope?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, he just gave me his guard dog stare and then went back to his bowl—mission accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The Martins can sleep soundly—their sentinel didn't take the morning off.

meaning: bruit de l'aboiement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: I swear, Mathis, it was past midnight and all of a sudden, a huge [whoosh] echoed right in front of the door—it was almost theatrical!

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Honestly, your building never lacks excitement at this hour, does it?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Between the plants falling from the neighbor’s balcony and this, my nights are far from peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Next time, you should make a recording—we could almost put together an album of nighttime noises.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Believe it or not, I didn’t even have time to grab my phone—I was frozen in place.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Makes you wonder if suspense is just part of the scenery at your place!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Another movement near the gate, it's starting to happen a lot these days…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Did you see? Right after someone passed by, we heard a solid [wham] against the fence—it's never quiet when he's outside.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I can just imagine the poor delivery guy, forced to take the long way around every time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Better that than a package quietly stolen, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With an ally like that behind the fence, we can really sleep soundly.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He does the night rounds better than the streetlights around here, honestly.

meaning: bruit de moteur, particulièrement lors d'une accélération.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hop on the back, Camille, today we're taking the open roads!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I can already feel the wind in my hair... Are you sure your bike will make it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, she’s been through worse, but hold on tight—she loves a bit of craziness.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I just hope she doesn’t have a meltdown halfway up like last time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This time, I checked everything—nothing’s going to stop her. Ready to fire up the engines?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: (presses the starter, a vibration then [vroom]) There, that’s her favorite roar—we’re good to go!

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: Today, I got behind the wheel of my cousin's Mustang, can you believe it?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: No way! Tell me, is it really that impressive?

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: I barely touched the accelerator... The scenery was flying by so fast!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Just hearing you talk about it, I feel like I'm there—it must give you chills!

dialogue.speaker: Yasmine
dialogue.text: There was this moment when everything was calm and, all of a sudden, [vroom], my heart started beating faster.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: That's it, I have to experience that at least once—will you take me next time?

meaning: pour marquer la soudaineté ou la rapidité d'un procès.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Wow, you looked really out of it earlier—what happened to you?

dialogue.speaker: Malick
dialogue.text: Oh, forget it... I was leaving the café, and suddenly everyone started running in front of me!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: [whoosh], that must have surprised you! I can just picture the scene, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Malick
dialogue.text: I almost spilled my hot chocolate on my shoes, and I never figured out what was going on.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Sounds like your morning deserved to be on a hidden camera show.

dialogue.speaker: Malick
dialogue.text: Seriously, next time I'm staying on the terrace—it's safer!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You know, I was at the bakery when something unbelievable happened.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Oh? Sounds like a morning adventure, tell me!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: In a split second, an owl flew in, [whoosh], snatched a croissant and flew off as if nothing had happened!

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: No way, how did the baker react to that?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: She was speechless, then burst out laughing and asked if the owl was going to pay.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: That's going to make quite a story to tell at the next coffee break, I love these kinds of unpredictable mornings!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Oh look Arthur, your dog didn’t even move when the mailman came by earlier!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Don’t be fooled by appearances, he’s much more attentive than you’d think.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Do you think he’d react if someone crossed the fence right now?

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Sometimes you just have to get his attention with a little game or a sound he knows.

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Really? Show me how you do it then!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Watch: [psst psst], [psst psst] – see how he’s already perking up his ears?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look behind the gate, the dog hasn’t taken its eyes off the mailman this whole time.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, listen to this: [yip yip]! See how his ears perk up all of a sudden?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He’s actually gotten up now, you’re going to get us in trouble if you keep this up.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I promise, I’ll stop before the neighbor storms over!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We’d better keep moving if we want to avoid a scene.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Lesson learned, really!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look Maxime, as soon as I go '[whoosh whoosh]', Oslo gets all excited, you can see his tail wagging everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: That dog is impressive, I’ve never seen such a reaction to just a little noise.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh yes, he’s super responsive, he notices anything out of the ordinary.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: With a personality like that, I imagine your shoes have to stay hidden when he’s around.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: To be honest, he keeps an eye on everything lying around, he doesn’t miss a thing!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Good thing you’re watchful, otherwise he’d turn the yard into a treasure hunt every day!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Well, your dog is circling around like he smells buried treasure!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, if I do this… [shff shff]… do you see his face? He perks up and frowns!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Totally! He looks like he's waiting for a password to pounce.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, that little sound puts him on high alert right away, it's his thing.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He's going to end up thinking he's on a secret mission at every street corner!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With him, it's better to always keep a biscuit handy, just in case.

meaning: bruit de parasites sur une ligne téléphonique ou lors d'une émission de radio ; bruit de grincement d'un disque rayé.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I saw on the subway platform this morning!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Don't tell me it was that lady with the outrageous hat again?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Even better! A guy in a superhero costume, cape included... can you imagine the look on everyone's faces?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Wait, he actually walked around like that in front of everyone?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Yes, and at that moment, guess what, the whole train car suddenly started going [buzz buzz], it was almost like an improvised soundtrack!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I would have given anything to see that, honestly, your line is turning into a show today!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: You know, I was really looking forward to chatting a bit after this marathon of a day.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, tell me, I'm all ears... well, almost, I feel like something is trying to mess with the sound here.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: It seems like our phones want to have their say tonight... But I'll try anyway: guess what, I ran into Clara completely by chance!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh seriously? So, did she tell you about her travel plans or her story with the... uh wait, are you still there?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Yes, but now it's going [bzz bzz] in my ears, it's epic, I'm only catching half the words!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: At this rate, we'll end up having to write on scraps of paper... should we try another time?

meaning: Exprime l'allégresse.
Accompagne un saut, un mouvement vif.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Guess what, my project was selected for the cultural center's exhibition!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, [yay]! That's amazing, Elodie, you must be on cloud nine!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I can hardly believe it, I feel like running everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: We have to celebrate, I'm taking you out for ice cream to mark the occasion!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I'd love that, news like this definitely deserves a mountain of whipped cream.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Here comes a sweet celebration—get ready for a festival of flavors!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at this message, they're going to announce the results on the website soon!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: My heart is racing, do you think we're on the list?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed, we gave it our all during the prep!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If it works out, I'll bring golden croissants tomorrow morning, no excuses.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [yay], just imagining it gives me so much energy!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I love when you get excited like this, tomorrow's going to be great!

meaning: pour exciter un chien à attaquer, à mordre.
pour exciter une personne contre une autre.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look Max, the neighbor's dog is going crazy behind the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, he's jumping all over the place, his fur is standing up on his back.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I saw Lucas and Emma go up to him with sticks earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: They were going like "[zz zz] [zz zz]" in front of him, it was quite a show!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, he's not going to calm down anytime soon with that kind of excitement.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Looks like he's about to wake up the whole neighborhood if this keeps up.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, your German Shepherd is staring at me like I'm about to steal the whole street.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, don’t worry! He judges first, acts later—he’s a real guard dog.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It looks like he’s about to pounce—did you see his ears standing up?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He’s naturally curious, especially when he senses something new around him.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, we’d better not hang around in front of his kennel when he’s on guard!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look, if I just do this, [zip zip], [zip zip]... he’s instantly on alert, it’s impressive!

meaning: bruit sifflant d'un projectile avant son point d'impact.
bruit produit par des cymbales.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: It's incredible how your dart throw just grazed the target—I thought you were going to go right through the wall!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you hear it, just before the dart stuck? A sharp '[zip]', it even surprised me.

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: It makes the throw almost spectacular, it's like we're in a movie!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If only I could aim at the center as well as I make that sound…

dialogue.speaker: Manon
dialogue.text: With a bit of practice, you'll be formidable soon, sound or not!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Promise, next time I'll try to add both the show AND the accuracy.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen carefully, I'm going to throw the pebble, you'll probably hear a little '[zip]' just before it hits the can!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Go ahead, I'm watching you, show me your skill!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: (she readies her arm, aims, then throws)

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Wow, not bad at all, you've improved since last time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Thanks! It's your turn now, try to hit the bottle!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: OK, get ready to see what I can do, the pressure's on!

meaning: bruit des cymbales et de la grosse caisse.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It was absolutely wild last night, that band brought the house down!

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Did you see how everyone jumped up all at once during the third song?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And when they started that frenzied part, I thought the floor was shaking under my feet.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: At that moment, it echoed everywhere, [bam crash], there was no way to stay still!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I felt like I was floating, it was so powerful.

dialogue.speaker: Sébastien
dialogue.text: Seriously, we need more nights like that!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, I think my ears still haven’t recovered after that concert!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Seriously, it felt like the stage was about to take off with how much it was shaking.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: When they dropped that famous "[bam crash]", I swear, I almost spilled my soda!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I saw you jump, it was epic. I thought we were going to end up on Mars at that rate.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And to think we weren’t even in the front row… those musicians are something else.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I still have echoes in my head, I feel like I’m going to be buzzing all week!

meaning: bruit des cymbales et de la grosse caisse.

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: My head is still spinning after last night's parade, you should have seen the atmosphere in the street!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: I'm not even surprised—with that procession, the whole neighborhood was buzzing!

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: At one point, the musicians came right under my windows, it was impossible to stay seated.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: You couldn't help but tap your foot, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: It was irresistible! I even grabbed a pot to join in, the neighbors were laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: And there I was, listening from my balcony, I could hear [boom bang] coming from every direction!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You should have seen my sister last night during the show, she jumped out of her chair at the famous "[bam boom]!" moment!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That doesn't surprise me about her, she always reacts so intensely when the atmosphere heats up.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I think it was the first time she got so involved, even the neighbors heard her clapping.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: What a show! The emotions swept through the whole room, you could have thought it was a little impromptu party.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Exactly, and to think we almost didn't come! In the end, we got a real evening full of surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I bet we'll be talking about it for weeks in the neighborhood, that kind of energy really leaves a mark.

meaning: bruit des cymbales et de la grosse caisse.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You see, as soon as the orchestra starts, it goes straight [bam boom boom], it gives me chills every time.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's amazing how it fills the whole room, it feels like we're in another world.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think it's the kind of atmosphere that makes me want to dance without thinking.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Well, if you start dancing, I won't let you dance alone!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You never know, maybe one day I'll end up on stage doing something just as crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Save me a front row seat for that moment, I want to see it!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I think my ears are still ringing after last night. Didn't you think it was wild?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Absolutely! When the conductor raised his baton and we heard that famous "[bam boom boom]", I literally jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I swear, I almost spilled my drink, it was so unexpected.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Plus, with the lights flashing everywhere, we were instantly immersed in the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Even the kids were left speechless, that's rare!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: It's in moments like that you really feel the magic of the show, don't you think?

meaning: son du violon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, yesterday I went to a classical music concert at the Salle Pleyel.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Lucky you! Was the atmosphere as grand as the venue?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely. As soon as the violinist started, I could hear that little '[zing zing]' from the violin—it was magical in the hall.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: That must have been captivating. What piece did she play?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A Mendelssohn concerto—the virtuosity and emotion were both there.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: You're really making me want to go next time, especially with such an atmosphere!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look, the musician just took out his violin, he always has that focused look when he's getting ready.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Do you notice how his bow subtly brushes the strings? It's like he creates an atmosphere just by moving his hands.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It's amazing, every time he plays here, he draws in people passing by without them even realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Even the birds seem to stop and listen, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Yes, everything pauses for a few seconds, as if time slows down around us.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: And in the middle of it all, that [zing zing] drifting through the air—it's really unique in this park.

meaning: bruit brusque et cinglant, produit notamment par un coup, par un choc.
bruit d'instruments de musique, notamment de cymbales.
bruit de scie électrique.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Argh, the frying pan refuses to fit in this drawer, it must be cursed!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, let me try... Oops, [zing]! Looks like it wanted to make a run for it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Unbelievable, even the utensils are making a break for it here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: With our luck, even the spatula will want to go bungee jumping.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I promise, if a lid starts rolling into the living room, I’ll just let it go!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Deal, adventure kitchen mission accomplished for today!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: So, are you planning to challenge the blender again like last time?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Careful what you say, today I’ve totally mastered the machine!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: In theory, maybe... But in practice, we'll see if you can avoid disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watch closely, this time nothing will get past me! I plug it in, I add the eggs...

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Oops, your whisk just slipped off the counter... [zing]!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Even the whisk wants to join in the action today, this is going to be interesting!

meaning: son du violon.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, earlier when I walked past the bandstand, I thought I saw someone playing under a light drizzle—it was almost unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, the bandstand always attracts musicians on rainy days! Did you recognize what he or she was playing?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Not really, but it sounded like each note was gliding softly, as if time was stretching around the sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I can just imagine the [tingling] in the air, that little shiver that makes the shadows dance around the wet benches.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, there was this suspended atmosphere, almost as if the leaves stopped falling to listen too.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: To think that some people walk by without even looking up—they miss those moments that transform the city!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: You wouldn't have believed it, Paul, the alley was echoing yesterday with an enchanting melody.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Ah, you mean that musician with the felt hat was there again?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Yes, him. It was like he was telling a story with just his bow.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I still have that little [ting-a-ling] spinning in my head, almost irresistible.

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: It really swept me away, I completely lost track of time.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: The best walks are the ones where you get surprised like that, right?

meaning: bruit de glissade, de frottement, de crissement.

dialogue.speaker: Adeline
dialogue.text: We don’t take the old sleds out of the attic every day—do you remember how we used to do this when we were kids?

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: I remember the wind stinging my nose and the bumps in the snow, but I’m not as daring as I used to be!

dialogue.speaker: Adeline
dialogue.text: Come on, get a running start, I’ll give you a little push just like the good old days.

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: Alright, careful, I’m getting ready… Are you sure there aren’t any rocks on the track?

dialogue.speaker: Adeline
dialogue.text: And there you go, a good push… [whoosh]! You’re off at full speed, Thierry!

dialogue.speaker: Thierry
dialogue.text: Ha ha, I almost lost my hat! What a feeling, it makes me feel ten years younger.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This drawer is stuck again... Do you think you can open it without making everything fall?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch closely, if I pull right here... [zip] ! There, it worked.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, you’ve mastered the art of avoiding disaster in this kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: After juggling these stubborn drawers so much, I’m starting to get some experience.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should almost put ‘drawer sliding champion’ on your resume.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I’ll take the suggestion, but only if you’re in charge of handing out saucepan lid medals!

meaning: bruit de ciseaux.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The blue strip of paper is ready, do you want to start cutting, Hugo?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: I'll get started right away... [snip snap], [snip snap]! The next one will be green, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, and we'll need a yellow one for the center too.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: You're doing great with the assembly, it's really coming together.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Looks like we're going to finish before snack time at this rate!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, there'll even be some chocolate left for the two of us.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: The strip of paper is ready, we just need to cut out this shape here.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Watch closely… [snip snap]… there you go, an almost perfect star!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: At this rate, you're going to turn the whole living room into a constellation.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Admit it, you didn't expect this much talent from me!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If you manage to make a moon, I promise to give you my last candy.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted, get ready to see me in action!

meaning: bruit d'une fessée ; fessée.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Every time I did something naughty, my mom would burst into the hallway and shout her famous '[spank smack]' while clapping her hands—it was automatic!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Just hearing you imitate your mom, I feel like I'm right there—it's so iconic.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, just hearing that sound would make my legs start shaking all on their own.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At our place, it was more the sound of the stool being dragged that said it all!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, the methods varied from house to house, but the effect was the same!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We laugh about it now, but back then, it was straight into camouflage mode under the table.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at the old photo! Doesn’t it look like I was hiding the cookie box behind my back?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely, you can see it in your eyes—the sabotage mission had begun!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I never thought Mom would find the crumbs so quickly, honestly...

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Well, you always left clues everywhere—it wasn’t very secret agent of you!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yeah, well... My career had just started, I hadn’t mastered escape plans yet.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: And then the final scene... You can still hear the famous [pew pew], just like in action movies!

meaning: bruit d'un coup que l'on donne à une personne.
bruit produit par la vibration d'un objet.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Clément, this isn't the first time you've come home limping after practice... Did you pull another stunt?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: I should've filmed it, you would've seen: Axel slipped right in front of me, and suddenly [wham], he crashed into my ankle out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Oh no... With you two on the field, it sometimes looks like a real action movie.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: I swear, it looked like a botched stunt scene. But hey, I'm fine—just ended up with a bump.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Next time, let me know—I'll bring popcorn to watch your show.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Deal, but at least promise you'll clap if I end up sprawled out on the ground!

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Wow, you still have the guts to show up after what he did to you in the ring yesterday?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, you think I'm going to let something like that get me down?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Honestly, it looked like you didn't expect him to speed up like that.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I saw his arm coming, but I swear, there was no way to dodge in time.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: In the video, you can almost feel the impact just by watching.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I swear, the moment it hit, in my head it went [clang], I thought it would echo all evening!

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement d'un insecte ailé, notamment mouche ou moustique.
bruit de ronflement d'un petit moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Hey, Thomas, don't you notice a sneaky little [bzzz] in the corner for a while now?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, it almost makes me nostalgic for summers at my grandmother's place, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Nostalgic, maybe, but I’d rather have some nice quiet to finish this puzzle.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Worst case, we can always offer our invisible guest a puzzle piece.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: If it manages to place a piece, I’ll gladly give up my spot at the table!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Deal, but I hope it doesn’t take the last piece of chocolate too.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you hear that noise? It sounds like we're not the only ones enjoying the sun.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I saw a really stubborn fly hovering near the salad.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It's making a real [bzzz] around my head, it's unbearable!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Try not to move, maybe it'll go away on its own.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Easy for you to say, I feel like it thinks I'm a flower.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If it keeps going, we can switch places, okay?

meaning: bruit de siflement d'un fouet.
bruit de glissade, de frottement, de crissement.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So, Luc, ready to break some records with this chocolate mousse?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: More than ready to jump into action! Just hand me the mixing bowl and the whisk, and get ready to be amazed.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Careful, it’s not a competition, you know! Cooking is all about finesse above all.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Alright, I promise not to turn the kitchen into a battlefield… Even if it’s tempting.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Come on, show me what you’ve got, but no splattering, you have my word!

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Watch closely… [whoosh]! That’s how real chefs kick things off.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Let's see if you can whip up egg whites like a pro!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I doubt my arms will survive, but I'm up for the challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: (she shakes the whisk briskly) Wait, listen closely... [swish]! That's the sound of success, you see?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, your whisk is faster than my electric mixer!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's all about practice... and a healthy dose of sweet tooth.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, my turn to try, but hopefully without redecorating the kitchen!

meaning: pour exprimer la rapidité d'un procès, impliquant une action plus violente.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Did you see how the door suddenly swung open, [whoosh], while everyone was just chatting calmly?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I thought someone was about to burst in or that it was some uncontrollable draft!

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: It startled everyone, even the waitress almost dropped her tray.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I admit, in a split second, the whole atmosphere changed, everyone was on edge.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I saw a group by the window start whispering, everyone was wondering what was going on.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: In the end it was more of a scare than anything, but it really stressed everyone out!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I saw in front of the mall this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Go on, spill the scoop, it sounds huge!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There was a commotion between two guys; everyone stopped to watch.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: It must've been intense then, did security step in?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not even a second to breathe, they showed up, [whoosh], the guys were already restrained before I could blink.

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Honestly, it amazes me how everything can flip in a flash in this city!

meaning: pour exprimer la rapidité d'un procès, impliquant une action moins violente.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Jérôme, look at this, my coffee is about to overflow again, what a mess...

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Grab a saucer, quick, I'll move the cup away from the edge before we have a liquid disaster!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: But do you think you'll be fast enough, without spilling it everywhere?

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Watch closely, here I slip my hand, [whoosh], the cup is saved and nothing on the floor!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: What talent, not even a drop spilled, I'm hiring you as a coffee rescuer!

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: With me on duty, cups better behave, espresso mission accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Look at the pile that's left... The files seem to multiply as soon as we turn our backs.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: It's the bottomless drawer effect—take one out and two more appear!

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: If we switch tasks, you take the red forms and I'll take the blue ones, maybe it'll go better.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Perfect, I'll handle the red ones. Let's see if that changes things.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It's working better than expected—I've already finished half my stack!

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Same here, [whoosh], everything's filed away. The desk can breathe again!

meaning: bruit de glissade, de frottement, de crissement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, when I push the drawer gently, it always makes that little "[zip]" every time, isn't that funny?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I never noticed that before! Do you think it's because of the paint we put on?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe, or maybe it's just the wood getting old, who knows.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Anyway, your drawer has its own little song now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet even if I replace it, the new one will find another sound just for fun.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We'll have a concert next time we open the cupboards, then!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Marie, if you help me slide this piece of furniture against the wall, we might finally be able to put up the shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Wait, let me push from one side, because the other leg is catching a bit on the rug.

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Hold on, I'll wedge my hands underneath... there, go ahead, but take it easy.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: Ready? I'm pushing slowly... if it gets stuck, we stop right away!

dialogue.speaker: Benoit
dialogue.text: Okay... here we go... [scrape]... do you feel the resistance all of a sudden? We need to push a bit harder from here.

dialogue.speaker: Marie
dialogue.text: No problem, as long as the furniture doesn't end up on my feet, I'm in!

meaning: bruit produit par la vibration d'un objet.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Look, as soon as I put this old electric razor on the shelf, it always makes a little [bzz], it's distracting.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You make me laugh, it’s like your razor absolutely wants to get attention.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it never did that before, I’m starting to almost believe it has a secret life.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Try setting it down gently next time, maybe it just needs a little tenderness.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The scene is worthy of a movie: me, all serious, trying to handle a grumpy razor.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At the very least, we should give this little rebel a name!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Have you ever tried putting your phone on this old table while it's getting a call?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: No, but it must really make you jump, given the state of the wood.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen to this… [bzzzt]! It almost sounds like the table's about to take off.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Totally, we should record that sound for a unique alarm!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I bet no one would ever guess where it's coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: With finds like this, we're going to end up opening a museum of improbable things at my place!

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, do you hear that little noise, like a "[zzzt]" coming from the lamp?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I just noticed it. It sounds a bit like an insect buzzing.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wonder if it's a fly stuck in there or just an old electrical wire.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Maybe, or maybe it's just the light making that noise as it heats up.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Either way, it made me jump. I thought it was a message on my phone!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You could almost think this apartment is trying to communicate with us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that weird noise, like a loud [bzzzt] outside?

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Yes, I hear it, it's pretty unsettling... It sounds like it's getting closer.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, it's just a lost insect.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: An insect? With all that racket, you'd think it was a little drone!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Or maybe it's another giant wasp... I'd rather play it safe.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Good idea, let's keep the window closed, just in case.

meaning: Bruit, sifflement léger et continu (bourdonnement d'insecte, souffle d'un dormeur…).

dialogue.speaker: Inès
dialogue.text: This place really makes me feel like I'm on vacation, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Lying in the grass, a perfect sky, and no one to ruin the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Inès
dialogue.text: If you listen closely, you notice how everything seems to move in slow motion here.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Totally, look: [zzz]... [zzz]... Even my thoughts are stretching out slowly!

dialogue.speaker: Inès
dialogue.text: I almost feel like melting into the scenery and disappearing, right here, right now.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: If you close your eyes, careful, I can't promise we'll still be able to spot you in this meadow!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There, listen... [bzzz]... it's flying around the lamp, right above us.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: That's typical, it just can't resist the light tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you remember last summer, we had to put all the candles outside because of that.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Yes, and it attracted them even more, it was quite a show!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At least tonight, there's only one doing acrobatics.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Let's hope it doesn't bring the whole troupe for dessert.

meaning: bruit que fait le chat pour manifester son contentement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look, Paul, Fripouille has settled right up against my legs again.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: He knows where it's cozy, that old rascal! Looks like he's claimed your blanket.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Do you remember when he used to jump on anything that moved? Now all he dreams about is soft cushions.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll scratch him behind the ear—that's his little Sunday treat.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Go gently, he's already offering you his paw, that's a good sign.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, there it is, he's purring [purr purr] at full volume—mission accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at Felix on the cushion, he's already going [purr purr] just seeing me come over!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: He already knows he's about to get his dose of cuddles, he goes crazy with joy every time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: He has a knack for changing the mood with his little expressions, it's incredible.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Did you notice how he closes his eyes like he's savoring the moment?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: He looks like he's completely floating, nothing can bother him when he's like that.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's almost contagious, I relax just seeing him sprawled out there.

meaning: bruit de grognement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Wait, something's happening behind that gate. Do you see anything?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I just heard a kind of '[woof]' just now, that's all I heard.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: In any case, it doesn't really make me want to go check it out up close!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I prefer when that kind of surprise stays behind a gate.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Another one of those adventures going straight into my journal of hectic days.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: At least we can say we put our nerves to the test today!

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Hey, that old path behind the town hall hasn’t changed since our high school days.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: That’s true, even the green gate still creaks. Do you hear those paws scurrying?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Yes, wait, right there, behind the hedge… Oh, there’s a huge labrador watching us!

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Looks like he’s hesitating to come over. He’s circling around the trunk, see?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Oh no, now he’s lowering his ears, he really doesn’t look reassured.

dialogue.speaker: Yassine
dialogue.text: Listen, he’s doing it again… [woof], [woof]… looks like he’s keeping a close watch, that one!

meaning: bruit d'une déflagration, d'un choc violent, d'une fusillade, d'une rafale d'arme automatique.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you think we'll still be able to go through that street after what just happened?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: No idea... I saw people running everywhere, it was total chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My bag almost slipped out of my hands, I had such a hard time staying on my feet when everything shook.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: And the moment I turned around, it went '[crash]' right behind me! Honestly, I thought the windows were going to shatter.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If my heart recovers from this, it'll be a miracle... I've never experienced anything like that.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Looks like we're going to have quite a story to tell, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, my hands are still having trouble recovering from what we heard the other night.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: For me, it was my heart that skipped a beat. I thought the window was going to shake until it fell.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was like the whole neighborhood froze in place—did you see the neighbors in the courtyard?

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: Oh yes, even the cats hid away, there wasn't a sound after that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The tension was wild, I stopped breathing for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Karim
dialogue.text: And then suddenly, without warning, a huge '[CRASH]' tore through everything.

meaning: Interjection, juron atténué.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: This can't be happening, my glasses have disappeared again when I needed to read this file!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, did you already check the bathroom? Last time, they were sitting on the washing machine.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I went there thinking exactly that, but nothing at all. Honestly, it's enough to drive you crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Want me to check the fridge? You know how scatterbrained you can be sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh but... I think I left them on the bench in front of the building when I took the dog out earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: [grumble grumble], well, looks like we're in for another quick trip outside...

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Well, my umbrella just flipped inside out again in the wind... I'm going to end up soaked to the bone!

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: [grumble grumble], these darn umbrellas never hold up when you need them!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Tell me about it, the rain is following me today, and the forecast says it's sunny everywhere else.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: You really have a knack for attracting clouds, it seems!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: At this rate, I might as well invest in a rain poncho, it'd be more effective.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Or we could open a shop selling umbrellas tested and approved for storms, you never know!

meaning: Poésie, narration scandée librement, de manière rythmée.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: I need to add a little spark to my evening, you know what I mean?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If you want some rhythm, there’s this scene at Café Indigo, I hear it’s electric.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Something where words fly around and you catch them on the spot, that really excites me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: We could just show up, let ourselves be surprised, no planning.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Imagine, everyone’s holding their breath… then [bam], it explodes right in the middle of the room!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, that’s the spark we need, I’m grabbing my coat!

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: When I hear [slam], I picture words bursting out, hammered onto the stage like wild heartbeats—do you feel that too?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it's like the stories break loose, crashing into each other to make the whole room vibrate.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: I want to try, to let the flow go, to invent images with nothing but my voice.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Go for it—even your hesitations become rhythm, and every corner of silence pushes you to create.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Do you think people will listen to me, even if I go off track and my sentences collide?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: That's exactly the beauty of it: that chaos gives birth to magic—everyone's waiting to hear you come alive.

meaning: bruit de galop du cheval.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: So Léa, do you remember the moment when we crossed the river? I felt like I was in a western, and my horse was going "[clip clop clip clop clip clop]" on the pebbles!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: I thought you were going to drop the reins you were laughing so hard!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I know, it was impossible to stay serious! Your bursts of laughter didn’t help either.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: It was like we were in an impromptu race—did you see the guide’s face?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: He looked both amused and a little worried, especially when our horses sped up out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: I still laugh just thinking about it, we absolutely have to do it again one weekend!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, Louise, they're speeding up toward the river! You can almost feel the wind with them.

dialogue.speaker: Louise
dialogue.text: It's fascinating, all that power concentrated in their run. I wish I could be that fast!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: When they pass near the fence, it feels like everything shakes a little, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Louise
dialogue.text: Yes, and now, listen... [clip clop clip clop clip clop]... it almost sounds like they're keeping the beat of a song!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Just watching them, I already feel tingling in my legs, it gives me as much energy as they have!

dialogue.speaker: Louise
dialogue.text: If they keep going like this, we'll end up running after them without even realizing it!

meaning: Tambour de bronze ou gong d'Extrême-Orient.
Tambour en usage en Afrique subsaharienne comme instrument de musique et pour la transmission de messages.
Bruit, publicité tapageuse.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Sometimes, I think back to that evening at the Asian museum, when the room gradually filled with whispers before the demonstration.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It was magical, you could swear everything stopped spinning for a few minutes. Did you notice how everyone’s eyes were fixed on the stage?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Absolutely! There was this tension, a palpable anticipation, even the children were barely whispering.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: And then, do you remember that moment just before the show started? That suspense is impossible to forget.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At that very moment, a deep sound filled the room, [boom boom]… [boom boom]… and I could feel the vibrations right in my ribs.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to go back just to relive that thrill that swept through the whole audience.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: It's hard to explain what I felt yesterday: I was sitting outside when, all of a sudden, "[thump thump]", that sound surprised and fascinated me at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Moments like that catch you off guard and change the whole atmosphere, don’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Exactly! The air was vibrating, everything seemed to become more intense, as if the sounds were spreading all the way to my heart.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: It's crazy how a simple sound can turn an ordinary place into something almost sacred.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That’s what I love about those evenings—just one moment is enough to make you feel far away, transported somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Hold on to that memory, it’s the kind of feeling that’s worth its weight in gold.

meaning: Tambour de bronze ou gong d'Extrême-Orient.
Tambour en usage en Afrique subsaharienne comme instrument de musique et pour la transmission de messages.
Bruit, publicité tapageuse.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I enjoyed the Asian art exhibit at the museum today; it was quite a refreshing experience.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Lucky you! I heard there's even a room dedicated to rare instruments—did you see it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, I spent a long time in front of a series of old metal objects; it was truly fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: Just thinking about it, I can already hear the soundscape echoing in my head. Were there any demonstrations?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At one point, a guide struck a large suspended disc and there was this resounding "[boom-boom]" that made all the visitors vibrate at once.

dialogue.speaker: Jérôme
dialogue.text: It must give you chills to hear such an intense sound, especially in such a vast space!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, Marc, if I do '[thump-thump]' like this, you can feel the vibration all the way up your arms, right? It’s amazing what kind of sensory experiences museums offer!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Honestly, it almost gives me chills. It feels like we’re transported somewhere else, just with a few sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Imagine a huge silent hall, then suddenly that deep resonance filling the space… It really gives the moment so much depth.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Do you think they ever let visitors try? I’d love to feel that for real, wouldn’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m sure there must be workshops, or even introductory sessions. It would be the perfect chance to step into the shoes of a musician from the past.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: We should look into it, honestly—experiencing that firsthand is the only thing missing from this visit!

meaning: bruit sec réitéré, produit notamment par un heurt léger.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It really feels suspenseful at your place tonight, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait, didn't you notice anything strange in the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No, except maybe your old piece of furniture that's creaking again!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No, this is different... come on, move forward a bit, you'll see.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You're almost making me want to investigate!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen carefully, right there... [knock knock knock]... do you hear it now?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Have you noticed, for a while now, there are little noises sneaking around in the living room?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I thought it was just the wind playing with the shutters.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No, listen closely! It almost feels like there's an unexpected guest.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'll turn off the music... Here, stay quiet for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There it is again, [knock knock knock], right behind the bookshelf this time!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I bet it's that clever sparrow sneaking in to explore the house again.

meaning: bruit d'une locomotive à vapeur.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look Paul, if we close our eyes for a few seconds... [choo-choo]... it really feels like traveling back in time!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: You're right, it almost makes me want to take out my camera just to capture the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Between the rumbling, the smell of the old engine, and all these people gathered together, it feels like we're in a movie.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: And to think that scenes like this were part of everyday life not so long ago!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Let's leave the crowd for a bit, we could walk along the platform to get a closer look.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Great idea, and I've already spotted the perfect place for an amazing photo!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With this weather, I almost feel like digging out my old collection of train tickets. Do you remember when we used to visit Grandpa at his station?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, the waiting room always smelled of wood and smoke... I loved watching the conductors in their uniforms.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That's true! And we always got a bar of hot chocolate at the buffet, right before they announced the train's arrival.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: As soon as the bell rang, you'd press your nose to the window, convinced you'd spot the locomotive first.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I was mostly waiting for the moment when the steam covered everything, you couldn't see anything outside anymore, it was almost magical!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Just talking about it, I can still hear that little rhythm in my head... [choo-choo], [choo-choo], that followed us the whole trip.

meaning: bruit d'une démarche inégale, bruit des sabots d'un équidé.
bruit de verres qui s'entrechoquent, lorsqu'on trinque.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Look, here comes Ulysse from the meadow, but he’s not really following the usual path.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listening to him come, he almost sounds like an old alarm clock: [tick tock], [tick tock] on the stones.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That’s strange, he’s dragging his leg a bit, or is it just the dew?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, look at his left hoof, it’s all dirty, it must be slippery.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With all the running around he does, he must end up in every muddy corner.
