dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: A real little adventurer, that Ulysse, but he could pick a different pace to come home today!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, Mathieu, did you hear that behind us on the sunken path?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Yeah, it echoes strangely, sounds like something is coming, dragging its leg.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet one of Gérard's ponies has escaped from the pasture again, it happens to him every summer.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh look, there he is coming around the bend, with his harness all crooked.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I recognize his gait… listen to that, [clip clop], [clip clop] on the stones of the path, you can't mistake it!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Good old Filou, always ready to put on a show so we'll open the gate for him.

meaning: bruit d'une démarche inégale, bruit des sabots d'un équidé.
bruit de verres qui s'entrechoquent, lorsqu'on trinque.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Last night, I jumped in my bed, convinced that something strange was happening outside.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: This neighborhood never sleeps, have you noticed? What was it that caught your attention this time?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Well, it was happening at irregular intervals... [tick tock tick tock]... No way to tell exactly what it was.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: That kind of thing would get on my nerves. Did you try lighting up the street to see?

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: I didn't even dare lift the curtain—it froze me in place.

dialogue.speaker: Romain
dialogue.text: Let me know if you hear that signal again, we'll solve this mystery together.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Do you smell that freshly cut grass? I love walking along these paths after the rain.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: It's true, it's relaxing. But listen, there's a strange noise coming from the bend.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Yeah, I hear it too, like it's echoing off the stones.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Every time we come here, there are always surprises. It's like the road has something in store.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The rhythm isn't always the same, don't you think? Sometimes, it's almost hesitant.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [tick tock tick tock]... It's funny how it pounds the ground behind that bush!

meaning: bruit de coups frappés à une porte ou à une vitre par une personne, pour manifester sa présance et/ou se faire ouvrir.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I'm sure he's still buried in his book; he won't even notice how late it's getting...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: This novel is impossible to put down, but I hear movement in the hallway—it's suspicious.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [knock knock knock], are you planning to stay locked in there all evening?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, bad luck! I thought I could enjoy my mystery in peace.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Too bad for you, I'm bringing the latest clue: dinner is ready!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: In that case, that's an interruption I can only applaud!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Apparently the rain is going to last all day… We're nice and sheltered in here.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Honestly, I love hearing this kind of downpour when I'm cozy inside. Don't you?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, it relaxes me, especially with a cup of tea and a good book in my hands.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Hey, did you just see that lightning outside? It lit up the whole living room.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: [knock knock knock]… Wait, something's happening at the window.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: What is it? Do you think it's the wind or someone outside?

meaning: bruits de battements précipités du cœur, sous le coup de l'essoufflement, de l'émotion.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: You’ve been staring at your shoelaces for a while now… Is there a marathon going on in your head, or is it just the bench creaking too much?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The bench would be a good excuse, but you know, it’s more complicated than that.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: You’ve got me curious now. Something’s really weighing on you, isn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It’s the kind of thing that mixes with the silence, you know… a real mess in here.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Come on, spill it, I promise I won’t run away!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright… when you smile like that, [knock-knock], everything wakes up, and I just want to stay here, not mess anything up.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Phew... Marc, did you see that sprint? [knock-knock], [knock-knock], even my hands are still shaking!

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: That was really down to the wire, I thought we were going to crash into the train door!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Another adventure to tell, next time I'm definitely wearing sneakers.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: And I'll avoid carrying such a heavy bag, I feel like I just ran a marathon.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: At least we've really earned our coffee break, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Absolutely, and without that feat, the day would have lacked excitement!

meaning: Luxe recherché et voyant.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It was impossible to miss Sophie's villa last night: every detail looked like it came straight out of a design magazine.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Totally! Even the fountains in the garden seemed like they wanted to steal the spotlight from the guests.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And the table… crystal everywhere, golden cutlery, it was a real visual feast.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: When I saw the dessert decorated with gold leaf, I almost asked if it was actually edible!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I wonder what the neighbors think when they see such a display of luxury every Saturday night.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: In my opinion, they end up getting used to that [la-di-da] vibe that floats around the house at every party.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Imagine, Marc, this store just opened and it looks like everything is sparkling through the windows.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: It's impossible not to notice the reflections—even the streetlights seem less bright next to it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Come on, let's get a little closer, I really want to see what's hiding behind those golden doors.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: I'm warning you, if a salesperson offers me a coffee, I'm expecting silver spoons.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at this decor, it's a real [la-di-da]! Even the walls seem to be wearing jewelry.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: If we leave with even just a business card, I'll feel like I've won a ruby lottery.

meaning: bruit produit par un coup de sifflet ; bruit d'un sifflement.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Look at the atmosphere in the stadium, Léa, it’s electric tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it feels like every fan brought their energy—things are going to heat up on the field.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: Oh, he totally threw himself at the ball—this defender isn’t afraid of anything.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: [beep]! There you go, immediate intervention, no hesitation.

dialogue.speaker: Amadou
dialogue.text: That was close, but honestly he didn’t leave any room for doubt.

dialogue.speaker: Léa
dialogue.text: With this kind of intensity right from the start, we might see more surprises before halftime!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: The stadium is on fire tonight, the stands are going wild!

dialogue.speaker: Raphaël
dialogue.text: Even the kids behind us won't stop cheering, what a racket!

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Watch out, look, that player is charging straight at the opposing defense.

dialogue.speaker: Raphaël
dialogue.text: Oh, that dribble! If he gets past the last one, it could change the score.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Whoa, the defender stopped him cold, looks like there’s going to be a heated discussion with the referee...

dialogue.speaker: Raphaël
dialogue.text: And there it is, [tweet], that completely cuts off their momentum, they'll have to deal with the decision.

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, do you remember grandma's old lawnmower, the one that's been stuck in the shed for ages?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: How could I forget? It always refused to start when we needed it most!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yesterday, I tried my luck before the rain... I thought it was about to give up the ghost.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Brave of you... Last year, it gave me a hard time for at least an hour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I pulled the handle and then, [vrrr], nothing happened! Just that persistent noise...

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Typical! With that thing, you knew you'd end up doing everything by hand.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: [vroom]... Do you hear that? That sound always gives me a little rush of adrenaline.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: It's true, it sets the mood right away, especially in this old garage.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: It seems like your passion comes alive every time we start up a machine here.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: I can't help it, I think it's hereditary with all these tools lying around for three generations.

dialogue.speaker: Julie
dialogue.text: Anyway, if you're looking for someone to go for a ride, I'll put on my sneakers without hesitation!

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Get ready then, the open road is waiting for us at every turn.

meaning: bruit produit par un moteur.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Hey Thomas, what's with all the suspense in front of the garage?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Look, as soon as I turn the key... [vrrrrrr]... it still won't move an inch.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: It sounds like that scooter wants to give its own weather report!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I thought it was going to start up again, but it's been messing with me since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Want a hand before the neighbors think we're organizing a race?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Grab the handlebars, I'll give it a shot with you—maybe we'll have better luck together!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My old moped gave me another scare on the road this morning, it's unbelievable!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Did it stop you dead in the middle of the hill or were you still able to keep going a bit?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was this close to finishing the climb on foot, I really had my doubts…

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Can you imagine the scene, you who always refuse to let cars pass you!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I gripped the handlebars, closed my eyes for a second, and went for broke.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: [vroom vroom], it suddenly starts up again and there you are, speeding off!

meaning: bruit de batterie de D.C.A.

dialogue.speaker: Lucien
dialogue.text: Look at these photos, it almost seems like night never really fell over there, not with all those lights in the sky.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.text: Ah, I can still hear them... that famous [woof woof] in the distance, which seemed to come from everywhere and nowhere at once.

dialogue.speaker: Lucien
dialogue.text: It made your whole body vibrate, didn’t it? Sometimes I felt like even the ground was shaking to that rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.text: And with every burst, we’d count the seconds, hoping no shooting star would come down too low.

dialogue.speaker: Lucien
dialogue.text: Say, ever since we got back, I keep watching for flashes of lightning, but never the same thrill.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.text: It’s like some nights leave marks that no silence can ever really erase.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look, the old turrets are still visible behind the trees—it's impressive how they've stood the test of time.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: Yeah, and sometimes I almost feel like I can sense the tension that must have been here.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: When the wind blows like this, you could almost hear some "[woof woof]" in the distance, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: That's true, it's as if echoes from the past are trying to make themselves heard through the mist.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: There's something strangely alive in this interrupted silence.

dialogue.speaker: Luc
dialogue.text: And that's what gives this place all its mystery—you could almost believe that time plays tricks here.

meaning: Cri d'enthousiasme, souvent accompagné d'un geste exubérant.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [yay], look! My name finally appears on the list of students selected for the school trip!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I see that, it’s awesome, you’ll get to discover Rome with us!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was so afraid I’d be on the waiting list, can you imagine?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it wouldn’t have been the same without you in the group.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Get ready, I fully intend to take as many photos as possible and try every Italian ice cream!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At this rate, we’ll come back with a photo album and a few extra pounds, I’m warning you!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Listen to this: the jury just announced the results of the photo contest!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, so, tell me quickly, did you get a message?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [yay]! I finished in the top three, and they want to display my photo at the downtown gallery!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: That’s amazing, you’re going to see your work shown in front of everyone!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: My heart is racing, I never thought this would happen!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We’ll have to celebrate properly, get ready for a night to remember!

meaning: pour exprimer la rapidité d'un procès, impliquant une action moins violente.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: You know, my file for the insurance absolutely had to be sent before noon, otherwise I wouldn't get reimbursed.

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: Oh, that was tight! Did you manage to take care of it despite this morning's rush?

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Didn't even have time to stress, I scanned everything and [zap], the documents landed straight in their inbox!

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: Haha, impressive, you totally outdo me when it comes to responsiveness.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I admit, when everything works on the first try, it really saves your skin.

dialogue.speaker: Sofiane
dialogue.text: I'm taking note of that technique for the next time everything's on a timer like today!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: In your opinion, Paul, how do you manage to clear out your inbox without feeling overwhelmed?

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: This morning, I sorted my messages, [zap], there was nothing left, and I suddenly felt light.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that's really impressive, especially without stressing yourself out.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I think I was just in the right groove, it happened naturally.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wish I had that kind of momentum at home, especially for the bills folder.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: It'll come, sometimes all it takes is a spark and everything just flows without you even noticing.

meaning: bruit de bourdonnement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, there's a persistent noise behind the garage door, did you notice it too?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've been hearing a kind of [bzzzzz] for a while now, it's making me curious—it sounds like it never stops!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we'll end up wondering if the garage is trying to play a trick on us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's true, this is exactly the kind of thing that tests my patience.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: How about we go take a look before we start imagining the worst?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let's go—at least then we'll know if we should worry or just laugh about it later!

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: I told you my balcony was perfect for trying out your new herbs.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and the sun hits just right here. Even my basil looks happy.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: It almost makes me want to grow tomatoes, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Imagine the scent of the leaves with a bit of rain, that would be amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Nina
dialogue.text: Oh, actually, listen… [bzzz]… Do you feel the lively atmosphere around us all of a sudden?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's what makes the garden so charming, an energy you can't find anywhere else!

meaning: Pousser un gloussement.
Rire en poussant de petits cris.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: So, Thomas, does your family still call you the king of blunders?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It's not my fault if even automatic doors sometimes refuse to open for me!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Wait, the memory that comes back to me is the day you mistook a store mannequin for a real customer.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, that one... I think I talked about the weather for five minutes before realizing no one was answering me.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Even the cashier couldn't handle how serious you were!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Every time I think about it, I can't help but [chuckle], it's stronger than me.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can't believe I stepped in a puddle right in front of everyone again this morning... bad luck just follows me!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: How do you even do it? That's the third time this week—are you sure you're not aiming for them on purpose?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You should see the state of my shoes... It looks like they went swimming without me.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Sorry, but I just can't help [chuckle]... You really have a natural talent for urban slapstick!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Enjoy it—not everyone gets to turn a sidewalk into a comedy sketch every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If you ever make it through a morning dry, it'll almost be disappointing, just saying!

meaning: bruit du cri du porc.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Guess what, last Sunday my nephew wanted to feed the animals at the park; you should have seen his face in front of the big enclosure!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh, that reminds me of the time I tried to draw the pigs there, but it was impossible to stay serious for long.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Just thinking back to that scene, I can still hear in the back of the park: [oink oink] everywhere, it was epic!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's crazy how a simple sound can turn an entire afternoon into a fit of laughter.

dialogue.speaker: Nathalie
dialogue.text: Since then, my nephew asks every week to go back and check if they're still just as chatty.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It must be contagious, I almost want to dig out my old pencils just listening to you!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh look, Paul, they're all gathered around the trough!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Looks like it's feast time! They're not leaving a single scrap.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen to that concert in the straw... [oink oink], it's like a real choir!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh yes, their enthusiasm is contagious, I almost want to join them.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you find a pig snout mask, I won't stop you!

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: With a little imagination, I could blend right in—you wouldn't even recognize me.

meaning: bruit du rot.
marque la nausée physique.
marque le dégoût, la répugnance.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You know, last night's raclette was really a great idea!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Absolutely, especially with all that cheese... I'm still dreaming about it.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: So, should we do it again this weekend? I can buy more cold cuts.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I'd love to, but my stomach is going to remember it for days!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [ugh]... Did you just hear that noise or am I just imagining things?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Haha, don't worry, it's probably just my digestion acting up again!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The raclette was really huge tonight, I don't know how we managed to finish it all.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Totally, even the bread had trouble keeping up with the melted cheese!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, [urp]... sorry, it just came back up, I should've held it in.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You can really tell the feast keeps going even after the meal...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope you don't mind, it's the raclette fighting back!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No worries, it's part of the Savoyard tradition, right?

meaning: bruit de grognement du chien.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Did you see that dog behind the tree? It's coming toward us very slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, it really looks on guard... I hope it's friendly.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen, do you hear that? It sounds like it's going [growl], that doesn't reassure me at all.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Try to stay calm, let's avoid looking it in the eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Okay, no sudden movements... I'm holding my bag really tight!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If anything happens, I have some treats in my pocket, maybe that'll win it over.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: When I walked past the gate earlier, there was a strange racket in the bushes.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Another one of those cats prowling around, or do you think it's something else?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No, this time it was more like a sound like [growl], as if something was standing guard.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: You're almost giving me chills now... You didn't see anything unusual?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just some shadows between the hedges, but nothing really moving.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Maybe we should take a look before our imagination does the rest!

meaning: bruit d'un rire souvent fort ou d'un ricanement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Picture this: I spilled my coffee right on the boss’s report, just before the meeting, and he walked around with the stain all morning!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s impressive! I managed to send an email to the whole company when I only meant to send it to my manager… and it was not flattering.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Tell me it wasn’t the email with the blunder about endless meetings?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Right on the mark, that was the one! [haha], all my coworkers sent me gifs all day after that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With our performances, we should patent maximum embarrassment mode.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Good thing no one really takes us seriously here, it saves us a bit!

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: Hey Marc, do you remember when I tried to make crepes last week?

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Do I remember? The pan was flying everywhere and so was the flour!

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: And the worst part is, the cat took advantage of it to lick the batter off the counter.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: [haha], that cat is really the king of food lovers, you can't leave anything lying around with him!

dialogue.speaker: Amelie
dialogue.text: Since that day, I keep all the ingredients on the top shelf, it's become essential.

dialogue.speaker: Marc
dialogue.text: Maybe we should sign your cat up for the little chefs contest—who knows what he could do!

meaning: bruit d'un rire souvent fort ou d'un ricanement.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You know what, [ha ha ha], yesterday I saw a guy trying to juggle his groceries on the subway… apples were flying everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Oh, that must have been an epic scene! Were there any casualties among the passengers?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: An old lady caught an apple in midair—I think she has an athletic past!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Honestly, that deserves a standing ovation. Subway rides are never boring when you’re around.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I wonder if SNCF will start installing nets to catch stray fruit soon.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Or maybe signs: “Caution: Beware of falling bananas!”

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, I found this old photo from our trip to the lake. Do you remember my famous fall?

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: Oh yes, how could I forget... You slipped on some algae and made a spectacular dive!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And on top of that, my hat flew off and I tried to catch it like a movie hero.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: The whole beach was watching you—you looked so determined to save that poor hat.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: In the end, I ended up soaked, without my hat, and applauded by a group of kids.

dialogue.speaker: Nicolas
dialogue.text: [ha ha ha], honestly, that scene will stay in my memory forever!

meaning: Interjection servant à appeler.

dialogue.speaker: Mounia
dialogue.text: You know, with all these colorful posters, I get completely lost in this lobby.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You should see the library, it's even more confusing the first time.

dialogue.speaker: Mounia
dialogue.text: It's like a real obstacle course here! I'm looking for the photography workshop, but I can't find the room anywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, the photography workshop... it must be next to the big staircase, right?

dialogue.speaker: Mounia
dialogue.text: [hey], wait! Are you holding the map of the building there?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good idea, if this map doesn't help you, nothing will!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: [hey]! Your cap just fell onto the sidewalk.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I didn’t even notice, thanks Camille!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I know your collection, it would’ve been a shame to lose that one.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Especially the one with the autograph, I owe you one.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: You can invite me to that famous pizzeria you’ve been talking about forever, that’ll make up for it!

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Deal, and I’ll even get extra mozzarella, I promise!

meaning: bruit d'un coup brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: I told you that window wouldn't last long with today's draft.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yes, but look, it held all morning without moving a millimeter.

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: [bang]! Did you just hear that?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, the glass didn't appreciate the wind's show of strength...

dialogue.speaker: Mickael
dialogue.text: I bet it's the handle coming off again, it always makes that kind of unexpected noise.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, we're going to have to play improvised handymen if we don't want to end up freezing tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you really think your hammer blow will be enough to get that old nail out?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Just wait and see, I’ve totally mastered the art of improvised DIY.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, the wall didn’t ask for this, don’t get too cocky!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Watch closely… [wham]! There you go, the nail’s gone flying, mission accomplished.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And here I was thinking we’d have to repaint after your little demonstration.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: See? Even the wall wants more, it’s still standing!

meaning: bruit d'un rire souvent niais, contraint ou égrillard.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see Julien's face when he realized he’d forgotten the meeting?

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Hard to miss that—he almost knocked over his chair rushing in.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’ll teach him to take three coffee breaks in the morning. Maybe he should invent an espresso alarm.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: With him, the daily suspense is whether he’ll show up on time… or with a new coffee stain on his shirt.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s true, subtle elegance isn’t really his thing… [hehehe]… but at least he livens things up.

dialogue.speaker: Théo
dialogue.text: Come on, next time let’s bet on his shirt pattern and how many coffees he spills!

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what I found in the break room fridge!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Wait, is it another story about a yogurt from the Stone Age?

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Not even! A tuna sandwich wrapped up... since last November!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: [hehehe]... Honestly, that could be used as a secret weapon in a disaster movie.

dialogue.speaker: Clément
dialogue.text: Admit it, it makes you want to order a pizza right away, huh.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: You read my mind... Well, I think I'll avoid the fridge until further notice.

meaning: bruit de coups en rafale, bruit de martèlement.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I was right in the middle of a call and suddenly, the ceiling started vibrating like never before.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That neighbor on the third floor with his renovations again? He never stops!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly... I thought all the dishes were going to fall off the shelf by themselves.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s like he wants to redo the whole building in his spare time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Sometimes, you just hear: [whoosh whoosh] [whoosh whoosh], it's like something out of an action movie...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, you should ask him for the soundtrack—it would liven up your next meeting!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey Chloé, do you also feel the floor vibrating under your feet or am I going crazy?

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: No, no, you're not crazy, it's been rumbling above our heads for at least five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It feels like there's an entire construction site in the living room with no opening to the street!

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: Listen, it's starting again... [whoosh whoosh] whoosh... you'd think they're moving furniture nonstop.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can't even imagine what the walls look like, it's going to leave marks if this keeps up.

dialogue.speaker: Chloé
dialogue.text: I'm tempted to go check if an orchestra hasn't set up upstairs!

meaning: bruit léger et ponctuel.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Wait, do you feel like there's something strange in the apartment?

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Wasn't it you who just made the tablecloth move on the table?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: No, I didn't touch anything... It seems like it's starting again, listen closely.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Do you hear that little "[flap-flap]" behind the curtains?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: It almost feels like we're not alone...

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: If it's another bat, I'm not dealing with it by myself!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, do you feel a strange atmosphere here since the rain stopped?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, I think there's a little noise nearby, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, just behind the curtains... it seems to pop up every now and then.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Listen, do you hear that? [flap-flap]... it seems to start up again every time there's a gust of wind.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, it almost gives the place a suspenseful vibe, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I'll end up believing the house is trying to play tricks on us today!

meaning: bruit produit par un pétard, une fusée.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The square is already starting to fill up, look at all these people with their little bags.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, and some even brought folding chairs—no one's messing around tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I hope we'll keep a good view of the bell tower when it starts.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, from here it should be perfect. Last year we had a close call with the sparks!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I brought earplugs this time, I don’t want to jump every second.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Good thinking, soon it’ll be [bang bang] everywhere and everyone will be amazed!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: The square is starting to fill up, and I think they're already setting up the equipment for tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, did you hear that? There was a [bang bang] behind the town hall—I bet they didn't wait until midnight to start their tests.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: It's always the same, there's always someone who's too impatient!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And then they pretend to be surprised when we talk about it.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I'd get a real laugh out of seeing the mayor suddenly show up in the middle of all that!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think he'd rather stay near the buffet and act like nothing's happening!

meaning: bruit produit par des applaudissements.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I still have images of the scene in my head—what energy there was at the theater last night!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Oh yes, especially at the end, it was [clap clap] all over the room, I could almost feel the floor vibrating!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That's true, even my hands remember it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: The actors kept smiling thanks to all that atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's the kind of evening that gives you a real boost, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Exactly, I can tell tomorrow my head will still be full of positive memories.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Right after my last note, I heard a real [bang bang] behind me that surprised me—I really wasn’t expecting it at all!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That must have felt pretty strange, having that reaction, especially since you thought you were being discreet!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Honestly, I blushed a little, but it really gave me a boost for the rest of the show.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At the same time, you always kill it as soon as you get on stage, so it’s no wonder people react spontaneously.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: If I’d known, I would have recorded that moment to let you hear it—it was really unexpected.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll sneak into the audience with my phone, I promise—I want to see it with my own eyes!

meaning: bruit produit par des applaudissements.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: I swear, that magician really pulled out all the stops with his last illusion tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally! When he made that table disappear, I almost dropped my popcorn.

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Did you see the little girl's face in the front row? She couldn't believe her eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: She's going to dream about magic for weeks, that's for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Fatou
dialogue.text: Listen to what's happening behind us, it sounds like a real fireworks show: [bang bang bang], it's wild!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely, this place has never been so lively, you can tell everyone wants more!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: This competition is a real event every year, I feel like the room is already buzzing even before it starts!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, the energy on stage is incredible. The participants are outdoing themselves tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Just listen to what's happening in the audience… [bam bam bam], it's absolute madness behind us!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: All this shared excitement gives me chills, you can feel the crowd is swept away.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With all these reactions, tonight is bound to be unforgettable, I love this atmosphere!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No kidding, you'd have to be made of stone not to feel anything, this collective moment is magical!

meaning: bruit produit par un fluide.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Léna, do you see this sun? I'm this close to turning into melted ice cream.

dialogue.speaker: Léna
dialogue.text: Wait, I brought a mint thermos, that should save us!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Ooh, that [pssh] when you pour, I love it!

dialogue.speaker: Léna
dialogue.text: This is promising, the aroma hits right away with the first drop.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Pour me some quick before I melt right here!

dialogue.speaker: Léna
dialogue.text: Keep the cup, I'm having some too!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: [sigh], the foam is overflowing everywhere, you really have to keep an eye on the dishwasher when you use a new product!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, but you told me you were careful with the amounts!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I thought it would be fine, but now the whole kitchen floor is a mess.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, we're going to end up slipping and doing some unexpected acrobatics!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Grab the mop, I'll handle the faucet while you distract the foam.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, but warn me if you launch a surprise dish attack—I’m not equipped for a sudsy battle!

meaning: Onomatopée qui exprime le bruit des avertisseurs à deux tons des voitures de pompiers (en France).

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Something moved in the street, I almost spilled my coffee on my shirt!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh no, what happened, was it another cat that jumped under a car?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Not this time, it was a red truck that sped right past the bakery.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Ah, it must be the effect of the freshly baked brioche, they just couldn't resist.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: If you had seen Madame Fournier's face, she hid behind her stall!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: With the [wee-woo] echoing everywhere, no one knew where to go!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With this calm, you almost forget we're right in the city center.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's true, you could think we're in the countryside here, it's so peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, listen, something's coming down the street really fast.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? [wee-woo], [wee-woo]... That was all we needed to break the country mood!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It makes me jump every time, their passing is really spectacular.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Here, it's never quiet for long, that's what gives the neighborhood its charm.

meaning: bruit de l'avertisseur à trois tons d'une ambulance.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Did you feel that vibration just now? It must have made the glasses shake in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Emilien
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, the classic [wee-woo-wee] just went all the way up the avenue, you can't escape it even with the windows closed!

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: And to think I was lost in my novel—I jumped like never before.

dialogue.speaker: Emilien
dialogue.text: It really interrupts everything, huh? I almost dropped my mug on the tiles.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I’ll end up installing double glazing just for some peace and quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Emilien
dialogue.text: Hey, at least you’ll be able to say you’re ready for the next unexpected sonic shake-up!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, listen to that racket behind us! We can't even finish our ice cream in peace.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: It goes [nee-naw-nee], that thing echoes through the whole city, there's no escaping it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Every time, I feel like it's going to pop out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: At the same time, with that much noise, even the pigeons get out of the way.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My ice cream almost slipped just because I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Hold on to it tight, or the sidewalk will get a taste before you do!

meaning: Exclamation qui exprime le dégoût, le mépris.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: I can’t believe what I found in my bowl this morning… the spoon stood up all by itself in it!

dialogue.speaker: Marine
dialogue.text: No way, are you kidding? What was in that mix?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Some kind of porridge with a suspicious look, and honestly, I smelled something weird before I even tasted it.

dialogue.speaker: Marine
dialogue.text: That’s disgusting… I once had a yogurt where the date was rubbed off, and I got suspicious right away.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: [yuck], just imagining it gives me chills down my spine!

dialogue.speaker: Marine
dialogue.text: Just talking about it kills my appetite, if you want to know the truth…

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: Tell me I'm dreaming—did you see the color of that soup last night?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, and that was nothing compared to the smell coming off it...

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: I tried to taste it, but the first spoonful was already a challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I swear, I almost put my spoon down right away.

dialogue.speaker: Melanie
dialogue.text: [yuck], I think even my cat wouldn't have wanted to touch it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Well, we can say we tried that famous homemade recipe…

meaning: Onomatopée, souvent répétée, évoquant un bruit de trompe, de klaxon.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, crossing the intersection just now was an adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can totally imagine, especially with that bus coming and everyone going [honk], as if that would make things go faster.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Those moments when you wonder if you should run or turn back.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly, and me, stuck in the middle with a bike, I almost felt like I was on a giant game board.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm getting rocket-powered sneakers, maybe that'll be faster!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Or a fluorescent vest so you can be spotted from the moon, you never know!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I see you've embarked on the most perilous crossing in the whole neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: I'll take full responsibility if a car decides to take me on an unexpected detour.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: With this stream of scooters, we should almost ask for an escort.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: Or maybe invest in a flashing light, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, listen! [honk] [honk]! Someone's already giving a warning—it's a jungle out here.

dialogue.speaker: Lucie
dialogue.text: We'll end up learning to walk like tightrope walkers in this urban chaos.

meaning: Onomatopée, souvent répétée, évoquant un bruit de trompe, de klaxon.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wait, you’re going to laugh, this morning when I went out, I almost got run over by a bike speeding by going [honk], and I jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Seriously? At this hour too! Some cyclists really have a lot of energy.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No, but the worst part is, he just looked at me and went on like nothing happened.

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: Ah, morning people, always going full speed, and here we are in the middle, still a bit groggy.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I have to admit, that really woke me up. More effective than coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Sebastian
dialogue.text: We’ll have to invent an anti-sleep horn for pedestrians, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: [honk]! I hope you were ready for the surprise attack from the slipper brigade.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: What on earth are you doing with that thing? It sounds like a sonic invasion in my living room!

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: I think my mischievous mood took over when I saw that thing in the closet.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Clearly, I'm going to have to start hiding all the risky objects...

dialogue.speaker: Elodie
dialogue.text: Good luck, I have a knack for finding all the weird stuff!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: At this rate, I'm going to invest in some colorful earplugs—it fits the vibe.

meaning: Onomatopée évoquant le bruit d'un liquide qui fuse.
Atomiseur.
Dose de liquide atomisé.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: (grabs the bottle and opens it) [pssst]! Exactly what I needed to recover from that wild run.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Looks like you just set off a mini-storm in the kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I really needed that, my throat was drier than ever.

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Now I want some too—are you sharing or keeping the treasure for yourself?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Come on, I'm not the type to drink alone—here you go!

dialogue.speaker: Mélanie
dialogue.text: Awesome, you just saved my thirst for adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at this bottle, it's just waiting to join our picnic.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With all this sunshine, it won't last long, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I have a feeling we'll savor every drop, hold on a second.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Go ahead, I'm ready—let the party begin!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Here we go, I'm opening it... [pssst]... there, it's ready to pour!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: These little moments make all the difference.

meaning: bruit produit par un vaporisateur.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Oh, look at your ficus leaf, it's starting to turn a bit yellow, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Yeah, I noticed. That's why I make sure to give it a bit of humidity every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: How do you do it exactly? Ah, I can already hear the little [spritz-spritz], it's funny!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Just an old bottle that I reuse, and voilà, a few sprays on the leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: The ficus is lucky to have such a caring owner.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: It pays me back, especially when it grows new leaves in the spring!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [spritz-spritz]! There we go, nothing like this to wake up my tired leaves after a long day at work.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Ah, giving them a little home spa tonight? I have to admit, your plants look over the moon.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: They really deserve it, especially after yesterday’s heatwave. I think they handle the heat better than I do!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: No kidding, I could use a cool mist myself from time to time.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You could almost steal the bottle, but careful, it’s reserved for chlorophyll VIPs around here.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: One day, you’ll see, I’ll get my revenge and my banana plant will have its special moment too!

meaning: Bruit de sifflement continu.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Hey, Lucas, don't you find the atmosphere a bit strange here this afternoon?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, I feel like the air is really heavy... Maybe it's the weather affecting the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Or maybe a device suddenly woke up, who knows... I'll take a look under the desk.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I'm looking over at the coffee machine—it could play tricks on us at any moment too.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Wait, listen closely... [bzzzt]... It gets louder when I put my hand near the power strip.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Looks like our outlets want to get our attention today, what a surprise!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [bzzz]... do you feel that thing in the air? I think it's completely distracting me while I'm reading.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I was just wondering if it was my ear ringing, or if it was coming from somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It's louder over in the corner of the room, next to the lamp. Will you check it with me?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Wait, I'll unplug it, we'll know right away if the noise changes.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Thanks, I have to admit, spending the evening with that background noise isn't ideal.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Don't worry, we'll solve this mystery tonight, I promise.

meaning: Cri du canard.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Do you see that swirl over there on the pond? I bet it's going to resurface any moment now!

dialogue.speaker: Corentin
dialogue.text: Oh, you mean the waves by the edge? It looks like there's a whole little world hidden under those leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: With a bit of patience, maybe we'll discover the artist behind this aquatic show.

dialogue.speaker: Corentin
dialogue.text: Look there! It's moving again! It seems like something is getting closer to the dock.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Listen closely... [quack quack]... It's starting to get lively, I think they're having a little meeting!

dialogue.speaker: Corentin
dialogue.text: Looks like the troupe is putting on an imitation contest for us—it's a party on the water!

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: You know, this morning I jumped when I walked past the pond—there was an unexpected noise right behind me.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Ah, wasn’t it the famous '[quack]' echoing through the neighborhood that wakes everyone up?

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, it probably came from the little group hiding among the reeds.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: They always sneak in there; you’d almost think they were standing guard.

dialogue.speaker: Lea
dialogue.text: One day, I’ll end up talking to them like they’re neighbors!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: If you start telling them stories, save me a spot on the bench!

meaning: bruit de craquement ou de grincement, de cassure, de déchirure.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I bet you this wardrobe hasn't been opened since Grandma left.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We'll see soon enough if your muscles are up to the task, Claire.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Be careful, this old door looks a bit fragile.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Alright, just a little push right here and... [creeeak]! Well, that's done.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That echoed all the way up to the attic. Do you think we'll find a treasure or a mouse nest?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With that kind of noise, my vote's on mice...

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I told you that old stool couldn't be trusted... [crack]! There you go, it just reminded me why.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Well, looks like that chair just had its final moments under you.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I bet it already belonged to my grandparents... It's definitely time for it to retire.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: We could display it as a piece of contemporary art: "Survived Until Now."

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: With my luck, it would become the center of attention at that big dinner on Saturday.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: I promise, I'll bring you a real chair next time, just to avoid this kind of stunt.

meaning: Cri du grillon, de la cigale.
Grillon.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: It feels so good to sit outside after dinner, don’t you think, Camille?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Absolutely! That little breeze on the terrace is just what we needed after all that heat.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Listen to everything around us. It’s like the night is starting its concert… [chirp-chirp], [chirp-chirp], do you hear it too?

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: I was just wondering where that special atmosphere was coming from. It adds something magical.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Under this starry sky, the little sounds take on a whole new meaning.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: It’s a quiet show you only notice when you really take the time to stop.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This bench under the arbor is really the perfect spot after a long day.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's true, it feels like we're a bit cut off from the world here, especially when the temperature drops.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Do you hear that? [chirp-chirp]... it sounds like the night is starting to take over.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I really like that little background sound, it almost makes you want to say nothing and just listen.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should do this more often, enjoy the garden at dusk.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: And let the rest of the world bustle far from here, exactly what we needed.

meaning: marque d'anticléricalisme primaire.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: More bells ringing all morning... The streets are blocked, it's impossible to go to the market peacefully.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Of course, the annual procession... It seems like we can't escape it, even when we do everything to avoid it.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Some people like it, you know. Apparently, it 'brings the neighborhood to life,' according to the neighbor.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yeah, except that 'bringing the neighborhood to life' always means endless sermons and hassles for everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe we could try to take it with a sense of humor, don't you think? Traditions are part of the scenery.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Humor or not, it's always the same old story... They show up all proud, [caw caw], perched on their pedestal as if no one else exists but them!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Look at the poster for the new square: another big mass planned for the inauguration...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The organization really can't do anything without going through that, it's getting predictable.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It seems like there's no event that can stand on its own without a blessing...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You'd think they're afraid it will rain if no one waves incense around.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: But you know, for some people, it's part of the tradition—they care about it as much as king cake.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No matter how much we try to bring something new, as soon as we mention it, it's a chorus of [caw caw] in the town hall, always the same old tunes!

meaning: Pousser son cri.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: Look, there's still a whole group of frogs on the lily pads tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yes, they seem especially lively—they sound like they're having a noise contest!

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It's true, every spring night it's the same strange symphony.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: I love it when they all start [ribbiting] at the same time, it's almost like they're trying to drown out the birdsong.

dialogue.speaker: Elise
dialogue.text: It makes me smile every time—their energy is contagious.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: With such a natural orchestra, we don't need a radio to accompany the evening!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, listen for a moment: I could have sworn I heard a frog [ribbit] near the willow over there.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Your ears aren't playing tricks on you, there's a whole choir tonight, it seems.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Between the frogs and the breeze, we've got quite the atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's a nice change from the city noises, I really like it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should come more often to enjoy this unique calm.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Promise, next time I'll bring something to sit on so we can stay until it's completely dark.

meaning: bruit d'un craquement, d'un coup violent.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look, the branch is stuck between those two rocks, we'll have to move it if we want to get through.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Wait, let me try with my foot, it should work without too much trouble.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Go slowly... [crack]!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Oh, that reacted more strongly than I expected, I almost jumped!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I didn't think it would have that effect.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Anyway, nothing's blocking the path anymore, mission accomplished!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen, Paul, if we just force it right here, [crack], the lock should give way easily.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Do you really think we’ll manage to open it without damaging the door?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We don’t have a choice, we lost the key ages ago…

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Alright, go ahead, I’ll hold the handle while you push.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Watch your hands, you never know what might get stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’m doing it gently… well, I’m trying!

meaning: Tomber en s'affaissant.
S'effondrer.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Look at the old warehouse behind the park, it had been leaning for days already.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I was just wondering how long it would stay standing in that state…

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: Well, this morning, I heard a sort of rumble, and I saw the roof [crash] down all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That must have made a huge cloud of dust, the whole neighborhood was talking about the noise.

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.text: I admit, I still have the scene in my head, it was impressive to see it so close.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Luckily no one was hanging around there at the time, that was really a close call this time!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what happened when I went to feed the chickens behind the old shed this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: Oh, don't tell me that place played another trick on you!

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: I put one foot next to the barrel, and suddenly I felt the ground shake.

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: You're scaring me—what was under your feet?

dialogue.speaker: Amelia
dialogue.text: Well, as I turned around, I saw the old plank [crack] under my weight, and everything collapsed all at once!

dialogue.speaker: Martin
dialogue.text: That's so typical of the shed—always ready to surprise you when you least expect it!

meaning: Oiseau noir, voisin de la corneille.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, Maxime, hurry up, it’s the perfect time to watch the birds around here.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that strange, raspy call up there by the bell tower, just like I did?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, there’s a whole little group circling around—it’s pretty rare to see so many at once.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Listen, it almost sounds like they’re saying '[jackdaw] [jackdaw]' as they swoop around the rooftops!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It’s amazing how agile their flight is in these narrow streets—it looks like they’re playing with the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Maxime
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll bring my binoculars—with a show like this, you never get bored here.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look up there, on the church roof! Do you see them circling around? It almost makes you dizzy.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Listen to that [caw caw] echoing in the air, it’s like he’s calling all his friends for the show.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, their coordination is amazing. They form black waves like a perfectly rehearsed choreography.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I love that moment when they all land together, it makes the tiles on the bell tower vibrate.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And sometimes, it just takes the slightest thing for them to all take off at once, like on an invisible signal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Their ballet will last until dusk, they really know how to make the end of the day spectacular.

meaning: Produire un sifflement assourdi.
Prononcer les consonnes sifflantes (s et z) comme ch et j.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It seems like the evening has an unexpected noise in store for us, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: True, I'm trying to ignore it but it's really coming from behind the window, over there.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let's get a little closer. It sounds persistent, too.

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll pull the curtain back very slowly... But if something jumps out, you're going first!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Shh, listen... It's starting to [hiss] again right behind us, do you feel that vibration?

dialogue.speaker: Antoine
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's really strange... It's like the night is coming alive with its own little secrets.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's really buzzing in this hallway today, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: It's like every step wakes up an old ghost under these neon lights.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No need to tell strange stories for the atmosphere to give me chills!

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: Look, the train's coming, it looks like it's sliding between the walls...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Listen closely, you can hear its [whoosh] just before it pokes its nose in.

dialogue.speaker: Mathieu
dialogue.text: I can feel it all the way down to my shoes, that kind of sound always makes me smile and I don't even know why!

meaning: Produire un bruit sec et sonore.
Mourir.
Faire de l'effet.
Donner une claque à (qqn).
Dépenser en gaspillant.
Éreinter, fatiguer.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Did you see me slip on that patch of black ice in front of the bakery? How embarrassing, everyone must have been watching!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: I really thought your shoe was going to [smack] against the window, but you managed to catch yourself just in time!

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: If only pastries were as easy to avoid as falling…

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: With your acrobatics, at least the customers got a real show before digging into their chocolate croissants.

dialogue.speaker: Nadia
dialogue.text: Well, if not elegance, at least I proved my balance!

dialogue.speaker: Amine
dialogue.text: Let’s just say next time, we’ll invest in cleats instead of croissants.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: For a while now, I feel like the building vibrates every time there's a loud noise.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: Earlier, I actually jumped when I heard that bag [thud] against the entryway wall.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Ah, so that was it! I thought someone had fallen down the stairs.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: No, it was just a lady with her arms full and the bag scraped a bit too hard.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: That kind of noise always makes me jump, especially when I'm reading quietly.

dialogue.speaker: Mathis
dialogue.text: I get it, I almost spilled my coffee on the rug!

meaning: Faire un bruit sec.
Actionner le bouton d'une souris ou poser le doigt sur un écran pour activer une commande.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look, I'm trying to adjust this old projector, but the dial is really stiff.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Right there, it just went [click]! Do you want me to help you turn the lens?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No, it's okay, I think the mechanism still works fine as long as we don't force it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Have you ever seen any photos with this device or is this your first time?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This is the first time I'm trying it, but it belonged to my grandfather.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: So, if we manage to capture an image, that'll already be a great victory!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: This miniaturized safe is driving me crazy, the key still won't turn, look.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Let me give it a try, maybe I've got a better touch with this kind of mechanism.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: You've always had a knack for unlocking things that seem impossible.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Okay, I'll force it just a little... and there, it just went [click], that's it!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Impressive, your trick works every time, even on stubborn locks.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Looks like safes can't resist me, you'll be able to save your secret messages.

meaning: Pousser son cri.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: It seems like the pond really comes alive as soon as the light fades.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: That's true, all those sounds coming from the grass, it's almost like an evening song.

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Do you remember when we tried to walk without scaring away the little creatures, when we were kids?

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: Yeah, and we always ended up with wet sneakers!

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Listen to that noise, it's like they're putting on a real concert tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Yann
dialogue.text: That, [ribbit], they sure know how to make themselves heard in the middle of the quiet!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Hey, did you notice those strange noises near the pond last night?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was really weird... Do you think it was an animal?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Right under my window, I heard a loud [ribbit], it even made me jump!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I should have opened the window to listen, I was curious too.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It gave the night a special atmosphere, with all that commotion.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With sounds like that, it almost feels like we're in the middle of a jungle, don't you think?

meaning: Crier (en parlant de l'oie).

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: When I think back to Sunday afternoon, I can still smell the fields in my nose!

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: It was like the whole countryside was awake, with the cows, the sheep, and that big pond.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Right by the pond, didn’t you jump when the geese all started [honk honk] at once?

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Haha, I almost dropped my basket right then, their enthusiasm really caught me off guard!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen your face, it looked like you’d just run into a mythical creature.

dialogue.speaker: Louis
dialogue.text: Don’t make fun of me, between that and the frogs singing further away, it was really a unique atmosphere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Hey, did you hear that racket near the vegetable garden?

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Yeah, it even startled the cat—he dashed under the wheelbarrow!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I thought it was the wind, but no, it's way louder than that.

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: Sounds like it's coming from behind the big hedge.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Look, behind the fence, a goose puffing out its chest!

dialogue.speaker: Hugo
dialogue.text: There she goes again, [honk honk] like the whole village needs to hear her!

meaning: S'emploie pour exprimer une sensation de frisson (froid, peur).

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It feels like the temperature suddenly dropped, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Totally, and look at this fog! You can’t see five meters ahead.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It reminds me of those strange stories Grandma used to tell, when everything would suddenly go quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: [shiver], this atmosphere makes me think we might not be alone in this alley.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Don’t start with your ideas, or I’ll end up running all the way home!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Be ready—if something jumps out, it’s every person for themselves!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at that mist around the streetlamp, it feels like we’re in an old detective movie!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It’s true, all that’s missing is a black cat to complete the scene!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: [brrr], the atmosphere is perfect for letting your imagination run wild!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Between the dampness and this silence, I don’t even dare step on the leaves…

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It really looks like the setting of an urban legend, no wonder no one’s hanging around the street.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Good thing there are two of us, otherwise I’d turn back right away!

meaning: Bruit confus qui s'élève d'une foule.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Wow, Arthur, did you see the line to get in? I think we're going to have to elbow our way through if we want a seat.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: I can't believe it, the auditorium is almost full and we're early. This is going to be something…

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: If you spot a free spot, give me a sign, okay? I'd rather not end up standing behind a column.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: Wait, there might still be two seats left at the back, next to the emergency exit.

dialogue.speaker: Nora
dialogue.text: Good eye! But do you think we'll be able to hear anything from that far away?

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.text: With all this [buzz], I guarantee even the front rows will have trouble following what's being said!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at this crowd, it's almost as if the whole city decided to come out tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: It's incredible, every time I try to talk to you, the people behind us start laughing even louder.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It seems like everyone gets excited as soon as the music starts up again, it makes me smile.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you want to try getting closer to the fountain? Maybe we'll be able to hear each other better over there.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, let's go before the [buzz] around the stage gets even more intense.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: To the fountain! We'll get there before this whole cheerful crowd takes over the place.

meaning: Pousser son cri (chèvre).

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Look at those little rascals, they've climbed all the way to the top of the hay bale!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: They seem to have found their favorite playground up there. Did you see the one wiggling its ears?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Yes, I wonder what he's up to with that mischievous look...

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe he's getting ready for a new trick—better be careful not to get too close!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Too late, listen to him: he's already going [baa] as soon as I get closer, as if he wants the whole stage to himself!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He really gets the show, that one. Looks like he's inviting you to applaud him!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Hey, this part of the farm is always the liveliest, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh yes, just listen to the goats behind the fence, they've been [maa-ing] nonstop since we arrived!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It sounds like they're having a big conversation, each one wants to have the last word.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe they're arguing about who will get the best share of hay.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: They should switch careers and become a comedy troupe, it would be a hit every time!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: With acts like that, I bet they'd sell out every night.

meaning: Énoncé ou suite d'énoncés verbeux, et parfois mensonger(s), destiné(s) à masquer le vide de la pensée, à éblouir quelqu'un, ou à endormir sa vigilance.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Did you see the boss's email about the new project? It looks like something big, but I wonder what’s really behind it.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, he talked about the big transformation plan and all that jazz, [yada yada yada]. I almost fell asleep reading it.

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: Tell me about it, I read it twice and I still didn’t get any concrete info.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: If only we could get some clear info between those walls of text, it would be a miracle…

dialogue.speaker: Camille
dialogue.text: At this rate, we’ll need to call in a translator just to figure out the hidden intentions.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Or start a buzzword bingo at the next meeting, just to make it a bit more fun!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Apparently the new project is going to change everything, according to Marc. Do you believe it?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Every time it's the same old story: he promises us the world, uses big words, [yada yada yada], and then nothing moves forward.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's crazy how he has a knack for getting us excited with his announcements and then, in the end, everything just falls flat.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Do you remember last year's so-called digital plan? We're still waiting for something truly new.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've stopped kidding myself. I listen with one ear, that's enough.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: We should organize bingo every time he goes off on one of his speeches—it would at least keep us entertained!

meaning: Bavardage, verbiage sans intérêt.
Boniment, baratin.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I swear, at one point, I really thought the presentation was never going to end.

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: Oh, you mean when Sophie started piling on the examples? It was endless.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Exactly, with every slide, another unnecessary detail!

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: I tried to keep up but there was just too much information, and almost none of it was actually useful.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: And the moment she brought out her statistics, it was off again with a string of numbers, [yada yada] and all the rest...

dialogue.speaker: Thomas
dialogue.text: It felt like I was stuck in a never-ending loop, I couldn't wait to get back to my coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You left the room really quickly earlier, was everything okay?

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Yeah, I was fine, but I have to admit the atmosphere was a bit stifling…

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I felt the same way: as soon as we brought up a new topic, it was [blah blah] for ages.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: Exactly! It felt like we’d never get out of there.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least it gives us a story to tell at the coffee break.

dialogue.speaker: Julien
dialogue.text: For sure! Next time, I suggest we time everyone’s turns.

meaning: Exclamation exprimant le mépris, la lassitude, l'indifférence.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
